Meister, Surirella nervosa (A. Schmidt) Mayer, Surirella rorata Frenguelli and Surirella splendida (Ehrenberg) Ktzing were registered for the first time in central western Brazil. A description, illustration and comments are given for each taxon.
23501661|Tillandsia paraibensis is described and illustrated as a new species known only from the state of Paraba, Brazil. The affinities of this new species to other species and information on its biology are discussed. Tillandsia paraibensis, uma espcie nova do estado da Paraba  descrita e ilustrada. A afinidade desta espcie com outras do gnero e informaes sobre sua biologia so discutidas.
23501666|Myrtaceae  reconhecidamente uma famlia de grande importncia no bioma Cerrado. Dentre os gneros da famlia, Myrcia desponta como um dos mais representativos e com centros de distribuio geogrfica nos estados de Minas Gerais e Gois. O presente estudo revela a ocorrncia de 33 espcies de Myrcia nos campos rupestres e fisionomias florestais associadas de Minas Gerais. O presente tratamento para o gnero no estado apresenta chave de identificao, descries, dados de distribuio geogrfica e comentrios sobre as espcies. Myrtaceae is admittedly a family of great importance in the Cerrado biome. Myrcia is one of the most representative genera of the family, with the main distribution centers in the states of Minas Gerais and Gois. The current study reveals the occurrence of 33 Myrcia species in the "campos rupestres" and associated forest formations of Minas Gerais. Treatment of the genus includes identification keys, descriptions, geographic distribution data and comments on the species.
23501663|Foram realizados levantamentos florsticos para conhecer as espcies arbreas, arborescentes e arbustivas no Municpio de Pelotas, Rio Grande do Sul. As coletas foram feitas por meio de caminhamentos em 21 fragmentos em diferentes estados de conservao. A vegetao estudada pertence a duas fitofisionomias: matriz de paisagem florestal distribuda sobre a Encosta do Escudo Sul-Riograndense e matriz campestre na Plancie Costeira. A riqueza encontrada foi de 148 espcies distribudas em 101 gneros e 48 famlias. Myrtaceae, com 24 espcies, foi a famlia de maior riqueza, mostrando gneros representativos em espcies: Eugenia (7), Myrcia (4), Myrcianthes e Myrceugenia (3), Outros gneros apresentaram quatro espcies cada, que foram Schinus (Anacardiaceae), Baccharis (Asteraceae) e Myrsine (Myrsinaceae). Ocorreu baixa contribuio de rvores da famlia Fabaceae com apenas duas espcies, sendo gnero Inga ausente em matas ciliares. Constatou-se a ocorrncia de espcies de distribuio geogrfica tipicamente tropical como: Geonoma schottiana Mart (Arecaceae), Alchornea triplinervia (Spreng.) Mll. Arg (Euphorbiaceae) e Schefflera morototoni (Aubl.) Maguire, Steyerm. & Frodin (Araliaceae) e txons de carter temperado como Azara uruguayensis (Speg.) Sleumer (Salicaceae) e Quillaja brasiliensis Mart. (Quillajaceae). Isso demonstra uma rea biogeogrfica de ectono entre a Mata Atlntica stricto sensu e o Bioma Pampa. Desde modo a biodiversidade  considerada elevada em virtude das latitudes e das baixas temperaturas no perodo de inverno, sendo necessrios estudos para desenvolver meios adequados para sua conservao, restaurao e manejo florestal. The floristic composition of forest fragments was surveyed including tree, arborescent and shrub species in forest fragments in the municipality of Pelotas, Rio Grande do Sul state, southernmost Brazil. Data was collected by the 'walking' method in 21 forest fragments with different conservation status. The vegetation studied was characterized by two phytophysiognomies: a forest landscape matrix (Sul-Riograndense Slopes) and a grassland (Coastal Plain). A total of 148 species distributed in 101 genera and 48 families were found. Myrtaceae, with 24 species was the richest family, with genera representative in number of species: Eugenia (7), Myrcia (3), Myrcianthes (3), and Myrceugenia (3). Other genera had four species each: Schinus (Anacardiaceae), Baccharis (Asteraceae) and Myrsine (Myrsinaceae). Fabaceae with only two species contributed little to tree richness, with the Inga genus absent in riverine areas. There were species with typically tropical geographic distribution range such as Genoma schottiana Mart (Arecaceae), Alchornea triplinervia (Spreng.) Mll. Arg (Euphorbiaceae) and Schefflera morototoni (Aubl.) Maguire, Steyerm. & Frodin (Araliaceae), and taxa with temperate affinity such as Azara uruguayensis (Speg.) Sleumer (Salicaceae) and Quillaja brasiliensis Mart (Quillajaceae). This shows a biogeographic ecotone area between Mata Atlantica stricto sensu and Pampa Biome. But biodiversity is considered to be high because of latitude and low temperatures during winter. Further studies are necessary to develop appropriate strategies of conservation, restoration and management of trees and forest resources.
23501668|Baccharis compreende ca. 340 espcies distribudas nas Amricas. O indumento em tufos diminutos, formado por tricomas com uma nica clula basal, e as flores funcionalmente unissexuais so caracteres diagnsticos do gnero. No estado do Rio de Janeiro ocorrem 55 espcies de Baccharis. O trabalho apresenta os resultados de estudos taxonmicos de Baccharis subgen. Molina (Pers.) Heering para a flora fluminense. No estado, o subgnero est representado por 18 espcies pertencentes a quatro sees  Caulopterae (8 spp.), Molinae (4 spp.), Baccharidastrum (3 spp.) e Trinervatae (3 spp.).  apresentada uma chave para a identificao das sees e espcies e descries morfolgicas, ilustraes, dados de distribuio geogrfica e ecologia. Trs espcies so novos registros e cinco so excludas da lista de espcies do Rio de Janeiro. Baccharis comprises c. 340 species occurring in the Americas. The tufted indumentum, with trichomes having a single adjoining basal cell, and florets functionally unisexual are diagnostic characters of the genus. The Rio de Janeiro state flora contains 55 species of this genus. This work presents the results of taxonomic studies of Baccharis subgen. Molina (Pers.) Heering in Rio de Janeiro state. The subgenus is represented by 18 species belonging to four sections  Caulopterae (8 spp.), Molinae (4 spp.), Baccharidastrum (3 spp.), and Trinervatae (3 spp.). A key for the identification of sections and species, plus morphological descriptions, illustrations, and comments on geographic distribution and ecology are provided. Three species are new records and five are excluded from the state checklist of species.
23501669|Lauraceae  constituda por 52 gneros e ca. 2500-3500 espcies distribudas amplamente nas regies tropicais e subtropicais do planeta. No Brasil  representada por 23 gneros e aproximadamente 420 espcies. A Floresta Atlntica  considerada como um dos centros de diversidade para a famlia e esse estudo tem como objetivo o tratamento taxonmico das laurceas realizado em fragmentos de Floresta Atlntica no estado de Pernambuco. Neste estudo so apresentadas 10 espcies em quatro gneros: Cassytha filiformis, Cinnamomum triplinerve, Nectandra cuspidata, Ocotea canaliculata, O. indecora, O. glauca, O. glomerata, O. longifolia, O. notata e O. puberula, esta ltima como primeira referncia para o Estado de Pernambuco. So apresentados chave de identificao, descries e comentrios sobre as espcies, alm de ilustraes dos caracteres diagnsticos. Lauraceae has 52 genera and about 2500-3500 species and is widely distributed in tropical and subtropical regions of the planet. In Brazil, it is represented by 23 genera and approximately 420 species. The Atlantic Forest is considered to be one of the centers of diversity for this family. This study aims to treat the Lauraceae taxonomically from fragments of Atlantic forest in Pernambuco state. This study presents 10 species in four genera: Cassytha filiformis, Cinnamomum triplinerve, Nectandra cuspidata, Ocotea canaliculata, O. indecora, O. glauca, O. glomerata, O. longifolia, O. notata, and O. puberula, the latter being a new record for Pernambuco. An identification key, descriptions and comments on the species, and illustrations of diagnostic characters are presented.
23501672|A modelagem preditiva tem sido aplicada para analisar a distribuio geogrfica de espcies, a partir de extrapolaes das caractersticas ambientais dos locais conhecidos de ocorrncia. O interesse por esse tipo de modelagem deve-se  necessidade de respostas rpidas e fundamentadas para as ameaas que as espcies tm enfrentado, devido  perda de habitat, invaso de espcies exticas, mudanas climticas, entre outros. Este artigo oferece uma viso geral dos avanos recentes no campo da modelagem e visa incentivar a discusso e aplicao desse mtodo, que pode auxiliar tanto na aquisio de conhecimento bsico sobre a biologia das espcies, quanto na anlise e formulao de polticas para sua conservao. Predictive modelling has been used to analyze species geographic distribution through extrapolation of environmental characteristics of known occurrence areas. Interest in this kind of modelling is derived from the need for rapid and well-grounded answers to the threats faced by species due to habitat loss, exotic species invasion, climate changes, and others. This article provides an overall view of recent advances in modelling and aims to encourage the discussion and application of this method that can help with basic biological knowledge acquisition as well as with public policies aimed at their conservation.
23501657|En el marco de un estudio de regeneracin post-incendio de la vegetacin autctona en campos de sierra ubicados en proximidades de Falda del Carmen (Sierras Chicas, Crdoba, Argentina), se ha analizado el banco de semillas areo para facilitar la identificacin de las especies presentes en las muestras de suelo. Entre las familias con mayor diversidad y abundancia en la zona evaluada, las Malvaceae se encuentran representadas por 14 especies pertenecientes a los gneros: Abutilon Mill., Gaya Kunth., Krapovickasia Fryxell, Malvastrum A. Gray, Pavonia Cav., Pseudabutilon R. E. Fr., Sida L. y Sphaeralcea A. St.-Hil.. Se presentan dos claves dicotmicas para diferenciar las especies utilizando caracteres morfolgicos de las disporas, mericarpos y semillas respectivamente, acompaadas por las descripciones y las ilustraciones de las estructuras consideradas. Se tienen en cuenta aspectos morfolgicos de los mericarpos (forma, tamao, superficie de las caras dorsal y laterales, dehiscencia, aristas, pubescencia, divisiones internas, nmero de semillas por mericarpo) y de las semillas (forma, tamao, superficie, pubescencia, hilo). As part of a study of post-fire regeneration of native vegetation in montane areas near Falda del Carmen (Sierras Chicas, Crdoba, Argentina), we analyzed the aerial seed bank to help identify the species present in soil samples. Among families with greater diversity and abundance in the study area, the Malvaceae are represented by 14 species belonging to the genera: Abutilon, Gaya, Krapovickasia, Malvastrum, Pavonia, Pseudabutilon, Sida and Sphaeralcea. Two dichotomous keys are presented to differentiate the species using the morphological characters of diaspores, mericarps and seeds, respectively, accompanied by descriptions and illustrations of the structures examined. These keys take into account mericarp morphology (shape, size, dorsal and lateral surface, dehiscence, cusps, pubescence, internal divisions, number of seeds per mericarp) and seed morphology (size, shape, surface, pubescence, hilum).
23501671|Este estudo descreve um novo sistema para manipulao e gerenciamento eletrnico de colees botnicas. O software descrito foi desenvolvido com objetivo de auxiliar herbrios brasileiros no resgate e manuteno segura de registros de espcies de plantas provenientes de diversos ecossistemas nacionais, fornecendo uma ferramenta confivel, com interface amigvel, fcil de utilizar e dotado de funcionalidades para cadastro, consultas, atualizaes, estatsticas, relatrios, gerao de etiquetas, geoprocessamento e banco de imagens. This study describes a new system for handling and eletronic managing of botanical collections. The software described here was developed in order to give support to herbaria in the task of protecting records of plants species from various national ecosystems, by providing a safe tool, with a friendly interface, easy to use and equipped with features for registration, consultation, updates, statistics, reports, label management, geoprocessing and image database.
23501660|The anatomy of the pericarp of the macaw palm (Acrocomia aculeata) was followed during development. Ovaries of flowers collected at anthesis of the bracts as well as pericarps were evaluated at different development phases using traditional plant anatomy techniques. The ovary wall has two meristematic regions, one adjacent to the external epidermis and the other surrounding the seminal cavity. The external meristematic region gives rise to the woody exocarp, and the internal meristematic region is responsible for thickening of the oily/fibrous mesocarp as well as the hard endocarp. Sclerification of the exocarp and endocarp occurs approximately 70 days after anthesis and defines the final fruit volume. Lignification of the exocarp cell layers is incomplete, lending porosity to the structure. Numerous canals develop in the mesocarp that are formed by the fusion of raphide-containing idioblasts. Lignification of the sclereids and their generally random arrangement confers impermeability and rigidity to the endocarp. In mature fruits, lipidic reserves are observed in parenchymatic cells of the mesocarp, and the germination pore in the endocarp is composed of parenchymatic cells. O objetivo deste trabalho foi caracterizar anatomicamente o pericarpo da macaba (Acrocomia aculeata) durante seu desenvolvimento. Foram avaliados ovrios de flores coletadas no dia da antese da brctea e pericarpos em diferentes fases de desenvolvimento, por meio de tcnicas usuais em anatomia vegetal. A parede ovariana apresenta duas regies meristemticas, uma adjacente  epiderme externa e outra que envolve a cavidade seminal. A regio meristemtica externa origina o exocarpo lenhoso. A regio meristemtica interna  responsvel pelo espessamento do mesocarpo oleaginoso-fibroso e do endocarpo ptreo. A esclerificao do exocarpo e do endocarpo, que ocorre prximo dos 70 dias da antese, define o volume final do fruto. A lignificao das clulas do exocarpo  incompleta, conferindo porosidade  estrutura. No mesocarpo se desenvolvem numerosos canais, formados pela fuso de idioblastos contendo rfides. No endocarpo, a lignificao e a orientao das escleredes em vrias direes, conferem impermeabilidade e rigidez. Nos frutos maduros, a reserva lipdica se localiza em clulas parenquimticas do mesocarpo e observa-se a presena de poro germinativo no endocarpo, composto por clulas parenquimticas.
23501664|Uma espcie nova de Ocotea Aubl. (Lauraceae), Ocotea marumbiensis Brotto & Baitello,  descrita e ilustrada. A espcie, com flores hermafroditas, assemelha-se a Ocotea indecora (Schott) Mez e ocorre em floresta atlntica nos estados do Paran e Santa Catarina, Regio Sul do Brasil. A new species of Ocotea Aubl. (Lauraceae), Ocotea marumbiensis Brotto & Baitello, is described and illustrated. The species with hermaphrodite flowers resembles Ocotea indecora (Schott) Mez and occurs in the Atlantic Forest in the states of Parana and Santa Catarina, southern Brazil.
23501658|A phytosociological survey was carried out in a study area located at Serra do Sudeste, southern Brazil, where forests and grasslands are distributed in a mosaic, seeking to unravel diversity patterns in four different grassland communities. Grassland management traditionally adopted by the local population is characterized by burning practices that aim to eliminate woody species, delaying the forest expansion process that is favored by the extant climate. The number of plots distributed per community was as follows: rocky grasslands (17), dry grasslands (33), moist grasslands (15) and marshy grasslands (5). Different numbers of plots were used due to the natural conditions of these communities, with highest cover for dry grasslands, followed by rocky, moist and marshy grasslands. Data analyses consisted of calculating community indexes and parameters and exploratory multivariate analysis. We verified that c. 15% of species among the 177 registered taxa were highly dominant in the constitution of the vegetation matrix in all communities, whereas most of the species showed low frequency and cover values. Rocky and dry grasslands showed higher similarity and diversity indexes than moist and marshy grasslands. We concluded that the large number of rare or intermediate-frequency species is decisive for the high diversity found in these grasslands. Um levantamento fitossociolgico foi realizado em uma rea de vegetao campestre localizada na Serra do Sudeste, sul do Brasil, onde campos e florestas esto distribudos em mosaico, buscando compreender padres de diversidade em quatro comunidades. O manejo destes campos realizado pela populao local  caracterizado por prticas de queimadas peridicas visando eliminar espcies lenhosas, retardando assim o processo de expanso florestal favorecido pelo clima atual. O nmero de parcelas por comunidade foi: campo rupestre (17), campo seco (33), campo mido (15), campo brejoso (5). Diferentes totais de parcelas foram utilizados devido s condies naturais dessas comunidades, com uma alta cobertura de reas de campo seco, seguido pelos campos rupestres, midos e brejosos. A anlise de dados consistiu no clculo de ndices e parmetros fitossociolgicos e anlises multivariadas exploratrias. Verificou-se que aproximadamente 15% dos 177 txons registrados apresentaram maior dominncia na composio da vegetao nas quatro comunidades, enquanto a maioria das espcies apresentou baixos valores de frequncia e cobertura. Maiores ndices de similaridade e diversidade foram encontrados entre campos secos e rupestres do que entre campos midos e brejosos. Conclui-se que o grande nmero de espcies raras e de frequncia intermediria  determinante para os elevados ndices de diversidade encontrados nestes campos.
23501670|A Serra Negra est inserida no complexo da Serra da Mantiqueira, na regio sul da Zona da Mata de Minas Gerais. A vegetao da regio  formada por um mosaico de campos rupestres e remanescentes de Floresta Ombrfila Alto-montana, Floresta Ombrfila Baixo-montana e Floresta Ombrfila Aluvial, entre altitudes de 900 a 1698m. A famlia Gesneriaceae est representada na rea por 4 gneros e 9 espcies: Anetanthus gracilis, Nematanthus crassifolius, N. lanceolatus, N. strigillosus, Sinningia cooperi, S. sceptrum, S. tuberosa, Vanhouttea brueggeri e V. hilariana. So apresentadas chave de identificao, descries, ilustraes, distribuio geogrfica e comentrios taxonmicos das espcies. Serra Negra is part of the Serra da Mantiqueira mountain range, in the southern part of the "Zona da Mata" in Minas Gerais. Vegetation is composed of a mosaic of "campos rupestres" and remnants of Tropical Upland Rainforest, Tropical Lowland Rainforest and Alluvial Rainforest at altitudes varying from 900 to 1680 m. The family Gesneriaceae is represented in the area by 4 genera and 9 species: Anetanthus gracilis, Nematanthus crassifolius, N. lanceolatus, N.strigillosus, Sinningia cooperi, S. sceptrum, S. tuberosa, Vanhouttea brueggeri and V. hilariana. An identification key for species, descriptions, illustrations, geographic distribution and taxonomic comments are provided.
23501662|Foram realizados estudos na regio entremars de recifes da Praia de Boa Viagem, Recife, nordeste do Brasil, em dezembro de 2009 (perodo seco) e abril de 2010 (perodo chuvoso), para analisar a estrutura da comunidade das macroalgas epfitas em outras macroalgas. O material foi coletado em dois trechos recifais, cada um com aproximadamente 30 m de extenso, em diferentes compartimentos favorveis ao crescimento de macroalgas. Todo o material coletado permaneceu congelado at o procedimento de anlise. Os exemplares esto depositados no Herbrio do Instituto de Botnica, So Paulo, Brasil (SP). Foram encontradas nove novas ocorrncias para a costa pernambucana: Boodlea composita (Harv.) F. Brand, Ceramium corniculatum Mont., Chaetomorpha clavata Ktz., C. nodosa Ktz., Chondracanthus cf. saundersil C.W. Schneid. & C.E. Lane, Cladophora laetevirens (Dillwyn) Ktz., Neosiphonia sphaerocarpa (Brgesen) M.-S. Kim & I.K. Lee, Ulva linza L. e U. prolifera O.F. Mll. Destas, quatro tiveram sua distribuio consideravelmente ampliada ao longo do litoral brasileiro. Studies were carried out in the intertidal reefs of Boa Viagem beach, Recife, northeastern Brazil, in December 2009 (dry season) and April 2010 (rainy season), to analyze the community structure of seaweeds growing on other macroalgae. The material was collected in two areas, each around 30 m long, in different habitats which are suitable for the growth of seaweeds. The seaweeds remained frozen until the analysis. The specimens are deposited at the Herbarium of the Instituto de Botnica, So Paulo, Brazil (SP). Nine species were recorded for the Pernambuco coast for the first time: Boodlea composita (Harv.) F. Brand, Ceramium corniculatum Mont., Chaetomorpha clavata Ktz., C. nodosa Ktz., Chondracanthus cf. saundersii C. W. Schneid. & C.E. Lane, Cladophora laetevirens (Dillwyn) Ktz., Neosiphonia sphaerocarpa (Brgesen) M.-S. Kim & I.K. Lee, Ulva linza L. and U. prolifera O.F. Mll. Of these, four species had their distribution along the Brazilian coast considerably expanded.
23501673|Cololejeunea panamensis G. Dauphin & Pcs, descrita em 2006 foi referida como endmica para a ilha de Barro Colorado no Panam, Amrica Central. Durante um estudo sobre a brioflora da ilha do Maraj, uma espcie de Cololejeunea mostrou-se diferente das espcies j registradas no Brasil, provando ser uma nova ocorrncia para a Amrica do Sul. O objetivo desse trabalho  divulgar a ocorrncia dessa espcie em territrio brasileiro e ampliar o conhecimento sobre sua distribuio geogrfica, morfologia e ecologia. O material estudado foi coletado na ilha do Maraj, municpio de Soure, estado do Par, Brasil, no perodo de 10 a 16 de Janeiro de 2007. As amostras coletadas esto depositadas no Herbrio do Museu Paraense Emlio Goeldi (MG). Foram coletadas um total de nove amostras contendo Cololejeunea panamensis, sendo esse o segundo registro j feito da espcie alm do material tipo e o primeiro registro para a Amrica do Sul. A espcie  descrita taxonomicamente, ilustrada e so feitos comentrios sobre a distribuio geogrfica, variao morfolgica e habitat. Cololejeunea panamensis G. Dauphin & Pcs was described in 2006 and cited as endemic to Barro Colorado Island in Panama, Central America. During a study on the bryophytes of Maraj Island, one of the Cololejeunea collected showed differences from the species recorded in Brazil, proving to be a new record for South America. The aim of this study is to report the occurrence of this species in Brazil and discuss its geographic distribution, morphology and ecology. The material studied was collected on Maraj Island, municipality of Soure, Para state, Brazil, from 10 to 16 January 2007. The collections are deposited in the herbarium of Museu Paraense Emlio Goeldi (MG). We sampled nine collections containing Cololejeunea panamensis. This is the second record for C. panamensis after the type collection and the first record in South America. The species is described taxonomically, illustrated and comments on geographic distribution, morphology and habitat are presented.
23501656|Os parques urbanos tm uma importncia estratgica para a qualidade de vida dos centros urbanos, contribuindo com importantes servios ambientais e sociais. O conhecimento da estrutura florestal tem ajudado a subsidiar a conservao destes parques. A partir da anlise fitossociolgica das espcies arbreas de um fragmento de Floresta Estacional Semidecidual (120 ha), este estudo classificou o estado de conservao deste remanescente. Foram amostrados todos os individuos arbreos com CAP  15 cm, presentes em 25 parcelas permanentes (20 x 20 m) e as espcies foram classificadas por grupos sucessionais e sndrome de disperso. Foram registrados 798 indivduos distribudos em 98 espcies, pertencentes a 37 famlas. As espcies secundrias iniciais apresentaram maiores valores na riqueza de espcies, densidade e valor de importncia, seguido das espcies secundrias tardias que apresentaram maior dominncia e das espcies pioneiras que tiveram pouca representatividade. Quanto  sindrome de disperso, mais de 77% da comunidade  representada por indivduos zoocricos. Tais resultados aumentam a valorao do Parque da Matinha reafirmando a importncia deste parque urbano na conservao da fauna e flora nativa, e reforam a necessidade de criar politicas pblicas para utilizao do parque pelos visitantes. Urban parks have a strategic importance fot the quality of life in urban centers, contributing to significant environmental and social services. Knowledge of forest structure has helped to subsidize the maintenance of these parks. Based on the phytosociological analysis of tree species in a semideciduous forest fragment (120 ha), this study assessed the conservation status of this remnant. We sampled all trees with CBH  15 cm, present in 25 permanent plots (20 x 20 m), and classified the species as to successional groups and dispersal syndromes. We recorded 798 individuals in 98 species belonging to 37 families. Early secondary species had the highest values of species richness, density and importance value, followed by late secondary species with the highest dominance, and pioneer species with low representation. Regarding the dispersal syndrome, over 77% of the community is represented by species with zoochoric dispersal. These results increase the valuation of the "Parque da Matinha", reaffirming the importance of this urban park for the conservation of native fauna and flora, and supporting the need for public policies of park use by visitors.
23493169|The present paper is a Key to Identification of the Pteridophyta Families that occur in Brazil, according to Engler System (1959). It was based in the following characteres: habit, steam, and leaves; the esporophyte (fertile leaf) has not been used in the Key.
23493167|As variaes encontradas nas sementes examinadas, permitiram que a autora criasse 12 tipos de sementes, alm dos 5 anteriormente criados por THIERET, vizando uma futura aplicao dessas caractersticas em uma chave que permita a determinao dos gneros encontrados no Brasil. On the basis of shape and structure, twelve types of seeds have been established, besides the five ones previously named by Thieret. The author believes that a criterion of differentiation only using the seed-characters for the creation of a "key" would be possible to establish.
23493170|Este trabalho tem por objetivo a classificao e a divulgao dos tipos do Herbrio do Jardim Botnico do Rio de Janeiro (RB), sendo ilustrado com fotografias das espcies This paper is connected with the classification of the Combretaceae types from the Rio de Janeiro Botanical Garden Herbarium. Photographs ilustrate each species cited.
23493165|O presente trabalho  uma reviso de todas as espcies tidas como Raputia. O tipo das inflorescncias, o nmero de estames e de estamindios, a presena e o comprimento dos apendculos da antera e a natureza dos frutos possibilitam um reagrupamento das espcies. A heterogeneidade dos carcteres morfolgicos encontrados permite uma nova conceituao do gnero Raputia e a descrio de trs novos gneros, derivados, Neoraputia, Raputiarana e Sigmatanthus. Duas espcies novas e uma variedade so descritas. Dados histricos, morfolgicos e ecolgicos so apresentados. Mapas indicam a distribuio geogrfica das diferentes espcies. This paper presents a taxonomic revision off all species of the genus Raputia. The nature of the inflorescences and fruits, the number of stames and staminodia, the presence and length of the appendages of anthers made a new reorganization possible. The heterogeneity of the morfological characters permits a new concept of the genus Raputia and the descripition of three new derivated genus: Neoraputia, Raputiarana and Sigmatanthus. Two new species and one variety are described. Historical, morfological and ecological consideration are given. Mapps of geographical distribuition are included. In dieser Arbeit werden alle die zu Raputia gehoerenden Arten kritisch bearbeitet. Die Art der Bluetenstaende, der Fruechte, die Zahl der Staubblaetter und Staminadien, das Vorhandensein und die Laenge der Anhaengseln der Antheren ermoeglichen eine neue Reagrupierung der Arten. Die Verschidenheit der morphologischen karacteren erlauben eine neue Definition der Gattung Raputia und die Beschreibung drei neuer, abgeleiteter Gattungen: Neoraputia, Raputiarana und Sigmatanthus. Zwei neue Arten und eine Varietaet werden beschrieben. Historische, morphologische und oekologische Daten, sowie die geographische Verbreitung der Gattungen werden angefuehrt.
23493168|Neste trabalho os autores apresentam algumas consideraes sobre os caracteres delimitadores das variedades e forma de Ludwigia leptocarpa (Nutt.) Hara. Esta espcie ocorre no Brasil desde o Norte at o Sul em habitats diversos. As polulaes por ns selecionadas para aplicao dos testes experimentais, foram da Restinga de Jacarepagu (nvel do mar) e Serra dos rgos (cerca de 1000m de altitude). As duas populaes foram transplantadas para os canteiros experimentais do Horto Botnico do Museu Nacional sob as mesmas condies ambientais. Osfentipos se mantiveram conforme as caractersticas apresentadas quando nos seus ambientes naturais. O nmero de cromossomas das duas populaes  n=16. Quanto  polinizao verificamos que L. leptocarpa (Nutt.) Hara  autogmica, autocompatvel e cruzada. Os frutos obtidos por autogamia possuem hipanto com menor tamanho. Os obtidos por cruzamento so mais desenvolvidos. O pedicelo varia de 3 a 8mm de comprimento. Maior ou menor desenvolvimento do fruto deve-se  falta de fertilizao dos vulos situados na parte inferior do ovrio que lhes d um aspecto de pedicelo. Para comprovar as diferenas do desenvolvimento dos frutos recorremos a estatstica. The characteristics of the varieties of Ludwigia leptocarpa (Nutt.) Hara are discussed by the authors. This species occurs from the North to the South of Brazil, in totally different habitat. Populations from the Restinga de Jacarepagu (sea level) and from Serra dos rgos (about 1000m altitude) were selected in order to apply the experimental tests. Both populations were transplanted to the experimental gardens at the Museu Nacional (RJ) and mantained under the same experimental environment. The two phenotypes retained their original characteristics. The number of chromosomes is n=16 for both populations. Ludwigia leptocarpa (Nutt.) Hara is autogamic, autocompatible and crossed. Fruits obtained through autogamic present a smaller capsule than those obtained by crossing. Pedicel range from 3 to 8mm in lenght. The no fertilization of the ovules situated in the lower regions of the ovary leads to a lower development of the fruits, and gives to them the aspect of a pedicel. Statistical methods were applied to compare the differences in development of the fruits.

The genus Heliconia has ever been seen as homogeneous and with strong morphological characteristics, even by the oldest authors as Richard (1831) and ENDLICHER (1837).

23493240|A nova capital do Brasil  Braslia , com dezoito anos de fundao e funcionamento, prev a criao de um Jardim Botnico. 23493246|O presente estudo trata do levantamento da ocorrncia de frutos do tipo smara, em diversas famlias de plantas dicotiledneas. Consideram-se, apenas, aqueles que apresentam ala paranuclear. So estudadas smaras de 7 famlias, num total de 19 gneros. Faz-se descrio de cada tipo, tanto das smaras propriamente ditas, como das suas sementes. Por meio de chaves dicotmicas, procura-se distinguir os diversos gneros, levando-se em considerao a posio e a nervao da ala, presena de apndices e de estpite, persistncia do clice, forma do ncleo seminfero, presena de albume, estrutura do embrio etc. Tenta-se dar uma descrio da origem da ala e levantar uma hiptese a respeito das caractersticas primitivas e avanadas, analisadas. This study is a survey of the occurrence of samaras with a paranuclear wing in various families of dicotyledons plants. Samaras of 19 genera belonging to seven families are studied. A description of each type is given, both of the samaras themselves and their seeds as well. An attempt is made to provide a key to the genera based on such characteristics as the position and venation of the wing, presence of appendices and stipe, persistence of the calyx, form of the seed-bearing nucleus, presence fo endosperm, and structure of the embryo. An attempt is made to give a description of the origin of the wing and hypothesize primitive and advanced characteristics.
23493244|In this paper new localities of occurrence of 43 Lauraceae are given and some important specimens for the study of this family are cited. 23493241|The authors describe, after a brief revision of the literature, the range of Dalbergia decipularis Rizz. & Matt., the tree which furnishes the fabled wood known as sebastio-de-arruda. They showed that such range is divided into two subareas which are really well disjunct: 1. Bahia subarea; Minas Gerais subarea; these are sketched in the map included in this paper (Fig. 3). Formely the species was known to occur in Bahia. Now, it has been found in Minas Gerais in a variety of stations along the river Jequitinhonha; in these localities it inhabits a sort of dry semideciduous forest which are notorious for a great number of lianas. Finally, the writers give some information on the destruction of the local vegetation; both the caatinga and the forest stretches have been heavily swept away. But sebastio-de-arruda enjoys the ability to regenerate in the open to a certain extent and can survive as isolated trees in some places not too much disturberd.
23493247|A ocorrncia de folhas bipenadas em um grupo de famlias das Dicotyledonaea assume importncia sistemtica. Excludas das Leguminosae, onde a sua freqncia e diversificao  de molde a constituir um estudo  parte, foram estudadas as folhas bipenadas de espcies compreendidas em oito (8) famlias e onze (11) gneros, a saber: Araliceae (Coudenbergia), Bignoniaceae (Jacaranda e Memora), Leeaceae (Leea), Meliaceae (Melia), Moringaceae (Moringa), Rutaceae (Dictyoloma), Sapindaceae (Dilodendron, Koelreuteria e Paullinia) e Vitaceae (Cissus). Foram elaboradas chaves analticas, baseadas nesses tipos foliares, para determinao dos gneros. Tambm so apresentadas descries desses rgos, no s no que toca ao aspecto morfolgico externo, como tambm ao seu padro de nervao e  sua epiderme, em vista frontal. Como uma contribuio ao estudo foliar, acrescentou-se, no final das descries, a distribuio geogrfica das espcies dos gneros estudados, baseada em informao da literatura consultada e nas etiquetas do material manuseado. Sempre que possvel, foram feitas ilustraes das folhas e dos detalhes observados. The occurrence of bipinnate leaves in a group of families of the Dicotyledoneae assumes systematic importante. Having excluded the Leguminosae, where frequency and distribution of this leaf form are such as to constitute a separate examination, this study was limited to the bipinnate leaves of species included in eight (8) familie and eleven (11) genera, as follows; Araliaceae (Coudenbergia), Bignoniaceae (Jacaranda and Memora), Leeaceae (Leea), Meliaceae (Melia), Moringaceae (Moringa), Rutaceae (Dictyoloma), Sapindaceae (Dilodendron, Koelreuteria and Paullinia) e Vitaceae (Cissus). Based on the leaf types, analytical keys were constructed. Descriptions of these organs include venation pattern and a frontal view of the epidermis as well as external morphology. To complement the leaf study, geographic distribution of the species is inclused, based on information gathered from the literature and from labels of the herbarium material examined. Illustrations of leaf detail are included where possible.

23493242|The authors describe in this paper both the organography and anatomy of the tree known as escorrega-macaco, namely Vochysia haenkeana Mart. It has as an especially distinct feature the trunk bark smooth, yellow, and covered by an dusty cork. No other species in this genus shows such kind of cortex which is compared with the common type in V. thyrsoidea Pohl. The main points on wood anatomy are as follows. VESSEL: Very few to numerous; solitary and multiple, of 23, sometimes crowded; from none to 9 (12) per square mm; with simple perforations; intervascular pitting of small size 47 micra, numerous, alternate, vestured, commonly coalescent; pits to ray and parenchyma cells alternate, opposite or irregular, medium-sized to very large, 720 (23) micra. VESSEL MEMBERS: From short to large, measuring 0,5001,375 mm, mostly 1,001,250 mm, with short appendages or without them. In tangential sections they seem to be very short, with perforations in the radial lateral walls. They show themselves in the tangential sections crooked, being similar to elbows, whence the name geniculate vessels (RIZZINI & MATTOS, 1965). WOOD PARENCHYMA: Very abundant, mostly paratracheal comprising both the aliform and the aliform-confluent types; more plentiful about the gum duct regions. RAY PARENCHYMA (RAYS): Ray tissue heterogeneous KRIB'S type III, somentimes possessing well differentiated apical cell. The rays are two sizes; uniseriate rays predominant and multiseriate rays 210 (12) cells in the maximum; 30148 micra and 210 cells wide, usually 80118 micra, 69 cells wide; height 0,1501,385 (1,485) mm, 375 cells in width, commonly 0,3950,790 mm, 1548 cells; frequently interrupted by fiber layers and somentimes by parenchyma stands with sclerotic cells. An special feature of this species in the ocurence of vessel element perforation inside the ray. This trait seems to have been observed for the first time here in any wood. WOOD FIBERS: Libriform, homogeneous and heterogeneous; very short to long, (0,9501,875 mm), usually (1,2501,625 mm); wall thin to thick. GROWTH RINGS: Indistinct. GUM DUCTS: Present in tangential lines (rings porous). RIPPLE MARKS: Absent.

There has been described and figured the 16 species that make up the genus; their affinities and morphological variations also were treated of. New to science are 6 synonyms and 1 variety, the doubtful species, total 5, beside those to be excluded from the genus. The investigation carried ou upon gross morphology of the plants, pollen grains, and leaf and flower vascularization, pointed out the importance of the structural factors both in the circumscription and distinction of the species. Finally, it is emphazised that further researches on ecological anatomy would be welcomed.

23493145|As espcies do gnero Dorstenia L. mostram-se bastante conhecidas entre ns pelos nomes vulgares de caiapi, contra-erva e figueira-terrestre. Das obras clssicas a respeito desse gnero, as de Fischer & Meyer (1846), de Miquel (1853) e de Bureau (1873), destacam-se como as de maior valor. Os caracteres que se revelaram de importncia sistemtica foram a morfologia do caule e dos rgos subterrneos, as estpulas, o receptculo (cenanto) e alguns aspectos da folha. No Brasil e pases limtrofes ocorrem da Sect. Lecania Fisch. & Mey., 19 espcies; da Sect. Sychinia (Desv.) Fisch. & Mey., apenas 4; da Sect. Dorstenia, 7; e da Sect. Emygdioa Car., 11. H espcies que se destacam pela beleza ornamental e outras pelos rizomas aromticos. A maioria se concentra no Brasil-Sudeste,  beira dos riachos ou em grotes rochosos. Ocorrem muitos endemismos e os exemplos mais notveis acham-se nas sees Lecania e Sychinia. Das 41 espcies sul-americanas apenas 4 no foram encontradas at hoje no Brasil. O gnero Dorstenia, apesar de bem situado na famlia Moraceae, prximo a Ficus, apresenta caracteres que demonstram certas afinidades com gneros de Urticaceae. The species of the genus Dorstenia L. are known to us by the common names of "caiapi", "contra-erva" and "figueira-terrestre". Of the classical works on this genus, those of Fischer & Meyer (1846), Miquel (1853) and Bureau (1873) stand out as most valuable. Characters that reveal systematic importance are the morphology of the stem and underground organs, stipules, receptacle (coenanthium) and some features of the leaf. In Brazil and surrounding areas distribution of species into sections is as follows: Sect. Lecania Fisch. & Mey., 19 species; Sect. Sychinia (Desv.) Fisch. & Mey., only 4; Sect. Dorstenia 7; Sect. Emygdioa Car., 11. Sections Sychinia and Dorstenia contain species of great ornamental beauty whereas those of Sect. Emygdioa are distinguished by their aromatic rhizomes. The majority of the species are concentrated in Southeastern Brazil, along the margins of brooks or in rock splits. There are many endemic species: the most remarkable examples are in the Sect. Lecania and Sychinia. Of the 41 South-American species only 4 have not been found in Brazil. Although the genus Dorstenia fits well in Moraceae, near Ficus, its presents characters that demonstrate an affinity with some genera of Urticaceae.
23493149|Nesse artigo foram estudados a acumulao e perda de radionucldeos artificiais em trs espcies de algas marinhas bentnicas do Estado do Rio de Janeiro, em condies laboratoriais, visando a seleo de indicadores biolgicos de contaminao radioativa no meio marinho. In this paper, the acummulations and the loss of artificial radionuclides in three species of marine benthic algae of state of Rio de Janeiro were studied under laboratory conditions, so that a selection of biological indicators for radioctive contamination of the marine environment could be made. Medium concentration factores were calculated in the described conditions, the most significant figures being those obtained for the algae Pterocladia capillacea (Gmelin) Bornet et Thuret (13240) p/131I and Sargassum vulgare J. Agardh (195) p/51Cr.
23493144|The Author describes a new species of Apodanthes Poit. (Rafflesiaceae): Apodanthes roraimae Vattimo n.sp., collected in the Brazilian Territory of Roraima, near the locality of Auaris, on "terra firmi" and also between Mait and the Indian Village of Paramiteri (Vila Indgena de Paramiteri), on ManausCaracara Road. The species is close to Apodanthes panamensis Vattimo, but differs by the more developed flowers and the petals not truncated at base (as they are in panamensis). The petals of A. roraimae Vattimo n.sp. are suborbicular, often attenuated at the base.
23497132|Foi realizado o estudo taxonmico do gnero Heliotropium L. no estado de Pernambuco, utilizando-se espcimes coletados em campo por um perodo de 16 meses, alm de materials de emprstimo e/ou doao provenientes de vrios herbrios nacionais. Verificou-se a ocorrncia de sete taxa: H. angiospermum Murray, H. curassavicum L., H. elongatum (Lehm.) I.M. Johnst., H. indicum L., H. polyphyllum Lehm., H. procumbens Mill e H. ternatum Vahl. H. curassavicum e H. ternatum constituem nova referncia para o Nordeste e Pernambuco, Brasil, respectivamente. As espcies mais amplamente distribudas so H. angiospermum, H. elongatum e H. procumbens, ocorrendo desde a zona do litoral at a zona das caatingas. A taxonomic study of the genus Heliotropium L. in the State of Pernambuco was carried out. The survey was based on field studies during 16 months and material provided by loan and donation from different brazilian herbaria. Seven species were recorded: H. angiospermum Murray, H. curassavicum L., H. elongatum (Lehm.) I.M. Johnst., H. indicum L., H. polyphyllum Lehm., H. procumbens Mill. and H. ternatum Vahl. H. curassavicum and H. ternatum represent new geographical occurrences from Northeastern and State of Pernambuco, Brazil, respectively. The species most widely distributed were H. angiospermum, H. elongatum and H. procumbens, occurring both since litoral to caatinga's zone.
23497128|Este trabalho teve como objetivo inventariar as Orchidaceae das restingas do estado do Esprito Santo, detectar as formas de vida e proceder a uma anlise da similaridade entre as formaes vegetais das restingas, atravs da flora orquidolgica. Foram identificados 73 txons, sendo 71 espcies, dentre estas uma nova para cincia, e dois hbridos naturais. O major nmero de espcies foi encontrado em Epidendrum (7) e Pleurothallis (6). Foram encontrados 31 txons holoepfitos, 28 txons terrestres, 12 txons epfitos facultativos e dois txons hemiepfitos. Das 10 formaes vegetais de restinga as Orchidaceae estiveram representadas em oito. A floresta arenosa litornea apresentou 58 txons, seguida pela formao aberta de Clusia (31), formao aberta de Ericaceae (20), floresta periodicamente inundada (14), formao pspraia (13), formao Palmae (10), formao brejo herbceo (3) e formao praial graminide (2). A major similaridade florstica, utilizando o ndice de Sorensen, foi encontrada entre as formaes arbustivas fechadas (ps-praia e Palmae) seguidas pelas formaes arbustivas abertas (de Ericaceae e de Clusia). Estes dois grupos se ligam, com menor similaridade s formaes florestais, enquanto as formaes herbceas so as mais dissimilares. An inventory of the Orchidaceae of the coastal plain vegetation (restingas) of Esprito Santo State, Brazil, is presented here. The life forms were examined as well as the similarity between restinga vegetation types based on the orchid flora. Botanical material was collected along the entire coast and material from the following herbaria was examined: CVRD, MBML and VIES. A total of 73 taxa were identified, including two natural hybrids. Of the 71 remaining taxa, one was a new species. The most species-rich genera were Epidendrum (7) and Pleurothallis (6). The taxons were classified as follows: 31 holoepiphytes, 28 terrestrials, 12 facultative epiphytes and 2 hemiepiphytes. Orchid species are found in eigth of the 10 restinga vegetation types: sandy coastal forest (58), open Clusia scrub (31), open Ericaceae scrub (20), periodically flooded forest (14), closed beach-thicket (13), Palm scrub (10), sedge swamp (3) and creeping psammophytic (2). Highest floristic similarity based on Sorensen's index was found between the closed formations (beach thicket and Palmae scrub), followed by the open formations (Ericaceae and Clusia). These two groups are linked at lower similarity values with the forest formations, while the herbaceous formations are quite dissimilar.
23497133|Neste trabalho descreve-se o desenvolvimento da lmina foliar de Beilschmiedia rigida (Mez) Kosterm., desde o surgimento do primrdio foliar no pice vegetativo at sua completa expanso. So apontadas caractersticas como  presena de tricomas apenas nas folhas jovens; ocorrncia de projees parietais e invaginaes protoplasmticas nas paredes anticlinais e periclinais das clulas epidrmicas; estmatos paracticos de origem mesopergena; hipoderme em trs estratos na face adaxial e em apenas um na face abaxial da lmina foliar e clulas secretoras que surgem nos primeiros estgios de diferenciao da folha assim como idioblastos cristalferos em grupos. The differentiation and development of leaves of Beilschmiedia rigida from the leaf primordium to the complete leaf expansion are described. Characteristics as  presence of trichomes in young leafs only, occurrence of walls and protoplasmic projections in the anticlinal and periclinal walls of epidermal cells, paracitic stomata of mesoperiginous origin; three layers of hipodermis in the adaxial face and one layer in the abaxial face of leaf blade and secretory cells and cristaliferous idioblasts groups that arises in the leaf primordium were pointed.
23497129|Este trabalho trata das espcies de Piperaceae representadas no estado do Cear, Brasil, com interesse assentado no conhecimento taxonmico, como tambm no seu valor medicinal. O tratamento taxonmico compreende descries, chaves para identificao dos txons e distribuio geogrfica com base no exame de exsicatas de herbrios, incluindo tipos. Comentrios sobre utilidades e dados ambientais so atribudos a algumas espcies. Para o Cear, segundo o material examinado, so assinalados 4 gneros, separados principalmente pelo hbito e pela disposio das inflorescncias, constantes de 35 taxa que se distinguem pelos padres de nervao foliar, bractolas florais e frutos. Os indivduos destes txons ocorrem nas reas midas das serras de Baturit, Maranguape, Aratanha e Machado; a maioria apresenta distribuio ampla, enquanto que Piper rufipilum Yunck.  espcie endmica da Chapada do Araripe e Ottonia leptostachia Kunth constituiu-se em uma nova localidade. The subject of this paper is the Piperaceae species which occur in the state of Cear, Brazil, with special attention paid to their taxonomy, as well as the medicinal value. The taxonomic treatment used in this study were the following in the examination of dissected dried herbarium specimens including types, descriptions, keys for identification of taxa and geographical distribution. Commentary on the use and ambiental data are presented for some taxa. The State of Cear denote in the material examined 4 genera, differentiated by habitat and arrangement of inflorescence, in 35 taxa which are distinguishable by their patterns of foliar nervation, floral bracteoles and fruits. The individuals these taxa occur in the humid regions of the mountains of Baturit, Maranguape, Aratanha and Machado; where the majority of them are widely distributed, whereas Piper rufipilum Yunck. is only found in Chapada do Araripe and Ottonia leptostachia Kunth is found in yet another are.

23497134|O estudo taxonmico de Phyllanthus L. no bioma Caatinga de Pernambuco foi realizado atravs da anlise morfolgica de materiais herborizados e de observaes de campo. Constataramse 11 taxa: Phyllanthus acuminatus Vahl., P. amarus Schumach. & Thonn., P. caroliniensis Walt. subsp. caroliniensis., P. claussenii Mll. Arg., P. jacobinensis Mll. Arg., P. klotzschianus Mll. Arg., P. minutulus Mll. Arg., P niruri L., P. heteradenius Mll. Arg., P. stipulatus (Raf.) Webster e P. tenellus Roxb. Os principais caracteres morfolgicos utilizados para separao das espcies foram o hbito, o padro de a ramificao, forma do disco glandular das flores de ambos os sexos, o nmero e unio dos estames e a ornamentao das sementes. A maior parte das espcies apresenta distribuio nas subzonas do agreste e serto em vegetao de Caatinga. Apenas P. acuminatus Vahl, P. minutulus Mll. Arg. e P. stipulatus (Raf.) Webster foram encontradas exclusivamente na subzona do Agreste, nas florestas Montanas. The taxonomic study of species in the genus Phyllanthus L. in the caatinga biome of the State of Pernambuco was carried out based on morphological analysis of fresh material or from specimen vouchers of the local herbaria. Eleven taxa were recorded: Phyllanthus acuminatus Vahl, P. amarus Schumach. & Thonn., P. caroliniensis Walt. subsp. caroliniensis, P. claussenii Mll. Arg., P. heteradenius Mll. Arg., P. jacobinensis Mll. Arg., P. klotzschianus Mll. Arg., P. minutulus Mll. Arg., P niruri L., P. orbiculatus Rich., P. stipulatus (Raf.) Webster. and P. tenellus Roxb. The main morphological features used for delimitation of the species were habit, branching pattern, shape of the glandular disk on both male and female flowers, number and union of the stamens, type of dehiscence of anthers and seed coat. Most species present geographical distribution in steppe-savannah vegetation on different vegetational physiognomies (Agreste and Serto). Only P. acuminatus Vahl., P. minutulus Mll. Arg. and P. stipulatus (Raf.) Webster occur exclusively in the upland forests within the Agreste Zone.
23497130|A Flora Brasiliensis, obra idealizada e editada, em sua maior parte por Karl Friederich Philipp von Martius, entre os anos de 1840 e 1906, trata do conjunto de espcies da flora brasileira at ento conhecidas. Nessa obra, a famlia Rubiaceae, representada por 99 gneros e 1043 espcies, teve o tratamento taxonmico feito por K. Schumann e Mueller Argoviensis. O estudo descritivo da distribuio geogrfica, apresentado s pginas 415 a 422 do volume 6, parte 6, foi elaborado apenas por Schumann. A leitura e interpretao do tratamento dado s Rubiaceae, nessa obra, ainda hoje  muito importante e, muitas vezes, imprescindvel para estudiosos da flora brasileira, especialmente para aqueles que se dedicam  taxonomia,  florstica e  fitogeografia. A dificuldade de leitura do texto descritivo, em latim, sobre a distribuio geogrfica deste grupo assim como as muitas alteraes sofridas nos nomes genricos e binmios especficos criam empecilhos  interpretao da viso primorosa de Schumann sobre o conjunto de Rubiaceae da flora brasileira e da contribuio dos txons desta famlia nos diferentes biomas brasileiros. Apresenta-se, neste trabalho, a traduo para o portugus de texto latino elaborado por Schumann sobre a distribuio geogrfica das Rubiaceae, acompanhada da atualizao dos nomes cientficos nele contidos. Flora Brasiliensis, planned and edited mainly by Karl Friederich Philipp von Martius, from 1840 and 1906, deals with all species from Brazilian Flora known at that time. In this work, the Rubiaceae, represented by 99 genus and 1043 species, was taxonomicaly analysed by K. Schumann and Mueller Argoviensis. The geographical distribution study, presented on pages 415 to 422 of volume 6, part 6, was written only by Schumann. Reading and interpretation of this work is very important and sometimes indispensable for Brazilan flora researchers, specially for those dedicated to taxonomy, floristic and fitogeography. The descriptive text on the geographical distribution in Latin and the various changes on generic and specific names raise difficulties for comprehending Schumann's great vision about the whole Rubiaceae family in Brazilian flora and the presence of this family's taxa throughout different Brazilian biomes. This paper presents the Portuguese translation of the latin text by Schumann on the geographical distribution of Rubiaceae, and updates scientific names presented there.
23497135|O presente estudo visou avaliar mensalmente a compartimentao mineral em Ouratea spectabilis (Mart.) Engl. nas diferentes fenofases, no perodo de agosto de 1995 a julho de 1996, em rea de cerrado, na Reserva Biolgica e Estao Experimental de Mogi-Guau, localizado no municpio de Mogi-Guau, em So Paulo. Foram analisados todos os macronutrientes (N, P, K, Ca, Mg e S) nos compartimentos folha, em 3 estdios de desenvolvimento foliar, ramo, flor e fruto. As observaes fenolgicas foram realizadas mensalmente em 20 espcimens distribudos na rea de cerrado, sendo consideradas as fenofases brotao, queda foliar, florao e frutificao. A distribuio dos elementos minerais nos compartimentos e nos diferentes estdios de desenvolvimento foliar revelou diferenas significativas e padres sazonais bem definidos, permitindo identificar a importncia de cada nutriente nas diferentes fases do desenvolvimento da planta, e sugerir sobre a capacidade de retranslocao destes elementos e manuteno do balano nutricional. Face a essas anlises, a espcie O. spectabilis comporta-se de maneira altamente eficiente na utilizao de gua e nutrientes, refletindo padres fenolgico e de distribuio que garantem a sua sobrevivncia em ambientes de cerrado. The present study aims to evaluate monthly the mineral nutrition presented by the population of Ouratea spectabilis (Mart.) Engl. in different phenophases, from August of 1995 to July of 1996, in a cerrado area of the Reserva Biolgica e Estao Experimental de Mogi-Guau, located at Mogi-Guau City, So Paulo. All the macro elements (N, P, K, Ca, Mg and S) were analyzed on leaves, branches, flowers and fruits compartments, and in 3 leaf development stages. The phenological studies were made monthly in 20 specimens distributed in the cerrado area and phenophases variation (leaf flushing, leaf fall, flowering and fruiting) were analyzed quantitatively. The distribution of the mineral elements among the sampled vegetative parts revealed significant differences and a well defined seasonal pattern, which allows to identify the importance of each nutrient in different developmental phase of the plant, and it suggest about the mineral translocation capacity and its nutritional status. In face of these facts, O. spectabilis shows significant efficiency in water and nutrient utilization, reflecting in distribution and phenological patterns that guarantees its survival in cerrado's environments.

23497600|Realizou-se o estudo morfolgico e taxonmico dos txons de Myrceugenia O. Berg (Myrtaceae) do Parque Nacional do Itatiaia e avaliou-se a utilizao dos caracteres vegetativos e elementos florais como informao diagnstica. O estudo consta de descries, chave analtica, observaes de campo efetuadas durante as coletas e levantamento de herbrios. Foram assinalados para a rea oito txons: Myrceugenia alpigena (DC.) Landrum var. alpigena; M. bracteosa (DC.) D. Legrand & Kausel; M. campestris (DC.) D. Legrand & Kausel; M. cucullata D. Legrand; M. glaucescens var. latior Burret (Landrum); M. miersiana (Gardner) D. Legrand & Kausel, M. ovata var. regnelliana (O. Berg) Landrum e M. seriatoramosa (Kiaersk.) D. Legrand & Kausel. Os caracteres diagnsticos considerados para os txons foram forma da inflorescncia, do boto floral, dos prfilos e lobos calicinais bem como presena e ausncia de nervura intramarginal. Os caracteres vegetativos por si s no constituram elementos suficientemente diagnsticos para os txons ocorrentes na rea. Foram registradas duas novas ocorrncias para o estado do Rio de Janeiro: M. campestris e M. cucullata. A morphological and taxonomic analysis of the species of Myrceugenia O. Berg (Myrtaceae) in Itatiaia National Park, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, was carried out. In addition to determining the species present in the Park, the usefulness of vegetative and floral characters as diagnostic tools was evaluated. The study includes descriptions, an identification key, observations made in the field and from herbarium collections. Eight taxa were identified: Myrceugenia alpigena (DC.) Landrum var. alpigena; M. bracteosa (DC.) D. Legrand & Kausel; M. campestris (DC.) D. Legrand & Kausel; M. cucullata D. Legrand; M. glaucescens var. latior Burret (Landrum); M. miersiana (Gardner) D. Legrand & Kausel, M. ovata var. regnelliana (O. Berg) Landrum and M. seriatoramosa (Kiaersk.) D. Legrand & Kausel. Diagnostic characters found useful were the shapes of the inflorescence, the flower bud, the prophyll and the calyx-lobes, as well as the presence or absence of an intramarginal vein. vegetative characters alone are not diagnostic to distinguish the species of Myrceugenia in the Park. Two new occurrences for the state of Rio de Janeiro were registered: M. campestris and M. cucullata.
23497601|Este trabalho consiste da taxonomia, com o auxlio de observaes de campo dos txons, de Swartzia na Reserva Natural da Companhia Vale do Rio Doce. Alm da chave de identificao e descries detalhadas para cada um dos oito txons detectados neste trabalho, so apresentadas observaes sobre o porte, aspecto externo e interno da casca, com fotografias para todas as espcies, sendo que foram atribudos padres da casca externa para cada um dos txons. Swartzia apetala var. apetala  encontrada nos mais diversos habitats presentes na rea de estudo, enquanto S. acutifolia, S. apetala var. glabra, S. linharensis, S. myrtifolia var. elegans e S. simplex var. ochnacea so encontradas somente na Floresta Alta de Terra Firme e S. macrostachya var. macrostachya, na rea focada aqui,  exclusiva do Campo Nativo. S. myrtifolia var. elegans e S. simplex var. ochnacea so os nicos txons que no apresentam casca descamante. This study consists of the taxonomy, with the use of field observations, to distinguish among taxa of Swartzia occuring in the "Reserva Natural da Companhia Vale do Rio Doce". Besides the key to identify and the detailed descriptions to each one of the eight taxa detected in this study we present observations on the size, internal and external aspects on the bark, with photographs of all taxa, where we attributed patterns of external bark to all of them. S. apetala var. apetala is found in all different habitats present in the studied site, while S. acutifolia, S. apetala var. glabra, S. linharensis, S. myrtifolia var. elegans, and S. simplex var. ochnacea are found just in the "Floresta Alta de Terra Firme" and S. macrostachya var. macrostachya, in the area focused here, is exclusive of the "Campo Nativo". S. myrtifolia var. elegans and S. simplex var. ochnacea are the only taxa that do not have bark that peels off.

The analysis of the pteridophyte flora indicates the occurrence of 17 families, 45 genera and 117 species. Identification keys for families and species of the area are presented.

23497598|Dos grandes biomas brasileiros, a caatinga  um dos mais desconhecidos do ponto de vista florstico e fitogeogrfico. No Piau, este bioma reveste cerca de 37% do seu territrio, apresentando uma nica Unidade de Conservao, o Parque Nacional Serra da Capivara. Este trabalho objetivou listar as espcies coletadas na rea do Parque. Para isso, foi realizado um levantamento do material coletado na regio, depositado no Herbrio Graziela Barroso da Universidade Federal do Piau  TEPB/UFPI, acrescidos de material resultante de coletas realizadas em duas unidades geomorfolgicas (sedimentar e cristalino) no perodo de dois anos. Foram registradas um total de 210 espcies distribudas em 149 gneros e 62 famlias. As famlias com maior riqueza foram Caesalpiniaceae, Fabaceae, Mimosaceae, Bignoniaceae, Euphorbiaceae e Myrtaceae com 46% das espcies. Verificou-se que a heterogeneidade do ambiente fsico influencia na distribuio das espcies nos diferentes bitopos da regio. No que se refere  regio semi-rida como um todo, observou-se que, com exceo de um pequeno grupo de espcies, h semelhana florstica entre a rea de estudo com outras reas de caatinga do semi-rido nordestino, quer sejam instaladas em terrenos sedimentares ou sobre o embasamento cristalino. Of the great Brazilian biomes, the caatinga is one of the most poorly known from the floristic and phytogeografic point of view. In Piau state, this biome covers about 37% of its territory, with only one conservation unit, the Serra da Capivara National Park. This work aims at listing the species collected in the Park area. With that objective, a survey was made of the material collected in the area deposited in the Herbarium "Graziela Barroso" of the Universidade Federal do Piau  TEPB/UFPI, in adittion to samples resultant from collection in two geomorphologic units (sedimentary lands and crystalline soil) during a two year period. It was registered a total of 210 species distributed in 149 genus and 62 families. The families with greater diversity were Caesalpiniaceae, Fabaceae, Mimosaceae, Bignoniaceae, Euphorbiaceae and Myrtaceae totalling 46% of the species. It was verified that the heterogeneity of the physical environment influences in the distribution of species in the different biotypes of the area. As far as the semi-arid region as a whole is concerned, it was observed that, except for a small group of species, there is floristic similarity between the study area with other areas of caatinga in Brazil's Northeastern native semi-arid, whether installed in sedimentary lands or on crystalline soil.
23497831|A Reserva est localizada em Descoberto, Minas Gerais, e abrange uma rea de 263,8 hectares de floresta estacional semidecdua. Foram encontrados oito gneros e 17 espcies que ocorrem preferencialmente prximas dos cursos d'gua e raramente formam grandes populaes, sendo que a maioria das espcies est representada na rea por poucos indivduos. So apresentadas chave de identificao das espcies, descries, informaes sobre florao e frutificao, distribuio geogrfica e habitat, e ilustraes. The Reserva Biolgica da Represa do Grama is situated in Descoberto, Minas Gerais, and consists of 263,8 hectares of seasonal forest. Eight genera and 17 species of Araceae have been recorded from the Reserve. The species occur commonly close to the river margins and rarely form large populations, the great majority of the species is represented by few individuals. A key for the identification of the species, descriptions, illustrations, information about flowering and fruiting, geographical distribution and habitats of each species are presented.
23497830|New species from the Department of Amazonas in Peru are described as new in preparation for the treatment of the Araceae for the Flora del Cenepa y Areas Adyacentes Amazonas Peru. 23497826|Duas espcies novas do gnero Anthurium so descritas para a Serra da Bocaina, estado de So Paulo, ambas at o momento endmicas dessa localidade. Anthurium bocainensis pertence  seo Urospadix, subseo Flavescentiviridia e A. ameliae pertence  seo Urospadix subseo Obscureviridia, e ocorrem no bioma floresta atlntica. So fornecidas diagnoses, ilustraes e comentrios  cerca da distribuio geogrfica, ecologia, registro de florao, frutificao e conservao para cada espcie. Two new species of the genus Anthurium are described from the Serra da Bocaina, So Paulo state, Brazil. Both currently endemic to this area and thus considered part of the Atlantic Forest biome. Anthurium bocainensis belongs to sect. Urospadix, subsect. Flavescentiviridia, and A. ameliae belongs to sect. Urospadix subsect. Obscureviridia. Diagnoses, descriptions, illustrations and commentary on geographical distribution, ecology, flowering and fruiting times and conservation status are provided for each species.
23497825|The paper discusses the taxonomy and nomenclature of Philodendron hastatum and aims to clarify the status of some other names often used to name specimens with similar leaf blade shape. A description of the species is provided based on the study of herbarium material. So fornecidas descrio morfolgica e figura da espcie baseadas no estudo de materiais de herbrio.
23497827|Five new species of Anthurium are described from Peru: Anthurium chinchipense Croat & Lingn, A. hamiltonii Croat & Lingn, A. magdae Croat & Lingn, A. mariae Croat & Lingn, and A. piurensis Croat & Lingn. 23497832|Leaf and spathe anatomy of seven species and two varieties of the genus Anthurium (section Urospadix; subsection Flavescentiviridia) were analyzed. Plant material was collected from different locations in Brazil and cultivated under identical glasshouse conditions in the Rio de Janeiro Botanical Garden. Our attempt is to evaluate the diagnostic potential of leaf and spathe anatomy for taxonomic purposes. Leaves presented smooth cuticle, polygonal epidermal cells randomly disposed in paradermal view, periclinal divisions of epidermal cells in transversal view, non-raised stomata, collenchyma, sclerenchymatic bundle sheaths and raphides in the mesophyll. The spathe presented cuticular striations; rectangular and elongated cells in parallel rows; raised stomata; absence of collenchyma, raphides and sclerenchymatic bundle sheaths and presence of sclerenchyma as fibre caps under phloem. Clustering analysis based on leaf and spathe anatomical characters, revealed that the spathe can give a better resolution for segregation of species groups. So apresentados dados relativos  anatomia da lmina foliar e espata de sete espcies e duas variedades do gnero Anthurium pertencentes  seo Urospadix; subseo Flavescentiviridia. Os indivduos foram coletados nos estados do Rio de Janeiro, So Paulo e Minas Gerais, e aclimatados no Instituto de Pesquisas Jardim Botnico do Rio de Janeiro. O objetivo deste estudo  comparar anatomicamente lmina foliar e espata, visando detectar qual das duas estruturas  mais til  diagnose taxonmica das espcies estudadas. Observa-se nas folhas a presena de cutcula lisa e clulas epidrmicas dispostas ao acaso, estmatos nivelados com a epiderme, divises periclinais em clulas epidrmicas, alm de rfides no mesofilo e bainha esclerenquimtica nos feixes vasculares. J quanto  espata observa-se cutcula estriada, clulas alongadas e ordenadas de forma paralela, estmatos por vezes elevados, ausncia de rfides e presena de calota de fibras apenas junto ao floema, quando no ausentes. A anlise de agrupamento para folha e espata revelou maior poder de resoluo com base em caracteres anatmicos da espata; alm dos grupos formados com base nos caracteres anatmicos da folha no serem consistentes taxonomicamente. Sugere-se portanto que a espata apresenta maior valor diagnstico ao nvel anatmico para subsidiar estudos taxonmicos do gnero Anthurium.
23497823|Araceae apresenta uma morfologia e terminologia especfica, que pode ocasionar dificuldades de compreenso. Alm disso, alguns conceitos adotados para a famlia, so discordantes entre os especialistas do grupo. Para uma compreenso profunda de tal morfologia, bibliografias especializadas so requeridas. No levantamento das espcies de Araceae do Parque Estadual do Rio Doce (PERD) foram encontradas 13 espcies e oito gneros (incluindo aqueles com maior diversidade especfica, Anthurium e Philodendron). Uma sntese ilustrada da morfologia e terminologia dos gneros e espcies do PERD  apresentada, visando uma melhor compreenso da morfologia e taxonomia geral da famlia. The use of specialized terms for some morphological features in Araceae can cause problems in understanding for the general reader and there are not always agreements among taxonomic specialists of the correct usage of some descriptive terminologies. For a complete understanding of this morphology, specialized literature must be consulted. In an inventory of Araceae from the Rio Doce State Park (PERD) the morphology of 13 species and 8 genera was studied (including Anthurium and Philodendron). An illustrated overview of the morphology and terminology of the genera and species from the PERD is presented aiming a better understanding of the morphology and taxonomy of the family.
23497828|The formerly considered monospecific genus Scaphispatha (Araceae  Caladieae) is here revised. Scaphispatha robusta E.G.Gon, a second species for the genus is newly described from the Cerrado Biome and the transition Cerrado-Amazonia. It differs from S. gracilis Brongn. ex Schott by the much more robust petioles and leaves, primary lateral veins drying clearer than the lamina, lateral secondary veins conspicously more prominent than tertiary veins and for the female spadix with 11-15 rows of flowers visible in side view. A key to separate both species is provided, as well as ink illustrations and general remarks on the genus. O gnero Scaphispatha (Araceae  Caladieae), at ento considerado monoespecfico,  aqui revisado. Scaphispatha robusta E.G.Gon., uma segunda espcie para o gnero  descrita para o bioma Cerrado e a transio Cerrado-Amazonia. Difere de S. gracilis Brongn. ex Schott pelos pecolos e folhas muito mais robustas, nervuras laterais mais claras que o limbo quando secas, nervuras laterais secundrias mais proeminentes que as tercirias e pela poro feminina do espdice com 11-15 espirais de flores visveis em vista lateral. Uma chave para separar as espcies, assim como ilustraes em nanquim e aspectos gerais para o gnero so apresentados.
23497829|A new species of Monstera, M. barrieri Croat, Moonen & Poncy, is described from French Guiana. The species is characterized by its deeply pinnately lobed, black-drying blades and the wine-red to orange spadix axis. O presente trabalho apresenta uma nova espcie de Monstera nativa da Guiana Francesa, M. barrieri Croat, Moonen & Poncy. A espcie  caracterizada por apresentar lmina profundamente lobada, tornando-se negra quando seca e eixo da espdice vermelho-vinceo a alaranjado.
23497824|A revision of 6 closely related species from the Amazon basin in Colombia, Ecuador and Peru is presented, and 4 new species of Anthurium are published as new: Anthurium ceronii Croat, A. payaminoense Croat & Lingn, A. sydneyi Croat & Lingn and A. whitmorei Croat & Lingn. Two species, A. decurrens Poeppig and A. longispadiceum K. Krause are redescribed because they have been, until recently, totally unknown or misrepresented by other taxa. The species are all members of a new section named Decurrentia, newly named here for the first time. All members of section Decurrentia have in common short internodes, elongated, epunctate leaf blades, and peduncles tending to be weakly or prominently ridged or winged. In addition, several of the species have early-emergent, elongated berries. All species treated here occur in the lowlands of Amazonia and have been confused with one another by botanists for a long time.  apresentada uma reviso de seis espcies estreitamente relacionadas da bacia amaznica na Colmbia, Equador e Peru, sendo quatro espcies novas: Anthurium ceronii Croat, A. payaminoense Croat & Lingn, A. sydneyi Croat & Lingn e A. whitmorei Croat & Lingn. Duas espcies, A. decurrens Poeppig e A. longispadiceum K. Krause, so novamente descritas porque foram, at recentemente, totalmente desconhecidas ou confundidas com outros taxa. As espcies so membros de uma seo nova, Decurrentia, descrita aqui pela primeira vez. Todos os membros da seo Decurrentia tm em comum interns curtos, alongados, lminas da folha sem pontuaes e pednculos que tendem a ser fraca ou proeminente rgidos ou alados. Alm disso, vrias espcies tm bagas precocemente emergentes e alongadas. Todas as espcies tratadas aqui ocorrem na plancie amaznica e tm sido confundidas umas com as outras por botnicos durante muito tempo.
23498270|Nas elevadas altitudes do sudeste brasileiro so encontrados os campos de altitude. A fisionomia mais freqentemente encontrada nos plats relativamente extensos  a de arbustos inseridos em uma matriz de touceiras de gramneas, com esparsas ervas e pteridfitas. Os objetivos deste trabalho foram elaborar a lista florstica de plantas vasculares e determinar o espectro biolgico florstico, de uma campo de altitude localizado no Parque Estadual da Serra do Brigadeiro, Minas Gerais, Brasil. Para tanto, foram realizadas expedies mensais entre julho de 2000 a janeiro de 2002. As espcies foram classificadas nas classes de formas de vida de Raunkiaer, modificadas segundo Braun-Blanquet. Para a comparao do espectro biolgico da flora estudada com o espectro normal de Raunkiaer foi realizado um teste de qui-quadrado de independncia. Foram coletadas 81 espcies de plantas vasculares. A famlia mais rica foi Orchidaceae, seguida por Asteraceae, ambas bem representadas nos campos de altitude. O elevado nmero de espcies exclusivas de cada sinsia indica que as mesmas esto bem delimitadas na vegetao local. O espectro biolgico florstico mostrou um predomnio dos hemicriptfitos, seguido pelos camfitos, formas de vida relacionadas  fisionomia campestre. O teste de qui-quadrado mostrou que o espectro biolgico da vegetao estudada difere do normal de Raunkiaer.  necessria, a realizao de um maior nmero de estudos florsticos e ecolgicos em campos de altitude, pois a carncia atual de estudos no permite anlises comparativas, ferramentas importantes para se aferir relaes fitogeogrficas, e para avaliar o estado de conservao das reas possuidoras de tal formao vegetacional. In the high atitudes of Brazilian southeast, "campos de altitude" are found. The physiognomy most frequent in the relatively extensive plateaus is the one of schrubs within a matrix of bunchgrasses, with sparse herbs and pteridophytes. The aims of this paper were the elaboration of a floristic checklist of vascular plants and the determination of the floristic biological spectrum of a campo de altitude located in the "Serra do Brigadeiro" State Park, Minas Gerais  Brazil. For that, field expeditions were monthly accomplished between July 2000 to January 2002. The species were classified in the life form classes of Raunkiaer, modified according to Braun-Blanquet. A chi-square test of independence was carried out to compare the biological spectrum of the studied flora with the normal spectrum of Raunkiaer. Eighty-one species of vascular plants were identified, and the richest family was Orchidaceae, followed by Asteraceae, both well represented in "campos de altitude". The high number of species which are exclusive of each synusiae indicates that the same are well delimited in the local vegetation. The floristic biological spectrum showed a prevalence of hemicryptophytes followed by chamaephytes, life forms related to grassland physiognomy. The chi-square test showed that the biological spectrum of the studied vegetation differs from the normal of Rankiaer. The accomplishment of a higher number of floristic and ecological studies in campos de altitude is needed, since the lack of studies allows neither the realization of comparative studies, important to confront biogeographical relations nor foresight of their conservation status.
23498264|A famlia Annonaceae est representada nas restingas do estado do Rio de Janeiro por nove espcies: Anaxagorea dolichocarpa Sprague & Sandwith, Annona acutiflora Mart., A. glabra L., A. montana Macfad., Duguetia sessilis (Vell.) Maas, Guatteria nigrescens Mart., Oxandra nitida R.E.Fr., Xylopia ochrantha Mart. e X. sericea A.St.-Hil. Apresentam-se chave de identificao das espcies, breves descries, ilustraes e comentrios sobre fenologia, distribuio geogrfica, habitats e usos.
