23499401|Caraipa andina from La Fundacin, in the western Andes of Venezuela (Tchira State) is described, illustrated, and its morphological relationship with an allied species is discussed. This new species is morphologically related to C. heterocarpa Ducke, but it differs by the leaf blade shape, size, and dense abaxial papillae; fewer-flowered inflorescence; and shorter pedicel, flower buds, petals, and filaments. Phytogeographical information about the La Fundacin area is presented. This species represents the first report of this genus in the Venezuelan Andes. Caraipa andina foi descoberta em La Fundacin, nos Andes Ocidentais da Venezuela (Estado de Tchira) e  aqui descrita e ilustrada, discutindo-se suas afinidades morfolgicas com as espcies prximas. Morfologicamente relacionada com C. heterocarpa Ducke, a nova espcie diferencia-se pelo tamanho, forma da lmina foliar e face abaxial densamente papilosa; inflorescncia paucifloras; pedicelos, botes florais, ptalas e filamentos mais curtos. Informaes sobre a fitogeografia do local so apresentadas. Esta espcie representa o primeiro registro deste gnero nos Andes Venezuelanos.
23499392|Este estudo tem o intuito de testar o desempenho fotossinttico das espcies de algas bentnicas mais representativas da Lagoa Rodrigo de Freitas (Polysiphonia subtilissima, Cladophora vagabunda e Ulva flexuosa subsp. flexuosa) em diferentes salinidades, a fim de verificar seus limites de tolerncia. Cada amostra foi incubada nas salinidades 10, 15 e 25. Para cada salinidade foram realizadas quatro repeties (luz e escuro). Amostras de 10 mg foram utilizadas para cada espcie, durante aproximadamente 30 minutos de incubao, sob irradincia de 500  5 mmol.m2s1. Polysiphonia subtilissima e Cladophora vagabunda tiveram maior produo fotossinttica na salinidade de 15 (P < 0,05). Ulva flexuosa subsp. flexuosa no apresentou diferena em sua taxa fotossinttica nas trs salinidades (P = 0,09). Os resultados obtidos sugerem que alteraes futuras na salinidade da lagoa podero causar modificaes na dinmica das populaes das algas locais. This study aimed to test the photossynthetic performance of the most representative benthonic macroalgae species at the Rodrigo de Freitas Lagoon (Polysiphonia subtilissima, Cladophora vagabunda and Ulva flexuosa subsp. flexuosa) in response to different salinities in order to verify their tolerance limits. Each sample was tested under salinities 10, 15 and 25. Four replicates (light and dark) were used for each salinity. Samples of 10 mg were used for each species, during 30 minutes incubation, under irradiance of 500  5 mmol.m2s1. P. subtilissima and C. vagabunda presented higher photosynthetic production in the salinity of 15 (P < 0.05). U. flexuosa subsp. flexuosa did not differ in its photosynthetic rate under the three salinities sampled (P = 0.09). The present results suggest that future alterations related to the lagoon's salinity may cause alterations in the populations dynamics of the local algae.
23499397|Oito espcies de Stylogyne ocorrem no estado do Rio de Janeiro, das quais S. depauperata, S. lhotzkiana, S. sellowiana e S. sordida so endmicas. As flores pistiladas de S. lhotzkiana e bissexuais de S. sellowiana so descritas pela primeira vez. Cinco espcies so ilustradas pela primeira vez. So apresentados chave para identificao, comentrios sobre afinidades, distribuio geogrfica e ecologia das espcies. A Serra do Mar se destaca como importante centro de diversidade do gnero no estado do Rio de Janeiro, sendo os contrafortes da Serra dos rgos e do Macio do Tingu, as reas com maior representatividade de txons. Eight species of Stylogyne occur in Rio de Janeiro state, S. depauperata Mez, S. lhotzkiana, S. sellowiana and S. sordida being endemics. The pistillate flowers of S. lhotzkiana and the bisexual ones of S. sellowiana are described for the first time. Five species are illustrated for the first time. Identification key, and commentaries about affinities, distribution and ecology of the species are provided. In Rio de Janeiro state, the Serra do Mar presents the greatest diversity of Stylogyne species, in which the Serra dos rgos and Tingu groups of mountains show the larger number of taxa.
23499400|Realizou-se o estudo taxonmico de Melastomataceae, tribos Bertolonieae e Merianieae, no Parque Nacional do Itatiaia, situado entre os limites dos estados do Rio de Janeiro e Minas Gerais. Identificaram-se quatro espcies pertencentes a quatro gneros  Bertolonia, Behuria, Huberia e Meriania. So apresentadas chaves analticas para identificao de todos os gneros ocorrentes no Parque e das espcies estudadas, bem como descries, ilustraes, dados de distribuio geogrfica e comentrios sobre caractersticas morfolgicas e particularidades do ambiente. The taxonomic study of the tribes Bertolonieae and Merianieae (Melastomataceae) in the Itatiaia National Park is presented. This conservation unit is located between Rio de Janeiro and Minas Gerais states, where one species of each Bertolonia, Behuria, Huberia and Meriania were found. Identification keys of all the Melastomataceae genera found within this area and for those species studied in detail are presented, accompanied by descriptions, illustrations, geographical distribution data and comments about morphological characteristics and habitat notes.
23499880|Foi realizado o estudo palinolgico de 12 espcies de Acacia: A. farnesiana (Acacia subg. Acacia) e A. bahiensis, A. globosa, A. kallunkiae, A. langsdorffi, A. martiusiana, A. monacantha, A. piauhiensis, A. polyphylla, A. riparia, A. tenuifolia e A. velutina (Acacia subg. Aculeiferum). Os gros de plen foram acetolisados, medidos, descritos e ilustrados sob microscpio de luz e eletrnico de varredura. Os gros de plen em Acacia so reunidos em polades calimadas, mdias ou grandes, de contorno esferoidal, em vista frontal e elptico, em vista lateral, com 16 gros de plen, organizados de forma regular, com oito gros de plen em cada face, 4-porados. Em A. farnesiana, so observados 24-32 gros de plen organizados de forma irregular, 3-sulcados. Os gros de plen da polade so pequenos, subquadrados na face distal e piramidal, quando em vista equatorial. A sexina  granulada ou rugulada, na maioria das espcies. Conclui-se que as espcies no podem ser separadas atravs das suas caractersticas palinolgicas, com exceo de A. farnesiana. The pollen of 12 species of Acacia: A. farnesiana (L.) Willd. (Acacia subg. Acacia) e A. bahiensis Benth., A. globosa A. Bocage & S. Miotto, A. kallunkiae Grimes & Barneby, A. langsdorffii Benth., A. martiusiana (Steud.) Burkart, A. monacantha DC., A. piauhiensis Benth., A. polyphylla DC., A. riparia Kunth, A. tenuifolia (L.) Willd., and A. velutina DC. (Acacia subg. Aculeiferum) was studied. Material was acetolized, measured, described and illustrated using light and scanning electron microscopy. The pollen grains in Acacia are bound in medium or large calimad polyads, spheroidal in shape on frontal view and elliptical from the side, containing 16 pollen grains, organized regularly with 8 pollen grains on each side. Pollen grains are 4-porate. In A. farnesiana, 24-32 pollen grains are found irregularly organized, while pollen grains are 3-sulcate. The polyad pollen grains are small, subsquared on distal view and pyramidal on the equatorial view, sexine is thicker than the nexine. Species could not be separated by their palynological features, except for A. farnesiana.
23499877| apresentado o estudo taxonmico dos arbustos, subarbustos e trepadeiras de Leguminosae em dois fragmentos de Floresta Estacional Semidecidual em Araponga, proximo ao Parque Estadual da Serra do Brigadeiro (PESB). A coleta do material botnico foi realizada entre agosto de 2005 e setembro de 2006, durante visitas mensais ao entorno e interior de dois fragmentos florestais. Foram amostrados 21 txons, distribudos em 13 gneros. O gnero com maior nmero de espcies foi Desmodium (4 spp.), seguido por Chamaecrista, Senna, Mimosa, Centrosema e Crotalaria (2 spp. cada). O hbito subarbustivo foi o mais representado com 13 espcies. O estudo apresenta chave, descries e ilustraes dos txons, comentrios sobre taxonomia, fenologia, distribuio geogrfica e hbitat. The present study focussed on shrubs, subshrubs and vines belonging to the Leguminosae in two Seasonal Semidecidual Forest fragments in Araponga, near the Parque Estadual da Serra do Brigadeiro (PESB). Collections were carried out between August 2005 and September 2006, in monthly visits to the two sites and their surroundings. Twenty one taxa were found, distributed amongst 13 genera, of which the largest was Desmodium (4 spp.), followed by Chamaecrista, Senna, Mimosa, Centrosema and Crotalaria. (2 spp. each). The most frequent habit was subshrubby, found in 13 species. The study presents identification key, descriptions and illustrations of taxa, as well as data on their phenology, distribution and habitat.
23499879|Este trabalho trata do estudo taxonmico das espcies de Mimosoideae encontradas nos campos rupestres do Parque Estadual do Itacolomi (PEI), situado no sul da Cadeia do Espinhao. As coletas foram mensais, no perodo compreendido entre setembro de 2003 e outubro de 2004, em oito trilhas preestabelecidas. Foram encontradas 11 espcies de Mimosoideae, reunidas em trs gneros: Abarema (1 sp.), Inga (2 spp.) e Mimosa (8 spp.). So apresentadas chaves, descries e ilustraes para as espcies. Alm disso, so fornecidos dados sobre a distribuio geogrfica, fenologia, taxonomia e hbitat das espcies estudadas. A taxonomic treatment of the species of Mimosoideae from "campos rupestres" of the Itacolomi State Park (PEI), south portion of Espinhao Range, is presented. Field trips were performed monthly, from September/2003 to October/2004, in eight pre-established trails. Eleven species of Mimosoideae were found, belonging to three genera: Abarema (1 sp.), Inga (2 spp.) and Mimosa (8 spp.). An analytic key, species diagnoses and illustrations are presented. Additional informations are providing concerning geographic distribution, phenology, taxonomy and habitats.
23499881|A famlia Leguminosae  a mais representativa da caatinga, compreendendo cerca de um tero da riqueza de espcies catalogadas. Devido  importncia das Leguminosae no bioma, foi realizado um inventrio florstico no municpio de Mirandiba-PE, rea considerada prioritria para investigao cientfica devido  carncia de informao sobre a flora e a fauna. A coleta de material botnico foi realizada entre maro de 2006 e janeiro de 2008. Foram registradas 81 espcies distribudas em 42 gneros representando cerca de 25 % das leguminosas j citadas para o bioma. Destas, 17 so endmicas da caatinga, representando 25% do total de espcies amostradas. A subfamlia Caesalpinioideae contribuiu com 22 espcies distribudas em sete gneros, Mimosoideae com 23 espcies distribudas em 13 gneros e Papilionoideae com 36 espcies distribudas em 22 gneros. Os gneros mais representativos foram Senna (8 spp.), Mimosa (7 spp.), Chamaecrista (6 spp.), Macroptilium (4 spp.), Aeschynomene, Caesalpinia, Centrosema, Senegalia e Zornia (3 spp. cada), Bauhinia, Chloroleucon, Crotalaria, Desmodium, Dioclea, Indigofera, Piptadenia e Stylosanthes (2 spp. cada), e os demais com uma espcie cada. The Family Leguminosae is the most representative of the caatinga, comprizing about a third of the total number of species detected for that biome. Due to the importance of Leguminosae in caatinga, a floristic inventory was accomplished in the municipal district of Mirandiba-PE, a prioritary area for scientific investigation due to the lack of information on the flora and the fauna. Field trips were accomplished from March 2006 to January 2008 for collecting botanical material. Eighty one species distributed in 42 genera were registered, comprizing about 25% of the Leguminosae already registered for the biome. Seventeen of them are endemic to the caatinga, representing 25% of the total sampled species. The subfamily Caesalpinioideae is represented by 22 species distributed in 7 genera, Mimosoideae by 23 species distributed in 13 genera and Papilionoideae by 36 species distributed in 22 genera. The most representative genera were Senna (8 spp.), Mimosa (7 spp.), Chamaecrista (6 spp.), Macroptilium (4 spp.), Aeschynomene, Caesalpinia, Centrosema, Senegalia and Zornia (3 spp.), Bauhinia, Chloroleucon, Crotalaria, Desmodium, Dioclea, Indigofera, Piptadenia and Stylosanthes (2 spp.), the other ones with one species each.
23499876|A demanda de petrleo e derivados provoca acidentes que contaminam extensas reas. A maioria dos trabalhos sobre os efeitos dessa contaminao refere-se  germinao e desenvolvimento vegetal, pouco se sabendo sobre os efeitos na estrutura de tecidos e clulas. Este trabalho teve como objetivo analisar o efeito do solo contaminado por petrleo e solo biorremediado na anatomia de plntulas de Mimosa pilulifera (Leguminosae). O experimento foi realizado com solo da REPAR/PETROBRS, Araucria-PR, onde ocorreu um vazamento de petrleo em 2000. O experimento constou de trs tratamentos: solo contaminado com petrleo, solo biorremediado e solo no contaminado, com cinco repeties. Aps 30 dias da semeadura, foram analisados anatomicamente a raiz, hipoctilo, cotildone e eofilo e realizados testes microqumicos com sudan III, lugol e cloreto frrico. Mensuraram-se: dimetro do cilindro vascular e espessura do crtex da raiz, dimetro do hipoctilo e espessura dos cotildones e eofilos. A estrutura celular radicial de M. pilulifera sofreu maior interferncia no solo contaminado que no biorremediado. Na parte area, a nica alterao foi a reduo da espessura do eofilo em solo contaminado. The demand of oil and its derivatives have provoked accidents, contaminating areas of the planet. The majority of are relative to the effect in seed germination and plant development. Little is known on the effect of the hydrocarbons in the structure of the tissues and plant cells. This work intends to analyse the effect of the ground contaminated by oil and the bioremediated ground on the anatomy of seedlings of Mimosa pilulifera. The experiment was carried through with ground proceeding of the REPAR/PETROBRS, Araucria-PR, where a leak of oil occurred in 2000. The experiment consisted of three treatments: petroleum contaminated soil, bioremediated soil and non contaminated soil, with five repetitions. Thirty days after sowing, 10 seedlings were collected per treatment. The root, the hipocotyl, the cotyledon and the eophyll were analysed anatomically and were submitted to histochemical tests with Sudan III, lugol and ferric chloride. The diameter of the vascular cylinder and the thickness of the cortex of the root, the diameter of the hipocotyl and the thickness of the cotyledons and eophylls were measured. The cellular structure of the root of M. pilulifera suffered greater interference in the contaminated soil that the biorremediated. In shoots, the only change was the reduction in the thickness of eophyll in contaminated soil.
23499875|No presente trabalho foi estudada a morfologia dos frutos e das sementes e caractersticas de plntulas de: Canavalia rosea, Ormosia arborea, Pithecellobium tortum e Swartzia apetala var. apetala, de janeiro de 2004 a outubro de 2006, na restinga de Maric, Rio de Janeiro. As espcies possuem frutos deiscentes com disperso autocrica. As sementes de S. apetala var. apetala sugerem tambm disperso zoocrica pela presena de um arilo. As sementes recm-coletadas apresentam mdias altas de germinao: C. rosea (99%), O. arborea (100%), P. tortum (75%) e S. apetala var. apetala (93%), entretanto, no habitat natural, s foram encontradas plntulas de C. rosea. A germinao  criptocotiledonar em O. arborea e S. apetala var. apetala e fanerocotiledonar em C. rosea e P. tortum. The morphology of fruits, seeds and seedlings of Canavalia rosea, Ormosia arborea, Pithecellobium tortum and Swartzia apetala var. apetala in the "restinga" of Maric, state of Rio de Janeiro was studied between January 2004 and October 2006. All species present dehiscent fruits and autochorous dispersial, but the seeds of S. apetala var. apetala also suggest zoochorous dispersial by the presence of an aril. Newly collected seeds show high germination success: C. rosea (99%), O. arborea (100%), P. tortum (93%) and S. apetala var. apetala (75%), however, the only seedlings found in the natural habitat were of C. rosea. Cryptocotylar seedling was recorded for O. arborea and S. apetala var. apetala. while phanerocotylar seedling was observed in C. rosea and P. tortum.
23499873|The phytogeography and preferred habitat of Crotalaria species from Brazil are studied. Four species are widely distributed in Brazil, while C. goiasensis and C. irwinii are endemic to the state of Gois, C. clausseni to So Paulo, C. rufipila to Minas Gerais and C. brachycarpa and C. harleyi to Bahia. Crotalaria species occurs in the following biogeographical provinces: Amazonian, Atlantic, Caatinga, Cerrado, Chaquea, Guayana, Pampeana and Paranaense. The Cerrado province presents the largest number of species with restricted distribution, followed by the Paranaense province. The geographical distribution of species in Brazil shows higher species diversity in the highlands (800  2000 m.s.m.), such as the Serra Geral de Gois, Chapada dos Veadeiros, Espinhao Range (15-16 spp.), Serra da Mantiqueira and Serra do Mar (14 spp.). As well as the altitude, vegetation and climate influence the distribution of Crotalaria in Brazil. Este estudo apresenta a fitogeografia e os hbitos preferenciais das espcies de Crotalaria no Brasil. Quatro espcies so amplamente distribudas no Brasil. Por outro lado, C. goiasensis e C. irwinii so endmicas de Gois, C. clausseni de So Paulo, C. rufipila de Minas Gerais e C. brachycarpa e C. harleyi da Bahia. As espcies de Crotalaria ocorrem nas seguintes provncias biogeogrficas: cerrado, paranense, atlntica, amaznica, caatinga, chaquenha, guayana e pampeana. A provncia do cerrado apresenta o maior nmero de espcies exclusivas seguida da provncia paranense. A distribuio geogrfica das espcies brasileiras mostra que a maior diversidade ocorre em reas elevadas (800  2000 m.s.m.), como a Serra Geral de Gois, Chapada dos Veadeiros, Cadeia do Espinhao (15-16 spp.), Serra da Mantiqueira e Serra do Mar (14 spp.). As elevadas altitudes, bem como as caractersticas vegetacionais e climticas influenciam a distribuio das espcies de Crotalaria no Brasil.
23499874|Calliandra brevipes e Calliandra tweedii, tambm conhecidas como caliandra ou esponjinha, so espcies nativas do Brasil cultivadas como plantas ornamentais. O objetivo deste trabalho foi avaliar os efeitos da aplicao de diferentes concentraes de cido Indolbutrico (AIB) no enraizamento de Calliandra tweedii e Calliandra brevipes e relacion-los com a estrutura anatmica das estacas. Ambas as espcies apresentaram um aumento na porcentagem de enraizamento e no nmero de razes quando tratadas com AIB. Todos os tratamentos de Calliandra brevipes obtiveram porcentagens de enraizamento superiores s de Calliandra tweedii, sendo que os melhores resultados desta foram com 2000 mg.L1 AIB (56,67%). C. brevipes teve 90% de enraizamento sem a necessidade de aplicao de AIB. A raiz tem origem direta em ambas as espcies, podendo originar-se na regio interna ou externa do floema. Provavelmente, os fatores limitantes ao enraizamento de C. tweedii so devidos  estrutura anatmica e fisiolgica, como a ausncia de grnulos de amido na regio da medula. Calliandra brevipes and Calliandra tweedii, known as 'caliandra' or 'esponjinha', are native Brazilian ornamental species. This experiment aimed to evaluate the effect of the application of different concentrations of Indolbutiric acid (IBA) in root formation of both species by observing anatomical structure. Both species presented an increase in root formation percentage and number of new roots when treated with IBA. All Calliandra brevipes treatments achieved higher root formation percentages than Calliandra tweedii. The best results of C. brevipes were 2000 mg.L1 IBA (56,67%). C. brevipes had 90% of rooting without IBA application. Roots originated directly for both species, either from the inner or outer phloem region. Probably the limiting factors for C. tweedii root formation were linked to its anatomy and physiology, such as the absence of starch granules in the medular region.
23499878|Stylosanthes  um gnero pantropical constitudo por 50 espcies, sendo a metade destas registradas no Brasil. Neste estudo  apresentado o levantamento das espcies de Stylosanthes ocorrentes em Mato Grosso do Sul, por meio de anlises de material depositado em herbrios nacionais e de coletas efetuadas no estado. Stylosanthes est representado em Mato Grosso do Sul por 17 espcies, distribudas em duas sees. Stylosanthes seo Styposanthes est representada por cinco espcies: S. bracteata, S. capitata, S. hamata, S. macrocephala e S. scabra e Stylosanthes seo Stylosanthes por 12 espcies: S. acuminata, S. gracilis, S. grandifolia, S. guianensis, S. hippocampoides, S. humilis, S. linearifolia, S. longiseta, S. maracajuensis, S. montevidensis, S. nunoi e S. viscosa. So ocorrncias inditas para o estado: S. capitata, S. hamata, S. hippocampoides, S. humilis, S. linearifolia, S. macrocephala, S. montevidensis e S. nunoi. Em Mato Grosso do Sul verifica-se que as espcies de Stylosanthes podem ocorrer no cerrado, cerrado, campo sujo e chaco. Among those used species is the genus Stylosanthes is a pantropical genus with 50 species, half of them occurring in Brazil. This study presents a survey of Stylosanthes species of the state of Mato Grosso do Sul, through analysis of material from national herbaria and field collections. Stylosanthes is represented in Mato Grosso do Sul by 17 species, distributed into two sections. Stylosanthes section Styposanthes is represented by five species: S. bracteata, S. capitata, S. hamata, S. macrocephala and S. scabra and Stylosanthes section Stylosanthes by 12 species: Stylosanthes acuminata, S. gracilis, S. grandifolia, S. guianensis, S. hippocampoides, S. humilis, S. linearifolia, S. longiseta, S. maracajuensis, S. montevidensis, S. nunoi and S. viscosa. As new occurrences for the state are pointed out: S. capitata, S. hamata, S. hippocampoides, S. humilis, S. linearifolia, S. macrocephala, S. montevidensis and S. nunoi. Species of Stylosanthes in Mato Grosso do Sul occur in cerrado savanna, cerrado-woodland, grassland and Chaco.
23499870|O estudo taxonmico de Mimosa no Vale do Ipanema foi realizado atravs da anlise morfolgica de materiais de herbrios e coletados em campo. Constataram-se 11 txons distribudos em trs sees: 1) Mimosa sect. Batocaulon (M. adenocarpa, M. arenosa, M. gemmulata var. adamantina, M. lewisii, M. misera, M. ophthalmocentra e M. tenuiflora); 2) Mimosa sect. Habbasia (M. somnians); e 3) Mimosa sect. Mimosa (M. hirsutissima var. hirsutissima, M. modesta var. ursinoides e M. sensitiva var. sensitiva). Os principais caracteres morfolgicos utilizados para separao das espcies foram os tipos de indumento e de inflorescncias, nmero de pinas, folilulos, de elementos do perianto e de estames, alm do aspecto do fruto. A maior parte das espcies apresenta distribuio em vegetao de caatinga, apenas M. hirsutissima var. hirsutissima, M. gemmulata var. adamantina, M. misera e M. sensitiva var. sensitiva ocorrem em vegetao arbustiva pereniflia. The taxonomic study of Mimosa L. in the Ipanema Valley was based on morphologic analysis of fresh material or herbarium specimens, as well as field observations. Eleven taxa, distributed in three sections, were found: 1) Mimosa sect. Batocaulon (M. adenocarpa, M. arenosa, M. gemmulata var. adamantina, M. lewisii, M. misera, M. ophthalmocentra and M. tenuiflora); 2) Mimosa sect. Habbasia (M. somnians); and 3) Mimosa sect. Mimosa (M. hirsutissima var. hirsutissima, M. modesta var. ursinoides and M. sensitiva var. sensitiva). The main characters used for delimitation of the species were type of indumentum, inflorescence morphology, number of pinnae, leaflets, perianth elements and stamens, as well as aspects from the fruit. Most species occur in caatinga vegetation, only M. hirsutissima var. hirsutissima, M. gemmulata var. adamantina, M. misera and M. sensitiva var. sensitiva occur in evergreen shrubby vegetation.
23499872|O gnero Copaifera est presente na frica (4 spp.), Amrica Central (4 spp.), Amrica do Sul (cerca de 37 spp.) e, provavelmente, na sia (1 sp.). Foram reconhecidas nove espcies de Copaifera na Amaznia brasileira: Copaifera duckei, C. glycycarpa, C. guyanensis, C. martii, C. multijuga, C. paupera, C. piresii, C. pubiflora e C. reticulata, representadas tanto por arbustos ou rvores que chegam a atingir at 40 metros de altura, fornecendo tanto madeira como o leo-resina, extrado de seu tronco, utilizada na preparao de medicamentos, cosmticos, tintas e revelao de fotografias. O presente trabalho apresenta uma chave para identificao das espcies que ocorrem na Amaznia brasileira, incluindo ilustraes, descries e comentrios sobre morfologia e taxonomia. Copaifera occurs in Africa (4 spp.), Central America (4 spp.), South America (about 37 spp.) and probably in Asia (1 sp.). Nine species were recognized within the Brazilian Amazon: Copaifera duckei, C. glycycarpa, C. guyanensis, C. martii, C. multijuga, C. paupera, C. piresii, C. pubiflora e C. reticulata. Their habit varies between shrubby and tree-like, with some species forming 40 m tall trees. Copaifera is economically important as a timber source, and increasingly as the source of an oleoresin used as a component of medicines, cosmetics, ink and film-development. The present treatment includes an identification key for the species, illustrations, descriptions and comments regarding the morphology, taxonomy and distribution of the species treated.
23499871|Visando o tratamento de Leguminosae tribo Cercideae no estado do Rio de Janeiro, este trabalho apresenta resultados relativos  taxonomia e Conservao de Bauhinia ser. Aculeatae. Com evidncias em novas colees botnicas, a descrio do material florfero de B. albicans  aqui apresentada e ilustrada pela primeira vez. Foi verificado o status de conservao de B. albicans, espcie vulnervel e endmica da regio dos Lagos. Alm disso,  apresentada uma descrio de B. affinis, aparentemente extinta no estado do Rio de Janeiro. The taxonomy and conservation of Bauhinia ser. Aculeatae is part of the treatment of Leguminosae Cercideae for the state of Rio de Janeiro. The description of the flowering material of B. albicans is presented and illustrated for the first time, while this endemic species of coastal Rio de Janeiro has been categorized as vulnerable. A description of B. affinis, regionally extinct in Rio de Janeiro, is also presented.
23499869|Se presentan las caractersticas cromosmicas descriptas hasta el momento en Leguminosas americanas. A travs del anlisis de estos datos en conjunto con los morfolgicos y las filogenias moleculares se proponen hiptesis acerca de los cambios cromosmicos ocurridos durante el proceso de divergencia y especiacin de la familia. Los estudios cromosmicos indican una gran variacin intergenrica, inter e intraespecfica, adems de una amplia diversificacin en el tamao del genoma entre gneros, especies y poblaciones. A partir del nmero bsico ancestral x=7 se deduce que la especiacin hbrida poliploide ha sido muy importante en la diversificacin de la familia. Por procesos de disploida creciente y decreciente, tanto a nivel diploide como poliploide se originaran nmeros bsicos secundarios y series poliploides modificadas. En la parafiltica subfamilia Caesalpinioideae habra predominado el proceso de disploidia decreciente de n=14 a n=11. En la monofiltica subfamilia Mimosoideae, ocurri un evento principal de evolucin del nmero cromosmico de 14 a 13. Por ltimo en Papilionoideae, la subfamilia ms derivada de Leguminosae, se observ reduccin del nmero bsico de 14 a 7, pasando por nmeros gamticos de 11 y 8. Por otro lado, el origen recurrente de los poliploides y la ocurrencia de rearreglos intergenmicos, hibridacin y poliploida secundaria, son procesos que dificultan la agrupacin natural de los taxones en algunos grupos de la familia Leguminosae. Chromosomic features described so far for Americans legumes are reviewed and analyzed, simultaneously with morphological and molecular characters. This is an invaluable opportunity to propose hypotheses about chromosome changes during the family divergence and speciation processes. The chromosome studies showed wide inter-generic, inter and intra-specific variability, as well as marked differences in genome sizes between genera, species and populations. By postulating an ancestral basic number of seven (x=7) it is possible to deduce that polyploid hybrid speciation was very important in the diversification of the family as a whole. Due to increasing and decreasing diploidy processes, secondary basic numbers and modified polyploids series could have arised both at diploid and polyploid levels. On the other hand, recurrent origin of polyploids, occurrence of inter-genomic rearrangements, hybridization and secondary polyploidy are all processes that make it difficult to group the taxa within the Leguminosae family in a natural sequence.
23495925|Este trabalho relaciona as espcies e variedades de Bromeliaceae ocorrentes nos campos de altitude do Estado do Rio de Janeiro, Brasil. Foram encontrados quatro padres bsicos de distribuio geogrfica: 1. Ampla distribuio. 2. Costa leste do Brasil. 3. Disjuno Rio de Janeiro  Minais Gerais, e 4. Endemismo para o Estado do Rio de Janeiro. Foram verificados os demais habitats onde ocorrem e seus respectivos hbitos. This paper enumerates the species and varieties of Bromeliaceae occuring in the altitudinal fields of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Four basic patterns of geographic distribution were found and verified the other habitats were they are represented with their respective habits.
23495928|No presente trabalho, o autor contribui para o conhecimento da anatomia da folha Tocoyena bullata (Vell.) Mart., destacando a ocorrncia de emergncia de colter na estpula, estmato do tipo paractico, mesofilo dorsiventral e feixes vasculares do tipo colateral. O sistema vascular adquire formato circular na lmina foliar ou no pecolo, envolvendo ocasionalmente pequenos feixes medulares neste ltimo. Idioblastos tanferos e cristalferos encontram-se distribudos pelo parnquima fundamental da estpula, pecolo, nervura mediana e no clornquima do mesofilo. In this report, the author contributes to the knowledge of the leaf anatomy of Tocoyena bullata (Vell.) Mart. He points out the occurrence of emergency and colleter in the stipule, paracytic type stomata, dorsiventral mesophyll and colateral vascular bundles. The vascular system acquires a ring shape in the leaf blade or in the petiole, occasionally enclosing a few small medullary strands in the latter. Tannin and crystal idioblasts can be found in fundamental parenchyma of stipule, petiole, midrib and in the chlorenchyma of mesophyll.

Muell.; Leucobryum martianum (Hornsch;) Hampe; Leucobryum sordidum Angstr.; Octoblepharum albidum Hedw.; Octoblepharum cocuiense Mitt. 23495927|O presente trabalho consiste no estudo da anatomia foliar de Himatanthus lancifolius (Muell. Arg.) Woodson. Essa espcie apresenta sistema vascular com disposio bicolateral, observando-se grupos isolados de floema na regio correspondente  medula ao nvel do pecolo da nervura mediana. Os laticferos, caractersticos das Apocynaceae, so do tipo no-articulado ramificado, acompanhando ou no os feixes vasculares. Em ambas as epidermes da lmina foliar ocorrem estruturas que se caracterizam pela disposio radial das clulas epidrmicas, que podem apresentar um certo grau de suberificao. Tais funes so semelhantes s verrugas suberificadas (corkwarts) referidas para a famlia. So observadas ainda colteres na face adaxial da regio prxima do peciolo, que secretam uma substncia mucilaginosa nos primeiros estdios de desenvolvimento da folha. The work here presented consists in a study of the leaf anatomy of Himatanthus lancifolius (Muell. Arg.) Woodson. This species has the vascular system in a bicolateral arrangement and small islands of phloem can be observed in the region that corresponds to the pith of the petiole and the midrib. The laticifers, one of the characteristics of the Apocynaceae, are non-articulated, branched and may accompany the veins or run freely in the mesophyll. In both the epiderms occur structures which are characterized by radial arrangement of the epidermal cells. These cells may show a certain degree of suberification. These structures are similar to corkwarts that are mentioned for the family. Colleters occur at the petiole towards its adaxial side. They secrete a mucilaginous substance during its earliest stages of development.
23495926|Neste trabalho os autores apresentam os dados obtidos nas observaes realizadas sobre a ecologia da polinizao e biologia da reproduo de Miconia stenostachya DC., referentes aos espcimes cultivados no Parque do Jardim Botnico do Rio de Janeiro. Acredita-se que nessa espcie o sistema de reproduo efetivo seja a apomixia por agamospermia, e que a ocorrncia de reproduo alogmica seja uma possibilidade muito remota. Suas flores possuem atributos melitfilos, tendo anteras com 90 a 95% de gros de plen estreis e recebendo poucas visitas das abelhas em busca do alimento, quando ocorre, ento, a polinizao do tipo vibrtil e ordenha, esternotribo, pelas abelhas Trigona (Trigona) trinidadensis (Pruv.) e Melipona fasciata scutellaris (Lat.). No ocorre diviso de trabalho nas anteras de diferentes tamanhos, e a mudana de cor das peas florais no se d por polinizao ou por fecundao e, provavelmente, est relacionada com a fisiologia da planta. In this paper the authors present some data about the pollination, ecology and reproduction biology of Miconia stenostachya DC. from plants cultivated in Jardim Botnico do Rio de Janeiro. It's believed that in this species the efective reproduction system is the apomixy by agamospermy, and that the occurrence of alogamy is a remote possibility. Their flowers possess mellitophilic characters and anthers with 90-95% of sterile pollen, receiving few visits by bees to collect pollen as food. When pollination occurs it is sternotribic and of the "vibratile" or "milking" type to extract pollen from the poricidal anthers by bee Trigona (Trigona) trinidadensis Pruv. and Melipona fasciata scutellaris Lat. In the two types of the anthers there is no separation of function in pollination and the change of colour of the floral parts is not related to pollination or fecundation, but possibly to the physiology of the plant.
23495924|Continuando o estudo sobre a famlia Bignoniaceae, o autor encontrou uma espcie nova do gnero Tabebuia Gomes ex DC., coletada no Estado do Esprito Santo, a qual denominou de Tabebuia ovatifolia devido s folhas ovais que a espcie possui. The author describes a new brazilian species of Tabebuia Gomes ex DC. (Bignoniaceae): T. ovatifolia It. Vattimo, colected in the brazilian state of Esprito Santo.
23493366| feita a discusso taxonmica do gnero Barjonia Decne., constitudo quase exclusivamente de espcies brasileiras, distribudas principalmente nas Regies Centro-Oeste, Sudeste e Sul, ocorrendo em cerrados, campos e mais raramente em florestas de galeria. Barjonia erecta (Vell.) Schum., espcie de maior distribuio geogrfica, vai da Linha Equatorial aos Trpicos e  aqui citada pela primeira vez para o Suriname. O tratamento dado ao gnero assinala 5 espcies com diagnoses, ilustraes, estudo do tipo de nervao das folhas, epidermes, germinao de uma espcie e distribuio geogrfica. Elaborou-se uma chave dicotmica para a identificao das espcies, classificou-se Barjonia glazioui Marq. e foram sinonimizados 5 binmios para Barjonia erecta (Vell.) Schum., espcie que tem originado muitas dvidas nomenclaturais. Ilustraes e mensuraes das diferentes fases da germinao de Barjonia erecta (Vell.) Schum., foram aqui fornecidos com objetivo nico de anexar dados aos caracteres morfolgicos da semente. A ocorrncia de uma nervura marginal no permitiu que fosse definido o padro de nervao foliar, por no se enquadrar nos tipos mencionados pelos diferentes autores consultados. Foi verificada a ocorrncia de traqueides de reserva nas espcies Barjonia grazielae Font. et Marq. e Barjonia glazioui Marquete. Na face interna dos ptalos, observou-se um indumento constitudo de plos unicelulares e pluricelulares unisseriados, carter taxonmico para algumas espcies. Em Barjonia laxa Malme e Barjonia erecta (Vell.) Schum. foram assinaladas alm das emergncias glandulares peculiares s espcies da famlia e ocorrentes na face interna das folhas, junto  insero do pecolo e internamente na axila dos spalos, outras situadas respectivamente nos ns do caule e na raque da inflorescncia. Quanto  vascularizao dos spalos e dos ptalos,  constituda por 3 nervuras, uma mediana e 2 laterais, variando apenas quanto s suas ramificaes. It is a taxonomic discussion of the genus Barjonia Decne. made almost exclusively of Brazilian species, distributed mostly in Center-West, Southeast and South, ocurring in "cerrados", camps and much rarely in gallery forests. Barjonia erecta (Vell.) Schum., a specie of most geographic distribution, goes from the Equatorial Line to the Tropics and is here mentioned for the first time to the Suriname. The tratment given to the genus marks out 5 species with diagnosis, ilustrations, study about the kind of foliar nervation, epydermis, germination of a specie and the geographic distribution. It has been elaborated a dichotomic key for the identification of the species, it was classified Barjonia glazioui Marq. and there were synonymized 5 binoms to Barjonia erecta (Vell.) Schum., that is a specie which has originated many nomenclature doubts. The illustrations and mensurations of the different germination phasis of Barjonia erecta (Vell.) Schum., were furnished here as the only object to attach things to the morphologic characters of the seed. The occurrence of a marginal nervure didn't allow the definition of the standard of foliar nervation, because it don't place in the tipes mentioned by the diferents consulted authors. Were verified the occurence of "storage tracheids" of the species Barjonia grazielae Font. et Marq. and Barjonia glazioui Marquete. In the internal face of the petals, it was observed an indument constituted of unicellular and pluricellulars unisseriated hairs, that is a taxonomic character for some species. In Barjonia laxa Malme and Barjonia erecta (Vell.) Schum., there were marked out beyond the glandulars emergencies peculiars to the species of the family and occurring in the internal face of the leaves, near the inserction of peciolus and internally in the axial of the sepals, others situated in the nodes of the trunk and in the raquis of the inflorescence, respectively. Concerning the vascularization of the sepals and the petals, it is constituted of 3 nerves, one median and two laterals changing only regarding the ramifications.
23493368|A autora trata da discusso taxonmica do gnero Bauhinia sect Tylotaea Vogel (Leguminosae-Caesalpinoideae) exclusiva da faixa neotropical, cujas espcies ocorrem sob a forma de lianas, principalmente na regio da Amaznia, com forte endemismo, nos brejos do Nordeste, nas matas do Sudeste e do Sul, e nas florestas ciliares da regio CentroOeste. A maioria das espcies  conhecida pelos nomes vulgares de Cip-escada de jaboti, ou cip-escada de macaco ou simplesmente cip-escada. Foram descritas e discutidas 23 espcies com suas respectivas distribuies geogrficas, acompanhada da fotografia dos tipos. As espcies estudadas enquadram-se naturalmente no gnero Bauhinia L. s.1., como pertencentes a seo Tylotaea, independentes das espcies da seo Schnella (Raddi) Bentham 1870. Os caracteres que se revelaram de importncia sistemtica foram a morfologia do boto floral, clice, ptalas, brctea, bractolas e em menor grau a da folha.  apresentada uma chave dicotmica para identificao das espcies assinaladas. The author presents a taxonomic study of the genus Bauhinia sect. Tylotaea, especific of the neotropical area, which species are lianas or scandent shrubs, occuring mainly on the Amazonic region, with a strong endemism, in the brejo of the Northeastern region, in the forest of the Southeastern and South, or in gallery forest of the Centerwestern region. The majority of the species is known by the vulgar names of cip-escada de jaboti, cip-escada de macaco or simply cip-escada. Twenty three species were redescribed and discussed along with their respective geographic distributions and illustrated by the pictures of the types. A dicotomic key is presented for the identification of the mencioned species. The characters that showed a sistematic importance were the morphology of the floral bud, the calyx, the petals, the bracteas, and in a lower degree the leaf. The species studied are prfectly inserted in the genus Bauhinia, as belonging to the sect. Tylotaea, independent of the species of the sect. Schnella.

23493200|Neste trabalho  feita a reviso das cinco espcies do gnero Genlisea Lentibulariaceae, que ocorrem nas regies sudeste e sul do Brasil. As espcies a encontradas, esto distribudas em duas sees: Genlisea  caracterizada pela deiscncia circuncisa do fruto e Tayloria  caracterizada pela deiscncia longitudinal do fruto. A seo Genlisea compreende, nas regies sudeste e sul do Brasil, as seguintes espcies: G. aurea, G. filiformis, G. pygmaea e G. repens que se diferenciam pelos seguintes caracteres: forma e tamanho do clcar, pilosidade, porte da planta e tamanho da corola. A seo Tayloria, est representada nessas regies, apenas, por uma espcie. G. violacea. Os caracteres mais expressivos para diferenciar as duas sees, alm da deiscncia do fruto, so: colorao das flores, forma do lbio superior da corola, posio do pedicelo no fruto, clcar, sementes e pilosidade. O estudo organogrfico ressalta a morfologia da face interna da folha utriculfera, morfologia das folhas verdadeiras, brcteas do escapo e as da base do pedicelo, bractolas, clice, corola e poro interna do clcar, observados em viso frontal. Alm da organografia, so apresentados o histrico do gnero, observaes palinolgicas, polinizao, habitat, distribuio geogrfica acompanhada de mapas elucidativos, tratamento taxinmico, relao dos exemplares estudados, fenologia, discusso e concluses, ndice dos coletores e das espcies e, finalmente, referncias bibliogrficas. Genlisea, described by saint-Hilaire(1833), is one of the two genera of Lentibulariaceae found in Brazil. In Genlisea the calyx is five-lobbed and the trap leaf is a straighten body attached by a pedicel to the rizome, with a middle bladder and an elongated neck tipped by two twisted arms. The other is Utricularia L. readily differentiated by its two-lobbed calyx and the urn-like bladders. The Brazilian species of Genlisea occurring in southern and southeastern Brazil are: G. violacea, G. aurea, G. filiformis, G. repens and G. pygmaea. The first one belongs to the section Tayloria, has prismatic seeds and fruits with a longitudinal deiscence; the other four have piramidal seeds, fruit with circuncise deiscence and belong to the section Genlisea. Those two groups of species can be readily recognized in the field, by the flower color which is violet in G. violacea and yellow in the remaining four species. The pollen has a similar morphology to all the studied species; it is isopolar, tri or tetracolporate, subprolate, tectate and medium-sized grain with a baculate endosexine and a rugose ektosexine. In equatorial view it is allways elliptic and in polar view it is circular but sometimes it can be a little triangular and angulaperturate as in G. pygmaea. In G. aurea, G. filiformis and G.repens occur the syncolpism already pointed out by Thanikaimoni (1966) and Huynh (1968) for Utricularia. Besides the palinology, taxonomy and some general remarks (as polination, geographical distribution, etc) of those five species, the organography of the aerial and subterraneous organs was also studied. Special attention is given to the indumentum and the different types of hairs that are used as a taxonomic character.

23493353|O gnero Mollinedia Ruiz et Pavon (Monimiaceae, Monimioideae) apresenta duas sees, a saber: Appendiculatae e Exappendiculatae, criadas e delimitadas por Perkins em 1900. O presente trabalho trata do estudo taxonmico desta ltima seo, que  exclusiva do Brasil, Peru e Colmbia, ocorrendo predominantemente em matas de altitude. O tratamento taxonmico aqui dado  seo configura-a como compreendendo 25 espcies que so redescritas e ilustradas com desenhos analticos de flores e frutos, rede de nervao, epidermes foliares, fotografias dos tipos e mapas das reas de ocorrncia. So propostos e comentados 6 novos sinnimos ao nvel de espcie: M. widgrenii A. DC (= M. chrysorrachis Perkins, M. warmingii Perkins);M. engleriana Perkins (= M. pachypoda Perkins); M. uleana Perkins (= M. yomalla Perkins); M. triflora (Sprengel) Tulasne (= M. chrysophyla Perkins) e M. oligantha Perkins (= M. riedeliana Tolmathew). Novas localidades de ocorrncia so citadas para M. argyrogyna Perkins, M. clavigera Tulasne e M. heteranthera Perkins.  apresentada uma chave analtica para identificao das espcies da seo. The genus Mollinedia Ruiz et Pavon (Monimiaceae, Monimioidae) is represented by two sections: Appendiculatae and Exappendiculatae created and delimitated by Perkins in 1900. The present work involved a taxonomic study of the latter section which geographical range is circunscribed to montanious forest areas of Brazil, Peru, Colombia and Bolivia. The secction is here considered to be represented by 25 species that were redescribed and illustrated through analytical drawings of flowers and fruits, leaf vein arragement and epidermis, photos of the types and maps of the distribution areas. Six new synonyms are proposed and commented: M. widgrenii A. DC (= M. chrysorrachis Perkins, M. warmingii Perkins); M. engleriana Perkins (= M. pachypoda Perkins); M. uleana Perkins (= M. yomalla Perkins); M. triflora (Sprengel) Tulasne (= M. chrysophylla Perkins) and M. oligantha Perkins (= M. riedeliana Tolmathew). New distribution points were indicated for M. argyrogyna Perkins, M. clavigera Tulasne e M. heteranthera Perkins. A analytical key for species identifications is also presented.

23493351|In this work the author discuss the species Smilax spicata Vell that, for a long time, was believed to be synonym of Smilax procera Griseb, being reestablished exclusively by De Candolle. Analysing Vellozo's stamp and comparing it with material of various national and foreign herbarium collections and the living plant that we can observe in this habitat, and cultivated at Botanical Garden of Rio de Janeiro, we have certified De Candolle was correct. We have made the species description, explained by illustrations, and also the female flower diagnose, in Latin language, till now unknown. We have located a new area for Smilax spicata Vell, in which its ocurrence was not well defined yet. 23496771|A polinizao de Passiflora alata Dryander decorre da atividade de coleta de nctar ou plen por abelhas Anthophoridae e Apidae de grande porte durante todo o perodo de florao entre maro e setembro. O vo, possivelmente seguindo rotas de visitas, permite a polinizao cruzada, favorecida pela deflexo dos rgos reprodutivos. H flores que no apresentam deflexo dos estiletes e podem ser consideradas como funcionalmente masculinas, o que pode interferir na alocao total de recursos para a produo de sementes. The pollination of Passiflora alata Dryander is accomplished by Anthophoridae and Apidae large bees when collecting nectar or pollen during the flowering time from march to setember. Forage fligth behavior of trap-line bees possibly allowded cross-pollination what is enhanced by deflection of the reproductive organs. Styles of some flowers may not be deflected and could be considerd as functionally male ones, what may interfer in resource allocation to seedset.

23496772|Foi feito o levantamento das espcies da famlia Polygonaceae distribudas na zona semirida do estado da Bahia. A famlia est representada na rea por 5 gneros com 21 (vinte e uma) espcies, das quais, o maior nmero pertence ao gnero Coccoloba (11): C. alagoensis, C. alnifolia, C. brasiliensis, C. bullata, C. confusa, C. fastigiata, C. mosenii, C. ochreolata, C. scandens, C. schwakeana e C. warmingii; seguido por Polygonum (5): P. acuminatum, P. ferrugineum, P. hispidum, P. hydropiperoides e P. punctatum; Ruprechtia (3): R. apetala, R. laxiflora e R. ramiflora; Rumex (1): R. crispus e Triplaris (1): T. gardneriana. So apresentadas chaves de identificao, descries sucintas e ilustraes para a maioria das espcies. This research is a survey of the Polygonaceae species distributed in semi-arid zone of state of the Bahia. In that area the family is represented by the following genera with their respective species: Coccoloba (11): C. alagoensis, C. alnifolia, C. brasiliensis, C. bullata, C. confusa, C. fastigiata, C. mosenii, C. ochreolata, C. scandens, C. schwakeana and C. warmingii; Polygonum (5): P. acuminatum, P. ferrugineum, P. hispidum, P. hydropiperoides and P. punctatum; Ruprechtia (3): R. apetala, R. laxiflora and R. ramiflora; Rumex (1) R. crispus and Triplaris (1) T. gardneriana. Key to the genera and species, descriptions and illustrations are presented for the majority of the species studied.
23496777|O presente trabalho aborda a anatomia foliar de Stromanthe thalia (Vell.) J.M.A. Braga (Marantaceae) crescida em dois ambientes da Mata Atlntica do Estado do Rio de Janeiro. As caractersticas comuns aos indivduos de altitude e de baixada foram a presena de epiderme uniestratificada, com clulas de paredes anticlinais sinuosas; estmatos do tipo paractico; estrutura dorsiventral; pulvino com parnquima aqfero; aernquima na bainha, no pecolo e na lmina foliar; feixes vasculares do tipo colateral acompanhados por calotas de fibras. As variaes anatmicas foram observadas em diferentes regies da lmina foliar nos indivduos das duas populaes. Nos indivduos de baixada a nervura mediana, ao nvel do tero mdio, ocorreu um aumento no tecido de sustentao e no nmero de camadas da hipoderme adaxial prximo  nervura mediana e na extremidade do bordo observou-se um feixe de fibras. This work deals with the leaf anatomy of the Stromanthe thalia (Vell.) J.M.A. Braga (Marantaceae) from two different environments of the Atlantic Rain Forest, Rio de Janeiro. The common characteristics observed on the specimens from lowland forest and montane forest were single epidermal layer in both surfaces and sinuous anticlinal cell walls; paracytic stomata; dorsiventral leaf; pulvinus with water storage tissue; sheaths fibrous close to collateral vascular bundles; aerenchyma throughout the sheath, petiole and lamina. The structural variations observed were fibrous tissue increased at the margin and midrib region as well as the larger number and the size of the adaxial hypodermis layers near the midrib of lamina on the specimen from lowland forest.
23500752|Neste estudo, so confirmados 18 txons de Machaerium para Mato Grosso e Mato Grosso do Sul. Dos 15 txons ocorrentes em Mato Grosso, seis so citados pela primeira vez no Estado: M. biovulatum, M. floribundum var. floribundum, M. macrophyllum var. macrophyllum, M. paraguariense, M. quinatum var. parviflorum e M. quinatum var. quinatum. O gnero encontra-se amplamente distribudo nos Estados e est representado em diversas formaes vegetacionais. In this study, 18 taxa of Machaerium are confirmed for Mato Grosso and Mato Grosso do Sul. Amongst the 15 taxa occurring in Mato Grosso, six were cited for the first time in the State: M. biovulatum, M. floribundum var. floribundum, M. macrophyllum var. macrophyllum, M. paraguariense, M. quinatum var. parviflorum, and M. quinatum var. quinatum. Amongst the nine species confirmed for Mato Grosso do Sul, M. eriocarpum and M. isadelphum are new records for the State. The genus is widely distributed in the States and is represented in various vegetational formations. Analytical key, descriptions, and information on the phenology and preferential environments of each taxon are presented, besides illustrations for certain taxa.
23500751|Convolvulaceae  uma famlia predominantemente tropical e compreende entre 1600 e 1700 espcies. O Brasil  um importante centro de endemismo do grupo, mas sua diversidade ainda  pouco conhecida e subestimada no pas. A flora de Convolvulaceae da Usina So Jos, aqui apresentada, portanto, incrementa o conhecimento sobre a diversidade da famlia no Nordeste. O tratamento conta com chave de identificao, descries, ilustraes e comentrios para os txons. Convolvulaceae is a predominantly tropical family and comprises between 1600 and 1700 species. Brazil is an important center of endemism of the group, but its diversity is still poorly understood and underestimated in the country. Therefore, the flora of Convolvulaceae from the Usina So Jos, presented here, increases the knowledge about the diversity of the family in the Northeast Brazil. Twelve species and five genera of Convolvulaceae is reported in the region: Bonamia maripoides, Evolvulus nummularius, Ipomoea bahiensis, I. hederifolia, I. nil, I. philomega, I. quamoclit, I. tiliacea, Jacquemontia glaucescens, J. sphaerostigma, Merremia macrocalyx, and M. umbellata. 23500745|O presente estudo visou realizar o inventrio das samambaias e licfitas da Reserva Ecolgica de Gurja (Pernambuco, Brasil) avaliando a riqueza, composio, distribuio geogrfica e raridade das espcies. Foi realizado a partir do exame das colees dos principais herbrios do Estado e levantamento florstico com trabalho de campo. A distribuio geogrfica das espcies no globo e em territrio brasileiro foi baseada em dados da literatura e foram consideradas como espcies raras aquelas com apenas um ou dois pontos de coleta na Floresta Atlntica Nordestina. Foram registradas duas espcies pertencentes ao grupo das licfitas e 75 espcies pertencentes ao grupo das samambaias, das quais 10% so raras, no contexto da Floresta Atlntica Nordestina. As familias mais representativas foram Pteridaceae (21 espcies), Thelypteridaceae (8 spp.) e Polypodiaceae (8 spp.). Os gneros com maior nmero de espcies foram Adiantum (14 spp.) e Thelypteris (7 spp.). A maioria das espcies  amplamente distribuda nos trpicos e tambm em territrio brasileiro. This paper aimed floristic survey the ferns and lycophytes from Reserva Ecolgica de Gurja (Pernambuco, Brazil) evaluating the richness, composition, geographical distribution, and rarity of the species. The study was realized from examination the collections of major herbaria in the State and floristic survey with field work. The geographical distribution of species on the globe and in Brazilian territory was based on literature and were considered rare species as those with one or two collection points in the Northeastern Atlantic Forest. The floristic survey identified two species of lycophytes and 75 species of ferns. Among ferns, 10% were considered rare in the context of the Northeastern Atlantic Forest. The most representative families were Pteridaceae (21 species) Thelypteridaceae (8 spp.) and Polypodiaceae (8 spp.). The richest genera were Adiantum (14 spp.) and Thelypteris (7 spp.). Most species are widely distributed in the tropics and also in Brazilian territory.
23500747|Las siguientes cuatro especies: Balliella pseudocorticata, Perikladosporon percurrens, Monosporus indicus y Seirospora occidentalis, constituyen las primeras citas para la costa venezolana. Se mencionan sus caracteres diagnstico y se establecen comparaciones con especies cercanas. Todas estas han sido mencionadas en arrecifes coralinos de aguas tropicales y se consideran comunes en el Mar Caribe. The following four species: Balliella pseudocorticata, Perikladosporon percurrens, Monosporus indicus and Seirospora occidentalis, represent the first report to the Venezuelan coast, of which mention their diagnostic features and making comparisons with its relatives. All these species have been identified in coral reefs of tropical waters and are considered common in the Caribbean Sea.
23500757|The wide diversity of their trichomes, which vary from simple unicellular to very complex structures, is a remarkable characteristic in Melastomataceae. This paper characterizes the leaf indumentum of Miconia albicans (Sw.) Triana, M. chamissois Naudin, M. fallax DC., M. ligustroides (DC.) Naudin, Microlepis oleaefolia (DC.) Triana and Rhynchanthera dichotoma DC., typical species from Brazilian cerrado. Samples collected from the median third of young and mature leaf blades were processed following the usual scanning electron microscopy techniques (SEM). We observed ten morphological types of trichomes and four of emergences. With five different types, four of which are reported for the first time, Rhynchanthera dichotoma is the species that presents the most diverse indumenta. A mixed type of trichome formed by a glandular and a branched non-glandular portion called lateral-gland was observed in M. ligustroides. Such non-glandular portion presents different degrees of development. A correlation is suggested between the stage of development of the non-glandular portion and the exposition to light of these lateral gland on young leaves. A grande diversidade de tricomas, variando desde estruturas unicelulares a tricomas muito complexos  uma caracterstica marcante em Melastomataceae. Este trabalho caracteriza o indumento foliar de Miconia albicans (Sw.) Triana, M. chamissois Naudin, M. fallax DC., M. ligustroides (DC.) Naudin, Microlepis oleaefolia (DC.) Triana e Rhynchanthera dichotoma DC., espcies tpicas do cerrado brasileiro. Amostras retiradas do tero mediano do limbo de folhas jovens e adultas foram processadas segundo tcnicas usuais para microscopia eletrnica de varredura (MEV). Verificaram-se dez tipos morfolgicos de tricomas e quatro de emergncias. Rhynchanthera dichotoma foi a espcie que apresentou maior diversidade de indumento, cinco, sendo que destes, quatro foram registrados pela primeira vez. Um tipo misto de tricoma constitudo por uma poro glandular e outra no-glandular ramificada, denominado de "lateral-gland", foi observado em M. ligustroides. A poro no-glandular apresentou diferentes graus de desenvolvimento. Sugere-se uma correlao entre o grau de desenvolvimento da poro no-glandular e a exposio  luz destes tricomas em folhas jovens.

Hyde & Umali, Sporidesmiella aspera Kuthub. & Nawawi, S. fusiformis W.P. Wu e Triposporium verruculosum R.F. Castaeda, Gen & Guarro. Kendr constitui novo registro para a Amrica do Sul e Spadicoides macroobovata Matsush.  um novo registro para o Brasil. During inventory of conidial fungi at Serra da Fumaa, Pindobau, Bahia State, and Brazil, 44 species were found. Five species are new records for Americas: Dendryphiosphaera parvula Nawawi & Kuthub., Diplococcium dendrocalami Goh, K.D Hyde & Umali, Sporidesmiella aspera Kuthub. & Nawawi, S fusiformis W.P. Wu, and Triposporium verruculosum RF Castaeda, Gen & Guarro. Stanjehughesia hormiscioides (Corda) Subram. is a new record for Neotropics; Hemibeltrania decorosa RF Castaeda & WB Kendr. is a new record for South America and Spadicoides macroobovata Matsush is a new record for Brazil. Descriptions, illustrations, geographical distribution and comments are presented for new records. A list of species founded is included too.
23500750|As restingas so plancies arenosas ao longo da costa litornea que exibem uma rica e peculiar vegetao. As Moraceae nativas do Brasil englobam principalmente plantas lenhosas de porte arbreo que participam do estgio mais avanado das matas de restinga. Atravs de bibliografia especializada, consultas a herbrios e coletas de campo, objetivou-se elucidar a taxonomia, identificar os habitats preferenciais, atualizar a rea de ocorrncia e reconhecer o atual estado de conservao das espcies dessa famlia. Nas restingas fluminenses ocorrem cinco gneros e 20 espcies de Moraceae. Na Formao de Mata Seca acham-se presentes 16 espcies, na Mata Inundvel oito e na Arbustiva Fechada seis. Dessas espcies, 15 encontram-se ameaadas de extino, principalmente: Ficus pulchella e Maclura brasiliensis. Restingas are sandy coastal plains with a rich flora and distinct vegetation types. The native Brazilian Moraceae include primarily tall woody plants growing in the more developed stages of restinga forests, but they also include herbs and shrubs. Specialized bibliography, herbarium material and field collections, were used to elucidate the taxonomy, recognize the preferred habitats, update the area of occurrence and to recognize the current conservation status of its species. There are five genera and 20 species in Moraceae. In the Dry Forest formation occur 16 species, eight in Swamp Forest and six in Closed Shrub. These species, 15 are threatened of the extinction, mainly: Ficus pulchella and Maclura brasiliensis.
23500755|O presente trabalho buscou verificar se os recursos vegetais da Ilha do Cardoso so efetivamente usados pelos seus caiaras, alm de avaliar se a origem biogeogrfica e a finalidade de uso das plantas, bem como se fatores scioeconmicos influem no conhecimento local. O estudo consistiu na realizao de 51 entrevistas semi-estruturadas, com residentes do local h pelo menos cinco anos e maiores de 18 anos. Os resultados permitiram-nos concluir que os entrevistados retm amplo e diverso conhecimento sobre plantas e que grande parte do que conhecem  por eles utilizado (82%). As plantas mais conhecidas so em sua maioria nativas, apesar de verificarmos maior proporo de uso entre as exticas (95%). O conhecimento e uso variaram conforme a categoria de uso dos recursos e se mostraram, de modo geral, equivalentes em relao  idade e gnero dos informantes. Em relao  atividade exercida, constatou-se que as donas de casa usam um maior nmero de plantas exticas medicinais, que os pescadores conhecem e usam mais plantas nativas manufatureiras e que monitores ambientais e os que exercem atividades relacionadas ao turismo demonstraram conhecimento semelhante, predominando o de plantas medicinais, apesar de menos usadas, em comparao com os de outras atividades profissionais. This study aims to investigate if plant resources are effective used by caiaras ' communities of the Cardoso Island. We also want to verify if the biogeografic origin of plants, their uses and socioeconomic factors influence the locals' knowledge. We carried out 51 semi-structured interviews with people who have been living there for at least 5 years, who were older than 18. We concluded that the interviewees' knowledge is still diverse and that most of the plants known are used by them (82%). Native plants are largely known, while the exotic ones are the most used (95%). Knowledge and use vary according to the use of plants, although they were very similar, considering the interviewees' age and gender. We also realized that housewives use a large quantity of medicinal plants, which are mainly the exotic ones. Fishermen know and use native plants, usually for handicraft purposes. The environmental guides and people, whose job is tourism related, have a similar knowledge, especially about medicinal plants, which are less used when compared with the other professional activities.
23500758|A biologia floral e reprodutiva de Echinodorus grandiflorus (Cham. & Schltdl.) Micheli foram estudadas em populaes nativas do interior do estado de So Paulo. A espcie floresce no vero e suas flores oferecem tanto nctar quanto plen como recurso. O nctar  secretado por nectrios localizados na base dos carpelos marginais, opostos s ptalas. Os polinizadores (abelhas sociais e solitrias), no entanto, foram observados coletando apenas plen. As visitas, que podem durar de um a poucos segundos at mais de um minuto, acontecem desde o momento da abertura das flores (ca. 5:30 h) at o fenecimento. Cada flor dura cerca de oito horas. Todos os indivduos das populaes produzem apenas flores hermafroditas. A porcentagem de gros de plen viveis  de 75%. As populaes estudadas so auto-incompatveis e, como conseqncia, polinizadores so necessrios para transferncia de plen. Em condies naturais e a partir das polinizaes cruzadas realizadas manualmente, todos os receptculos apresentaram aqunios maduros. Atravs das anlises dos tubos polnicos das flores autopolinizadas manualmente, e devido ao fato dos aqunios derivados desse tratamento abortarem cerca de 30 dias a partir das autopolinizaes, aparentemente, as populaes de E. grandiflorus estudadas apresentam um mecanismo de auto-esterilidade de ao tardia. The reproductive biology and the pollination of Echinodorus grandiflorus (Cham. & Schltdl.) Micheli were studied in populations native to interior of the State of So Paulo, Brazil. This species blossoms in summer and its flowers offer both nectar and pollen as rewards to pollinators. Nectar is produced in nectaries located at the base of the marginal carpels, opposite the petals. However, the effective pollinators (social and solitary bees), were recorded collecting pollen only. Visits, which can last from one or a few seconds to more than one minute, occur during the whole flower lifespan. Each flower opens at about 5:30 a.m. and lasts circa eight hours. All plants in the studied populations produce only hermaphrodite flowers. Percentage of pollen viability is 75%. The studied populations are self-incompatible and, as a consequence, pollinators are needed to transfer pollen among individuals. In natural conditions and after hand cross-pollinations, all receptacles presented mature achenes. Based on the analyses of pollen tube growth from hand self-pollinated flowers, and as a consequence of achenes abortion circa 30 days after self-pollinations, the populations of E. grandiflorus studied apparently presents a mechanism of late-acting self-sterility.

The family is characterized by stem erect, short or very long-creeping, bearing trichomes or scales, or both, leaves pinnate or rarely simple, indusiate and marginal, submarginal or rarely abaxial sori, sporangia short to usually long-stalked, annulus interrupted by the stalk, spores lacking chlorophyll. Kramer, L. lancea (L.) Bedd. var. lancea, L. ovoidea Fe, L. quadrangularis Raddi ssp. quadrangularis, L. stricta (Aubl.) Dryand. var. stricta, L. virescens Sw. var. virescens, Paesia glandulosa (Sw.) Kuhn, Pteridium arachnoideum (Kaulf.) Maxon, Saccoloma elegans Kaulf., and S. inaequale (Kunze) Mett. Descriptions, identification keys, illustrations, geographical distribution, and comments of taxa are provided.
23500754|The variation in the species richness of herbaceous plants along an altitudinal gradient was analyzed in the Serra do Ouro Branco and Serra do Ribeiro, in the townships of Ouro Branco and Ouro Preto, respectively. Plant similarity between both serras was also assessed. Twenty spots were sampled along a 440 m (1105 m to 1545 m) altitudinal range; at each site, herbs were collected within ten 1 m2 plots, totaling 200 m2. We found 101 species distributed in 59 genera and 25 families. The richest plant families in Serra do Ouro Branco were Poaceae (22 spp.), Asteraceae (14 spp.) and Cyperaceae (10 spp.), while in Serra do Ribeiro, they were Poaceae (17 spp.), Cyperaceae (12 spp.) and Asteraceae (8 spp.). Variation between the number of species and altitude was not significant. The higher number of species in Serra do Ouro Branco may be due to different local environmental factors and to the occurrence of grazing and fires. The serras presented a high similarity value (J = 0.44), but cluster and ordination analysis indicated the formation of two distinct groups, reflecting the importance of local factors to determine the floristic composition of neighboring areas of campos rupestres. A variao da riqueza de plantas herbceas ao longo do gradiente altitudinal foi estudada em campos rupestres das Serras do Ouro Branco e do Ribeiro, localizadas respectivamente nos municpios de Ouro Branco e Ouro Preto. A similaridade entre a flora das serras tambm foi verificada. Foram amostrados 20 pontos num gradiente altitudinal de 440 m (1.105 m a 1.545 m); em cada ponto, as ervas foram coletadas em parcelas de 1 m2, totalizando 200 m2. Foram encontradas 101 espcies em 59 gneros e 25 famlias. Na Serra do Ouro Branco, as famlias com maior nmero de espcies foram Poaceae (22 spp.), Asteraceae (14 spp.) e Cyperaceae (10 spp.), enquanto na Serra do Ribeiro foram Poaceae (17 spp.), Cyperaceae (12 spp.) e Asteraceae (8 spp.). No houve variao significativa da riqueza de espcies com a altitude e a Serra do Ouro Branco apresentou um maior nmero de espcies. As serras apresentaram elevada similaridade entre si (J = 0,44), porm houve a formao de dois grupos distintos nas anlises de agrupamento e ordenao, indicando que a riqueza de espcies em reas relativamente prximas de campo rupestre podem estar sob influncia de fatores locais predominantes.
23500759|O gnero Tibouchina  comum no Brasil e encontrado principalmente na Floresta Atlntica, em especial na regio Sudeste. No presente estudo foi avaliada a viabilidade polnica de cinco espcies de Floresta Atlntica, T. cerastifolia, T. clinopodifolia, T. gracilis, T. pulchra e T. sellowiana, utilizando-se trs solues histoqumicas: carmim actico, Alexander e cloreto de 2,3,5-trifenil-tetrazlio. Foi avaliada a variao de viabilidade entre as anteras dimrficas, entre as solues histoqumicas e entre os indivduos. Em T. pulchra e T. sellowiana tambm foi avaliada a variao entre os dois primeiros dias a partir da abertura da flor. Nenhuma espcie apresentou variao relacionada ao dimorfismo das anteras. Nas duas espcies que apresentam maior longevidade floral, a viabilidade foi semelhante no primeiro e segundo dias em T. pulchra, enquanto que em T. sellowiana as flores de segundo dia apresentaram plen menos vivel. As solues histoqumicas empregadas revelaram taxas de viabilidade polnica distintas. Houve variao na viabilidade polnica entre os indivduos em todas as espcies. A soluo de cloreto de 2,3,5-trifenil-tetrazlio revelou a menor taxa de viabilidade em todos os indivduos. As solues histoqumicas empregadas, a amostragem e a longevidade floral foram fatores relacionados  variao da viabilidade polnica. The genus Tibouchina is common in Brazil, mainly found in Atlantic Forest, in Southeast region. In this study the pollen viability was evaluated in five species of Atlantic Forest, T. cerastifolia, T. clinopodifolia, T. gracilis, T. pulchra and T. sellowiana, using three histochemical solutions: acetocarmine, Alexander and 2, 3, 5-triphenyltetrazolium chloride. The variation of pollen viability was evaluated among the dimorphics anthers and among individuals. In T. pulchra and T. sellowiana it was also evaluated the variation among the two first days after flower openning. There was no variation related to anther dimorphism. Considering the two species with the longest flower longevity, the viability was similar in the first and second day in T. pulchra, but in T. sellowiana the pollen from the second day was less viable. The histochemical tests employed showed distinct rates of pollen viability. Rates of pollen viability were distinct among individuals in each species. The stain 2, 3, 5-triphenyltetrazolium chloride showed the smaller viability. The results show that the treatments employed, sampling and flower longevity were factors related to pollen viability.
23500753|Hinterland fragments of Atlantic forests situated in transitional areas are poorly known with respect to the effects of human impacts on their species composition and regeneration. The purpose of this study was to describe and characterize the structure and composition of the tree community of forest remnants located in Itumbiara, Gois State, Central Brazil, and to analyze their floristic relationship with other areas of seasonal and transitional vegetation ecotones. Five forest fragments were chosen for tree community sampling. The survey was carried out using PCQ (point-centered quarter) method and 25 points were distributed along linear transects totalling 125 sampling units. Four live trees with circumference at breast height (1.30 m) > 15 cm were recorded at each point. The floristic and phytosociological surveys recorded 149 tree species belonging to 110 genera and 47 families. The analysis of similarity confirmed the ecotonal character with many generalist species and other with occasional occurrence in 'Cerrado' (woody savanna) and seasonal forests. The forest remnants in Itumbiara showed a high tree species diversity. In spite of this, the tree community species suggests higher similarity with savanna vegetation. Os fragmentos de Mata Atlntica interioranos localizam-se em regio de tenso ecolgica e carecem de conhecimento sobre os efeitos de impactos antrpicos sobre sua composio e regenerao. Objetivou-se caracterizar e descrever a estrutura e composio da comunidade arbrea em remanescentes florestais localizados em Itumbiara, Gois, alm de analisar as relaes florsticas entre esses e outros fragmentos de formaes estacionais e de reas ecotonais. Foram selecionados cinco fragmentos para a amostragem da comunidade arbrea. Foi aplicado o mtodo de quadrantes, sendo alocados, em cada fragmento, transeces lineares contendo 25 pontos, o que resultou no estabelecimento de 125 unidades amostrais. Em cada ponto, foram inventariados os espcimes arbreos vivos com circunferncia a 1,30 m acima do solo >15 cm. As coletas florsticas e o levantamento fitossociolgico registraram 149 espcies arbreas, pertencentes a 110 gneros e distribudas em 47 famlias. A anlise de similaridade demonstrou o carter ecotonal, com muitas espcies generalistas e outras de ocorrncia mais pontual no Cerrado ou em matas estacionais. Os remanescentes florestais em Itumbiara apresentaram elevada diversidade arbrea. No entanto, a comunidade arbrea sugere relaes florsticas mais estreitas com as formaes savnicas.
23500756| apresentada uma reviso taxonmica das espcies de Andropogon L. que ocorrem no Brasil com base em coletas, observao de populaes no campo e anlise de colees de 72 herbrios nacionais e internacionais. Foram confirmadas 28 espcies, incluindo A. gayanus Kunth, introduzida da frica para cultivo, alm de uma subespcie e uma variedade. O trabalho inclui chaves de identificao, descries e ilustraes para todos os txons, alm de dados sobre distribuio geogrfica, hbitat, perodo de florao, nomenclatura e comentrios gerais. A taxonomic revision of the genus Andropogon L. in Brazil is presented. Based on field collections, observation of the populations and revision of 72 national and international herbaria, 28 species, including A. Gayanus Kunth introduced from Africa were confirmed, besides one subspecie and one variety. The work includes key for the identification of the confirmed taxa, descriptions and illustrations, as well as data about geographic distribution, habitat, flowering periods, typification, synonymy and general comments.
23500749|Apresenta-se o estudo taxonmico da famlia Solanaceae A. Juss na Serra Negra, municpio de Rio Preto, Minas Gerais. A famlia est representada na rea por oito gneros e 26 espcies. Solanum is the most representative genus with 19 species.
