The species described and illustrated are: Ardisia compressa, A. humilis, A. solanacea, Cybianthus cuneifolius, Myrsine coriacea, M. guianensis, M. hermogenesii, M. umbellata, M. venosa, Stylogyne depauperata and S. laevigata.
23499944|Duas espcies novas do gnero Anthurium (seo Urospadix) so descritas para o litoral do estado de So Paulo. Anthurium alcatrazense  endmica da Ilha de Alcatrazes (Estao Ecolgica Tupinambs), municpio de So Sebastio, e pertence  subseo Obscureviridia. Anthurium navicularis pertence  subseo Flavescentiviridia, sendo endmica da Estao Ecolgica Juria-Itatins, municpio de Perube. Ambas ocorrem no bioma Mata Atlntica, em reas rochosas litorneas. So fornecidas diagnoses, ilustraes e comentrios sobre distribuio geogrfica, ecologia, fenologia e estado de conservao das espcies. Two new species of the genus Anthurium (section Urospadix) from the coast of the state of So Paulo are described. Anthurium alcatrazense is endemic to the island of Alcatrazes (Ecological Station Tupinambs), municipality of So Sebastio, and belongs to the subsection Obscureviridia. Anthurium navicularis belongs to subsection Flavescentiviridia and is endemic to the Ecological Station Juria-Itatins, municipality of Perube. The two species occur in the Atlantic forest biome, in rocky coastal areas. Diagnoses, illustrations, and comments on the geographical distribution, ecology, phenology, and conservation status are provided for both species.
23499938|A famlia Asteraceae  uma das maiores famlias de Angiospermas, com cerca de 1.600 gneros e 25.000 espcies aproximadamente. Para o estado de Minas Gerais, os nicos estudos com a famlia como um todo so os levantamentos realizados na Serra do Cip, na Serra da Canastra, e em Gro-Mogol. O objetivo do presente estudo  o de apresentar as espcies de Asteraceae ocorrentes na Estao de Pesquisa e Desenvolvimento Ambiental Galheiro, Perdizes. Foram realizadas coletas mensais nesta estao, entre maio de 2002 e abril de 2004. O tratamento taxonmico inclui uma chave de identificao, descries das espcies e comentrios sobre distribuio geogrfica, hbitat e caractersticas diagnsticas. Para os gneros Eupatorium e Vernonia foram utilizados os conceitos tradicionais de classificao, uma vez que as novas propostas de classificao ainda necessitam de estudos taxonmicos mais aprofundados, particularmente para os txons brasileiros. Foram encontradas 107 espcies em 34 gneros. Os gneros mais representativos foram Vernonia (24 spp.), Eupatorium (19 spp.), Mikania (10 spp.) e Baccharis (8 spp.). As espcies encontradas na rea de estudo ocorrem principalmente nas formaes campestres, o que explica a existncia de aproximadamente 75% (81 de 107) das espcies encontradas na rea de estudo em comum com a lista compilada da famlia para a flora do Cerrado. The Asteraceae is one of the largest families of Angiosperms, with approximately 1600 genera and 25000 species. In Minas Gerais State there are few studies of the whole family, such as the surveys of the Serra do Cip, Serra da Canastra and Gro-Mogol. The objective of this study is to present an account of the species of Asteraceae in Estao de Pesquisa e Desenvolvimento Ambiental-Galheiro, Perdizes, MG. The survey was carried out between May 2002 and April 2004. The taxonomic treatment provides a identification key and descriptions of each species, followed by comments on their distribution, habitat and diagnostic characteristics. Eupatorium and Vernonia were treated using the traditional classification, once the current proposals still need further development particularly concerning the Brazilian taxa. A total of 107 species were collected belonging to 34 genera. The most representative genera were Vernonia (24 spp.), Eupatorium (19 spp.), Mikania (10 spp.) and Baccharis (8 spp.). The species found within the studied area are mainly representatives from open, savana-like vegetation, resulting in an overlap of approx. 75% (81 out of 107 species) with a compiled list for the Cerrado flora.
23499939|Polypodium lepidopteris is a terrestrial fern from coastal vegetation, and is used as medicinal. This work analyzed the effects of pH, temperature and light levels on the spore germination and the relative growth rate (RGR) of young sporophytes. Fertile fronds were collected in Florianpolis, SC, Brazil. The effect of pH (4.0 to 6.7) on spore germinability was observed in a growing room at 25  2C (22 mmol m2s1) under a 16h photoperiod. No statistical differences between treatments were found. The effect of different temperatures on the germinability was analyzed (20, 25 and 30C). The test was carried out in a germination chamber (17 mmol m2s1) under a 16h photoperiod. The germination was inhibited at 30C. The effect of natural light levels (54, 38, 22 and 8%) was analyzed. The highest germination percentages were verified at 22 and 8% of natural light. The growth analyses show statistical differences in the number of fronds and height of the longest frond between time 1 (283 days of spore inoculation) and time 2 (343 days of spore inoculation). Sporophytes of P. lepidopteris produced 1.33 0.09 fronds per month. The RGR (relative growth rate) was 0.15  0,009 cm cm1month1. Polypodium lepidopteris  uma pteridfita terrestre que ocorre nas restingas e que apresenta propriedades medicinais. Este trabalho analisou o efeito de pH, temperatura e nveis de luz na germinao de esporos e a taxa de crescimento relativo (TCR) de esporfitos jovens de P. lepidopteris. Frondes frteis foram coletadas em Florianpolis, SC, Brasil. O efeito do pH (4,0 a 6,7) na germinabilidade de esporos foi analisado em sala de cultivo a 25  2C (22 mmol m2s1) sob fotoperodo de 16 horas. No houve diferena estatisticamente significativa entre os tratamentos. Diferentes temperaturas foram testadas (20, 25 e 30C) em cmara de germinao (17 mmol m2s1) sob fotoperodo de 16 horas. A germinao foi inibida a 30C. O efeito de diferentes nveis de luz natural (54, 38, 22 e 8%) foi analisado. As maiores porcentagens de germinao ocorreram a 22 e 8% de luz natural. A anlise de crescimento dos esporfitos jovens mostra diferena significativa entre nmero de frondes e altura da maior fronde avaliados no tempo 1 (283 dias de inoculao de esporos) e no tempo 2 (343 dias de inoculao de esporos). Esporfitos de P. lepidopteris produziram 1,33  0,09 frondes por ms. A TCR (taxa de crescimento relativo) foi de 0,15  0,009 cm cm1ms.
23499946|O presente trabalho apresenta o levantamento das famlias Anemiaceae, Aspleniaceae, Cyatheaceae e Lygodiaceae da Estao Ecolgica do Panga e traz o tratamento taxonmico de suas espcies. A Estao Ecolgica do Panga abrange 409,5 ha e est situada a 30 km ao sul de Uberlndia, MG, entre as coordenadas 1909'201911'10 S e 4823'204824'35 W, entre 740840 m de altitude. A rea apresenta grande importncia ecolgica por ser uma das poucas formaes de vegetao natural da regio e por possuir diferentes fisionomias do bioma Cerrado, como campestres, savnicas e florestais. So tratadas neste artigo quatro famlias e oito espcies. So apresentadas chaves para as famlias, bem como ilustraes, distribuio geogrfica e comentrios dos txons. This paper is a floristic survey of the families Anemiaceae, Aspleniaceae, Cyatheaceae, and Lygodiaceae of the Ecological Station of Panga, and provides the taxonomic treatment for its species. The Ecological Station of Panga covers an area of 409.5 ha, and is located about 30 km to the South of Uberlndia, Minas Gerais State, Brazil, between the geographical coordinates 1909'201911'10 S and 4823'204824'35 W, at 740840 m altitude. The area represents a good remnant of the natural vegetation of the region, presenting different savanna and forest physiognomies. We present here the taxonomic treatments for four families and eight species. Identification keys, descriptions, illustrations of diagnostics characters of the families and species, geographical distribution, and comments are presented.
23499941|A famlia Pilotrichaceae no Brasil apresenta 11 gneros e 51 espcies, ocorre principalmente nos biomas Mata Atlntica e Amaznia, com maior riqueza de espcies concentradas nas Regies Sudeste e Sul. Trinta e quatro txons so neotropicais e 10 endmicos do Brasil. Quatro txons so considerados Vulnerveis, um Em Perigo e dois Criticamente em Perigo no pas. Neste estudo foram aceitos os vinte oito sinnimos recentemente realizados no tratamento para o estado do Rio de Janeiro e nas revises dos gneros Lepidopilum e Hypnella. Foram estudados materiais tipos de seis espcies.  apresentada uma chave para gneros e espcies, e para cada txom so fornecidas informao sobre o tipo, material examinado, distribuio geogrfica no Brasil e no mundo, substrato, variao altitudinal, status de conservao dos txons no pas e comentrios taxonmicos quando necessrios. So apresentadas ao final do trabalho trs listas, uma de sinnimos e duas de txons excludos. So fornecidas tambm ilustraes para aqueles txons que representam novos registros ou que se encontram ameaados no pas ou que no possuem ilustraes. Este estudo permitiu uma reduo de 20% do nmero total de txons citados para o Brasil. The Pilotrichaceae is represented in Brazil by 11 genera and 51 species, occurring mainly in the Atlantic Rain Forest and Amazonia, with the highest richness found in southeastern and southern Brazil. Thirty-four species are neotropical and 10 are endemic to Brazil. Four species are considered vulnerable, one endangered and two critically endangered. In this study 28 synonyms recently reduced in the treatment for Rio de Janeiro state and the taxonomic revisions of Lepidopilum e Hypnella are accepted. Type material of six species were studied. A key for the genera and species is provided, and for each species the following information is given; types, material examined, distributional range, substrate, altitudinal range, conservation status in the country and, when necessary, taxonomic comments. Following the taxonomic treatment three lists are presented, one with synonyms and two with excluded taxa. Illustrations are provided for those species that represents new records, considered threatened or those with no illustrations. This study reduced by 20% the total number of taxa cited previously for Brazil.
23499947|Estudos em vrias regies do globo tm demonstrado que a abundncia, riqueza e estrutura das comunidades de epfitas vasculares, importantes elementos das florestas tropicais, mostram relevantes modificaes de acordo com o grau de interferncia sobre a estrutura das florestas. Este estudo teve como objetivo o levantamento e anlise da distribuio da flora epiftica vascular do Parque do Ing (Maring, PR), verificando a existncia de mudanas nesta sinsia em zonas alteradas ao longo do fragmento estudado. Foram registradas 29 espcies de epfitas vasculares, representadas pelas famlias Bromeliaceae (7), Cactaceae (6), Polypodiaceae (4), Viscaceae (4), Orchidaceae (3), Araceae (2), Piperaceae (2) e Commelinaceae (1). A maioria das espcies so epfitas verdadeiras e as sndromes de disperso predominantes so a endozoocoria e anemocoria. Em estudo quantitativo, foram amostradas 22 espcies, sendo as famlias mais importantes, quanto ao valor de importncia epiftico, Polypodiaceae, Cactaceae e Bromeliaceae, ocupando preferencialmente o fuste alto e a copa. O ndice de diversidade de Shannon para o Parque do Ing foi de 1,106. Nas reas de zoneamento do Parque h uma distribuio diferenciada das espcies epifticas, de acordo com a umidade e oferta de luminosidade e nas reas com maior impacto antrpico a riqueza de espcies foi menor, confirmando estudos anteriores em outras regies de florestas tropicais. Studies in several areas of the world have been demonstrating that important elements of tropical forests like vascular epiphytes show relevant modifications according to the degree of interference on the structure of the forests. This study aims to rise and analyze the distribution of the vascular epiphytes of the Parque do Ing (Maring, PR) as well as to verify the existence of changes in this plant group in altered areas along the fragment. In qualitative study, 29 species of vascular epiphytes were registered, belonging to the families Bromeliaceae (7), Cactaceae (6), Polypodiaceae (4), Viscaceae (4), Orchidaceae (3), Araceae (2), Piperaceae (2) and Commenlinaceae (1). Most of the species is holoepiphytes and the anemochory and endozoochory are predominant dispersion syndromes. In quantitative study, 22 species were showed. Considering the value of epiphytic importance, the most important families are Polypodiaceae, Cactaceae and Bromeliaceae. They occupy preferentially loud trunk and the top trees. The Shannon diversity index for the Parque do Ing was of 1,106. In the zoning areas of the park there is a differentiated distribution of the epiphytic species, according to humidity and offer of light and in the areas with larger antropic impact the richness of species was low, confirming previous studies in other areas of tropical forests.
23499936|Comunidades de plantas sobre afloramentos rochosos no semi-rido brasileiro ainda so pouco conhecidas para a cincia. O municpio de Quixad, no semi-rido cearense, destaca-se pela grande concentrao de elevaes de ilhas rochosas. Este estudo tem por objetivos levantar e analisar a composio, o espectro biolgico e as sndromes de disperso das espcies que ocorrem em um inselbergue no municpio de Quixad, Cear, e a similaridade florstica deste com as espcies da vegetao circundante. Em 2000, foram realizadas coletas mensais de espcies e classificadas quanto s formas de vida e sndromes de disperso em uma rea situada a 457'S e 3901'W e 270 m de altitude. A similaridade da flora com o entorno foi analisada atravs do ndice de Jaccard. Foram inventariadas 77 espcies, 66 gneros e 36 famlias. As porcentagens do espectro biolgico foram: terfitos (44,2), fanerfitos (24,7), camfitos (14,6), hemicriptfitos (13,4), gefitos (2,6) e aerfitos (1,2) e as do espectro de disperso: anemocoria (49), autocoria (35) e zoocoria (16). A similaridade com flora do entorno foi de 13% (21 espcies), demonstrando que a caatinga local  a potencial fonte de propgulos. Os terfitos so as formas de vida dominante nos inselbergues de regies ridas e semi-ridas, cuja flora tambm  predominantemente dispersa por fatores abiticos, principalmente o vento. Assim, este estudo confirma o padro esperado para os atributos sndromes de disperso e espectro biolgico da vegetao sob climas ridos e semi-ridos. Plant communities on rock outcrops in brazilian semiarid are still largely unknown to science. The country Quixad, in the semiarid of the state of Cear, is distinguished by the great concentration of rock outcrops. This study aims to know the composition, the life-form and the strategies of dispersal of the species in an inselberg the country of Quixad and the similarity with surrounding caatinga. In the 2000 year, monthly collects of the flora were carried out and the life-forms and dispersal syndromes were classified in an area situated on 4 57 S and 39 01 W, 270 m. a.s.l. The similarity of the flora of the surrounding was analyzed through the Jaccard index. Seventy-seven species, 66 genera and 36 families had been inventoried. The percentages of the life-form spectrum and the dispersal spectrum represented were: therophytes (44,2), phanerophytes (24,7), chamaephytes (14,6), hemicryptophytes (13,4), geophytes (2,6), aerophytes (1,2) and anemocoric (49), autocoric (35) and zoocoric (16). The similarity with the flora of the caatinga surrounding was 13% (21 species), what it demonstrated that the vegetation surrounding is the main source of propagules. The therophytes are the dominant life-form in inselbergs of semi-arid regions, whose flora also is predominantly dispersed for abiotic factors, mainly the wind. This study confirms the expected patterns about dispersal and life-form spectrum of the arid and semiarid vegetation.
23499394|O objetivo deste artigo  avaliar a composio, abundncia e riqueza das diatomceas presentes na zona intermar da Praia de Itupanema e relacionar esses atributos  hidrodinmica atual, evidenciada pela textura do sedimento. Foram coletadas 10 amostras em duas transeces perpendiculares, em intervalos de 5 m nas coordenadas 0131'03''S e 4843'28''W em maro de 2006, sendo analisadas segundo as tcnicas convencionais no estudo de diatomceas. Os resultados mostraram a ocorrncia de 58 espcies, 82,75% bentnicas/epifticas e 17,25% planctnicas, comuns em guas doces a oligo-mesohalinas, as mais abundantes e freqentes em ordem decrescente foram Staurosirella pinnata, Aulacoseira granulata, Thalassiosira sp., Staurosira obtusa, Encyonema silesiacum, Gomphonema parvulum, Planothidium lanceolatum, Thalassiosira eccentrica, Cyclotella meneghiniana, Encyonema minutum, Nitzschia amphibia e Frustulia sp. Os dados tambm revelaram a influncia da relao areia/argila sobre a composio e a abundncia das diatomceas, o que pode explicar a prevalncia local de agrupamentos de espcies ora planctnicas, ora bentnicas na zona intermar, como resposta aos processos hidrodinmicos atuais. H de se salientar a provvel contribuio da vegetao herbcea, atenuando a energia das ondas e mars, retendo os sedimentos finos argilosos, promovendo assim, a reduo de processos de abraso na zona intermar e a conseqente preservao dos txons planctnicos. This paper aim evaluate the composition, abundance and richness of diatoms and to relate theses attributes to actual hydrodynamic processes evidenced by sedimentary texture on surface sediments located on intertidal zone of Itupanema Beach, situated on estuarine continental sector of the Par State, Amazon. The 10 samples were collected in perpendicular transects within 5 m intervals on coordinates 0131'03''S and 4843'28''W in 2006, March and were applied diatoms analysis following standard techniques. The results showed 58 species, being 82,75% benthic/epiphytic and 17,25% planktonic species, occurring commonly in fresh to oligo-mesohaline waters, the more abundant and frequent species in decrescent order were Staurosirella pinnata, Aulacoseira granulata, Thalassiosira sp, Staurosira obtusa, Encyonema silesiacum, Gomphonema parvulum, Planothidium lanceolatum, Thalassiosira eccentrica, Cyclotella meneghiniana, Encyonema minutum, Nitzschia amphibia and Frustulia sp. The data also revealed that the sedimentary ratio sand/clay was influenced by actual hydrodynamic processes, probably determining the local prevalence of planktonic species groups or benthic species groups on the intertidal zone, in terms of the composition and the abundance of diatoms species. The aquatic herbaceous vegetation had a possible role on the reduction the both energy waves and tidal current velocities, and the retention of muddy sediments, with the reduction of abrasion processes in the intertidal zone and consequently preserving planktonic taxa.
23499402|Um novo nome  proposto para a tribo Astereae (Asteraceae) no Brasil: Conyza neolaxiflora A. Teles & Stehmann (sinnimo: Erigeron laxiflorus Baker, no Conyza laxiflora Desf.), assim como  discutida a afinidade com Conyza monorchis (Griseb.) Cabrera, espcie morfologicamente relacionada. A new name is proposed for the tribe Astereae (Asteraceae) in Brazil: Conyza neolaxiflora A. Teles & Stehmann (synoym: Erigeron laxiflorus Baker, not Conyza laxiflora Desf.), and a discussion of its relationship with the closely related Conyza monorchis (Griseb.) Cabrera is presented.
23499393|No Brasil, 85% das Bignoniaceae so representadas pela tribo Bignonieae, caracterizada pelo hbito trepador e arbustivo escandente. No Parque Estadual do Rio Doce (PERD), um dos ltimos remanescente de Mata Atlntica em Minas Gerais, foram registradas 37 espcies dessa tribo. O presente estudo teve como objetivos: descrever a distribuio vertical das espcies de Bignonieae do PERD; reconhecer os padres fenolgicos de florao apresentados por elas; e associar os padres morfolgicos de corola e sndromes florais j estabelecidos com aqueles encontrados no PERD. As 37 espcies de Bignonieae foram observadas periodicamente, no perodo de 15 meses e 32 visitas. A distribuio vertical ocorreu em trs estratos: dossel (75,7%), entre-copa (16,2%) e sub-bosque (8,1%), significando que 24,3% dessas espcies difundiram-se para outros nichos ecolgicos, alm do estrato superior da mata. Os padres fenolgicos de florao foram: florao macia em 40,6% das espcies, vrias floraes macias em 21,6%, estacionrio modificado em 16,2% e cornucpia em 13,5%. O tipo de corola Anemopaegma foi o mais representativo (44,1% das espcies estudadas), seguido do tipo Stizophyllum e Cydista (14,7%, cada), Pithecoctenium e Pyrostegia (11,8%, cada) e Tynnanthus (2,9%). Associando a morfologia da corola ao possvel polinizador, verificou-se que 83,8% das espcies apresentam tipos florais relacionados  melitofilia, reforando a importncia das Bignonieae na manuteno de abelhas mdias e grandes em florestas tropicais. The tribe Bignonieae represents eighty-five percent of Bignoniaceae in Brazil, which are predominantly lianas, although some genera also have a few suffruticose species. At the Parque Estadual do Rio Doce (PERD), one of the last Atlantic Forest stretches in the state of Minas Gerais, 37 species of that tribe were recorded. The main purposes of the present study were: to describe the PERD's Bignonieae species vertical distribution and to recognise the flowering phenological patterns displayed by them; and associating corolla morphological patterns and established floral syndromes with those found at PERD. All thirty-seven species were observed on 32 visits during 15 months. Vertical distribution occurred in three strata: canopy (75.7%), intra-crown (16.2%) and under-storey (8.1%), meaning that 24.3% of those species spread out to other ecological niches, besides the forest's higher stratum. The flowering phenological patterns were: big bang in 40.6% of the species, multiple bang in 21.6%, modified steady state in 16.2% and cornucopia in 13.5%. The Anemopaegma corolla type was the most representative (44.1% of the studied species), followed by the types Stizophyllum and Cydista (14.7%, each), Pithecoctenium and Pyrostegia (11.8%, each) and Tynnanthus (2.9%). Associating the floral morphology to a possible pollinator it was found that 83.8% of the species display floral types associated to bee-pollination, highlighting the importance of the Bignonieae on the maintenance of the large and middle sized bees in tropical forests.
23499398|Foi realizado um estudo dos musgos ocorrentes em diferentes ecossistemas da microrregio do Salgado Paraense, visando determinar a riqueza, registrar os tipos de ecossistemas e substratos de ocorrncia das espcies, identificar algumas destas como indicadoras de ambientes perturbados e ampliar o conhecimento da brioflora do estado do Par. Foram registradas 38 espcies de musgos, distribudas em 21 gneros e 11 famlias. A riqueza de espcies foi relativamente baixa, levando-se em considerao a grande quantidade de amostras analisadas (558). Calymperes afzelii, C. erosum, C. lonchophyllum, C. palisotii, Octoblepharum albidum var. albidum, O. pulvinatum, Sematophyllum subsimplex, Splacnobryum obtusum e Taxithelium planum foram as que apresentaram melhor adaptao a condies adversas. Sugere-se que estas espcies podem ser potencialmente utilizadas como indicadoras de ambientes perturbados. Entretanto, todas as espcies ocorrentes nos oito municpios desta microrregio esto adaptadas a um complexo de fatores ambientais e encontram as condies necessrias e favorveis  sua manuteno e reproduo. A study of the mosses in different ecosystems of the micro-region of the Salgado Paraense, northeastern State of Par, was carried out. This study aimed to determine species richness, the ecosystem types and the substrates of occurrence of the species, as well as to identify species as indicators of disturbed environments and to increase to the knowledge of the bryoflora of Par. This inventory recorded 38 moss species, distributed in 21 genera and 11 families. The species richness was relatively low, considering the large number of examined specimens (558). Calymperes afzelii, C. erosum, C. lonchophyllum, C. palisotii, Octoblepharum albidum var albidum, O. pulvinatum, Sematophyllum subsimplex, Splacnobryum obtusum and Taxithelium planum were better adapted to adverse conditions. Potentially, these species could be used as indicators of disturbed environments. However, all the species collected in the eight municipalities are adapted to a combination of environmental factors and find the necessary and favorable conditions for their maintenance and reproduction.
23499395|So apresentados os resultados do levantamento florstico das diatomceas epilticas no curso superior do rio das Antas, estado do Rio Grande do Sul. As coletas foram realizadas mensalmente, de julho de 2005 a fevereiro de 2006, em quatro estaes amostrais entre 1.030 e 1.005 m de altitude. Um total de 38 espcies distribudas em 25 gneros e 16 famlias foram identificadas e ilustradas. A maioria das espcies  cosmopolita, porm foram encontrados txons com preferncia por ambientes oligotrficos e/ou de altitude, sem que os mesmos fossem restritos a esses ambientes, como Cocconeis placentula var. acuta, Meridion circulare var. constrictum e Psammothidium subatomoides. Cabe ressaltar a ocorrncia de trs novas citaes para o estado do Rio Grande do Sul, Gomphonema tenuissimum, Luticola costei e Pinnularia parvulissima, sendo a primeira registrada em microscpio eletrnico de varredura (MEV). The results of the floristic study of epilithic diatoms from the upper course of the rio das Antas, state of Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil, are presented. The samples were taken monthly from July 2005 to February 2006, in four sites between 1030 and 1005 m alt. Thirty-eight species distributed in twenty-five genera and sixteen families are presented and illustrated. Most species are cosmopolitan, but we found some taxa with preference for, however not restricted to, oligotrophic and/or high-altitude environments, such as Cocconeis placentula var. acuta, Meridion circulare var. constrictum and Psammothidium subatomoides. Gomphonema tenuissimum, Luticola costei and Pinnularia parvulissima are new citations for Rio Grande do Sul State, and the first was registered in scanning electron microscopy (SEM).
23499404|Este trabalho foi baseado na anlise de materiais de herbrio, documentaes bibliogrficas e coletas, revelando a ocorrncia de 36 espcies do gnero Phyllanthus na Regio Nordeste do Brasil. Parte destas espcies tem distribuio no domnio do semi-rido, estando oito delas dispersas na poro centro-sul da Bahia, quatro so mais comuns no Nordeste oriental e nove tm distribuio principalmente na faixa litornea, na Floresta Atlntica. As demais espcies so amplamente distribudas.  fornecida chave para identificao das espcies e comentrios sobre distribuio geogrfica e hbitats. This work was based on the analysis of the herbarium material, specialized bibliography and field-collections, recording the occurrence of 36 species of the genus Phyllanthus. Some species of Phyllanthus show distribution in the semi-arid region, with eight species dispersed in the central Southern part of Bahia, four species commonly found in the Eastern part of Northeastern Brazil, and nine species of the genus mainly distributed in the coastal area, in association with the atlantic forest. Other species have a wide ranging distribution. A key to identify the species together with comments about their distribution and habitat is provided.
23499391|Este trabalho tem como objetivo um estudo taxonmico da tribo Tecomeae (Bignoniaceae) no Parque Nacional do Itatiaia. O Parque est localizado na Regio Sudeste do Brasil e apresenta ampla variao do gradiente altitudinal e por conseqncia grande diversificao de formaes vegetacionais, caracterizando-se como uma rea de grande diversidade biolgica. A tribo Tecomeae est representada na rea por 13 espcies, distribudas em quatro gneros: Tabebuia com seis espcies, Jacaranda com cinco espcies, Cybstax e Sparattosperma, ambos com uma espcie. So apresentadas chaves para identificao dos txons, descries, ilustraes e comentrios sobre distribuio geogrfica. This manuscript presents a taxonomic study of the tribe Tecomeae (Bignoniaceae) in the Itatiaia National Park, located in Southeastern Brazil. The studied site has a wide ranging altitudinal gradient and consequently great diversification of vegetation formations and high biological diversity. The tribe Tecomeae is represented by 13 species, distributed in four genera: Tabebuia with six species, Jacaranda with five species, Cybstax and Sparattosperma, both with one species. Keys to identify the taxa, descriptions, illustrations and geographical distribution data are presented.
23499403|The Guatteria group (Annonaceae) consists of four genera: Guatteria, Guatteriopsis, Guatteriella, and Heteropetalum. Morphological data have for long suggested a close affinity between these genera. Recent phylogenetic analysis has shown that Guatteriopsis, Guatteriella as well as Heteropetalum are actually nested within Guatteria. Here the nomenclatural consequences following from these results are presented. Three new combinations and one new name are introduced for Guatteriopsis and one old name is reinstated, one new combination and one new name is proposed for Guatteriella, and one old combination is reinstated for Heteropetalum. With the transference of the species of these three genera into Guatteria the concept of the Guatteria group is put out of use. O grupo Guatteria (Annonaceae) consiste de quatro gneros: Guatteria, Guatteriopsis, Guatteriella e Heteropetalum. A afinidade entre estes quatro gneros manteve-se aceita por longo tempo, com base em dados morfolgicos. Entretanto, uma recente anlise filogentica demonstra que Guatteriopsis, Guatteriella e Heteropetalum encontram-se circunscritos em Guatteria. As conseqncias nomenclaturais dos resultados filogenticos obtidos so apresentadas neste trabalho. So propostas trs combinaes novas e um nome novo em Guatteriopsis, enquanto um nome antigo  restabelecido. Uma nova combinao e um novo nome so propostos em Guatteriella e uma combinao antiga  restabelecida em Heteropetalum. Com a transferncia das espcies destes trs gneros para Guatteria, o conceito de grupo Guatteria no  mais necessrio.
23499399|Foram estudadas trs espcies simptridas de Mandevilla buscando enriquecer o conhecimento da biota dos inselbergues e identificar estruturas anatmicas possivelmente relacionadas com o ambiente helifilo. Em seo transversal caulinar e vista paradrmica so comuns aos txons estudados os seguintes aspectos: epiderme unisseriada; estmatos paracticos; tricomas tectores simples; hipoderme unisseriada com compostos fenlicos e sistema vascular bicolateral. A medula  ampla em M. dardanoi e reduzida nas demais. Em seo transversal e vista paradrmica foliar as espcies apresentam epiderme unisseriada; cutcula estriada; estmatos paracticos, unidade vascular central bicolateral e mesofilo dorsiventral. Mandevilla scabra  anfihipoestomtica e as demais hipoestomticas. O colnquima angular ocorre na regio da nervura central em ambas as faces em M. dardanoi e M. scabra. O mesofilo  dorsiventral. Alguns aspectos anatmicos, principalmente foliares, encontrados nas espcies de Mandevilla aqui estudadas so freqentemente indicados como estratgias que podem atuar na resistncia a condies de alta temperatura e luminosidade e tambm estresse hdrico. Entre essas estruturas destacam-se a cutcula estriada, a hipoderme com compostos fenlicos, mesofilo compacto, alm de cristais prismticos e drusas. Os dados anatmicos fornecerem subsdios para futuras abordagens taxonmicas e ecolgicas em Mandevilla. Three sympatric species of Mandevilla were studied with the aim to increase the knowledge about the biota of inselbergs and to identify anatomical features that could be related to a high-insolation environment. Aspects common to all studied species that can be observed in transverse section and frontal view of the stems are: uniseriate epidermis; paracytic stomata; unicellular trichomes; uniseriate hypodermis with phenolic compounds and bicollateral vascular bundles. The medulla is broad in M. dardanoi and narrow in M. scabra and M. tenuifolia. Uniseriate epidermis with cuticular ridges and paracytic stomata were observed in transverse section and frontal view of the leaves. Mandevilla scabra is hypoamphistomatic and the other two hypostomatic. Angular collenchyma under both surfaces along the midrib occurs in M. dardanoi and M. scabra. The mesophyll is dorsiventral. Some of the anatomical aspects studied, particularly in the leaves of the studied species, are frequently associated with strategies that could have a role in protection against high temperatures, light levels and water stress. Among these structures, the striate cuticle, hypodermis with phenolic compounds, compact mesophyll, and prismatic crystals and druses can be listed. The anatomical data obtained provide subsidies for future research with taxonomic and ecological approaches in Mandevilla.

23499401|Caraipa andina from La Fundacin, in the western Andes of Venezuela (Tchira State) is described, illustrated, and its morphological relationship with an allied species is discussed. This new species is morphologically related to C. heterocarpa Ducke, but it differs by the leaf blade shape, size, and dense abaxial papillae; fewer-flowered inflorescence; and shorter pedicel, flower buds, petals, and filaments. Phytogeographical information about the La Fundacin area is presented. This species represents the first report of this genus in the Venezuelan Andes. Caraipa andina foi descoberta em La Fundacin, nos Andes Ocidentais da Venezuela (Estado de Tchira) e  aqui descrita e ilustrada, discutindo-se suas afinidades morfolgicas com as espcies prximas. Morfologicamente relacionada com C. heterocarpa Ducke, a nova espcie diferencia-se pelo tamanho, forma da lmina foliar e face abaxial densamente papilosa; inflorescncia paucifloras; pedicelos, botes florais, ptalas e filamentos mais curtos. Informaes sobre a fitogeografia do local so apresentadas. Esta espcie representa o primeiro registro deste gnero nos Andes Venezuelanos.
23499392|Este estudo tem o intuito de testar o desempenho fotossinttico das espcies de algas bentnicas mais representativas da Lagoa Rodrigo de Freitas (Polysiphonia subtilissima, Cladophora vagabunda e Ulva flexuosa subsp. flexuosa) em diferentes salinidades, a fim de verificar seus limites de tolerncia. Cada amostra foi incubada nas salinidades 10, 15 e 25. Para cada salinidade foram realizadas quatro repeties (luz e escuro). Amostras de 10 mg foram utilizadas para cada espcie, durante aproximadamente 30 minutos de incubao, sob irradincia de 500  5 mmol.m2s1. Polysiphonia subtilissima e Cladophora vagabunda tiveram maior produo fotossinttica na salinidade de 15 (P < 0,05). Ulva flexuosa subsp. flexuosa no apresentou diferena em sua taxa fotossinttica nas trs salinidades (P = 0,09). Os resultados obtidos sugerem que alteraes futuras na salinidade da lagoa podero causar modificaes na dinmica das populaes das algas locais. This study aimed to test the photossynthetic performance of the most representative benthonic macroalgae species at the Rodrigo de Freitas Lagoon (Polysiphonia subtilissima, Cladophora vagabunda and Ulva flexuosa subsp. flexuosa) in response to different salinities in order to verify their tolerance limits. Each sample was tested under salinities 10, 15 and 25. Four replicates (light and dark) were used for each salinity. Samples of 10 mg were used for each species, during 30 minutes incubation, under irradiance of 500  5 mmol.m2s1. P. subtilissima and C. vagabunda presented higher photosynthetic production in the salinity of 15 (P < 0.05). U. flexuosa subsp. flexuosa did not differ in its photosynthetic rate under the three salinities sampled (P = 0.09). The present results suggest that future alterations related to the lagoon's salinity may cause alterations in the populations dynamics of the local algae.
23499397|Oito espcies de Stylogyne ocorrem no estado do Rio de Janeiro, das quais S. depauperata, S. lhotzkiana, S. sellowiana e S. sordida so endmicas. As flores pistiladas de S. lhotzkiana e bissexuais de S. sellowiana so descritas pela primeira vez. Cinco espcies so ilustradas pela primeira vez. So apresentados chave para identificao, comentrios sobre afinidades, distribuio geogrfica e ecologia das espcies. A Serra do Mar se destaca como importante centro de diversidade do gnero no estado do Rio de Janeiro, sendo os contrafortes da Serra dos rgos e do Macio do Tingu, as reas com maior representatividade de txons. Eight species of Stylogyne occur in Rio de Janeiro state, S. depauperata Mez, S. lhotzkiana, S. sellowiana and S. sordida being endemics. The pistillate flowers of S. lhotzkiana and the bisexual ones of S. sellowiana are described for the first time. Five species are illustrated for the first time. Identification key, and commentaries about affinities, distribution and ecology of the species are provided. In Rio de Janeiro state, the Serra do Mar presents the greatest diversity of Stylogyne species, in which the Serra dos rgos and Tingu groups of mountains show the larger number of taxa.
23499400|Realizou-se o estudo taxonmico de Melastomataceae, tribos Bertolonieae e Merianieae, no Parque Nacional do Itatiaia, situado entre os limites dos estados do Rio de Janeiro e Minas Gerais. The taxonomic study of the tribes Bertolonieae and Merianieae (Melastomataceae) in the Itatiaia National Park is presented. This conservation unit is located between Rio de Janeiro and Minas Gerais states, where one species of each Bertolonia, Behuria, Huberia and Meriania were found. 23499880|Foi realizado o estudo palinolgico de 12 espcies de Acacia: A. farnesiana (Acacia subg. Acacia) e A. bahiensis, A. globosa, A. kallunkiae, A. langsdorffi, A. martiusiana, A. monacantha, A. piauhiensis, A. polyphylla, A. riparia, A. tenuifolia e A. velutina (Acacia subg. Aculeiferum). Os gros de plen foram acetolisados, medidos, descritos e ilustrados sob microscpio de luz e eletrnico de varredura. Os gros de plen em Acacia so reunidos em polades calimadas, mdias ou grandes, de contorno esferoidal, em vista frontal e elptico, em vista lateral, com 16 gros de plen, organizados de forma regular, com oito gros de plen em cada face, 4-porados. Em A. farnesiana, so observados 24-32 gros de plen organizados de forma irregular, 3-sulcados. Os gros de plen da polade so pequenos, subquadrados na face distal e piramidal, quando em vista equatorial. A sexina  granulada ou rugulada, na maioria das espcies. Conclui-se que as espcies no podem ser separadas atravs das suas caractersticas palinolgicas, com exceo de A. farnesiana. The pollen of 12 species of Acacia: A. farnesiana (L.) Willd. (Acacia subg. Acacia) e A. bahiensis Benth., A. globosa A. Bocage & S. Miotto, A. kallunkiae Grimes & Barneby, A. langsdorffii Benth., A. martiusiana (Steud.) Burkart, A. monacantha DC., A. piauhiensis Benth., A. polyphylla DC., A. riparia Kunth, A. tenuifolia (L.) Willd., and A. velutina DC. (Acacia subg. Aculeiferum) was studied. Material was acetolized, measured, described and illustrated using light and scanning electron microscopy. The pollen grains in Acacia are bound in medium or large calimad polyads, spheroidal in shape on frontal view and elliptical from the side, containing 16 pollen grains, organized regularly with 8 pollen grains on each side. Pollen grains are 4-porate. In A. farnesiana, 24-32 pollen grains are found irregularly organized, while pollen grains are 3-sulcate. The polyad pollen grains are small, subsquared on distal view and pyramidal on the equatorial view, sexine is thicker than the nexine. Species could not be separated by their palynological features, except for A. farnesiana.

The present study focussed on shrubs, subshrubs and vines belonging to the Leguminosae in two Seasonal Semidecidual Forest fragments in Araponga, near the Parque Estadual da Serra do Brigadeiro (PESB). Collections were carried out between August 2005 and September 2006, in monthly visits to the two sites and their surroundings. Twenty one taxa were found, distributed amongst 13 genera, of which the largest was Desmodium (4 spp.), followed by Chamaecrista, Senna, Mimosa, Centrosema and Crotalaria. (2 spp. each). A coleta de material botnico foi realizada entre maro de 2006 e janeiro de 2008. Foram registradas 81 espcies distribudas em 42 gneros representando cerca de 25 % das leguminosas j citadas para o bioma. Destas, 17 so endmicas da caatinga, representando 25% do total de espcies amostradas. The Family Leguminosae is the most representative of the caatinga, comprizing about a third of the total number of species detected for that biome. Due to the importance of Leguminosae in caatinga, a floristic inventory was accomplished in the municipal district of Mirandiba-PE, a prioritary area for scientific investigation due to the lack of information on the flora and the fauna. Field trips were accomplished from March 2006 to January 2008 for collecting botanical material. Eighty one species distributed in 42 genera were registered, comprizing about 25% of the Leguminosae already registered for the biome. Seventeen of them are endemic to the caatinga, representing 25% of the total sampled species. The subfamily Caesalpinioideae is represented by 22 species distributed in 7 genera, Mimosoideae by 23 species distributed in 13 genera and Papilionoideae by 36 species distributed in 22 genera. 23499876|A demanda de petrleo e derivados provoca acidentes que contaminam extensas reas. A maioria dos trabalhos sobre os efeitos dessa contaminao refere-se  germinao e desenvolvimento vegetal, pouco se sabendo sobre os efeitos na estrutura de tecidos e clulas. Este trabalho teve como objetivo analisar o efeito do solo contaminado por petrleo e solo biorremediado na anatomia de plntulas de Mimosa pilulifera (Leguminosae). O experimento foi realizado com solo da REPAR/PETROBRS, Araucria-PR, onde ocorreu um vazamento de petrleo em 2000. O experimento constou de trs tratamentos: solo contaminado com petrleo, solo biorremediado e solo no contaminado, com cinco repeties. Aps 30 dias da semeadura, foram analisados anatomicamente a raiz, hipoctilo, cotildone e eofilo e realizados testes microqumicos com sudan III, lugol e cloreto frrico. Mensuraram-se: dimetro do cilindro vascular e espessura do crtex da raiz, dimetro do hipoctilo e espessura dos cotildones e eofilos. A estrutura celular radicial de M. pilulifera sofreu maior interferncia no solo contaminado que no biorremediado. Na parte area, a nica alterao foi a reduo da espessura do eofilo em solo contaminado. The demand of oil and its derivatives have provoked accidents, contaminating areas of the planet. The majority of are relative to the effect in seed germination and plant development. Little is known on the effect of the hydrocarbons in the structure of the tissues and plant cells. This work intends to analyse the effect of the ground contaminated by oil and the bioremediated ground on the anatomy of seedlings of Mimosa pilulifera. The experiment was carried through with ground proceeding of the REPAR/PETROBRS, Araucria-PR, where a leak of oil occurred in 2000. The experiment consisted of three treatments: petroleum contaminated soil, bioremediated soil and non contaminated soil, with five repetitions. Thirty days after sowing, 10 seedlings were collected per treatment. The root, the hipocotyl, the cotyledon and the eophyll were analysed anatomically and were submitted to histochemical tests with Sudan III, lugol and ferric chloride. The diameter of the vascular cylinder and the thickness of the cortex of the root, the diameter of the hipocotyl and the thickness of the cotyledons and eophylls were measured. The cellular structure of the root of M. pilulifera suffered greater interference in the contaminated soil that the biorremediated. In shoots, the only change was the reduction in the thickness of eophyll in contaminated soil.
23499875|No presente trabalho foi estudada a morfologia dos frutos e das sementes e caractersticas de plntulas de: Canavalia rosea, Ormosia arborea, Pithecellobium tortum e Swartzia apetala var. apetala, de janeiro de 2004 a outubro de 2006, na restinga de Maric, Rio de Janeiro. As espcies possuem frutos deiscentes com disperso autocrica. As sementes de S. apetala var. apetala sugerem tambm disperso zoocrica pela presena de um arilo. As sementes recm-coletadas apresentam mdias altas de germinao: C. rosea (99%), O. arborea (100%), P. tortum (75%) e S. apetala var. apetala (93%), entretanto, no habitat natural, s foram encontradas plntulas de C. rosea. A germinao  criptocotiledonar em O. arborea e S. apetala var. apetala e fanerocotiledonar em C. rosea e P. tortum. The morphology of fruits, seeds and seedlings of Canavalia rosea, Ormosia arborea, Pithecellobium tortum and Swartzia apetala var. apetala in the "restinga" of Maric, state of Rio de Janeiro was studied between January 2004 and October 2006. All species present dehiscent fruits and autochorous dispersial, but the seeds of S. apetala var. apetala also suggest zoochorous dispersial by the presence of an aril. Newly collected seeds show high germination success: C. rosea (99%), O. arborea (100%), P. tortum (93%) and S. apetala var. apetala (75%), however, the only seedlings found in the natural habitat were of C. rosea. Cryptocotylar seedling was recorded for O. arborea and S. apetala var. apetala. while phanerocotylar seedling was observed in C. rosea and P. tortum.
23499873|The phytogeography and preferred habitat of Crotalaria species from Brazil are studied. Four species are widely distributed in Brazil, while C. goiasensis and C. irwinii are endemic to the state of Gois, C. clausseni to So Paulo, C. rufipila to Minas Gerais and C. brachycarpa and C. harleyi to Bahia. Crotalaria species occurs in the following biogeographical provinces: Amazonian, Atlantic, Caatinga, Cerrado, Chaquea, Guayana, Pampeana and Paranaense. The Cerrado province presents the largest number of species with restricted distribution, followed by the Paranaense province. The geographical distribution of species in Brazil shows higher species diversity in the highlands (800  2000 m.s.m.), such as the Serra Geral de Gois, Chapada dos Veadeiros, Espinhao Range (15-16 spp.), Serra da Mantiqueira and Serra do Mar (14 spp.). As well as the altitude, vegetation and climate influence the distribution of Crotalaria in Brazil. Este estudo apresenta a fitogeografia e os hbitos preferenciais das espcies de Crotalaria no Brasil. Quatro espcies so amplamente distribudas no Brasil. Por outro lado, C. goiasensis e C. irwinii so endmicas de Gois, C. clausseni de So Paulo, C. rufipila de Minas Gerais e C. brachycarpa e C. harleyi da Bahia. As espcies de Crotalaria ocorrem nas seguintes provncias biogeogrficas: cerrado, paranense, atlntica, amaznica, caatinga, chaquenha, guayana e pampeana. A provncia do cerrado apresenta o maior nmero de espcies exclusivas seguida da provncia paranense. A distribuio geogrfica das espcies brasileiras mostra que a maior diversidade ocorre em reas elevadas (800  2000 m.s.m.), como a Serra Geral de Gois, Chapada dos Veadeiros, Cadeia do Espinhao (15-16 spp.), Serra da Mantiqueira e Serra do Mar (14 spp.). As elevadas altitudes, bem como as caractersticas vegetacionais e climticas influenciam a distribuio das espcies de Crotalaria no Brasil.
23499874|Calliandra brevipes e Calliandra tweedii, tambm conhecidas como caliandra ou esponjinha, so espcies nativas do Brasil cultivadas como plantas ornamentais. O objetivo deste trabalho foi avaliar os efeitos da aplicao de diferentes concentraes de cido Indolbutrico (AIB) no enraizamento de Calliandra tweedii e Calliandra brevipes e relacion-los com a estrutura anatmica das estacas. Ambas as espcies apresentaram um aumento na porcentagem de enraizamento e no nmero de razes quando tratadas com AIB. Todos os tratamentos de Calliandra brevipes obtiveram porcentagens de enraizamento superiores s de Calliandra tweedii, sendo que os melhores resultados desta foram com 2000 mg.L1 AIB (56,67%). C. brevipes teve 90% de enraizamento sem a necessidade de aplicao de AIB. A raiz tem origem direta em ambas as espcies, podendo originar-se na regio interna ou externa do floema. Provavelmente, os fatores limitantes ao enraizamento de C. tweedii so devidos  estrutura anatmica e fisiolgica, como a ausncia de grnulos de amido na regio da medula. Calliandra brevipes and Calliandra tweedii, known as 'caliandra' or 'esponjinha', are native Brazilian ornamental species. This experiment aimed to evaluate the effect of the application of different concentrations of Indolbutiric acid (IBA) in root formation of both species by observing anatomical structure. Both species presented an increase in root formation percentage and number of new roots when treated with IBA. All Calliandra brevipes treatments achieved higher root formation percentages than Calliandra tweedii. The best results of C. brevipes were 2000 mg.L1 IBA (56,67%). C. brevipes had 90% of rooting without IBA application. Roots originated directly for both species, either from the inner or outer phloem region. Probably the limiting factors for C. tweedii root formation were linked to its anatomy and physiology, such as the absence of starch granules in the medular region.

Constataram-se 11 txons distribudos em trs sees: 1) Mimosa sect. Batocaulon (M. adenocarpa, M. arenosa, M. gemmulata var. adamantina, M. lewisii, M. misera, M. ophthalmocentra e M. tenuiflora); 2) Mimosa sect. Habbasia (M. somnians); e 3) Mimosa sect. Mimosa (M. hirsutissima var. hirsutissima, M. modesta var. ursinoides e M. sensitiva var. sensitiva). A maior parte das espcies apresenta distribuio em vegetao de caatinga, apenas M. hirsutissima var. hirsutissima, M. gemmulata var. adamantina, M. misera e M. sensitiva var. sensitiva ocorrem em vegetao arbustiva pereniflia. The taxonomic study of Mimosa L. in the Ipanema Valley was based on morphologic analysis of fresh material or herbarium specimens, as well as field observations. Eleven taxa, distributed in three sections, were found: 1) Mimosa sect. Batocaulon (M. adenocarpa, M. arenosa, M. gemmulata var. adamantina, M. lewisii, M. misera, M. ophthalmocentra and M. tenuiflora); 2) Mimosa sect. Habbasia (M. somnians); and 3) Mimosa sect. Mimosa (M. hirsutissima var. hirsutissima, M. modesta var. ursinoides and M. sensitiva var. sensitiva). The main characters used for delimitation of the species were type of indumentum, inflorescence morphology, number of pinnae, leaflets, perianth elements and stamens, as well as aspects from the fruit. Most species occur in caatinga vegetation, only M. hirsutissima var. hirsutissima, M. gemmulata var. adamantina, M. misera and M. sensitiva var. sensitiva occur in evergreen shrubby vegetation.
23499872|O gnero Copaifera est presente na frica (4 spp.), Amrica Central (4 spp.), Amrica do Sul (cerca de 37 spp.) e, provavelmente, na sia (1 sp.). Foram reconhecidas nove espcies de Copaifera na Amaznia brasileira: Copaifera duckei, C. glycycarpa, C. guyanensis, C. martii, C. multijuga, C. paupera, C. piresii, C. pubiflora e C. reticulata, representadas tanto por arbustos ou rvores que chegam a atingir at 40 metros de altura, fornecendo tanto madeira como o leo-resina, extrado de seu tronco, utilizada na preparao de medicamentos, cosmticos, tintas e revelao de fotografias. O presente trabalho apresenta uma chave para identificao das espcies que ocorrem na Amaznia brasileira, incluindo ilustraes, descries e comentrios sobre morfologia e taxonomia. Copaifera occurs in Africa (4 spp.), Central America (4 spp.), South America (about 37 spp.) and probably in Asia (1 sp.). Nine species were recognized within the Brazilian Amazon: Copaifera duckei, C. glycycarpa, C. guyanensis, C. martii, C. multijuga, C. paupera, C. piresii, C. pubiflora e C. reticulata. Their habit varies between shrubby and tree-like, with some species forming 40 m tall trees. Copaifera is economically important as a timber source, and increasingly as the source of an oleoresin used as a component of medicines, cosmetics, ink and film-development. The present treatment includes an identification key for the species, illustrations, descriptions and comments regarding the morphology, taxonomy and distribution of the species treated.
23499871|Visando o tratamento de Leguminosae tribo Cercideae no estado do Rio de Janeiro, este trabalho apresenta resultados relativos  taxonomia e Conservao de Bauhinia ser. Aculeatae. Com evidncias em novas colees botnicas, a descrio do material florfero de B. albicans  aqui apresentada e ilustrada pela primeira vez. Foi verificado o status de conservao de B. albicans, espcie vulnervel e endmica da regio dos Lagos. Alm disso,  apresentada uma descrio de B. affinis, aparentemente extinta no estado do Rio de Janeiro. The taxonomy and conservation of Bauhinia ser. Aculeatae is part of the treatment of Leguminosae Cercideae for the state of Rio de Janeiro. The description of the flowering material of B. albicans is presented and illustrated for the first time, while this endemic species of coastal Rio de Janeiro has been categorized as vulnerable. A description of B. affinis, regionally extinct in Rio de Janeiro, is also presented.
23499869|Se presentan las caractersticas cromosmicas descriptas hasta el momento en Leguminosas americanas. A travs del anlisis de estos datos en conjunto con los morfolgicos y las filogenias moleculares se proponen hiptesis acerca de los cambios cromosmicos ocurridos durante el proceso de divergencia y especiacin de la familia. Los estudios cromosmicos indican una gran variacin intergenrica, inter e intraespecfica, adems de una amplia diversificacin en el tamao del genoma entre gneros, especies y poblaciones. A partir del nmero bsico ancestral x=7 se deduce que la especiacin hbrida poliploide ha sido muy importante en la diversificacin de la familia. Por procesos de disploida creciente y decreciente, tanto a nivel diploide como poliploide se originaran nmeros bsicos secundarios y series poliploides modificadas. En la parafiltica subfamilia Caesalpinioideae habra predominado el proceso de disploidia decreciente de n=14 a n=11. En la monofiltica subfamilia Mimosoideae, ocurri un evento principal de evolucin del nmero cromosmico de 14 a 13. Por ltimo en Papilionoideae, la subfamilia ms derivada de Leguminosae, se observ reduccin del nmero bsico de 14 a 7, pasando por nmeros gamticos de 11 y 8. Por otro lado, el origen recurrente de los poliploides y la ocurrencia de rearreglos intergenmicos, hibridacin y poliploida secundaria, son procesos que dificultan la agrupacin natural de los taxones en algunos grupos de la familia Leguminosae. Chromosomic features described so far for Americans legumes are reviewed and analyzed, simultaneously with morphological and molecular characters. This is an invaluable opportunity to propose hypotheses about chromosome changes during the family divergence and speciation processes. The chromosome studies showed wide inter-generic, inter and intra-specific variability, as well as marked differences in genome sizes between genera, species and populations. By postulating an ancestral basic number of seven (x=7) it is possible to deduce that polyploid hybrid speciation was very important in the diversification of the family as a whole. Due to increasing and decreasing diploidy processes, secondary basic numbers and modified polyploids series could have arised both at diploid and polyploid levels. On the other hand, recurrent origin of polyploids, occurrence of inter-genomic rearrangements, hybridization and secondary polyploidy are all processes that make it difficult to group the taxa within the Leguminosae family in a natural sequence.
23495925|Este trabalho relaciona as espcies e variedades de Bromeliaceae ocorrentes nos campos de altitude do Estado do Rio de Janeiro, Brasil. Foram encontrados quatro padres bsicos de distribuio geogrfica: 1. Ampla distribuio. 2. Costa leste do Brasil. 3. Disjuno Rio de Janeiro  Minais Gerais, e 4. Endemismo para o Estado do Rio de Janeiro. Foram verificados os demais habitats onde ocorrem e seus respectivos hbitos. This paper enumerates the species and varieties of Bromeliaceae occuring in the altitudinal fields of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Four basic patterns of geographic distribution were found and verified the other habitats were they are represented with their respective habits.
23495928|No presente trabalho, o autor contribui para o conhecimento da anatomia da folha Tocoyena bullata (Vell.) Mart., destacando a ocorrncia de emergncia de colter na estpula, estmato do tipo paractico, mesofilo dorsiventral e feixes vasculares do tipo colateral. O sistema vascular adquire formato circular na lmina foliar ou no pecolo, envolvendo ocasionalmente pequenos feixes medulares neste ltimo. Idioblastos tanferos e cristalferos encontram-se distribudos pelo parnquima fundamental da estpula, pecolo, nervura mediana e no clornquima do mesofilo. In this report, the author contributes to the knowledge of the leaf anatomy of Tocoyena bullata (Vell.) Mart. He points out the occurrence of emergency and colleter in the stipule, paracytic type stomata, dorsiventral mesophyll and colateral vascular bundles. The vascular system acquires a ring shape in the leaf blade or in the petiole, occasionally enclosing a few small medullary strands in the latter. Tannin and crystal idioblasts can be found in fundamental parenchyma of stipule, petiole, midrib and in the chlorenchyma of mesophyll.

23495927|O presente trabalho consiste no estudo da anatomia foliar de Himatanthus lancifolius (Muell. Arg.) Woodson. Essa espcie apresenta sistema vascular com disposio bicolateral, observando-se grupos isolados de floema na regio correspondente  medula ao nvel do pecolo da nervura mediana. Os laticferos, caractersticos das Apocynaceae, so do tipo no-articulado ramificado, acompanhando ou no os feixes vasculares. Em ambas as epidermes da lmina foliar ocorrem estruturas que se caracterizam pela disposio radial das clulas epidrmicas, que podem apresentar um certo grau de suberificao. Tais funes so semelhantes s verrugas suberificadas (corkwarts) referidas para a famlia. So observadas ainda colteres na face adaxial da regio prxima do peciolo, que secretam uma substncia mucilaginosa nos primeiros estdios de desenvolvimento da folha. The work here presented consists in a study of the leaf anatomy of Himatanthus lancifolius (Muell. Arg.) Woodson. This species has the vascular system in a bicolateral arrangement and small islands of phloem can be observed in the region that corresponds to the pith of the petiole and the midrib. The laticifers, one of the characteristics of the Apocynaceae, are non-articulated, branched and may accompany the veins or run freely in the mesophyll. In both the epiderms occur structures which are characterized by radial arrangement of the epidermal cells. These cells may show a certain degree of suberification. These structures are similar to corkwarts that are mentioned for the family. Colleters occur at the petiole towards its adaxial side. They secrete a mucilaginous substance during its earliest stages of development.
23495926|Neste trabalho os autores apresentam os dados obtidos nas observaes realizadas sobre a ecologia da polinizao e biologia da reproduo de Miconia stenostachya DC., referentes aos espcimes cultivados no Parque do Jardim Botnico do Rio de Janeiro. Acredita-se que nessa espcie o sistema de reproduo efetivo seja a apomixia por agamospermia, e que a ocorrncia de reproduo alogmica seja uma possibilidade muito remota. Suas flores possuem atributos melitfilos, tendo anteras com 90 a 95% de gros de plen estreis e recebendo poucas visitas das abelhas em busca do alimento, quando ocorre, ento, a polinizao do tipo vibrtil e ordenha, esternotribo, pelas abelhas Trigona (Trigona) trinidadensis (Pruv.) e Melipona fasciata scutellaris (Lat.). No ocorre diviso de trabalho nas anteras de diferentes tamanhos, e a mudana de cor das peas florais no se d por polinizao ou por fecundao e, provavelmente, est relacionada com a fisiologia da planta. In this paper the authors present some data about the pollination, ecology and reproduction biology of Miconia stenostachya DC. from plants cultivated in Jardim Botnico do Rio de Janeiro. It's believed that in this species the efective reproduction system is the apomixy by agamospermy, and that the occurrence of alogamy is a remote possibility. Their flowers possess mellitophilic characters and anthers with 90-95% of sterile pollen, receiving few visits by bees to collect pollen as food. When pollination occurs it is sternotribic and of the "vibratile" or "milking" type to extract pollen from the poricidal anthers by bee Trigona (Trigona) trinidadensis Pruv. and Melipona fasciata scutellaris Lat. In the two types of the anthers there is no separation of function in pollination and the change of colour of the floral parts is not related to pollination or fecundation, but possibly to the physiology of the plant.
23495924|Continuando o estudo sobre a famlia Bignoniaceae, o autor encontrou uma espcie nova do gnero Tabebuia Gomes ex DC., coletada no Estado do Esprito Santo, a qual denominou de Tabebuia ovatifolia devido s folhas ovais que a espcie possui. The author describes a new brazilian species of Tabebuia Gomes ex DC. (Bignoniaceae): T. ovatifolia It. Vattimo, colected in the brazilian state of Esprito Santo.
23493366| feita a discusso taxonmica do gnero Barjonia Decne., constitudo quase exclusivamente de espcies brasileiras, distribudas principalmente nas Regies Centro-Oeste, Sudeste e Sul, ocorrendo em cerrados, campos e mais raramente em florestas de galeria. Barjonia erecta (Vell.) Schum., espcie de maior distribuio geogrfica, vai da Linha Equatorial aos Trpicos e  aqui citada pela primeira vez para o Suriname. O tratamento dado ao gnero assinala 5 espcies com diagnoses, ilustraes, estudo do tipo de nervao das folhas, epidermes, germinao de uma espcie e distribuio geogrfica. Elaborou-se uma chave dicotmica para a identificao das espcies, classificou-se Barjonia glazioui Marq. e foram sinonimizados 5 binmios para Barjonia erecta (Vell.) Schum., espcie que tem originado muitas dvidas nomenclaturais. Ilustraes e mensuraes das diferentes fases da germinao de Barjonia erecta (Vell.) Schum., foram aqui fornecidos com objetivo nico de anexar dados aos caracteres morfolgicos da semente. A ocorrncia de uma nervura marginal no permitiu que fosse definido o padro de nervao foliar, por no se enquadrar nos tipos mencionados pelos diferentes autores consultados. Foi verificada a ocorrncia de traqueides de reserva nas espcies Barjonia grazielae Font. et Marq. e Barjonia glazioui Marquete. Na face interna dos ptalos, observou-se um indumento constitudo de plos unicelulares e pluricelulares unisseriados, carter taxonmico para algumas espcies. Em Barjonia laxa Malme e Barjonia erecta (Vell.) Schum. foram assinaladas alm das emergncias glandulares peculiares s espcies da famlia e ocorrentes na face interna das folhas, junto  insero do pecolo e internamente na axila dos spalos, outras situadas respectivamente nos ns do caule e na raque da inflorescncia. Quanto  vascularizao dos spalos e dos ptalos,  constituda por 3 nervuras, uma mediana e 2 laterais, variando apenas quanto s suas ramificaes. It is a taxonomic discussion of the genus Barjonia Decne. made almost exclusively of Brazilian species, distributed mostly in Center-West, Southeast and South, ocurring in "cerrados", camps and much rarely in gallery forests. Barjonia erecta (Vell.) Schum., a specie of most geographic distribution, goes from the Equatorial Line to the Tropics and is here mentioned for the first time to the Suriname. The tratment given to the genus marks out 5 species with diagnosis, ilustrations, study about the kind of foliar nervation, epydermis, germination of a specie and the geographic distribution. It has been elaborated a dichotomic key for the identification of the species, it was classified Barjonia glazioui Marq. and there were synonymized 5 binoms to Barjonia erecta (Vell.) Schum., that is a specie which has originated many nomenclature doubts. The illustrations and mensurations of the different germination phasis of Barjonia erecta (Vell.) Schum., were furnished here as the only object to attach things to the morphologic characters of the seed. The occurrence of a marginal nervure didn't allow the definition of the standard of foliar nervation, because it don't place in the tipes mentioned by the diferents consulted authors. Were verified the occurence of "storage tracheids" of the species Barjonia grazielae Font. et Marq. and Barjonia glazioui Marquete. In the internal face of the petals, it was observed an indument constituted of unicellular and pluricellulars unisseriated hairs, that is a taxonomic character for some species. In Barjonia laxa Malme and Barjonia erecta (Vell.) Schum., there were marked out beyond the glandulars emergencies peculiars to the species of the family and occurring in the internal face of the leaves, near the inserction of peciolus and internally in the axial of the sepals, others situated in the nodes of the trunk and in the raquis of the inflorescence, respectively. Concerning the vascularization of the sepals and the petals, it is constituted of 3 nerves, one median and two laterals changing only regarding the ramifications.
23493368|A autora trata da discusso taxonmica do gnero Bauhinia sect Tylotaea Vogel (Leguminosae-Caesalpinoideae) exclusiva da faixa neotropical, cujas espcies ocorrem sob a forma de lianas, principalmente na regio da Amaznia, com forte endemismo, nos brejos do Nordeste, nas matas do Sudeste e do Sul, e nas florestas ciliares da regio CentroOeste. A maioria das espcies  conhecida pelos nomes vulgares de Cip-escada de jaboti, ou cip-escada de macaco ou simplesmente cip-escada. Foram descritas e discutidas 23 espcies com suas respectivas distribuies geogrficas, acompanhada da fotografia dos tipos. As espcies estudadas enquadram-se naturalmente no gnero Bauhinia L. s.1., como pertencentes a seo Tylotaea, independentes das espcies da seo Schnella (Raddi) Bentham 1870. Os caracteres que se revelaram de importncia sistemtica foram a morfologia do boto floral, clice, ptalas, brctea, bractolas e em menor grau a da folha.  apresentada uma chave dicotmica para identificao das espcies assinaladas. The author presents a taxonomic study of the genus Bauhinia sect. Tylotaea, especific of the neotropical area, which species are lianas or scandent shrubs, occuring mainly on the Amazonic region, with a strong endemism, in the brejo of the Northeastern region, in the forest of the Southeastern and South, or in gallery forest of the Centerwestern region. The majority of the species is known by the vulgar names of cip-escada de jaboti, cip-escada de macaco or simply cip-escada. Twenty three species were redescribed and discussed along with their respective geographic distributions and illustrated by the pictures of the types. A dicotomic key is presented for the identification of the mencioned species. The characters that showed a sistematic importance were the morphology of the floral bud, the calyx, the petals, the bracteas, and in a lower degree the leaf. The species studied are prfectly inserted in the genus Bauhinia, as belonging to the sect. Tylotaea, independent of the species of the sect. Schnella.

23493202|Nesse trabalho os autores apresentam um catlogo de nomes cientficos e vulgares indicando suas localizaes regionais e a famlia de cada espcie. In this work the authors present a catalogue of scientific and common names indicating its regional localization and the family of each species.
23493200|Neste trabalho  feita a reviso das cinco espcies do gnero Genlisea Lentibulariaceae, que ocorrem nas regies sudeste e sul do Brasil. As espcies a encontradas, esto distribudas em duas sees: Genlisea  caracterizada pela deiscncia circuncisa do fruto e Tayloria  caracterizada pela deiscncia longitudinal do fruto. A seo Genlisea compreende, nas regies sudeste e sul do Brasil, as seguintes espcies: G. aurea, G. filiformis, G. pygmaea e G. repens que se diferenciam pelos seguintes caracteres: forma e tamanho do clcar, pilosidade, porte da planta e tamanho da corola. A seo Tayloria, est representada nessas regies, apenas, por uma espcie. G. violacea. Os caracteres mais expressivos para diferenciar as duas sees, alm da deiscncia do fruto, so: colorao das flores, forma do lbio superior da corola, posio do pedicelo no fruto, clcar, sementes e pilosidade. O estudo organogrfico ressalta a morfologia da face interna da folha utriculfera, morfologia das folhas verdadeiras, brcteas do escapo e as da base do pedicelo, bractolas, clice, corola e poro interna do clcar, observados em viso frontal. Alm da organografia, so apresentados o histrico do gnero, observaes palinolgicas, polinizao, habitat, distribuio geogrfica acompanhada de mapas elucidativos, tratamento taxinmico, relao dos exemplares estudados, fenologia, discusso e concluses, ndice dos coletores e das espcies e, finalmente, referncias bibliogrficas. Genlisea, described by saint-Hilaire(1833), is one of the two genera of Lentibulariaceae found in Brazil. In Genlisea the calyx is five-lobbed and the trap leaf is a straighten body attached by a pedicel to the rizome, with a middle bladder and an elongated neck tipped by two twisted arms. The other is Utricularia L. readily differentiated by its two-lobbed calyx and the urn-like bladders. The Brazilian species of Genlisea occurring in southern and southeastern Brazil are: G. violacea, G. aurea, G. filiformis, G. repens and G. pygmaea. The first one belongs to the section Tayloria, has prismatic seeds and fruits with a longitudinal deiscence; the other four have piramidal seeds, fruit with circuncise deiscence and belong to the section Genlisea. Those two groups of species can be readily recognized in the field, by the flower color which is violet in G. violacea and yellow in the remaining four species. The pollen has a similar morphology to all the studied species; it is isopolar, tri or tetracolporate, subprolate, tectate and medium-sized grain with a baculate endosexine and a rugose ektosexine. In equatorial view it is allways elliptic and in polar view it is circular but sometimes it can be a little triangular and angulaperturate as in G. pygmaea. In G. aurea, G. filiformis and G.repens occur the syncolpism already pointed out by Thanikaimoni (1966) and Huynh (1968) for Utricularia. Besides the palinology, taxonomy and some general remarks (as polination, geographical distribution, etc) of those five species, the organography of the aerial and subterraneous organs was also studied. Special attention is given to the indumentum and the different types of hairs that are used as a taxonomic character.

23493353|O gnero Mollinedia Ruiz et Pavon (Monimiaceae, Monimioideae) apresenta duas sees, a saber: Appendiculatae e Exappendiculatae, criadas e delimitadas por Perkins em 1900. O presente trabalho trata do estudo taxonmico desta ltima seo, que  exclusiva do Brasil, Peru e Colmbia, ocorrendo predominantemente em matas de altitude. O tratamento taxonmico aqui dado  seo configura-a como compreendendo 25 espcies que so redescritas e ilustradas com desenhos analticos de flores e frutos, rede de nervao, epidermes foliares, fotografias dos tipos e mapas das reas de ocorrncia. So propostos e comentados 6 novos sinnimos ao nvel de espcie: M. widgrenii A. DC (= M. chrysorrachis Perkins, M. warmingii Perkins);M. engleriana Perkins (= M. pachypoda Perkins); M. uleana Perkins (= M. yomalla Perkins); M. triflora (Sprengel) Tulasne (= M. chrysophyla Perkins) e M. oligantha Perkins (= M. riedeliana Tolmathew). The present work involved a taxonomic study of the latter section which geographical range is circunscribed to montanious forest areas of Brazil, Peru, Colombia and Bolivia. The secction is here considered to be represented by 25 species that were redescribed and illustrated through analytical drawings of flowers and fruits, leaf vein arragement and epidermis, photos of the types and maps of the distribution areas. Six new synonyms are proposed and commented: M. widgrenii A. DC (= M. chrysorrachis Perkins, M. warmingii Perkins); M. engleriana Perkins (= M. pachypoda Perkins); M. uleana Perkins (= M. yomalla Perkins); M. triflora (Sprengel) Tulasne (= M. chrysophylla Perkins) and M. oligantha Perkins (= M. riedeliana Tolmathew). New distribution points were indicated for M. argyrogyna Perkins, M. clavigera Tulasne e M. heteranthera Perkins. A analytical key for species identifications is also presented.

We have made the species description, explained by illustrations, and also the female flower diagnose, in Latin language, till now unknown. We have located a new area for Smilax spicata Vell, in which its ocurrence was not well defined yet. Fizemos a descrio da espcie com ilustraes, alm da diagnose em latim da flor feminina, at ento desconhecida. Assinalamos uma nova localidade para Smilax spicata Vell., cuja rea de ocorrncia no estava ainda bem definida.

23496771|A polinizao de Passiflora alata Dryander decorre da atividade de coleta de nctar ou plen por abelhas Anthophoridae e Apidae de grande porte durante todo o perodo de florao entre maro e setembro. O vo, possivelmente seguindo rotas de visitas, permite a polinizao cruzada, favorecida pela deflexo dos rgos reprodutivos. H flores que no apresentam deflexo dos estiletes e podem ser consideradas como funcionalmente masculinas, o que pode interferir na alocao total de recursos para a produo de sementes. The pollination of Passiflora alata Dryander is accomplished by Anthophoridae and Apidae large bees when collecting nectar or pollen during the flowering time from march to setember. Forage fligth behavior of trap-line bees possibly allowded cross-pollination what is enhanced by deflection of the reproductive organs. Styles of some flowers may not be deflected and could be considerd as functionally male ones, what may interfer in resource allocation to seedset.

23496777|O presente trabalho aborda a anatomia foliar de Stromanthe thalia (Vell.) J.M.A. Braga (Marantaceae) crescida em dois ambientes da Mata Atlntica do Estado do Rio de Janeiro. As caractersticas comuns aos indivduos de altitude e de baixada foram a presena de epiderme uniestratificada, com clulas de paredes anticlinais sinuosas; estmatos do tipo paractico; estrutura dorsiventral; pulvino com parnquima aqfero; aernquima na bainha, no pecolo e na lmina foliar; feixes vasculares do tipo colateral acompanhados por calotas de fibras. As variaes anatmicas foram observadas em diferentes regies da lmina foliar nos indivduos das duas populaes. Nos indivduos de baixada a nervura mediana, ao nvel do tero mdio, ocorreu um aumento no tecido de sustentao e no nmero de camadas da hipoderme adaxial prximo  nervura mediana e na extremidade do bordo observou-se um feixe de fibras. This work deals with the leaf anatomy of the Stromanthe thalia (Vell.) J.M.A. Braga (Marantaceae) from two different environments of the Atlantic Rain Forest, Rio de Janeiro. The common characteristics observed on the specimens from lowland forest and montane forest were single epidermal layer in both surfaces and sinuous anticlinal cell walls; paracytic stomata; dorsiventral leaf; pulvinus with water storage tissue; sheaths fibrous close to collateral vascular bundles; aerenchyma throughout the sheath, petiole and lamina. The structural variations observed were fibrous tissue increased at the margin and midrib region as well as the larger number and the size of the adaxial hypodermis layers near the midrib of lamina on the specimen from lowland forest.

O Brasil  um importante centro de endemismo do grupo, mas sua diversidade ainda  pouco conhecida e subestimada no pas. Brazil is an important center of endemism of the group, but its diversity is still poorly understood and underestimated in the country. Therefore, the flora of Convolvulaceae from the Usina So Jos, presented here, increases the knowledge about the diversity of the family in the Northeast Brazil. 23500745|O presente estudo visou realizar o inventrio das samambaias e licfitas da Reserva Ecolgica de Gurja (Pernambuco, Brasil) avaliando a riqueza, composio, distribuio geogrfica e raridade das espcies. Foi realizado a partir do exame das colees dos principais herbrios do Estado e levantamento florstico com trabalho de campo. A distribuio geogrfica das espcies no globo e em territrio brasileiro foi baseada em dados da literatura e foram consideradas como espcies raras aquelas com apenas um ou dois pontos de coleta na Floresta Atlntica Nordestina. Foram registradas duas espcies pertencentes ao grupo das licfitas e 75 espcies pertencentes ao grupo das samambaias, das quais 10% so raras, no contexto da Floresta Atlntica Nordestina. As familias mais representativas foram Pteridaceae (21 espcies), Thelypteridaceae (8 spp.) e Polypodiaceae (8 spp.). Os gneros com maior nmero de espcies foram Adiantum (14 spp.) e Thelypteris (7 spp.). A maioria das espcies  amplamente distribuda nos trpicos e tambm em territrio brasileiro. This paper aimed floristic survey the ferns and lycophytes from Reserva Ecolgica de Gurja (Pernambuco, Brazil) evaluating the richness, composition, geographical distribution, and rarity of the species. The study was realized from examination the collections of major herbaria in the State and floristic survey with field work. The geographical distribution of species on the globe and in Brazilian territory was based on literature and were considered rare species as those with one or two collection points in the Northeastern Atlantic Forest. The floristic survey identified two species of lycophytes and 75 species of ferns. Among ferns, 10% were considered rare in the context of the Northeastern Atlantic Forest. The most representative families were Pteridaceae (21 species) Thelypteridaceae (8 spp.) and Polypodiaceae (8 spp.). The richest genera were Adiantum (14 spp.) and Thelypteris (7 spp.). Most species are widely distributed in the tropics and also in Brazilian territory.
