Sw., A. rutifolia Mart., A. tomentosa (Savigny) Sw. and A. villosa Humb. & Bonpl. ex Willd., Lygodium venustum Sw., L. volubile Sw., Schizaea elegans (Vahl) Sw.
23501684|Floristic sampling was carried out in Serra do Japi Biological Reserve, Jundia, state of So Paulo, Brazil, including physiognomies of semideciduous montane forest, a type of forest formation within the Atlantic Forest domain. Six hundred and sixty one species distributed in 129 families were recorded; the ten most diverse phanerogam families were: Asteraceae (56 species), Fabaceae (37), Rubiaceae (29), Poaceae (25), Solanaceae (24), Cyperaceae (19), Euphorbiaceae (19), Orchidaceae (19), Melastomataceae (17), and Piperaceae (17). The addition of 322 species from other floristic surveys increased the number of species of Serra do Japi to 976, distributed in 141 families. Compared to other floristic surveys carried out in the Atlantic Forest, our results highlight the floristic diversity of the study area and the importance of preserving the vegetation of this highly urbanized region. Amostragem florstica foi feita em reas da Reserva Biolgica Municipal da Serra do Japi, Jundia, Estado de So Paulo, inclundo fisionomias de floresta semidecdua montana, classificada como parte das formaes da Mata Atlntica. Foram encontradas 661 espcies em 129 famlias, as dez fanerogmicas mais diversas foram: Asteraceae (56 espcies), Fabaceae (37), Rubiaceae (29), Poaceae (25), Solanaceae (24), Cyperaceae (19), Euphorbiaceae (19), Orchidaceae (19), Melastomataceae (17), e Piperaceae (17). O acrscimo de 322 espcies adicionais compiladas de listagens florsticas suplementares eleva, para a Serra do Japi em geral, o nmero registrado a 976 espcies em 141 famlias. Comparada a outros levantamentos florsticos na Mata Atlntica, esses resultados demonstram a diversidade florstica da rea estudada e ressaltam o valor da preservao da vegetao nessa regio altamente urbanizada.
23501682|Androtrichum apresenta uma nica espcie, A. trigynum (Spr.) Pfeiffer, ocorrendo em regies litorneas da costa sudoeste atlntica. Apresenta o sistema subterrneo constitudo por rizomas e razes adventcias. O rizoma  espessado, plagiotrpico e simpodial, do qual partem os escapos florais e as razes. A partir do promeristema caulinar diferenciam-se a protoderme, o procmbio e o meristema fundamental. Na regio apical observam-se os meristemas intercalar e de espessamento primrio (MEP). As razes adventcias se originam do MEP e apresentam o pice radicular do tipo fechado. A epiderme jovem apresenta clulas papilosas. Observa-se tambm a endoderme meristemtica em atividade. Na maturidade, identifica-se o crtex externo ou hipoderme e crtex interno diferenciado em aernquima. A endoderme tem clulas alongadas no sentido radial com paredes finas e o periciclo  bisseriado. As caractersticas anatmicas observadas no presente estudo condizem com outras espcies de Cyperaceae, e caracteres xeromorfos podem ser identificados. Androtrichum has only one species, A. trigynum (Spr.) Pfeiffer, occurring in coastal regions of the southwestern Atlantic coast. It presents an underground system consisting of rhizomes and adventitious roots. The rhizome is thickened, plagiotropic, sympodial, and floral scapes and roots arise from it. From the stem promeristem, the protoderm, procambium and ground meristem are differentiated. At the apex region, the intercalary meristem and primary thickening meristem (PTM) are observed. The adventitious roots originate from the PTM, and present root apex with closed organization. The young epidermis has papillose cells, and meristematic endoderm activity is observed. In a mature root, the outer cortex, or hypodermis, and the internal cortex can be identified. The endoderm presents radially elongated cells with thin walls and the pericycle is biseriate. The anatomical features observed in the present study are found in other species of Cyperaceae and some xeromorphic characters can be identified.
23501690|The anatomical characteristics of both sun and shade leaves of Alseis pickelii were investigated in order to evaluate the consequences of selective logging (in seasonally dry Atlantic Forest) on the leaf structure of this species. Fully expanded sun and shade leaves were collected in two distinct stands of tabuleiro forest; a stand of recently logged forest and an unlogged stand. Only leaves from the unlogged stand revealed significantly different magnitudes of response to light regimes, producing leaves with structural characteristics associated with different levels of irradiance. The sun leaves from this stand had a thicker adaxial surface, mesophyll, palisade and spongy parenchyma, a secondary cell wall of fibers and a lower leaf area compared with the shade leaves. However, in the logged stand, the leaf cuticles of sun and shade leaves showed no significant differences, although the leaf area of the sun leaves was higher than the shade leaves. According to these data, we concluded that the unlogged stand produced typical "sun" and "shade" leaves. In contrast, leaves from the logged stand showed a lower variation of types, where neither typical "sun" nor typical "shade" leaves were produced, suggesting lower leaf plasticity of this late successional tree in this area. As caractersticas anatmicas de folhas de sol e sombra de Alseis pickelii foram investigadas a fim de se avaliar as consequncias do corte seletivo de madeira sobre a estrutura foliar em uma floresta atlntica estacional semidecidual. Folhas expandidas de sol e de sombra foram coletadas em dois distintos setores da mata, setor explorado (rea com recente atividade de corte seletivo), e setor preservado. Somente folhas do setor preservado revelaram significantes diferenas de resposta aos regimes de luz, produzindo folhas com caractersticas estruturais nitidamente associadas com diferentes nveis de irradiao. Folhas de sol deste setor apresentaram maiores espessuras da superfcie adaxial, mesofilo, parnquima palidico e lacunoso, parede secundria das fibras e menor rea foliar comparada s folhas de sombra. Entretanto, no setor explorado, as cutculas das folhas de sol e sombra no apresentaram diferenas significativas e as reas foliares das folhas de sol foram maiores que a das folhas de sombra. De acordo com estes resultados, conclui-se que o setor preservado produziu rvores com tpicas folhas de sol e sombra. Em contraste, no setor explorado as rvores apresentaram menor variao nos tipos de folhas, onde nem tpicas folhas de sol ou de sombra foram produzidas, sugerindo menor plasticidade desta espcie secundria tardia nesta rea.
23501677|The Espinhao Mountain Range in Minas Gerais state in southeastern Brazil is a center of endemism of the Bromeliaceae, mainly in campo rupestre montane vegetation that grows under rigorous edaphoclimatic conditions. This study sought to improve our knowledge of the Bromeliaceae from Serra da Piedade in the extreme southern portion of the Espinhao Mountain Range where ironstone outcrops predominate. Conservation status and spatial distribution of these plants were analyzed as well as floristic similarities with other regions with rocky outcrops. Twenty-five bromeliad species were found in Serra da Piedade, with the subfamily Tillandsioideae being the best represented. Twenty-seven percent of the species were exclusive to campo rupestre environments, while 73% occurred both on outcrops and in forest habitats. The bromeliads in the study area merit special attention as two species are considered vulnerable (Racinaea aerisincola and Vriesea minarum), five are endangered, and three are critically endangered. Low Jaccard index values indicated dissimilarities between the bromeliad floras in different localities of quartzite and ironstone outcrops within the Espinhao Mountain Range. Serra da Piedade has a distinct bromeliad flora that is threatened by mining activities and illegal harvesting and requires immediate measures to help guarantee conservation. A Cadeia do Espinhao em Minas Gerais, sudeste do Brasil,  reconhecida como centro de endemismo de Bromeliaceae, principalmente nos campos rupestres, onde as condies edafo-climticas so severas. O objetivo deste estudo foi estender o conhecimento sobre as Bromeliaceae da Serra da Piedade localizada no extremo sul da Cadeia do Espinhao onde predomina a ocorrncia de afloramentos ferruginosos. O estado de conservao e a distribuio espacial foram analisados, bem como, a similaridade florstica de bromlias entre diferentes localidades com afloramentos rochosos. Na Serra da Piedade foram encontradas 25 espcies, sendo a subfamlia Tillandsioideae a mais representativa. Dentre as espcies, 27% so exclusivas de campos rupestres e 73% ocorreram tanto nos afloramentos rochosos quanto nos habitats florestais. As espcies de bromlias na rea de estudo necessitam de muita ateno, pois duas espcies esto vulnerveis (Racinaea aerisincola e Vriesea minarum), cinco espcies em perigo e trs espcies em perigo crtico de extino. Os baixos valores do ndice de Jaccard apontaram uma dissimilaridade entre a flora de bromlias de diferentes localidades com afloramentos quartzticos e ferruginosos da Cadeia do Espinhao. A Serra da Piedade apresenta uma flora de bromlias exclusiva, a qual est ameaada pela minerao e extrativismo, sendo necessria uma ao imediata para sua conservao.
23501694|O principal objetivo deste trabalho foi descrever as mudanas na estrutura de comunidades de algas perifticas durante o processo de colonizao e sucesso, em perodo chuvoso, indicando suas espcies descritoras. O local selecionado para a realizao deste estudo foi o rio do Corvo (2239'S, 5246'W), um afluente do rio Paranapanema localizado prximo  barragem do reservatrio de Rosana, na regio noroeste do Paran, Brasil. Coletas do perifton em substrato artificial e medies de dados abiticos foram realizadas no perodo de 21 de novembro a 12 de dezembro de 2003, em intervalos de trs dias. A identificao e quantificao das algas foi feita em microscpio invertido, utilizando-se o mtodo de Utermhl. Para anlise da dinmica sucessional, foram considerados: riqueza de espcies, densidade total, abundncia relativa dos txons, espcies descritoras, diversidade de Shannon-Wiener e equitabilidade. As flutuaes observadas na densidade total foram determinadas principalmente por Bacillariophyceae, Chlorophyceae, Cyanophyceae e Zygnemaphyceae. Maiores valores de abundncia na comunidade de algas perifticas foram registrados para espcies pequenas de diatomceas, abundantes durante todo o perodo, consideradas colonizadores eficientes e de crescimento rpido, assim como para cianobactrias e algas verdes filamentosas (Oedogonium spp. e Stigeoclonium spp.), de crescimento mais lento e mais abundantes nos estdios tardios. As primeiras esto entre as r-estrategistas, enquanto as ltimas esto entre as C-S estrategistas (algas mais competitivas em sistemas mesotrficos e estveis). A diversidade de Shannon-Wiener foi elevada (2,2 a 3,1), com o maior valor constatado na terceira semana de desenvolvimento sucessional. Com base em anlise de componentes principais, as concentraes de nutrientes, o pH e a turbidez foram os principais fatores abiticos relacionados ao processo de sucesso. This paper aimed to describe the successional changes in the structure of periphytic algal assemblages in a lotic environment, during the rainy period, indicating the descriptor species. The study site was Corvo stream (2239'S, 5246'W), a tributary of the Paranapanema river, located near the Rosana Reservoir, in the northwestern Paran state, Brazil. Periphyton samples on artificial substrate and abiotic data were obtained from 21 November to 12 December 2003, at three-days intervals. Algae were identified and quantified using inverted microscope at 400X, according to Utermhl. The analysis of the succession dynamics considered the following parameters: species richness, total density, relative abundance of taxa, descriptor species, Shannon-Wiener diversity and evennes. Fluctuations in total density were determined mainly by Bacillariophyceae, Chlorophyceae, Cyanophyceae, and Zygnemaphyceae. Higher values of abundance of the periphytic algae were recorded for small species of diatoms, known as efficient colonizers, which were abundant throughout the study period and showed rapid growth, as well as for Cyanobacteria and filamentous green algae (Oedogonium spp. and Stigeoclonium spp.), which were more abundant in the latter successional stages and showed slower growth. The first ones are among the r-strategists, while the latter are among the C-S strategists (more competitive algae in mesotrophic and stable systems). Shannon-Wiener diversity was high (2.2 to 3.1), with the highest value in the third week of study. According to the principal components analysis, nutrients concentrations, pH and turbidity were the most important abiotic factors for explaining the community structure changes throughout the succession.
23501687|Myrtaceae  uma das famlias mais ricas em espcies nas restingas brasileiras. O objetivo desse trabalho foi levantar a riqueza e realizar o tratamento taxonmico das espcies de Myrtaceae presentes em remanescentes de restinga situados na divisa entre os Estados da Paraba e Rio Grande do Norte, no limite norte de distribuio da Mata Atlntica. Foram registradas 23 espcies, sendo a subtribo Eugeniinae a mais diversa, com 11 espcies, seguida de Myrciinae com 8 e Myrtinae com 4.  apresentada uma chave para identificao das espcies, bem como descries, ilustraes e dados relativos  fenologia e distribuio geogrfica. Myrtaceae are one of the richest families in the Brazilian restinga vegetation (open savannas or low forests over sand near the coast). The purpose of this study was to evaluate the species richness and present a taxonomic treatment of all Myrtaceae species occurring in restinga remnants near the border of Paraba and Rio Grande do Norte at the northern limit of the Atlantic coastal forest. We identified 23 species of Myrtaceae, 11 in subtribe Eugeniinae, 8 in Myrciinae, and 4 in Myrtinae. A key to species, descriptions, illustrations, as well as phenological and geographic distribution data are provided.
23501678|We aimed to describe population structure and dynamics of Cariniana estrellensis (Raddi) Kuntze to test the hypothesis that this species survives in the forest by forming a seedling bank. We evaluated seed germination, spatial distribution, and recruitment, growth and mortality rates of young individuals. To characterize population structure a 1.2-ha plot was defined, where reproductive adults were mapped; also 100 6 m2 sub-plots were established to characterize structure and monitor dynamics of young individuals. We estimated seed production using seed collectors and determined the percentage of canopy cover by hemispherical photographs. Seed rain and saplings showed clustered distribution indicating habitat-patch formation. Sapling mortality occurred mainly during the initial establishment phase. Size structure was characterized by many saplings (X = 9,763 individuals ha1) and few adults (X = 5 individuals ha1), associated with a high rate of seed production (X = 60,800 seeds ha1), low growth rates (X = 2.37 cm ano1) and mortality (15.66%) of established saplings, showing that species invest in seedling bank formation as a reproductive strategy. Este trabalho objetivou caracterizar a estrutura e a dinmica de uma populao de Cariniana estrellensis (Raddi) Kuntze, procurando testar a hiptese que a espcie persiste na floresta por meio do banco de plntulas. Foram avaliadas a germinao de sementes, distribuio espacial, e recrutamento, crescimento e mortalidade das plantas jovens. Para caracterizar a estrutura populacional uma parcela de 1,2 ha foi definida, onde foram mapeados os indivduos adultos, e distribudas 100 sub-parcelas de 6 m2 para caracterizar a estrutura e monitorar dinmica dos indivduos jovens. As sementes foram amostradas atravs de coletores para estimar sua produo e a porcentagem de cobertura do dossel por fotografias hemisfricas. A chuva de sementes e os juvenis apresentaram distribuio agregada, mostrando a existncia de manchas de habitas. A mortalidade dos jovens ocorreu principalmente no estgio inicial de estabelecimento. A estrutura de tamanhos, caracterizada pela ocorrncia de grande nmero de indivduos jovens (X = 9.763 indivduos ha1) e pequeno nmero de adultos (X = 5 indivduos ha1), associada  alta taxa de produo de sementes (X = 60.800 sementes ha1) e a baixas taxas de crescimento (X = 2,37 cm ano1) e mortalidade dos indivduos jovens estabelecidos (15,66%), demostram que a espcie investe na formao de banco de plntulas como estratgia reprodutiva.
23501681|Os gneros Aciotis D.Don, Acisanthera P. Browne, Marcetia DC., Microlepis (DC.) Miq., Pterolepis (DC.) Miq., Siphanthera Pohl ex DC., alm de Tibouchina Aubl., so os representantes da tribo Melastomeae no estado do Paran.  exceo do ltimo, cada um apresenta apenas uma espcie no estado, respectivamente: Aciotis paludosa (Mart. ex DC.) Triana, Acisanthera variabilis (DC.) Triana, Marcetia taxifolia (A.St.-Hil.) DC., Microlepis oleifolia (DC.) Triana, Pterolepis glomerata (Rottb.) Miq. e Siphanthera cordata Pohl ex DC. Os registros de Microlepis e Siphanthera so os primeiros para estes gneros no Paran e regio Sul. Neste trabalho foi elaborado um tratamento taxonmico para as espcies de Melastomeae no Estado, exceto para Tibouchina. So fornecidas chave de identificao, descries dos gneros e espcies, comentrios taxonmicos, ilustraes, informaes sobre distribuio geogrfica e listagens de materiais examinados. The genera Aciotis D.Don, Acisanthera P. Browne, Marcetia DC., Microlepis (DC.) Miq., Pterolepis (DC.) Miq., Siphanthera Pohl ex DC., and Tibouchina Aubl. represent the tribe Melastomeae in the state of Paran. Except for Tibouchina, each has only one species occurring in the state, respectively: Aciotis paludosa (Mart. ex DC.) Triana, Acisanthera variabilis (DC.) Triana, Marcetia taxifolia (A.St.-Hil.) DC., Microlepis oleifolia (DC.) Triana, Pterolepis glomerata (Rottb.) Miq. and Siphanthera cordata Pohl ex DC. Microlepis and Siphanthera are cited for the first time in Paran and in southern Brazil. In this article we present a taxonomic treatment for the species of tribe Melastomeae in the state, except for those of Tibouchina, with an illustrated identification key, descriptions, information on distribution and taxonomy, and collectors' lists.
23501696|This paper presents new nomenclatural combinations in Brazilian Lycopodiaceae, necessary for an upcoming conspectus of the family: there are 39 new combinations in the genus Phlegmariurus, and one in Pseudolycopodiella. Two taxa, formerly treated as varieties of Lycopodiella alopecuroides, are raised to status of species. So apresentadas novas combinaes nomenclaturais em Lycopodiaceae do Brasil, necessrias para publicao de um conspecto da famlia: 39 combinaos no gnero Phlegmariurus e uma em Pseudolycopodiella. Dois taxa, antes tratados como variedades de Lycopodiella alopecuroides, so elevados ao status de espcies.
23501695|A viagem de Martius e Spix pelo territrio brasileiro no sculo XIX gerou diversas obras, entre elas uma publicada em latim por Martius sobre plantas medicinais aqui ento utilizadas. No trabalho datado de 1843, Martius lista mais de 800 espcies, ordenando-as em um sistema de classes de substncias. Esta importante fonte de informaes sobre plantas medicinais e para estudos em etnobotnica histrica foi traduzida para o portugus por Henrique Velloso d'Oliveira em 1854, com o intuito de torn-la mais acessvel aos leitores em geral. A traduo apresenta graves inconsistncias com o comprometimento da citao das espcies, incluindo criao de nomes botnicos a partir de comentrios taxonmicos do autor original, omisses e adies de usos, propriedades, preparos, indicaes, comparaes, interpretaes, alm de outras questes botnicas. Alguns erros de traduo sugerem o desconhecimento de questes taxonmicas e morfolgicas, contribuindo ainda mais para a descaracterizao do original. A traduo altera o original a tal ponto que deve ser desconsiderada para fins de estudos sobre as plantas medicinais no Brasil. O texto original no entanto continua sendo uma rica fonte de informaes sobre este tema. Martius and Spix's trip through Brazil during the 19th century gave rise to many works, including a Latin manuscript by the famous botanist on the medicinal plants used in Brazil. In 1843, Martius published a list of over 800 species, classifying them according to the type of substance they contained. This important source of information on medicinal plants and historical ethnobotany was translated into Portuguese by Henrique Velloso d'Oliveira in 1854, aiming to make it more readily available to all readers. The translated version contains serious translation errors that cast doubt on species citations including the creation of new botanical names based on the original author's taxonomic comments, omission and addition of new usages, properties, modes of preparation, indications, comparisons, interpretation, and other botanical issues. Several translation errors indicate a misunderstanding of taxonomic and morphological questions, further contributing to distortion of the original text. The translation alters the original text to such an extent that it should be disregarded in studies on medicinal plants in Brazil. The original work, however, remains a rich source of information on this topic.
23501697|Little knowledge has been gathered on ferns and lycophytes occurring in the semi-arid region of Brazil known as the Caatinga, perhaps due to the widespread idea that a semi-arid climate would be incompatible with environmental demands of ferns and lycophytes (high humidity and shade). Ferns and lycophytes are represented in the semi-arid region of Brazil by at least 41 species, 20 genera and 11 families, distributed in the northeastern states (except Maranho) and Minas Gerais. In this region, most of the species were recorded in moist, shaded microhabitats: cracks in rocks, ravines in shaded areas, springs, temporary lakes or areas with temporarily flooded soil. Although the majority of species recorded are widely distributed throughout Brazil, the high representation of aquatic species and low representation of epiphytes demonstrate the unique identity of the fern and lycophyte flora of the semi-arid region. Pouco se sabe sobre as samambaias e licfitas ocorrentes na Caatinga do Brasil, talvez devido  idia comumente difundida de que o clima semirido seja incompatvel com as exigncias ambientais destas plantas, geralmente associadas a alta umidade e sombreamento. As samambaias e licfitas esto representadas na regio semirida do Brasil por pelo menos 41 espcies, 20 gneros e 11 famlias, distribudas nos estados do Nordeste (exceto Maranho) e Minas Gerais. Na regio semirida do Brasil, a grande maioria das espcies de samambaias e licfitas ocorrem de fato em microhabitats midos e sombreados: fendas de rochas, barrancos em reas sombreadas, nascentes, lagoas temporrias ou reas com solos temporariamente alagados. Apesar da maioria das espcies registradas serem amplamente distribudas no Brasil, a alta representatividade de espcies aquticas e o baixo nmero de epfitas evidenciam um perfil da flora de samambaias e licfitas do semirido.
23501686|A Marambaia localiza-se no sul do Estado do Rio de Janeiro, entre a Baa de Sepetiba e o Oceano Atlntico, nos domnios da Mata Atlntica. Os representantes da tribo Olyreae constituem os bambus herbceos e so encontrados, principalmente, nos trpicos do Novo Mundo, geralmente compondo o estrato herbceo de matas, estando por isso ameaados pela degradao ou fragmentao de habitats. O presente estudo objetivou levantar as espcies de Poaceae pertencentes  tribo Olyreae que ocorrem na rea de estudo e contribuir para o conhecimento da sua diversidade, distribuio e conservao. As coletas foram realizadas de agosto de 2008 a dezembro de 2010, atravs de caminhadas livres ao longo de trilhas nas diversas formaes vegetais. Foi verificada a ocorrncia de sete espcies da tribo Olyreae, distribudas, principalmente, nas reas de floresta atlntica de encosta. A subtribo Olyrineae est representada por Cryptochloa capillata, Olyra humilis, O. latifolia, Parodiolyra micrantha, Raddia brasiliensis e Reitzia smithii, e a subtribo Parianinae, por Eremitis sp. Olyra latifolia e P. micranta so as espcies mais comuns na rea. Eremitis sp. provavelmente se constitui em uma nova espcie. Marambaia is located in southern Rio de Janeiro state, between Sepetiba Bay and the Atlantic Ocean (231'S, 236'S; 4334'W, 44W), within the Atlantic Forest domain. The tribe Olyreae includes the herbaceous bamboos, found mainly in the New World Tropics, usually comprising the herbaceous layer of forests. They are being threatened by habitat fragmentation and degradation. This study aims to determine which Olyreae species occur in the area, contributing to our knowledge of their conservation, distribution and diversity. Samples were collected from August 2008 to December 2010 by free walks along trails in the various plant formations. The occurrence of seven Olyreae species distributed in Atlantic slope-forest areas was confirmed. Subtribe Olyrinae is represented by Cryptochloa capillata, Olyra humilis, O. latifolia, Parodiolyra micrantha, Raddia brasiliensis and Reitzia smithii, and subtribe Parianinae by Eremitis sp. Olyra latifolia and P. micrantha are the most common species in the area. Eremitis sp. is probably a new species.
23501683|O cultivo in vitro de bromlias tem sido considerado uma tcnica eficiente para aperfeioar a sua produo. Contudo, no existem relatos que comparem a eficincia dos mtodos de propagao in vitro e ex vitro da bromlia-imperial Alcantarea imperialis (Carrire) Harms utilizada no paisagismo e considerada ameaada de extino devido ao extrativismo ilegal. O cultivo in vitro surge como uma boa alternativa para se preservar a diversidade gentica dessa espcie polimrfica, assegurando a matria-prima para a evoluo contempornea ocorrer. O objetivo deste trabalho foi comparar o crescimento de plantas de A. imperialis, cultivadas in vitro e ex vitro, a partir de sementes, estabelecendo o perodo ideal de transferncia para aclimatao. As sementes foram submetidas  desinfestao superficial antes de serem transferidas para as condies de cultivo (meio de cultura ou substrato de casca de Pinus sp.). Aps perodos pr-estabelecidos, plntulas cultivadas in vitro foram transferidas para condies ex vitro (aclimatao). As plntulas provenientes do cultivo in vitro apresentaram maiores valores para todos os parmetros analisados em relao quelas cultivadas ex vitro. Os dados demonstraram que a aclimatao de plntulas mantidas in vitro por 2, 4 e 6 meses apresentaram maior crescimento, em comparao quelas aclimatadas aps terem sido cultivadas por mais tempo in vitro. Os resultados deste trabalho mostram a eficincia do mtodo de cultivo in vitro, indicando o tempo ideal para a permanncia das plntulas nos meios nutritivos, estabelecendo importante relao custo-beneficio para sua produo. The in vitro cultivation of bromeliads has been considered an effective technique to improve its production. However, there are no studies that compare the efficiency of the methods of in vitro propagation versus ex vitro for the Brazilian giant bromeliad Alcantarea imperialis (Carrire) Harms used in landscaping and considered to be endangered due to illegal extraction. The in vitro culture appears as a good alternative to preserve the genetic diversity of this polymorphic species, assuring that the raw material for the contemporary evolution will be available. The aim of this study was to compare the growth of plants of A. imperialis in vitro and ex vitro obtained from seed, establishing the ideal transfer period. The seeds were disinfected before being transferred to culture conditions (culture medium or Pinus sp. bark substrate). After the pre-established growing time, in vitro plants were transferred to ex vitro (acclimatization). Plants from in vitro cultures showed higher values for all measured parameters compared to those grown ex vitro. The data showed that the acclimation of plants cultivated in vitro for 2, 4, and 6 months showed better growth compared to those acclimated after being cultured in vitro for longer time. These results show the efficiency of the in vitro culture method, indicating the ideal time for the maintenance of the plants in nutrient media, providing important cost-benefit ratio for production.
23501665|Realizou-se o levantamento da diversidade de fungos zoospricos em duas reas de Cerrado, com estados de preservao distintos, na Reserva Biolgica de Mogi Guau, estado de So Paulo. Quatro coletas trimestrais de gua e solo foram realizadas em seis pontos por rea, durante as estaes chuvosa (janeiro e outubro de 2008) e seca (abril e julho de 2008). Utilizando a tcnica de iscagem mltipla com substratos celulsicos, quitinosos e queratinosos, especfica para o isolamento de fungos aerbicos saprbios e parasitas, foram obtidos 434 espcimes representados por 38 espcies dos filos Blastocladiomycota, Chytridiomycota e Oomycota, dentre as quais, 31 so primeiras citaes para a Reserva. Os resultados encontrados ampliam o conhecimento da ocorrncia destes organismos em reas de Cerrado no estado de So Paulo e no Brasil, complementando estudos realizados anteriormente na Reserva. Two areas of Cerrado ("A" and "B") at different preservation stages were selected at the "Reserva Biolgica de Mogi Guau", So Paulo state, to survey zoosporic fungi diversity. Water and soil samples were collected during the rainy (January and October 2008) and dry seasons (April and July 2008), every three months, at six sampling sites in areas "A" and "B". 434 specimens were obtained using the multiple baiting technique with cellulosic, chitinous and keratinous substrates, which are specific for the isolation of aerobic, parasitic or saprobial fungi. 38 species were identified, belonging to Blastocladiomycota, Chytridiomycota and Oomycota. Of these, 31 species are cited for the reserve for the first time. The results increased our knowledge of the occurrence of the organisms from Cerrado in So Paulo state and Brazil, complementing previous studies in the Reserve.

Schum., M. verticillata Wernham. Of these, M. congestoides is recorded for the first time for the southern region of Brazil.

A amostragem foi realizada entre junho e novembro de 2004 em 11 estaes, sendo as amostras fitoplanctnicas coletadas atravs de rede de plncton de malha de 25 m. Foram identificados 16 txons infragenricos, sendo dois do gnero Stenopterobia e 14 de Surirella. Surirella splendida (Ehrenberg) Ktzing foi registrada em todas as estaes. Meister, Surirella nervosa (A. Schmidt) Mayer, Surirella rorata Frenguelli e Surirella splendida (Ehrenberg) Ktzing foram citaes pioneiras para a regio Centro-Oeste do Brasil. So fornecidos descrio, ilustraes e comentrios para todos os txons. Lago dos Tigres System is composed of lotic habitats (gua Limpa and Vermelho rivers) and lentic habitats (Lago dos Tigres). It has great importance for tourism and agriculture in Britania, Gois state. Considering the lack of studies on diatoms from central western Brazil, this work aimed to identify taxa of Stenopterobia Brbisson and Surirella Turpin, Surirellaceae family, occurring in the plankton of Lago dos Tigres System during the low water period. Sampling was done from June to November 2004 at 11 stations, using a 25-m plankton net. Stenopterobia delicatissima (Lewis) Brbisson and Stenopterobia pelagica Hustedt, Surirella biseriata var. constricta (Grunow) Hustedt, Surirella davidsonii Schmidt, Surirella didyma Ktzing, Surirella linearis var. helvetica (Brun.) Meister, Surirella nervosa (A. Schmidt) Mayer, Surirella rorata Frenguelli and Surirella splendida (Ehrenberg) Ktzing were registered for the first time in central western Brazil. A description, illustration and comments are given for each taxon.

23501666|Myrtaceae  reconhecidamente uma famlia de grande importncia no bioma Cerrado. Dentre os gneros da famlia, Myrcia desponta como um dos mais representativos e com centros de distribuio geogrfica nos estados de Minas Gerais e Gois. O presente estudo revela a ocorrncia de 33 espcies de Myrcia nos campos rupestres e fisionomias florestais associadas de Minas Gerais. O presente tratamento para o gnero no estado apresenta chave de identificao, descries, dados de distribuio geogrfica e comentrios sobre as espcies. Myrtaceae is admittedly a family of great importance in the Cerrado biome. Myrcia is one of the most representative genera of the family, with the main distribution centers in the states of Minas Gerais and Gois. The current study reveals the occurrence of 33 Myrcia species in the "campos rupestres" and associated forest formations of Minas Gerais. 23501663|Foram realizados levantamentos florsticos para conhecer as espcies arbreas, arborescentes e arbustivas no Municpio de Pelotas, Rio Grande do Sul. As coletas foram feitas por meio de caminhamentos em 21 fragmentos em diferentes estados de conservao. A vegetao estudada pertence a duas fitofisionomias: matriz de paisagem florestal distribuda sobre a Encosta do Escudo Sul-Riograndense e matriz campestre na Plancie Costeira. A riqueza encontrada foi de 148 espcies distribudas em 101 gneros e 48 famlias. Myrtaceae, com 24 espcies, foi a famlia de maior riqueza, mostrando gneros representativos em espcies: Eugenia (7), Myrcia (4), Myrcianthes e Myrceugenia (3), Outros gneros apresentaram quatro espcies cada, que foram Schinus (Anacardiaceae), Baccharis (Asteraceae) e Myrsine (Myrsinaceae). Ocorreu baixa contribuio de rvores da famlia Fabaceae com apenas duas espcies, sendo gnero Inga ausente em matas ciliares. Constatou-se a ocorrncia de espcies de distribuio geogrfica tipicamente tropical como: Geonoma schottiana Mart (Arecaceae), Alchornea triplinervia (Spreng.) Mll. Arg (Euphorbiaceae) e Schefflera morototoni (Aubl.) Maguire, Steyerm. & Frodin (Araliaceae) e txons de carter temperado como Azara uruguayensis (Speg.) Sleumer (Salicaceae) e Quillaja brasiliensis Mart. (Quillajaceae). Isso demonstra uma rea biogeogrfica de ectono entre a Mata Atlntica stricto sensu e o Bioma Pampa. Desde modo a biodiversidade  considerada elevada em virtude das latitudes e das baixas temperaturas no perodo de inverno, sendo necessrios estudos para desenvolver meios adequados para sua conservao, restaurao e manejo florestal. The floristic composition of forest fragments was surveyed including tree, arborescent and shrub species in forest fragments in the municipality of Pelotas, Rio Grande do Sul state, southernmost Brazil. Data was collected by the 'walking' method in 21 forest fragments with different conservation status. The vegetation studied was characterized by two phytophysiognomies: a forest landscape matrix (Sul-Riograndense Slopes) and a grassland (Coastal Plain). A total of 148 species distributed in 101 genera and 48 families were found. Myrtaceae, with 24 species was the richest family, with genera representative in number of species: Eugenia (7), Myrcia (3), Myrcianthes (3), and Myrceugenia (3). Other genera had four species each: Schinus (Anacardiaceae), Baccharis (Asteraceae) and Myrsine (Myrsinaceae). Fabaceae with only two species contributed little to tree richness, with the Inga genus absent in riverine areas. There were species with typically tropical geographic distribution range such as Genoma schottiana Mart (Arecaceae), Alchornea triplinervia (Spreng.) Mll. Arg (Euphorbiaceae) and Schefflera morototoni (Aubl.) Maguire, Steyerm. & Frodin (Araliaceae), and taxa with temperate affinity such as Azara uruguayensis (Speg.) Sleumer (Salicaceae) and Quillaja brasiliensis Mart (Quillajaceae). This shows a biogeographic ecotone area between Mata Atlantica stricto sensu and Pampa Biome. But biodiversity is considered to be high because of latitude and low temperatures during winter. Further studies are necessary to develop appropriate strategies of conservation, restoration and management of trees and forest resources.
23501668|Baccharis compreende ca. 340 espcies distribudas nas Amricas. O indumento em tufos diminutos, formado por tricomas com uma nica clula basal, e as flores funcionalmente unissexuais so caracteres diagnsticos do gnero. No estado do Rio de Janeiro ocorrem 55 espcies de Baccharis. O trabalho apresenta os resultados de estudos taxonmicos de Baccharis subgen. Molina (Pers.) Heering para a flora fluminense. No estado, o subgnero est representado por 18 espcies pertencentes a quatro sees  Caulopterae (8 spp.), Molinae (4 spp.), Baccharidastrum (3 spp.) e Trinervatae (3 spp.).  apresentada uma chave para a identificao das sees e espcies e descries morfolgicas, ilustraes, dados de distribuio geogrfica e ecologia. Trs espcies so novos registros e cinco so excludas da lista de espcies do Rio de Janeiro. Baccharis comprises c. 340 species occurring in the Americas. The tufted indumentum, with trichomes having a single adjoining basal cell, and florets functionally unisexual are diagnostic characters of the genus. The Rio de Janeiro state flora contains 55 species of this genus. This work presents the results of taxonomic studies of Baccharis subgen. Molina (Pers.) Heering in Rio de Janeiro state. The subgenus is represented by 18 species belonging to four sections  Caulopterae (8 spp.), Molinae (4 spp.), Baccharidastrum (3 spp.), and Trinervatae (3 spp.). A key for the identification of sections and species, plus morphological descriptions, illustrations, and comments on geographic distribution and ecology are provided. Three species are new records and five are excluded from the state checklist of species.
23501669|Lauraceae  constituda por 52 gneros e ca. 2500-3500 espcies distribudas amplamente nas regies tropicais e subtropicais do planeta. No Brasil  representada por 23 gneros e aproximadamente 420 espcies. A Floresta Atlntica  considerada como um dos centros de diversidade para a famlia e esse estudo tem como objetivo o tratamento taxonmico das laurceas realizado em fragmentos de Floresta Atlntica no estado de Pernambuco. Neste estudo so apresentadas 10 espcies em quatro gneros: Cassytha filiformis, Cinnamomum triplinerve, Nectandra cuspidata, Ocotea canaliculata, O. indecora, O. glauca, O. glomerata, O. longifolia, O. notata e O. puberula, esta ltima como primeira referncia para o Estado de Pernambuco. So apresentados chave de identificao, descries e comentrios sobre as espcies, alm de ilustraes dos caracteres diagnsticos. Lauraceae has 52 genera and about 2500-3500 species and is widely distributed in tropical and subtropical regions of the planet. In Brazil, it is represented by 23 genera and approximately 420 species. The Atlantic Forest is considered to be one of the centers of diversity for this family. This study aims to treat the Lauraceae taxonomically from fragments of Atlantic forest in Pernambuco state. This study presents 10 species in four genera: Cassytha filiformis, Cinnamomum triplinerve, Nectandra cuspidata, Ocotea canaliculata, O. indecora, O. glauca, O. glomerata, O. longifolia, O. notata, and O. puberula, the latter being a new record for Pernambuco. An identification key, descriptions and comments on the species, and illustrations of diagnostic characters are presented.
23501672|A modelagem preditiva tem sido aplicada para analisar a distribuio geogrfica de espcies, a partir de extrapolaes das caractersticas ambientais dos locais conhecidos de ocorrncia. O interesse por esse tipo de modelagem deve-se  necessidade de respostas rpidas e fundamentadas para as ameaas que as espcies tm enfrentado, devido  perda de habitat, invaso de espcies exticas, mudanas climticas, entre outros. Este artigo oferece uma viso geral dos avanos recentes no campo da modelagem e visa incentivar a discusso e aplicao desse mtodo, que pode auxiliar tanto na aquisio de conhecimento bsico sobre a biologia das espcies, quanto na anlise e formulao de polticas para sua conservao. Predictive modelling has been used to analyze species geographic distribution through extrapolation of environmental characteristics of known occurrence areas. Interest in this kind of modelling is derived from the need for rapid and well-grounded answers to the threats faced by species due to habitat loss, exotic species invasion, climate changes, and others. This article provides an overall view of recent advances in modelling and aims to encourage the discussion and application of this method that can help with basic biological knowledge acquisition as well as with public policies aimed at their conservation.
23501657|En el marco de un estudio de regeneracin post-incendio de la vegetacin autctona en campos de sierra ubicados en proximidades de Falda del Carmen (Sierras Chicas, Crdoba, Argentina), se ha analizado el banco de semillas areo para facilitar la identificacin de las especies presentes en las muestras de suelo. Entre las familias con mayor diversidad y abundancia en la zona evaluada, las Malvaceae se encuentran representadas por 14 especies pertenecientes a los gneros: Abutilon Mill., Gaya Kunth., Krapovickasia Fryxell, Malvastrum A. Gray, Pavonia Cav., Pseudabutilon R. E. Fr., Sida L. y Sphaeralcea A. St.-Hil.. Se presentan dos claves dicotmicas para diferenciar las especies utilizando caracteres morfolgicos de las disporas, mericarpos y semillas respectivamente, acompaadas por las descripciones y las ilustraciones de las estructuras consideradas. Se tienen en cuenta aspectos morfolgicos de los mericarpos (forma, tamao, superficie de las caras dorsal y laterales, dehiscencia, aristas, pubescencia, divisiones internas, nmero de semillas por mericarpo) y de las semillas (forma, tamao, superficie, pubescencia, hilo). As part of a study of post-fire regeneration of native vegetation in montane areas near Falda del Carmen (Sierras Chicas, Crdoba, Argentina), we analyzed the aerial seed bank to help identify the species present in soil samples. Among families with greater diversity and abundance in the study area, the Malvaceae are represented by 14 species belonging to the genera: Abutilon, Gaya, Krapovickasia, Malvastrum, Pavonia, Pseudabutilon, Sida and Sphaeralcea. Two dichotomous keys are presented to differentiate the species using the morphological characters of diaspores, mericarps and seeds, respectively, accompanied by descriptions and illustrations of the structures examined. These keys take into account mericarp morphology (shape, size, dorsal and lateral surface, dehiscence, cusps, pubescence, internal divisions, number of seeds per mericarp) and seed morphology (size, shape, surface, pubescence, hilum).
23501671|Este estudo descreve um novo sistema para manipulao e gerenciamento eletrnico de colees botnicas. O software descrito foi desenvolvido com objetivo de auxiliar herbrios brasileiros no resgate e manuteno segura de registros de espcies de plantas provenientes de diversos ecossistemas nacionais, fornecendo uma ferramenta confivel, com interface amigvel, fcil de utilizar e dotado de funcionalidades para cadastro, consultas, atualizaes, estatsticas, relatrios, gerao de etiquetas, geoprocessamento e banco de imagens. This study describes a new system for handling and eletronic managing of botanical collections. The software described here was developed in order to give support to herbaria in the task of protecting records of plants species from various national ecosystems, by providing a safe tool, with a friendly interface, easy to use and equipped with features for registration, consultation, updates, statistics, reports, label management, geoprocessing and image database.
23501660|The anatomy of the pericarp of the macaw palm (Acrocomia aculeata) was followed during development. Ovaries of flowers collected at anthesis of the bracts as well as pericarps were evaluated at different development phases using traditional plant anatomy techniques. The ovary wall has two meristematic regions, one adjacent to the external epidermis and the other surrounding the seminal cavity. The external meristematic region gives rise to the woody exocarp, and the internal meristematic region is responsible for thickening of the oily/fibrous mesocarp as well as the hard endocarp. Sclerification of the exocarp and endocarp occurs approximately 70 days after anthesis and defines the final fruit volume. Lignification of the exocarp cell layers is incomplete, lending porosity to the structure. Numerous canals develop in the mesocarp that are formed by the fusion of raphide-containing idioblasts. Lignification of the sclereids and their generally random arrangement confers impermeability and rigidity to the endocarp. In mature fruits, lipidic reserves are observed in parenchymatic cells of the mesocarp, and the germination pore in the endocarp is composed of parenchymatic cells. O objetivo deste trabalho foi caracterizar anatomicamente o pericarpo da macaba (Acrocomia aculeata) durante seu desenvolvimento. Foram avaliados ovrios de flores coletadas no dia da antese da brctea e pericarpos em diferentes fases de desenvolvimento, por meio de tcnicas usuais em anatomia vegetal. A parede ovariana apresenta duas regies meristemticas, uma adjacente  epiderme externa e outra que envolve a cavidade seminal. A regio meristemtica externa origina o exocarpo lenhoso. A regio meristemtica interna  responsvel pelo espessamento do mesocarpo oleaginoso-fibroso e do endocarpo ptreo. A esclerificao do exocarpo e do endocarpo, que ocorre prximo dos 70 dias da antese, define o volume final do fruto. A lignificao das clulas do exocarpo  incompleta, conferindo porosidade  estrutura. No mesocarpo se desenvolvem numerosos canais, formados pela fuso de idioblastos contendo rfides. No endocarpo, a lignificao e a orientao das escleredes em vrias direes, conferem impermeabilidade e rigidez. Nos frutos maduros, a reserva lipdica se localiza em clulas parenquimticas do mesocarpo e observa-se a presena de poro germinativo no endocarpo, composto por clulas parenquimticas.
23501664|Uma espcie nova de Ocotea Aubl. (Lauraceae), Ocotea marumbiensis Brotto & Baitello,  descrita e ilustrada. A espcie, com flores hermafroditas, assemelha-se a Ocotea indecora (Schott) Mez e ocorre em floresta atlntica nos estados do Paran e Santa Catarina, Regio Sul do Brasil. A new species of Ocotea Aubl. (Lauraceae), Ocotea marumbiensis Brotto & Baitello, is described and illustrated. The species with hermaphrodite flowers resembles Ocotea indecora (Schott) Mez and occurs in the Atlantic Forest in the states of Parana and Santa Catarina, southern Brazil.
23501658|A phytosociological survey was carried out in a study area located at Serra do Sudeste, southern Brazil, where forests and grasslands are distributed in a mosaic, seeking to unravel diversity patterns in four different grassland communities. Grassland management traditionally adopted by the local population is characterized by burning practices that aim to eliminate woody species, delaying the forest expansion process that is favored by the extant climate. The number of plots distributed per community was as follows: rocky grasslands (17), dry grasslands (33), moist grasslands (15) and marshy grasslands (5). Different numbers of plots were used due to the natural conditions of these communities, with highest cover for dry grasslands, followed by rocky, moist and marshy grasslands. Data analyses consisted of calculating community indexes and parameters and exploratory multivariate analysis. We verified that c. 15% of species among the 177 registered taxa were highly dominant in the constitution of the vegetation matrix in all communities, whereas most of the species showed low frequency and cover values. Rocky and dry grasslands showed higher similarity and diversity indexes than moist and marshy grasslands. We concluded that the large number of rare or intermediate-frequency species is decisive for the high diversity found in these grasslands. Um levantamento fitossociolgico foi realizado em uma rea de vegetao campestre localizada na Serra do Sudeste, sul do Brasil, onde campos e florestas esto distribudos em mosaico, buscando compreender padres de diversidade em quatro comunidades. O manejo destes campos realizado pela populao local  caracterizado por prticas de queimadas peridicas visando eliminar espcies lenhosas, retardando assim o processo de expanso florestal favorecido pelo clima atual. O nmero de parcelas por comunidade foi: campo rupestre (17), campo seco (33), campo mido (15), campo brejoso (5). Diferentes totais de parcelas foram utilizados devido s condies naturais dessas comunidades, com uma alta cobertura de reas de campo seco, seguido pelos campos rupestres, midos e brejosos. A anlise de dados consistiu no clculo de ndices e parmetros fitossociolgicos e anlises multivariadas exploratrias. Verificou-se que aproximadamente 15% dos 177 txons registrados apresentaram maior dominncia na composio da vegetao nas quatro comunidades, enquanto a maioria das espcies apresentou baixos valores de frequncia e cobertura. Maiores ndices de similaridade e diversidade foram encontrados entre campos secos e rupestres do que entre campos midos e brejosos. Conclui-se que o grande nmero de espcies raras e de frequncia intermediria  determinante para os elevados ndices de diversidade encontrados nestes campos.
23501670|A Serra Negra est inserida no complexo da Serra da Mantiqueira, na regio sul da Zona da Mata de Minas Gerais. A vegetao da regio  formada por um mosaico de campos rupestres e remanescentes de Floresta Ombrfila Alto-montana, Floresta Ombrfila Baixo-montana e Floresta Ombrfila Aluvial, entre altitudes de 900 a 1698m. A famlia Gesneriaceae est representada na rea por 4 gneros e 9 espcies: Anetanthus gracilis, Nematanthus crassifolius, N. lanceolatus, N. strigillosus, Sinningia cooperi, S. sceptrum, S. tuberosa, Vanhouttea brueggeri e V. hilariana. So apresentadas chave de identificao, descries, ilustraes, distribuio geogrfica e comentrios taxonmicos das espcies. Serra Negra is part of the Serra da Mantiqueira mountain range, in the southern part of the "Zona da Mata" in Minas Gerais. Vegetation is composed of a mosaic of "campos rupestres" and remnants of Tropical Upland Rainforest, Tropical Lowland Rainforest and Alluvial Rainforest at altitudes varying from 900 to 1680 m. The family Gesneriaceae is represented in the area by 4 genera and 9 species: Anetanthus gracilis, Nematanthus crassifolius, N. lanceolatus, N.strigillosus, Sinningia cooperi, S. sceptrum, S. tuberosa, Vanhouttea brueggeri and V. hilariana. An identification key for species, descriptions, illustrations, geographic distribution and taxonomic comments are provided.
23501662|Foram realizados estudos na regio entremars de recifes da Praia de Boa Viagem, Recife, nordeste do Brasil, em dezembro de 2009 (perodo seco) e abril de 2010 (perodo chuvoso), para analisar a estrutura da comunidade das macroalgas epfitas em outras macroalgas. Lane, Cladophora laetevirens (Dillwyn) Ktz., Neosiphonia sphaerocarpa (Brgesen) M.-S. Kim & I.K. Lee, Ulva linza L. e U. prolifera O.F. Mll. Destas, quatro tiveram sua distribuio consideravelmente ampliada ao longo do litoral brasileiro. Studies were carried out in the intertidal reefs of Boa Viagem beach, Recife, northeastern Brazil, in December 2009 (dry season) and April 2010 (rainy season), to analyze the community structure of seaweeds growing on other macroalgae. The material was collected in two areas, each around 30 m long, in different habitats which are suitable for the growth of seaweeds. The seaweeds remained frozen until the analysis. The specimens are deposited at the Herbarium of the Instituto de Botnica, So Paulo, Brazil (SP). Nine species were recorded for the Pernambuco coast for the first time: Boodlea composita (Harv.) F. Brand, Ceramium corniculatum Mont., Chaetomorpha clavata Ktz., C. nodosa Ktz., Chondracanthus cf. saundersii C. W. Schneid. & C.E. Of these, four species had their distribution along the Brazilian coast considerably expanded.
23501673|Cololejeunea panamensis G. Dauphin & Pcs, descrita em 2006 foi referida como endmica para a ilha de Barro Colorado no Panam, Amrica Central. Durante um estudo sobre a brioflora da ilha do Maraj, uma espcie de Cololejeunea mostrou-se diferente das espcies j registradas no Brasil, provando ser uma nova ocorrncia para a Amrica do Sul. O objetivo desse trabalho  divulgar a ocorrncia dessa espcie em territrio brasileiro e ampliar o conhecimento sobre sua distribuio geogrfica, morfologia e ecologia. O material estudado foi coletado na ilha do Maraj, municpio de Soure, estado do Par, Brasil, no perodo de 10 a 16 de Janeiro de 2007. As amostras coletadas esto depositadas no Herbrio do Museu Paraense Emlio Goeldi (MG). Foram coletadas um total de nove amostras contendo Cololejeunea panamensis, sendo esse o segundo registro j feito da espcie alm do material tipo e o primeiro registro para a Amrica do Sul. A espcie  descrita taxonomicamente, ilustrada e so feitos comentrios sobre a distribuio geogrfica, variao morfolgica e habitat. Cololejeunea panamensis G. Dauphin & Pcs was described in 2006 and cited as endemic to Barro Colorado Island in Panama, Central America. During a study on the bryophytes of Maraj Island, one of the Cololejeunea collected showed differences from the species recorded in Brazil, proving to be a new record for South America. The aim of this study is to report the occurrence of this species in Brazil and discuss its geographic distribution, morphology and ecology. The material studied was collected on Maraj Island, municipality of Soure, Para state, Brazil, from 10 to 16 January 2007. The collections are deposited in the herbarium of Museu Paraense Emlio Goeldi (MG). We sampled nine collections containing Cololejeunea panamensis. This is the second record for C. panamensis after the type collection and the first record in South America. The species is described taxonomically, illustrated and comments on geographic distribution, morphology and habitat are presented.
23501656|Os parques urbanos tm uma importncia estratgica para a qualidade de vida dos centros urbanos, contribuindo com importantes servios ambientais e sociais. O conhecimento da estrutura florestal tem ajudado a subsidiar a conservao destes parques. A partir da anlise fitossociolgica das espcies arbreas de um fragmento de Floresta Estacional Semidecidual (120 ha), este estudo classificou o estado de conservao deste remanescente. Foram amostrados todos os individuos arbreos com CAP  15 cm, presentes em 25 parcelas permanentes (20 x 20 m) e as espcies foram classificadas por grupos sucessionais e sndrome de disperso. Foram registrados 798 indivduos distribudos em 98 espcies, pertencentes a 37 famlas. As espcies secundrias iniciais apresentaram maiores valores na riqueza de espcies, densidade e valor de importncia, seguido das espcies secundrias tardias que apresentaram maior dominncia e das espcies pioneiras que tiveram pouca representatividade. Quanto  sindrome de disperso, mais de 77% da comunidade  representada por indivduos zoocricos. Tais resultados aumentam a valorao do Parque da Matinha reafirmando a importncia deste parque urbano na conservao da fauna e flora nativa, e reforam a necessidade de criar politicas pblicas para utilizao do parque pelos visitantes. Urban parks have a strategic importance fot the quality of life in urban centers, contributing to significant environmental and social services. Knowledge of forest structure has helped to subsidize the maintenance of these parks. Based on the phytosociological analysis of tree species in a semideciduous forest fragment (120 ha), this study assessed the conservation status of this remnant. We sampled all trees with CBH  15 cm, present in 25 permanent plots (20 x 20 m), and classified the species as to successional groups and dispersal syndromes. We recorded 798 individuals in 98 species belonging to 37 families. Early secondary species had the highest values of species richness, density and importance value, followed by late secondary species with the highest dominance, and pioneer species with low representation. Regarding the dispersal syndrome, over 77% of the community is represented by species with zoochoric dispersal. These results increase the valuation of the "Parque da Matinha", reaffirming the importance of this urban park for the conservation of native fauna and flora, and supporting the need for public policies of park use by visitors.

23493167|As variaes encontradas nas sementes examinadas, permitiram que a autora criasse 12 tipos de sementes, alm dos 5 anteriormente criados por THIERET, vizando uma futura aplicao dessas caractersticas em uma chave que permita a determinao dos gneros encontrados no Brasil. 23493165|O presente trabalho  uma reviso de todas as espcies tidas como Raputia. O tipo das inflorescncias, o nmero de estames e de estamindios, a presena e o comprimento dos apendculos da antera e a natureza dos frutos possibilitam um reagrupamento das espcies. A heterogeneidade dos carcteres morfolgicos encontrados permite uma nova conceituao do gnero Raputia e a descrio de trs novos gneros, derivados, Neoraputia, Raputiarana e Sigmatanthus. Duas espcies novas e uma variedade so descritas. Dados histricos, morfolgicos e ecolgicos so apresentados. Mapas indicam a distribuio geogrfica das diferentes espcies. This paper presents a taxonomic revision off all species of the genus Raputia. The nature of the inflorescences and fruits, the number of stames and staminodia, the presence and length of the appendages of anthers made a new reorganization possible. The heterogeneity of the morfological characters permits a new concept of the genus Raputia and the descripition of three new derivated genus: Neoraputia, Raputiarana and Sigmatanthus. Two new species and one variety are described. Historical, morfological and ecological consideration are given. Mapps of geographical distribuition are included. Die Art der Bluetenstaende, der Fruechte, die Zahl der Staubblaetter und Staminadien, das Vorhandensein und die Laenge der Anhaengseln der Antheren ermoeglichen eine neue Reagrupierung der Arten. Die Verschidenheit der morphologischen karacteren erlauben eine neue Definition der Gattung Raputia und die Beschreibung drei neuer, abgeleiteter Gattungen: Neoraputia, Raputiarana und Sigmatanthus. Zwei neue Arten und eine Varietaet werden beschrieben. Historische, morphologische und oekologische Daten, sowie die geographische Verbreitung der Gattungen werden angefuehrt.
23493168|Neste trabalho os autores apresentam algumas consideraes sobre os caracteres delimitadores das variedades e forma de Ludwigia leptocarpa (Nutt.) Hara. Esta espcie ocorre no Brasil desde o Norte at o Sul em habitats diversos. As polulaes por ns selecionadas para aplicao dos testes experimentais, foram da Restinga de Jacarepagu (nvel do mar) e Serra dos rgos (cerca de 1000m de altitude). As duas populaes foram transplantadas para os canteiros experimentais do Horto Botnico do Museu Nacional sob as mesmas condies ambientais. Osfentipos se mantiveram conforme as caractersticas apresentadas quando nos seus ambientes naturais. O nmero de cromossomas das duas populaes  n=16. Quanto  polinizao verificamos que L. leptocarpa (Nutt.) Hara  autogmica, autocompatvel e cruzada. Os frutos obtidos por autogamia possuem hipanto com menor tamanho. Os obtidos por cruzamento so mais desenvolvidos. O pedicelo varia de 3 a 8mm de comprimento. Maior ou menor desenvolvimento do fruto deve-se  falta de fertilizao dos vulos situados na parte inferior do ovrio que lhes d um aspecto de pedicelo. Para comprovar as diferenas do desenvolvimento dos frutos recorremos a estatstica. The characteristics of the varieties of Ludwigia leptocarpa (Nutt.) Hara are discussed by the authors. This species occurs from the North to the South of Brazil, in totally different habitat. Populations from the Restinga de Jacarepagu (sea level) and from Serra dos rgos (about 1000m altitude) were selected in order to apply the experimental tests. Both populations were transplanted to the experimental gardens at the Museu Nacional (RJ) and mantained under the same experimental environment. The two phenotypes retained their original characteristics. The number of chromosomes is n=16 for both populations. Ludwigia leptocarpa (Nutt.) Hara is autogamic, autocompatible and crossed. Fruits obtained through autogamic present a smaller capsule than those obtained by crossing. Pedicel range from 3 to 8mm in lenght. The no fertilization of the ovules situated in the lower regions of the ovary leads to a lower development of the fruits, and gives to them the aspect of a pedicel. Statistical methods were applied to compare the differences in development of the fruits.

23493245|Neste trabalho apresentamos informaes sobre a Ecologia da Floresta Pluvial Tropical. Esse estudo  preliminar, devendo mais tarde ser acompanhado de adies, pois no foi possvel organizar simultneamente dados para os campos especficos de taxionmia, ecologia, fitogeografia e conservao da natureza. 23493240|A nova capital do Brasil  Braslia , com dezoito anos de fundao e funcionamento, prev a criao de um Jardim Botnico. Neste trabalho so feitas referncias aos objetivos recreativos e culturais que tal Instituio deve preencher, bem assim  enfatizado o carter cientfico que deve ser fundamental na sua dinmica de trabalho.  lembrado tipo de administrao que melhor atenda aos seus objetivos com mnimo de burocracia e mximo de independncia. The creation of a Botanical Garden for the new Capital of Brazil  Braslia  now in its eighteenth year of existence is foreseen. Reference is made to the recreational and cultural purposes of said institution and special emphasis is given to its scientific aspects, which shall be of primary importance among its objetives. The type of administration that suits the fulfillment of its objetives with a minimum of bureaucracy and a maximum of indepence is also presented.
23493246|O presente estudo trata do levantamento da ocorrncia de frutos do tipo smara, em diversas famlias de plantas dicotiledneas. Consideram-se, apenas, aqueles que apresentam ala paranuclear. So estudadas smaras de 7 famlias, num total de 19 gneros. Faz-se descrio de cada tipo, tanto das smaras propriamente ditas, como das suas sementes. Por meio de chaves dicotmicas, procura-se distinguir os diversos gneros, levando-se em considerao a posio e a nervao da ala, presena de apndices e de estpite, persistncia do clice, forma do ncleo seminfero, presena de albume, estrutura do embrio etc. Tenta-se dar uma descrio da origem da ala e levantar uma hiptese a respeito das caractersticas primitivas e avanadas, analisadas. This study is a survey of the occurrence of samaras with a paranuclear wing in various families of dicotyledons plants. Samaras of 19 genera belonging to seven families are studied. A description of each type is given, both of the samaras themselves and their seeds as well. An attempt is made to provide a key to the genera based on such characteristics as the position and venation of the wing, presence of appendices and stipe, persistence of the calyx, form of the seed-bearing nucleus, presence fo endosperm, and structure of the embryo. An attempt is made to give a description of the origin of the wing and hypothesize primitive and advanced characteristics.
23493244|In this paper new localities of occurrence of 43 Lauraceae are given and some important specimens for the study of this family are cited. The plant materal studied belong to the following Herbaria: F, GD, IAN, M, MG, NY, RB (the major part) and Museu Florestal Octavio Vecchi from So Paulo, Brasil.
23493241|The authors describe, after a brief revision of the literature, the range of Dalbergia decipularis Rizz. & Matt., the tree which furnishes the fabled wood known as sebastio-de-arruda. They showed that such range is divided into two subareas which are really well disjunct: 1. Bahia subarea; Minas Gerais subarea; these are sketched in the map included in this paper (Fig. 3). Formely the species was known to occur in Bahia. Now, it has been found in Minas Gerais in a variety of stations along the river Jequitinhonha; in these localities it inhabits a sort of dry semideciduous forest which are notorious for a great number of lianas. Finally, the writers give some information on the destruction of the local vegetation; both the caatinga and the forest stretches have been heavily swept away. But sebastio-de-arruda enjoys the ability to regenerate in the open to a certain extent and can survive as isolated trees in some places not too much disturberd.
23493247|A ocorrncia de folhas bipenadas em um grupo de famlias das Dicotyledonaea assume importncia sistemtica. Excludas das Leguminosae, onde a sua freqncia e diversificao  de molde a constituir um estudo  parte, foram estudadas as folhas bipenadas de espcies compreendidas em oito (8) famlias e onze (11) gneros, a saber: Araliceae (Coudenbergia), Bignoniaceae (Jacaranda e Memora), Leeaceae (Leea), Meliaceae (Melia), Moringaceae (Moringa), Rutaceae (Dictyoloma), Sapindaceae (Dilodendron, Koelreuteria e Paullinia) e Vitaceae (Cissus). Foram elaboradas chaves analticas, baseadas nesses tipos foliares, para determinao dos gneros. Tambm so apresentadas descries desses rgos, no s no que toca ao aspecto morfolgico externo, como tambm ao seu padro de nervao e  sua epiderme, em vista frontal. Como uma contribuio ao estudo foliar, acrescentou-se, no final das descries, a distribuio geogrfica das espcies dos gneros estudados, baseada em informao da literatura consultada e nas etiquetas do material manuseado. Sempre que possvel, foram feitas ilustraes das folhas e dos detalhes observados. The occurrence of bipinnate leaves in a group of families of the Dicotyledoneae assumes systematic importante. Having excluded the Leguminosae, where frequency and distribution of this leaf form are such as to constitute a separate examination, this study was limited to the bipinnate leaves of species included in eight (8) familie and eleven (11) genera, as follows; Araliaceae (Coudenbergia), Bignoniaceae (Jacaranda and Memora), Leeaceae (Leea), Meliaceae (Melia), Moringaceae (Moringa), Rutaceae (Dictyoloma), Sapindaceae (Dilodendron, Koelreuteria and Paullinia) e Vitaceae (Cissus). Based on the leaf types, analytical keys were constructed. Descriptions of these organs include venation pattern and a frontal view of the epidermis as well as external morphology. To complement the leaf study, geographic distribution of the species is inclused, based on information gathered from the literature and from labels of the herbarium material examined. Illustrations of leaf detail are included where possible.
23493243|No presente estudo foi observado pela autora o afloramento da cutina para o espessamento das camadas cuticulares em forma de vascularizaes e em forma reticular, bem como gotculas da pro-cutina atravessando a camada pecto-celulsica. In the present paper the Author observed the cutin outcrops to the thickning of the cuticular layers in vascularization and in reticular forms of the pro-cutin through the pect-cellulosic lamelar layer.
23493242|The authors describe in this paper both the organography and anatomy of the tree known as escorrega-macaco, namely Vochysia haenkeana Mart. It has as an especially distinct feature the trunk bark smooth, yellow, and covered by an dusty cork. No other species in this genus shows such kind of cortex which is compared with the common type in V. thyrsoidea Pohl. The main points on wood anatomy are as follows. VESSEL: Very few to numerous; solitary and multiple, of 23, sometimes crowded; from none to 9 (12) per square mm; with simple perforations; intervascular pitting of small size 47 micra, numerous, alternate, vestured, commonly coalescent; pits to ray and parenchyma cells alternate, opposite or irregular, medium-sized to very large, 720 (23) micra. VESSEL MEMBERS: From short to large, measuring 0,5001,375 mm, mostly 1,001,250 mm, with short appendages or without them. In tangential sections they seem to be very short, with perforations in the radial lateral walls. They show themselves in the tangential sections crooked, being similar to elbows, whence the name geniculate vessels (RIZZINI & MATTOS, 1965). WOOD PARENCHYMA: Very abundant, mostly paratracheal comprising both the aliform and the aliform-confluent types; more plentiful about the gum duct regions. RAY PARENCHYMA (RAYS): Ray tissue heterogeneous KRIB'S type III, somentimes possessing well differentiated apical cell. The rays are two sizes; uniseriate rays predominant and multiseriate rays 210 (12) cells in the maximum; 30148 micra and 210 cells wide, usually 80118 micra, 69 cells wide; height 0,1501,385 (1,485) mm, 375 cells in width, commonly 0,3950,790 mm, 1548 cells; frequently interrupted by fiber layers and somentimes by parenchyma stands with sclerotic cells. An special feature of this species in the ocurence of vessel element perforation inside the ray. This trait seems to have been observed for the first time here in any wood. WOOD FIBERS: Libriform, homogeneous and heterogeneous; very short to long, (0,9501,875 mm), usually (1,2501,625 mm); wall thin to thick. GROWTH RINGS: Indistinct. GUM DUCTS: Present in tangential lines (rings porous). RIPPLE MARKS: Absent.

Photographs illustrate each species cited by the author.
23493186|The species of Phoradendron known to occur in Venezuela amount up to now 74; they were arranjed in two kinds of keys and 70 were described in this paper, including synonymy as well as geographic ranges. A number of comments help distinguishing closely related species by adding diagnostic features of minor extent. Recently described ones are the following: P. agostinorum, P. atrorubens, P. crispulum, P. dunstervillorum, P. falconense, P. filispicum, P. glauco-lutescens, P. longiarticulatum, P. nodulifer, P. plerocymosum, P. pseudomucronatum, P. ramiaei, P. rotundifolium, P. spectabile, P. sulfuratum, and P. theloneuron. The following ones are new to Venezuela: P. densifrons, P. cerinocarpum, P. crenulatum, P. dimidiatum, P. jenmani, P. nothropiae, P. purpusi, and P. tetragonum. The bibliographic references have been referred to under the species names and occasionally amidst the comments regarding certain species. The most interesting ones were illustrated by means of photographs.

Pits Indistinctly to distinctly bordered pits, smaller apertures (about 36 micra), included within the outline of the border. Frequently longer (2,5003,250). Simple to indistinctly bordered pits, bigger apertures (about 610 micra), included within or extended beyond the outline of the border.

23493151|Neste trabalho apresentamos uma anlise taxonmica das espcies brasileiras do gnero Schwenckia Rooy. ex L. e sua distribuio geogrfica na Amrica do Sul, Central e frica. Descrevemos, ilustramos, estabelecemos o grau de afinidade e avaliamos a variao morfolgica para as 16 espcies. Acrescentamos 6 sinnimos novos, 1 variedade, 5 espcies duvidosas, alm da relao de espcies excludas do gnero. Evidenciamos com o estudo da morfologia externa da planta, dos gros de plen, da vascularizao das folhas e das peas florais, a importncia da estrutura na delimitao e discriminao das espcies, bem como a necessidade de futuras pesquisas antomo-ecolgicas. This paper deals with the taxonomy of the Brasilian species of Schwenckia Rooy. ex L. and their geographical distribution in Central America, South America, and Africa. There has been described and figured the 16 species that make up the genus; their affinities and morphological variations also were treated of. New to science are 6 synonyms and 1 variety, the doubtful species, total 5, beside those to be excluded from the genus. The investigation carried ou upon gross morphology of the plants, pollen grains, and leaf and flower vascularization, pointed out the importance of the structural factors both in the circumscription and distinction of the species. Finally, it is emphazised that further researches on ecological anatomy would be welcomed.
