23493146|The author describes a new species of Heliconia of Bahia, Brazil; this species has the habit cannoideus and has the cincinnus surpassing the leaves; it is related to H. psittacorum, but lacks the macula in the flowers.
23493145|As espcies do gnero Dorstenia L. mostram-se bastante conhecidas entre ns pelos nomes vulgares de caiapi, contra-erva e figueira-terrestre. Das obras clssicas a respeito desse gnero, as de Fischer & Meyer (1846), de Miquel (1853) e de Bureau (1873), destacam-se como as de maior valor. Os caracteres que se revelaram de importncia sistemtica foram a morfologia do caule e dos rgos subterrneos, as estpulas, o receptculo (cenanto) e alguns aspectos da folha. No Brasil e pases limtrofes ocorrem da Sect. Lecania Fisch. & Mey., 19 espcies; da Sect. Sychinia (Desv.) Fisch. & Mey., apenas 4; da Sect. Dorstenia, 7; e da Sect. Emygdioa Car., 11. H espcies que se destacam pela beleza ornamental e outras pelos rizomas aromticos. A maioria se concentra no Brasil-Sudeste,  beira dos riachos ou em grotes rochosos. Ocorrem muitos endemismos e os exemplos mais notveis acham-se nas sees Lecania e Sychinia. Das 41 espcies sul-americanas apenas 4 no foram encontradas at hoje no Brasil. O gnero Dorstenia, apesar de bem situado na famlia Moraceae, prximo a Ficus, apresenta caracteres que demonstram certas afinidades com gneros de Urticaceae. The species of the genus Dorstenia L. are known to us by the common names of "caiapi", "contra-erva" and "figueira-terrestre". Of the classical works on this genus, those of Fischer & Meyer (1846), Miquel (1853) and Bureau (1873) stand out as most valuable. Characters that reveal systematic importance are the morphology of the stem and underground organs, stipules, receptacle (coenanthium) and some features of the leaf. In Brazil and surrounding areas distribution of species into sections is as follows: Sect. Lecania Fisch. & Mey., 19 species; Sect. Sychinia (Desv.) Fisch. & Mey., only 4; Sect. Dorstenia 7; Sect. Emygdioa Car., 11. Sections Sychinia and Dorstenia contain species of great ornamental beauty whereas those of Sect. Emygdioa are distinguished by their aromatic rhizomes. The majority of the species are concentrated in Southeastern Brazil, along the margins of brooks or in rock splits. There are many endemic species: the most remarkable examples are in the Sect. Lecania and Sychinia. Of the 41 South-American species only 4 have not been found in Brazil. Although the genus Dorstenia fits well in Moraceae, near Ficus, its presents characters that demonstrate an affinity with some genera of Urticaceae.
23493149|Nesse artigo foram estudados a acumulao e perda de radionucldeos artificiais em trs espcies de algas marinhas bentnicas do Estado do Rio de Janeiro, em condies laboratoriais, visando a seleo de indicadores biolgicos de contaminao radioativa no meio marinho. In this paper, the acummulations and the loss of artificial radionuclides in three species of marine benthic algae of state of Rio de Janeiro were studied under laboratory conditions, so that a selection of biological indicators for radioctive contamination of the marine environment could be made. Medium concentration factores were calculated in the described conditions, the most significant figures being those obtained for the algae Pterocladia capillacea (Gmelin) Bornet et Thuret (13240) p/131I and Sargassum vulgare J. Agardh (195) p/51Cr.
23493144|The Author describes a new species of Apodanthes Poit. (Rafflesiaceae): Apodanthes roraimae Vattimo n.sp., collected in the Brazilian Territory of Roraima, near the locality of Auaris, on "terra firmi" and also between Mait and the Indian Village of Paramiteri (Vila Indgena de Paramiteri), on ManausCaracara Road. The species is close to Apodanthes panamensis Vattimo, but differs by the more developed flowers and the petals not truncated at base (as they are in panamensis). The petals of A. roraimae Vattimo n.sp. are suborbicular, often attenuated at the base.
23497132|Foi realizado o estudo taxonmico do gnero Heliotropium L. no estado de Pernambuco, utilizando-se espcimes coletados em campo por um perodo de 16 meses, alm de materials de emprstimo e/ou doao provenientes de vrios herbrios nacionais. Verificou-se a ocorrncia de sete taxa: H. angiospermum Murray, H. curassavicum L., H. elongatum (Lehm.) I.M. Johnst., H. indicum L., H. polyphyllum Lehm., H. procumbens Mill e H. ternatum Vahl. H. curassavicum e H. ternatum constituem nova referncia para o Nordeste e Pernambuco, Brasil, respectivamente. As espcies mais amplamente distribudas so H. angiospermum, H. elongatum e H. procumbens, ocorrendo desde a zona do litoral at a zona das caatingas. A taxonomic study of the genus Heliotropium L. in the State of Pernambuco was carried out. The survey was based on field studies during 16 months and material provided by loan and donation from different brazilian herbaria. Seven species were recorded: H. angiospermum Murray, H. curassavicum L., H. elongatum (Lehm.) I.M. Johnst., H. indicum L., H. polyphyllum Lehm., H. procumbens Mill. and H. ternatum Vahl. H. curassavicum and H. ternatum represent new geographical occurrences from Northeastern and State of Pernambuco, Brazil, respectively. The species most widely distributed were H. angiospermum, H. elongatum and H. procumbens, occurring both since litoral to caatinga's zone.
23497128|Este trabalho teve como objetivo inventariar as Orchidaceae das restingas do estado do Esprito Santo, detectar as formas de vida e proceder a uma anlise da similaridade entre as formaes vegetais das restingas, atravs da flora orquidolgica. As coletas de material botnico foram feitas ao longo de todo o litoral sendo includas as colees dos herbrios CVRD, MBML e VIES. Foram identificados 73 txons, sendo 71 espcies, dentre estas uma nova para cincia, e dois hbridos naturais. O major nmero de espcies foi encontrado em Epidendrum (7) e Pleurothallis (6). Foram encontrados 31 txons holoepfitos, 28 txons terrestres, 12 txons epfitos facultativos e dois txons hemiepfitos. Das 10 formaes vegetais de restinga as Orchidaceae estiveram representadas em oito. A floresta arenosa litornea apresentou 58 txons, seguida pela formao aberta de Clusia (31), formao aberta de Ericaceae (20), floresta periodicamente inundada (14), formao pspraia (13), formao Palmae (10), formao brejo herbceo (3) e formao praial graminide (2). A major similaridade florstica, utilizando o ndice de Sorensen, foi encontrada entre as formaes arbustivas fechadas (ps-praia e Palmae) seguidas pelas formaes arbustivas abertas (de Ericaceae e de Clusia). Estes dois grupos se ligam, com menor similaridade s formaes florestais, enquanto as formaes herbceas so as mais dissimilares. An inventory of the Orchidaceae of the coastal plain vegetation (restingas) of Esprito Santo State, Brazil, is presented here. The life forms were examined as well as the similarity between restinga vegetation types based on the orchid flora. Botanical material was collected along the entire coast and material from the following herbaria was examined: CVRD, MBML and VIES. A total of 73 taxa were identified, including two natural hybrids. Of the 71 remaining taxa, one was a new species. The most species-rich genera were Epidendrum (7) and Pleurothallis (6). The taxons were classified as follows: 31 holoepiphytes, 28 terrestrials, 12 facultative epiphytes and 2 hemiepiphytes. Orchid species are found in eigth of the 10 restinga vegetation types: sandy coastal forest (58), open Clusia scrub (31), open Ericaceae scrub (20), periodically flooded forest (14), closed beach-thicket (13), Palm scrub (10), sedge swamp (3) and creeping psammophytic (2). Highest floristic similarity based on Sorensen's index was found between the closed formations (beach thicket and Palmae scrub), followed by the open formations (Ericaceae and Clusia). These two groups are linked at lower similarity values with the forest formations, while the herbaceous formations are quite dissimilar.
23497133|Neste trabalho descreve-se o desenvolvimento da lmina foliar de Beilschmiedia rigida (Mez) Kosterm., desde o surgimento do primrdio foliar no pice vegetativo at sua completa expanso. So apontadas caractersticas como  presena de tricomas apenas nas folhas jovens; ocorrncia de projees parietais e invaginaes protoplasmticas nas paredes anticlinais e periclinais das clulas epidrmicas; estmatos paracticos de origem mesopergena; hipoderme em trs estratos na face adaxial e em apenas um na face abaxial da lmina foliar e clulas secretoras que surgem nos primeiros estgios de diferenciao da folha assim como idioblastos cristalferos em grupos. The differentiation and development of leaves of Beilschmiedia rigida from the leaf primordium to the complete leaf expansion are described. Characteristics as  presence of trichomes in young leafs only, occurrence of walls and protoplasmic projections in the anticlinal and periclinal walls of epidermal cells, paracitic stomata of mesoperiginous origin; three layers of hipodermis in the adaxial face and one layer in the abaxial face of leaf blade and secretory cells and cristaliferous idioblasts groups that arises in the leaf primordium were pointed.
23497129|Este trabalho trata das espcies de Piperaceae representadas no estado do Cear, Brasil, com interesse assentado no conhecimento taxonmico, como tambm no seu valor medicinal. O tratamento taxonmico compreende descries, chaves para identificao dos txons e distribuio geogrfica com base no exame de exsicatas de herbrios, incluindo tipos. Comentrios sobre utilidades e dados ambientais so atribudos a algumas espcies. Para o Cear, segundo o material examinado, so assinalados 4 gneros, separados principalmente pelo hbito e pela disposio das inflorescncias, constantes de 35 taxa que se distinguem pelos padres de nervao foliar, bractolas florais e frutos. Os indivduos destes txons ocorrem nas reas midas das serras de Baturit, Maranguape, Aratanha e Machado; a maioria apresenta distribuio ampla, enquanto que Piper rufipilum Yunck.  espcie endmica da Chapada do Araripe e Ottonia leptostachia Kunth constituiu-se em uma nova localidade. The subject of this paper is the Piperaceae species which occur in the state of Cear, Brazil, with special attention paid to their taxonomy, as well as the medicinal value. The taxonomic treatment used in this study were the following in the examination of dissected dried herbarium specimens including types, descriptions, keys for identification of taxa and geographical distribution. Commentary on the use and ambiental data are presented for some taxa. The State of Cear denote in the material examined 4 genera, differentiated by habitat and arrangement of inflorescence, in 35 taxa which are distinguishable by their patterns of foliar nervation, floral bracteoles and fruits. The individuals these taxa occur in the humid regions of the mountains of Baturit, Maranguape, Aratanha and Machado; where the majority of them are widely distributed, whereas Piper rufipilum Yunck. is only found in Chapada do Araripe and Ottonia leptostachia Kunth is found in yet another are.

23497134|O estudo taxonmico de Phyllanthus L. no bioma Caatinga de Pernambuco foi realizado atravs da anlise morfolgica de materiais herborizados e de observaes de campo. Constataramse 11 taxa: Phyllanthus acuminatus Vahl., P. amarus Schumach. & Thonn., P. caroliniensis Walt. subsp. caroliniensis., P. claussenii Mll. Arg., P. jacobinensis Mll. Arg., P. klotzschianus Mll. Arg., P. minutulus Mll. Arg., P niruri L., P. heteradenius Mll. Arg., P. stipulatus (Raf.) Webster e P. tenellus Roxb. Os principais caracteres morfolgicos utilizados para separao das espcies foram o hbito, o padro de a ramificao, forma do disco glandular das flores de ambos os sexos, o nmero e unio dos estames e a ornamentao das sementes. A maior parte das espcies apresenta distribuio nas subzonas do agreste e serto em vegetao de Caatinga. Apenas P. acuminatus Vahl, P. minutulus Mll. Arg. e P. stipulatus (Raf.) Webster foram encontradas exclusivamente na subzona do Agreste, nas florestas Montanas. The taxonomic study of species in the genus Phyllanthus L. in the caatinga biome of the State of Pernambuco was carried out based on morphological analysis of fresh material or from specimen vouchers of the local herbaria. Eleven taxa were recorded: Phyllanthus acuminatus Vahl, P. amarus Schumach. & Thonn., P. caroliniensis Walt. subsp. caroliniensis, P. claussenii Mll. Arg., P. heteradenius Mll. Arg., P. jacobinensis Mll. Arg., P. klotzschianus Mll. Arg., P. minutulus Mll. Arg., P niruri L., P. orbiculatus Rich., P. stipulatus (Raf.) Webster. and P. tenellus Roxb. The main morphological features used for delimitation of the species were habit, branching pattern, shape of the glandular disk on both male and female flowers, number and union of the stamens, type of dehiscence of anthers and seed coat. Most species present geographical distribution in steppe-savannah vegetation on different vegetational physiognomies (Agreste and Serto). Only P. acuminatus Vahl., P. minutulus Mll. Arg. and P. stipulatus (Raf.) Webster occur exclusively in the upland forests within the Agreste Zone.
23497130|A Flora Brasiliensis, obra idealizada e editada, em sua maior parte por Karl Friederich Philipp von Martius, entre os anos de 1840 e 1906, trata do conjunto de espcies da flora brasileira at ento conhecidas. Nessa obra, a famlia Rubiaceae, representada por 99 gneros e 1043 espcies, teve o tratamento taxonmico feito por K. Schumann e Mueller Argoviensis. O estudo descritivo da distribuio geogrfica, apresentado s pginas 415 a 422 do volume 6, parte 6, foi elaborado apenas por Schumann. A leitura e interpretao do tratamento dado s Rubiaceae, nessa obra, ainda hoje  muito importante e, muitas vezes, imprescindvel para estudiosos da flora brasileira, especialmente para aqueles que se dedicam  taxonomia,  florstica e  fitogeografia. A dificuldade de leitura do texto descritivo, em latim, sobre a distribuio geogrfica deste grupo assim como as muitas alteraes sofridas nos nomes genricos e binmios especficos criam empecilhos  interpretao da viso primorosa de Schumann sobre o conjunto de Rubiaceae da flora brasileira e da contribuio dos txons desta famlia nos diferentes biomas brasileiros. Apresenta-se, neste trabalho, a traduo para o portugus de texto latino elaborado por Schumann sobre a distribuio geogrfica das Rubiaceae, acompanhada da atualizao dos nomes cientficos nele contidos. Flora Brasiliensis, planned and edited mainly by Karl Friederich Philipp von Martius, from 1840 and 1906, deals with all species from Brazilian Flora known at that time. In this work, the Rubiaceae, represented by 99 genus and 1043 species, was taxonomicaly analysed by K. Schumann and Mueller Argoviensis. The geographical distribution study, presented on pages 415 to 422 of volume 6, part 6, was written only by Schumann. Reading and interpretation of this work is very important and sometimes indispensable for Brazilan flora researchers, specially for those dedicated to taxonomy, floristic and fitogeography. The descriptive text on the geographical distribution in Latin and the various changes on generic and specific names raise difficulties for comprehending Schumann's great vision about the whole Rubiaceae family in Brazilian flora and the presence of this family's taxa throughout different Brazilian biomes. This paper presents the Portuguese translation of the latin text by Schumann on the geographical distribution of Rubiaceae, and updates scientific names presented there.
23497135|O presente estudo visou avaliar mensalmente a compartimentao mineral em Ouratea spectabilis (Mart.) Engl. nas diferentes fenofases, no perodo de agosto de 1995 a julho de 1996, em rea de cerrado, na Reserva Biolgica e Estao Experimental de Mogi-Guau, localizado no municpio de Mogi-Guau, em So Paulo. Foram analisados todos os macronutrientes (N, P, K, Ca, Mg e S) nos compartimentos folha, em 3 estdios de desenvolvimento foliar, ramo, flor e fruto. As observaes fenolgicas foram realizadas mensalmente em 20 espcimens distribudos na rea de cerrado, sendo consideradas as fenofases brotao, queda foliar, florao e frutificao. A distribuio dos elementos minerais nos compartimentos e nos diferentes estdios de desenvolvimento foliar revelou diferenas significativas e padres sazonais bem definidos, permitindo identificar a importncia de cada nutriente nas diferentes fases do desenvolvimento da planta, e sugerir sobre a capacidade de retranslocao destes elementos e manuteno do balano nutricional. Face a essas anlises, a espcie O. spectabilis comporta-se de maneira altamente eficiente na utilizao de gua e nutrientes, refletindo padres fenolgico e de distribuio que garantem a sua sobrevivncia em ambientes de cerrado. The present study aims to evaluate monthly the mineral nutrition presented by the population of Ouratea spectabilis (Mart.) Engl. in different phenophases, from August of 1995 to July of 1996, in a cerrado area of the Reserva Biolgica e Estao Experimental de Mogi-Guau, located at Mogi-Guau City, So Paulo. All the macro elements (N, P, K, Ca, Mg and S) were analyzed on leaves, branches, flowers and fruits compartments, and in 3 leaf development stages. The phenological studies were made monthly in 20 specimens distributed in the cerrado area and phenophases variation (leaf flushing, leaf fall, flowering and fruiting) were analyzed quantitatively. The distribution of the mineral elements among the sampled vegetative parts revealed significant differences and a well defined seasonal pattern, which allows to identify the importance of each nutrient in different developmental phase of the plant, and it suggest about the mineral translocation capacity and its nutritional status. In face of these facts, O. spectabilis shows significant efficiency in water and nutrient utilization, reflecting in distribution and phenological patterns that guarantees its survival in cerrado's environments.
23497131|So apresentadas a descrio de Vellozia candida J.C.Mikan, ilustraes e anlise de sua distribuio geogrfica e sistemtica, bem como a lectotipificao de um de seus sinnimos. Description of Vellozia candida J.C.Mikan, ilustrations, and an analysis of its geographical distribution and systematics are presented. It is also stablished the leptotypus of one of its synonyms.
23497600|Realizou-se o estudo morfolgico e taxonmico dos txons de Myrceugenia O. Berg (Myrtaceae) do Parque Nacional do Itatiaia e avaliou-se a utilizao dos caracteres vegetativos e elementos florais como informao diagnstica. O estudo consta de descries, chave analtica, observaes de campo efetuadas durante as coletas e levantamento de herbrios. Foram assinalados para a rea oito txons: Myrceugenia alpigena (DC.) Landrum var. alpigena; M. bracteosa (DC.) D. Legrand & Kausel; M. campestris (DC.) D. Legrand & Kausel; M. cucullata D. Legrand; M. glaucescens var. latior Burret (Landrum); M. miersiana (Gardner) D. Legrand & Kausel, M. ovata var. regnelliana (O. Berg) Landrum e M. seriatoramosa (Kiaersk.) D. Legrand & Kausel. Os caracteres diagnsticos considerados para os txons foram forma da inflorescncia, do boto floral, dos prfilos e lobos calicinais bem como presena e ausncia de nervura intramarginal. Os caracteres vegetativos por si s no constituram elementos suficientemente diagnsticos para os txons ocorrentes na rea. Foram registradas duas novas ocorrncias para o estado do Rio de Janeiro: M. campestris e M. cucullata. A morphological and taxonomic analysis of the species of Myrceugenia O. Berg (Myrtaceae) in Itatiaia National Park, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, was carried out. In addition to determining the species present in the Park, the usefulness of vegetative and floral characters as diagnostic tools was evaluated. The study includes descriptions, an identification key, observations made in the field and from herbarium collections. Eight taxa were identified: Myrceugenia alpigena (DC.) Landrum var. alpigena; M. bracteosa (DC.) D. Legrand & Kausel; M. campestris (DC.) D. Legrand & Kausel; M. cucullata D. Legrand; M. glaucescens var. latior Burret (Landrum); M. miersiana (Gardner) D. Legrand & Kausel, M. ovata var. regnelliana (O. Berg) Landrum and M. seriatoramosa (Kiaersk.) D. Legrand & Kausel. Diagnostic characters found useful were the shapes of the inflorescence, the flower bud, the prophyll and the calyx-lobes, as well as the presence or absence of an intramarginal vein. vegetative characters alone are not diagnostic to distinguish the species of Myrceugenia in the Park. Two new occurrences for the state of Rio de Janeiro were registered: M. campestris and M. cucullata.
23497601|Este trabalho consiste da taxonomia, com o auxlio de observaes de campo dos txons, de Swartzia na Reserva Natural da Companhia Vale do Rio Doce. Alm da chave de identificao e descries detalhadas para cada um dos oito txons detectados neste trabalho, so apresentadas observaes sobre o porte, aspecto externo e interno da casca, com fotografias para todas as espcies, sendo que foram atribudos padres da casca externa para cada um dos txons. Swartzia apetala var. apetala  encontrada nos mais diversos habitats presentes na rea de estudo, enquanto S. acutifolia, S. apetala var. glabra, S. linharensis, S. myrtifolia var. elegans e S. simplex var. ochnacea so encontradas somente na Floresta Alta de Terra Firme e S. macrostachya var. macrostachya, na rea focada aqui,  exclusiva do Campo Nativo. S. myrtifolia var. elegans e S. simplex var. ochnacea so os nicos txons que no apresentam casca descamante. This study consists of the taxonomy, with the use of field observations, to distinguish among taxa of Swartzia occuring in the "Reserva Natural da Companhia Vale do Rio Doce". Besides the key to identify and the detailed descriptions to each one of the eight taxa detected in this study we present observations on the size, internal and external aspects on the bark, with photographs of all taxa, where we attributed patterns of external bark to all of them. S. apetala var. apetala is found in all different habitats present in the studied site, while S. acutifolia, S. apetala var. glabra, S. linharensis, S. myrtifolia var. elegans, and S. simplex var. ochnacea are found just in the "Floresta Alta de Terra Firme" and S. macrostachya var. macrostachya, in the area focused here, is exclusive of the "Campo Nativo". S. myrtifolia var. elegans and S. simplex var. ochnacea are the only taxa that do not have bark that peels off.
23497602|O presente trabalho trata do levantamento das espcies de Palmae ocorrentes na Reserva Biolgica da Represa do Grama, localizada na Zona da Mata do estado de Minas Gerais, no municpio de Descoberto. The area covers 263.8 hectares of stationary semidecidual forest. Six genera and seven species were found: Astrocaryum aculeatissimum, Attalea oleifera, Bactris vulgaris, Euterpe edulis, Geonoma brevispatha, G. rubescens and Syagrus romanzoffiana. Identification keys, descriptions, ilustrations, range, habit and comments for each species are furnished.
23497603|A Reserva Rio das Pedras situa-se no Municpio de Mangaratiba, estado do Rio de Janeiro, nas coordenadas 2259'S e 4405'W, com cerca de 1.260 ha.  uma Reserva Particular do Patrimnio Natural (RPPN), de propriedade do Clube Mediterrane, compreendendo um remanescente de Floresta Atlntica e altitudes que variam de 20 a 1.050 m alt., em diversos estgios de regenerao decorrentes de aes antrpicas distintas. A anlise da flora pteridoftica indica a ocorrncia de 17 famlias, 45 gneros e 117 espcies. So apresentadas chaves de identificao e comentrios para os txons encontrados. Rio das Pedras Reserve is located in the Municipality of Mangaratiba, State of Rio de Janeiro, in the coordinates 2259'S and 4405'W, with about 1260 ha. It is a Private Reserve (RPPN), which belongs to Club Mediterrane. The area is a remainder of Atlantic Pluvial Forest of several stages in succession, with altitudes from 20 to 1050 meters. The analysis of the pteridophyte flora indicates the occurrence of 17 families, 45 genera and 117 species. Identification keys for families and species of the area are presented.

A key for the identification of the sections and the species of the subgenus in Southeastern Brazil, along with their descriptions, types, examined material, common names, habitat, phenology, geographic distribution, etymology, and taxonomic comments are presented, as well as illustrations and distribution maps.

23497598|Dos grandes biomas brasileiros, a caatinga  um dos mais desconhecidos do ponto de vista florstico e fitogeogrfico. No Piau, este bioma reveste cerca de 37% do seu territrio, apresentando uma nica Unidade de Conservao, o Parque Nacional Serra da Capivara. Este trabalho objetivou listar as espcies coletadas na rea do Parque. Para isso, foi realizado um levantamento do material coletado na regio, depositado no Herbrio Graziela Barroso da Universidade Federal do Piau  TEPB/UFPI, acrescidos de material resultante de coletas realizadas em duas unidades geomorfolgicas (sedimentar e cristalino) no perodo de dois anos. Foram registradas um total de 210 espcies distribudas em 149 gneros e 62 famlias. As famlias com maior riqueza foram Caesalpiniaceae, Fabaceae, Mimosaceae, Bignoniaceae, Euphorbiaceae e Myrtaceae com 46% das espcies. Verificou-se que a heterogeneidade do ambiente fsico influencia na distribuio das espcies nos diferentes bitopos da regio. No que se refere  regio semi-rida como um todo, observou-se que, com exceo de um pequeno grupo de espcies, h semelhana florstica entre a rea de estudo com outras reas de caatinga do semi-rido nordestino, quer sejam instaladas em terrenos sedimentares ou sobre o embasamento cristalino. Of the great Brazilian biomes, the caatinga is one of the most poorly known from the floristic and phytogeografic point of view. In Piau state, this biome covers about 37% of its territory, with only one conservation unit, the Serra da Capivara National Park. This work aims at listing the species collected in the Park area. With that objective, a survey was made of the material collected in the area deposited in the Herbarium "Graziela Barroso" of the Universidade Federal do Piau  TEPB/UFPI, in adittion to samples resultant from collection in two geomorphologic units (sedimentary lands and crystalline soil) during a two year period. It was registered a total of 210 species distributed in 149 genus and 62 families. The families with greater diversity were Caesalpiniaceae, Fabaceae, Mimosaceae, Bignoniaceae, Euphorbiaceae and Myrtaceae totalling 46% of the species. It was verified that the heterogeneity of the physical environment influences in the distribution of species in the different biotypes of the area. As far as the semi-arid region as a whole is concerned, it was observed that, except for a small group of species, there is floristic similarity between the study area with other areas of caatinga in Brazil's Northeastern native semi-arid, whether installed in sedimentary lands or on crystalline soil.
23497831|A Reserva est localizada em Descoberto, Minas Gerais, e abrange uma rea de 263,8 hectares de floresta estacional semidecdua. Foram encontrados oito gneros e 17 espcies que ocorrem preferencialmente prximas dos cursos d'gua e raramente formam grandes populaes, sendo que a maioria das espcies est representada na rea por poucos indivduos. So apresentadas chave de identificao das espcies, descries, informaes sobre florao e frutificao, distribuio geogrfica e habitat, e ilustraes. The Reserva Biolgica da Represa do Grama is situated in Descoberto, Minas Gerais, and consists of 263,8 hectares of seasonal forest. Eight genera and 17 species of Araceae have been recorded from the Reserve. The species occur commonly close to the river margins and rarely form large populations, the great majority of the species is represented by few individuals. A key for the identification of the species, descriptions, illustrations, information about flowering and fruiting, geographical distribution and habitats of each species are presented.
23497830|New species from the Department of Amazonas in Peru are described as new in preparation for the treatment of the Araceae for the Flora del Cenepa y Areas Adyacentes Amazonas Peru. 23497826|Duas espcies novas do gnero Anthurium so descritas para a Serra da Bocaina, estado de So Paulo, ambas at o momento endmicas dessa localidade. Anthurium bocainensis pertence  seo Urospadix, subseo Flavescentiviridia e A. ameliae pertence  seo Urospadix subseo Obscureviridia, e ocorrem no bioma floresta atlntica. So fornecidas diagnoses, ilustraes e comentrios  cerca da distribuio geogrfica, ecologia, registro de florao, frutificao e conservao para cada espcie. Two new species of the genus Anthurium are described from the Serra da Bocaina, So Paulo state, Brazil. Both currently endemic to this area and thus considered part of the Atlantic Forest biome. Anthurium bocainensis belongs to sect. Urospadix, subsect. Flavescentiviridia, and A. ameliae belongs to sect. Urospadix subsect. Obscureviridia. Diagnoses, descriptions, illustrations and commentary on geographical distribution, ecology, flowering and fruiting times and conservation status are provided for each species.

23497832|Leaf and spathe anatomy of seven species and two varieties of the genus Anthurium (section Urospadix; subsection Flavescentiviridia) were analyzed. Plant material was collected from different locations in Brazil and cultivated under identical glasshouse conditions in the Rio de Janeiro Botanical Garden. Our attempt is to evaluate the diagnostic potential of leaf and spathe anatomy for taxonomic purposes. Leaves presented smooth cuticle, polygonal epidermal cells randomly disposed in paradermal view, periclinal divisions of epidermal cells in transversal view, non-raised stomata, collenchyma, sclerenchymatic bundle sheaths and raphides in the mesophyll. The spathe presented cuticular striations; rectangular and elongated cells in parallel rows; raised stomata; absence of collenchyma, raphides and sclerenchymatic bundle sheaths and presence of sclerenchyma as fibre caps under phloem. Clustering analysis based on leaf and spathe anatomical characters, revealed that the spathe can give a better resolution for segregation of species groups. So apresentados dados relativos  anatomia da lmina foliar e espata de sete espcies e duas variedades do gnero Anthurium pertencentes  seo Urospadix; subseo Flavescentiviridia. Os indivduos foram coletados nos estados do Rio de Janeiro, So Paulo e Minas Gerais, e aclimatados no Instituto de Pesquisas Jardim Botnico do Rio de Janeiro. O objetivo deste estudo  comparar anatomicamente lmina foliar e espata, visando detectar qual das duas estruturas  mais til  diagnose taxonmica das espcies estudadas. Observa-se nas folhas a presena de cutcula lisa e clulas epidrmicas dispostas ao acaso, estmatos nivelados com a epiderme, divises periclinais em clulas epidrmicas, alm de rfides no mesofilo e bainha esclerenquimtica nos feixes vasculares. J quanto  espata observa-se cutcula estriada, clulas alongadas e ordenadas de forma paralela, estmatos por vezes elevados, ausncia de rfides e presena de calota de fibras apenas junto ao floema, quando no ausentes. A anlise de agrupamento para folha e espata revelou maior poder de resoluo com base em caracteres anatmicos da espata; alm dos grupos formados com base nos caracteres anatmicos da folha no serem consistentes taxonomicamente. Sugere-se portanto que a espata apresenta maior valor diagnstico ao nvel anatmico para subsidiar estudos taxonmicos do gnero Anthurium.
23497823|Araceae apresenta uma morfologia e terminologia especfica, que pode ocasionar dificuldades de compreenso. Alm disso, alguns conceitos adotados para a famlia, so discordantes entre os especialistas do grupo. Para uma compreenso profunda de tal morfologia, bibliografias especializadas so requeridas. No levantamento das espcies de Araceae do Parque Estadual do Rio Doce (PERD) foram encontradas 13 espcies e oito gneros (incluindo aqueles com maior diversidade especfica, Anthurium e Philodendron). Uma sntese ilustrada da morfologia e terminologia dos gneros e espcies do PERD  apresentada, visando uma melhor compreenso da morfologia e taxonomia geral da famlia. The use of specialized terms for some morphological features in Araceae can cause problems in understanding for the general reader and there are not always agreements among taxonomic specialists of the correct usage of some descriptive terminologies. For a complete understanding of this morphology, specialized literature must be consulted. In an inventory of Araceae from the Rio Doce State Park (PERD) the morphology of 13 species and 8 genera was studied (including Anthurium and Philodendron). An illustrated overview of the morphology and terminology of the genera and species from the PERD is presented aiming a better understanding of the morphology and taxonomy of the family.
23497828|The formerly considered monospecific genus Scaphispatha (Araceae  Caladieae) is here revised. Scaphispatha robusta E.G.Gon, a second species for the genus is newly described from the Cerrado Biome and the transition Cerrado-Amazonia. It differs from S. gracilis Brongn. ex Schott by the much more robust petioles and leaves, primary lateral veins drying clearer than the lamina, lateral secondary veins conspicously more prominent than tertiary veins and for the female spadix with 11-15 rows of flowers visible in side view. A key to separate both species is provided, as well as ink illustrations and general remarks on the genus. O gnero Scaphispatha (Araceae  Caladieae), at ento considerado monoespecfico,  aqui revisado. Scaphispatha robusta E.G.Gon., uma segunda espcie para o gnero  descrita para o bioma Cerrado e a transio Cerrado-Amazonia. Difere de S. gracilis Brongn. ex Schott pelos pecolos e folhas muito mais robustas, nervuras laterais mais claras que o limbo quando secas, nervuras laterais secundrias mais proeminentes que as tercirias e pela poro feminina do espdice com 11-15 espirais de flores visveis em vista lateral. Uma chave para separar as espcies, assim como ilustraes em nanquim e aspectos gerais para o gnero so apresentados.
23497829|A new species of Monstera, M. barrieri Croat, Moonen & Poncy, is described from French Guiana. The species is characterized by its deeply pinnately lobed, black-drying blades and the wine-red to orange spadix axis. A espcie  caracterizada por apresentar lmina profundamente lobada, tornando-se negra quando seca e eixo da espdice vermelho-vinceo a alaranjado.
23497824|A revision of 6 closely related species from the Amazon basin in Colombia, Ecuador and Peru is presented, and 4 new species of Anthurium are published as new: Anthurium ceronii Croat, A. payaminoense Croat & Lingn, A. sydneyi Croat & Lingn and A. whitmorei Croat & Lingn. Two species, A. decurrens Poeppig and A. longispadiceum K. Krause are redescribed because they have been, until recently, totally unknown or misrepresented by other taxa. The species are all members of a new section named Decurrentia, newly named here for the first time. All members of section Decurrentia have in common short internodes, elongated, epunctate leaf blades, and peduncles tending to be weakly or prominently ridged or winged. In addition, several of the species have early-emergent, elongated berries. All species treated here occur in the lowlands of Amazonia and have been confused with one another by botanists for a long time.  apresentada uma reviso de seis espcies estreitamente relacionadas da bacia amaznica na Colmbia, Equador e Peru, sendo quatro espcies novas: Anthurium ceronii Croat, A. payaminoense Croat & Lingn, A. sydneyi Croat & Lingn e A. whitmorei Croat & Lingn. Duas espcies, A. decurrens Poeppig e A. longispadiceum K. Krause, so novamente descritas porque foram, at recentemente, totalmente desconhecidas ou confundidas com outros taxa. As espcies so membros de uma seo nova, Decurrentia, descrita aqui pela primeira vez. Todos os membros da seo Decurrentia tm em comum interns curtos, alongados, lminas da folha sem pontuaes e pednculos que tendem a ser fraca ou proeminente rgidos ou alados. Alm disso, vrias espcies tm bagas precocemente emergentes e alongadas. Todas as espcies tratadas aqui ocorrem na plancie amaznica e tm sido confundidas umas com as outras por botnicos durante muito tempo.
23498270|Nas elevadas altitudes do sudeste brasileiro so encontrados os campos de altitude. A fisionomia mais freqentemente encontrada nos plats relativamente extensos  a de arbustos inseridos em uma matriz de touceiras de gramneas, com esparsas ervas e pteridfitas. Os objetivos deste trabalho foram elaborar a lista florstica de plantas vasculares e determinar o espectro biolgico florstico, de uma campo de altitude localizado no Parque Estadual da Serra do Brigadeiro, Minas Gerais, Brasil. Para tanto, foram realizadas expedies mensais entre julho de 2000 a janeiro de 2002. As espcies foram classificadas nas classes de formas de vida de Raunkiaer, modificadas segundo Braun-Blanquet. Para a comparao do espectro biolgico da flora estudada com o espectro normal de Raunkiaer foi realizado um teste de qui-quadrado de independncia. Foram coletadas 81 espcies de plantas vasculares. A famlia mais rica foi Orchidaceae, seguida por Asteraceae, ambas bem representadas nos campos de altitude. O elevado nmero de espcies exclusivas de cada sinsia indica que as mesmas esto bem delimitadas na vegetao local. O espectro biolgico florstico mostrou um predomnio dos hemicriptfitos, seguido pelos camfitos, formas de vida relacionadas  fisionomia campestre. O teste de qui-quadrado mostrou que o espectro biolgico da vegetao estudada difere do normal de Raunkiaer.  necessria, a realizao de um maior nmero de estudos florsticos e ecolgicos em campos de altitude, pois a carncia atual de estudos no permite anlises comparativas, ferramentas importantes para se aferir relaes fitogeogrficas, e para avaliar o estado de conservao das reas possuidoras de tal formao vegetacional. In the high atitudes of Brazilian southeast, "campos de altitude" are found. The physiognomy most frequent in the relatively extensive plateaus is the one of schrubs within a matrix of bunchgrasses, with sparse herbs and pteridophytes. The aims of this paper were the elaboration of a floristic checklist of vascular plants and the determination of the floristic biological spectrum of a campo de altitude located in the "Serra do Brigadeiro" State Park, Minas Gerais  Brazil. For that, field expeditions were monthly accomplished between July 2000 to January 2002. The species were classified in the life form classes of Raunkiaer, modified according to Braun-Blanquet. A chi-square test of independence was carried out to compare the biological spectrum of the studied flora with the normal spectrum of Raunkiaer. Eighty-one species of vascular plants were identified, and the richest family was Orchidaceae, followed by Asteraceae, both well represented in "campos de altitude". The high number of species which are exclusive of each synusiae indicates that the same are well delimited in the local vegetation. The floristic biological spectrum showed a prevalence of hemicryptophytes followed by chamaephytes, life forms related to grassland physiognomy. The chi-square test showed that the biological spectrum of the studied vegetation differs from the normal of Rankiaer. The accomplishment of a higher number of floristic and ecological studies in campos de altitude is needed, since the lack of studies allows neither the realization of comparative studies, important to confront biogeographical relations nor foresight of their conservation status.

Maas, Guatteria nigrescens Mart., Oxandra nitida R.E.Fr., Xylopia ochrantha Mart. e X. sericea A.St.-Hil. Apresentam-se chave de identificao das espcies, breves descries, ilustraes e comentrios sobre fenologia, distribuio geogrfica, habitats e usos. Maas, Guatteria nigrescens Mart., Oxandra nitida R.E.Fr., Xylopia ochrantha Mart. and X. sericea A.St.-Hil. 23498263|O aparecimento de tricomas foliares de absoro (escamas)  analisado em propgulos oriundos de reproduo sexuada (sementes) e assexuada (rametes) de trs espcies de bromlias terrestres ocorrentes na restinga aberta de Barra de Maric, Rio de Janeiro (2258S - 4253W): Aechmea nudicaulis (L.) Griseb.; Neoregelia cruenta (Graham) L. B. Sm. e Vriesea neoglutinosa Mez. Nas trs espcies, a germinao (emisso da radcula) ocorreu aps trs dias de tratamento. Os eventos emisso da plmula e complete expanso da plmula com emisso da segunda folha ocorreram respectivamente at 11 e 15 dias aps a emisso da radcula em A. nudicaulis e N. cruenta. A anlise morfolgica em microscopia tica e eletrnica no detectou escamas at 17 dias aps a emisso da radcula. Entretanto plos radiculares ocorreram logo nos trs primeiros dias de germinao em A. nudicaulis e N. cruenta. Para V. neoglutinosa, a anlise morfolgica detectou escamas na plmula ainda em expanso, porm as escamas estavam em fase inicial de formao. No foram detectados plos radiculares em plntulas de V. neoglutinosa durante o experimento. Escamas com desenvolvimento estrutural completo foram observadas nos primrdios foliares junto ao meristema apical do caule dos rametes das trs espcies analisadas. Prope-se aqui que o aparecimento de escamas nas primeiras folhas dos rametes confere alta capacidade de estabelecimento por via vegetativa para as bromlias estudadas na restinga de Barra de Maric. Tal fato auxiliaria as espcies estudadas a superar a fase de estabelecimento de plntulas, intensamente limitada pelas condies abiticas vigentes nas restingas. The occurrence of absorptive leaf trichomes is studied in propagules originated from sexual (seeds) and assexual (ramets) reproduction from three terrestrial bromeliads in restinga of Barra de Maric, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil (2258S - 4253W): Aechmea nudicaulis (L.) Griseb.; Neoregelia cruenta (Graham) L. B. Sm. and Vriesea neoglutinosa Mez. For A. nudicaulis and N. cruenta, the radicle protrusion (germination) occurs in the third day of experiment. The complete expansion of the plumule and emission of the second leaf occur until 15 days after germination. For both species, no absorptive leaf trichomes were detected until day 17 of germination, but several root hairs appear in three days of germination. Results are different for V. neoglutinosa. Although radicle protrusion (germination) occurs in three days, the events "plumule emission" and "expanded plumule with second leaf emission" occurred after 15 and 18 days respectively. For this species, absorptive trichomes were detected yet in the young plumule, but still in the initial phase of differentiation. No root hairs occurred for V. neoglutinosa until the end of the experiment. Absorptive trichomes occurred in the shoot apical meristem from ramets of the studied species. Considering that the seedling phase is very sensible to harsh environments, we suggest that the occurrence of absorptive trichomes in the very first leaves of ramets, but not on young seedlings, represents an important adaptive capacity for the establishment of terrestrial bromeliads by assexual reproduction under the abiotic conditions of restinga.
23498260|Este trabalho representa uma contribuio ao Projeto Flora do Estado do Rio de Janeiro e objetiva: apresentar lista de txons de brifitas para o estado; elaborar diagnstico da diversidade e importncia destes na conservao dos ecossistemas; criar banco de dados para os txons. No total so reconhecidos 1.039 txons, em 308 gneros e 95 famlias de brifitas para o estado, das quais 11 so novas ocorrncias. As 10 famlias com maior riqueza compreendem 50% do total de txons. Para as hepticas, predomina o padro neotropical e, para os musgos, o endmico do Brasil. Em relao  variao altitudinal, as hepticas ocorrem desde a terra baixa at a montana, enquanto os musgos predominam nas faixas montana e altomontana. Dos 91 municpios levantados apenas 34 apresentam registros de brifitas. Quanto ao status de conservao, 125 txons so consideradas vulnerveis (VU), 25 ameaadas (EN) e 147 com dados deficientes (DD), as restantes includas na categoria de baixo risco (LR). Das 38 Unidades de Conservao do estado, nove so consideradas prioritrias para levantamentos florsticos de brifitas e 13 importantes centros de diversidade no estado. Dezoito reas so indicadas como prioritrias para a implantao de novas Unidades de Conservao ou ampliao das j existentes. This work is a contribution to the "Projeto Flora do Estado do Rio de Janeiro" and its objectives are: to present a cheklist of the bryophyte taxa to the state; to make a diagnosis of the diversity and importance of the bryophyte taxa in the conservation of the ecosystems; to create a data base for the bryophyte taxa. In total are recognized 1,039 taxa in 308 genera and 95 families of bryophytes to the state, of which 11 are new records. The 10 largest families account for 50% of the total diversity. For the hepatics, the neotropical distribution pattern predominate and for the mosses, the endemic to Brazil. In relation to the altitude variation, the hepatics show the highest diversity in the lowland to montane areas, while the mosses in the montane and uppermontane ones. There are 91 counties in the state, and only 34 present records of the bryophytes. One hundred and twenty five taxa are considered vulnerable (VU), 25 endangered (EN) and 147 with deficient data (DD), the remains had been enclosed in the low risk (LR). There are 38 Units of Conservation in the state, 9 are considered priorities for floristic surveys of bryophytes and 13 are important centers of diversity in the state. Eighteen areas are indicated as priorities for implantation of new Conservation Units or enlargment of already the existing ones.

23498266|So apresentados dados sobre a anatomia das flores estaminadas e pistiladas de Smilax fluminensis, objetivando fornecer subsdios que auxiliem na delimitao da espcie. As caractersticas anatmicas do pedicelo e das tpalas so semelhantes nas flores estaminadas e pistiladas. As flores estaminadas tm seis estames, dois dentre eles tm dois feixes colaterais, enquanto os outros quatro so vascularizados por um s feixe; as anteras so bisporangiadas, introrsas e de deiscncia rimosa. As flores pistiladas possuem seis estamindios, no vascularizados; o gineceu  sincrpico, tricarpelar com um rudimento seminal (vulo) por lculo; os trs estigmas so ssseis e sulcados, com epiderme papilosa na face adaxial; cada carpelo apresenta dois feixes vasculares, o dorsal e o ventral, que vascularizam, respectivamente, o estigma e o rudimento seminal. Nectrios e osmforos ocorrem em ambas as flores. Nectrios esto presentes no pice das tpalas, estames, estamindios e na surperfcie adaxial dos estigmas. Alm dos nectrios, ocorrem osmforos na base das tpalas nas flores estaminadas e pistiladas. As caractersticas analisadas, tais como a presena de nmero varivel de estames (seis-sete) nas flores estaminadas, sugerem que, no curso da evoluo, tenha havido reduo no nmero de estames em S. fluminensis. Anatomy of staminate and pistillate flowers from Smilax fluminensis L. is presented with objective to supply data to identify the species. Pedicel and tepals are anatomically similar in both flowers. The staminate flowers have six stamens. Two of them present two collateral bundles, while the other four have only one. Anthers are bisporangiated, introrse, with longitudinal dehiscent aperture. Nectaries and osmophorous are found in both flowers. Nectaries are present on the apex of the tepals, stamens and the adaxial surface of the stigma; osmophorous occur on tepals and in the basis of filament. Pistillate flowers have six staminodies that haven't vascular tissues. Gynoecium is syncarp, tricarpellate and presents one ovule per loculus. Three sessile and sulcated stigmas are present. Each carpel presents a dorsal and ventral vascular bundles that supply stigma and ovule, respectively. The occasional difference in the number of the stamens (six-seven) and the fact that two of them are supplied by two vascular bundles, suggest a reduction of the stamens during evolution.
23498269|Este trabalho apresenta a listagem, distribuio geogrfica e estado de conservao das espcies de Cactaceae no estado do Rio de Janeiro. Foram utilizadas como referncia as colees dos principais herbrios do estado e a literatura especializada. Os resultados apontam a ocorrncia de 45 espcies subordinadas a 13 gneros. Dez espcies foram listadas dentro de categorias de ameaa e sete so endmicas para o estado. A maior riqueza para a famlia foi encontrada no municpio do Rio de Janeiro que, apesar da alta presso antrpica, apresenta 30 espcies. Destaca-se, no levantamento, o gnero Rhipsalis, como o mais representativo, com 23 espcies. This work presents the Cactaceae checklist with geographical distribution and conservation status for the Rio de Janeiro State. The collections of the main herbaria in the State and the related bibliography were used as source of data. The results indicate the occurrence of 45 species distributed in 13 genera. Ten species are listed under threat categories and seven are State endemics. Despite the elevated urbanization pressure Rio de Janeiro was found as the most diverse municipality with 30 species. The genus Rhipsalis is notable in this checklist presenting 23 species.
23498273|As variaes da composio da flora arbrea de 60 reas de floresta atlntica sensu lato (ombrfilas e semidecduas) da regio das Bacias do Leste, englobando o sul da Bahia, o Esprito Santo, o leste de Minas Gerais e o norte do Rio de Janeiro, so analisadas em articulao com variveis geogrficas e climticas. Listagens de espcies so fornecidas para 16 destas reas. Anlises multivariadas detectaram trs padres de distribuio. (a) A diferenciao entre florestas ombrfilas e semidecduas na regio  floristicamente consistente e fortemente correlacionada com a sazonalidade do regime de chuvas. A flora arbrea das florestas semidecduas , em boa medida, um subconjunto da flora das florestas ombrfilas, extraindo espcies provavelmente mais eficientes em resistir e competir sob condies de seca mais prolongada. (b) Existe uma diferenciao latitudinal tanto para florestas ombrfilas e semidecduas, que aproxima floristicamente as duas fisionomias dentro da mesma faixa latitudinal. Este padro  causado provavelmente por variaes trmicas e pluviomtricas. As florestas ombrfilas so interrompidas no norte fluminense devido ao clima estacional, mas isto no tem como contrapartida uma disjuno na distribuio de espcies arbreas. (c) As variaes da altitude esto fortemente correlacionadas com a diferenciao interna tanto das florestas ombrfilas como das semidecduas. Variations in tree species composition of 60 areas of atlantic forest sensu lato (rain- and semideciduous forests) of Central-Eastern Brazil are analyzed in combination with geographic and climatic variables. Floristic checklists are provided for 16 areas. Multivariate analyses detected three main distribution patterns. (a) Differentiation between rain- and semideciduous forests in the region is floristically consistent and strongly correlated with rainfall seasonality. To a considerable extent, the tree flora of semideciduous forests is a subset of that of rainforests, extracting species that are more efficient in coping with a longer dry season. (b) There is a latitudinal differentiation for both rain- and semideciduous forests, that draws the two physiognomies together floristically present within the same latitudinal range. This pattern is probably caused by variations of both temperature and rainfall. The rainforests are interrupted in northern Rio de Janeiro state, due to the seasonal climate, but this has no counterpart in disrupted species distribution. (c) Variations in altitude are strongly correlated to internal variations of both rain- and semideciduous forests.
23498267|As algas calcrias incrustantes ocupam grande variedade de habitats nos substratos duros. Neste estudo as caractersticas morfolgicas destas algas foram relacionadas  influncia de fatores ambientais. Coletas foram realizadas na Praia do Forno (RJ) utilizando transectos de linha com 10 m de comprimento com 30 pontos aleatrios para quantificao das algas calcrias. Aspectos morfolgicos externos foram observados no estereomicroscpio e sees histolgicas preparadas para identificao dos grupos/txons. Seis grupos morfo-funcionais foram identificados sendo quatro mais abundantes: Hydrolithon samonse (Foslie) D. Keats & Y. Chamberlain dominou na regio do mesolitoral (53%) e no sublitoral (57-87%) junto  cloroficea Codium spongiosum Harvey e em locais desprovidos de outras algas, expostos  ao das ondas e alta densidade de ourios herbvoros. Spongites sp. foi abundante prximo s fendas nas rochas do mesolitoral (39-40%). Lithophyllum sp. dominou desde o mesolitoral (44%) at o sublitoral junto  Codium (43-74%) e Sargassum (74-93%). Houve discreta variao temporal na distribuio de H. samonse e Lithophyllum sp. Talos protuberantes em Lithophyllum dominaram em locais de maior sedimentao enquanto talos planos de H. samonse e Spongites sp. dominaram em locais de maior herbivoria. A distribuio dos grupos morfo-funcionais nos diferentes habitats concorda com padres associados aos distrbios biticos e abiticos, previstos para comunidades de costes rochosos. The crustose coralline algae occupy several different habitats in the rocky shores. In this study morphological characteristics of these algae were related to the influence of environmental factors. The algae collection was done at Praia do Forno (RJ) using 10 m transects lines with 30 random points to quantify coralline algae. The morphological aspects were observed by a stereomicroscope and anatomic sections were prepared to identify the groups/taxons. Six morphological groups were identified being four more abundant. Hydrolithon samonse (Foslie) D. Keats & Y. Chamberlain dominated on the littoral (53%) and sublittoral zones together with the chlorophyte Codium spongiosum Harvey and on barren rocks, exposed to wave action and high density of herbivorous sea-urchins (57-87%). Spongites sp was abundant on nearby rocky crevices on the littoral zone (39-40%). Lithophyllum sp. dominated from littoral (44%) to sublitoral zones together with Codium (43-74%) and Sargassum (74-93%). There was inconspicuous seasonal variation on the distribution of H. samonse and Lithophyllum sp. Protuberant thalli of Lithophyllum dominated in places under high sedimentation while flat thalli of H. samonse and Spongites dominated in areas with high herbivory. The distribution of form-functional groups in different habitats agrees with patterns associated with biotic and abiotic disturbances, expected for rocky shore communities.
23498268|O trabalho trata da famlia Opiliaceae na rea da Reserva Ecolgica do IBGE, situada em Braslia, Distrito Federal, com base na representatividade da famlia em colees de herbrios e observaes de campo. 23498265|A etnobotnica vem sendo definida como o estudo das sociedades humanas em suas relaes com as plantas.  uma disciplina antiga em sua prtica, mas jovem em sua teoria. A pesquisa etnobotnica cresceu na ltima dcada, especialmente na Amrica Latina. Esse crescimento exigiu o entendimento da disciplina na sua diversidade terico-metodolgica, conseqncia do seu carter interdisciplinar e necessidade da sistematizao da mesma. Este trabalho buscou resgatar e avaliar o ensino formal da etnobotnica em instituies brasileiras, a partir de questionrios enviados a Instituies de ensino e pesquisa no pas. Utilizou-se ainda a via eletrnica para atualizaes referentes aos cursos de graduaes. Foram encontradas 13 instituies que oferecem etnobotnica como disciplina especfica, e 27 instituies, em que a etnobotnica no  oferecida formalmente, sendo abordada apenas como tpico, principalmente relacionada aos cursos da rea de Cincias Biolgicas. Tanto os cursos com disciplinas especficas quanto aqueles em que consta como tpico, concentram-se nas instituies das Regies Sudeste (51%) e Nordeste (31%). O trabalho incluiu tambm uma avaliao dos contedos programticos das disciplinas e bibliografias utilizadas. Os dados mostraram uma tendncia de crescimento do ensino formal da etnobotnica tanto na graduao quanto na ps-graduao no Brasil. Ethnobotany is the study of human societies and their relationship with plants. It is an old discipline in practice, but young in theory. Ethnobotanical research has grown perceptibly in the past decade in many parts of the world, especially in Latin America. This growth calls for a broader understanding of the discipline in all its theoretical and methodological divesity. The interdisciplinary nature of ethnobotany also requires a greater academic systematization. This study focuses on the assessment of formal teaching methods of ethnobotany in Brazilian universities. Data were gathered from questionnaires sent over the Internet and filled out by graduate-course coordinators in Brazil, and by members of the Brazilian Ethnobotanical Committee of the Botanical Society of Brazil, and of the Brazilian Society of Ethnobiology and Ethnoecology. Thirteen Brazilian universities offer Ethnobotany as a specific discipline and in 27 other institutions, Ethnobotany is included as a topic in other disciplines. In both cases, these courses are generally offered by universities in Northeastern and Southeastern Brazil. The study included an evaluation of the contents as well as of references used in the courses. The data showed a strong tendency for growth of formal teaching of Ethnobotany in Brasil at both the undergraduate and graduate levels.
23498259|Buscamos analisar os trs primeiros anos do peridico cientfico Rodrigusia, publicado desde 1935. Essa primeira fase referese ao perodo em que a revista foi editada pelo Instituto de Biologia Vegetal, Jardim Botnico e Estao Biolgica de Itatiaia e tinha uma proposta de alcanar um pblico mais amplo que a divulgao entre pares e abranger um escopo alm da taxonomia botnica, como a entomologia agrcola, fitopatologia, gentica e ecologia agrcola. We analyzed the first three years of the scientific journal Rodrigusia that is being published since 1935. During this period, the journal was edited by the Instituto de Biologia Vegetal, Jardim Botnico and Estao Biolgica de Itatiaia. It had the purpose to reach other people over the scientific community including areas other than the Taxonomic Botany, such as Agricultural Entomology, Phytopatology, Genetics, and Agricultural Ecology.
23498261|Este trabalho visa contribuir para o melhor conhecimento da flor de Marsdenia loniceroides e fornecer subsdios  taxonomia de Asclepiadoideae. So apresentados dados relativos ao desenvolvimento e  anatomia floral da espcie e  analisada a origem da corona e dos transladores, assim como das estruturas localizadas entre as spalas e o tubo da corola, que so consideradas emergncias glandulares. As coronas de Marsdenia loniceroides tm origem estaminal e so desprovidas de vascularizao. Os transladores (retinculo e caudculas) so originados pela atividade secretora das clulas que revestem a cabea estilar e as emergncias glandulares tm origem na face interna das spalas. Esses trs aspectos  origem das coronas, formao dos transladores e origem e natureza das emergncias  caracterizam a espcie em anlise. Deve-se ressaltar que os demais aspectos anatmicos correspondem ao padro da subfamlia. Neste trabalho, denomina-se tubo floral ao conjunto formado pelo tubo da corola e pelo tubo estaminal. This work aims to contribute to a better knowlodge about the Marsdenia loniceroides flower, with the objective of providing subsidies to taxonomy of the subfamily Asclepiadoideae. Data about the development and floral anatomy of this species is presented. It is analized the origin of the corona, translators and the structures situated between the sepals and corola tube. These structures are considered glandular emergences. Marsdenia loniceroides corona has staminal origin and it are not vascularizated. Translators (retinaculum and caudiculum) are originated by the cells secretory activity that covers the stylar head, and the glandular emergences are originated in sepals internal face. These aspects  corona's and translators' origin, emergences' origin and its constitution are characteristics of this species. It must be emphasized that the other anatomic aspects correspond to the subfamily pattern. In this work the set consisted by corola tube and staminal tube is considered floral tube.

23497619|The Ducke Reserve in the central Amazon was the subject of an intensive floristic study between 1992 and 1999. The project showed that the biodiversity of the Reserve was much higher than had been anticipated. Data are presented chronicling the history of botanical exploration of the area. Based on the experience of the project, recomendations are made about procedures of inventory of plant species in tropical forest. A Reserva Ducke na Amaznia central foi o alvo de um estudo florstico intensivo entre 1992 e 1999. O projeto mostrou que a biodiversidade na Reserva era bem maior do que havia sido estimada anteriormente. So apresentados dados ilustrando a histria de explorao botnica na rea. 23498757|Persea willdenovii  uma espcie arbrea cuja ocorrncia foi registrada desde o estado de Minas Gerais at o Rio Grande do Sul, principalmente nas formaes de altitude. P. willdenovii encontra-se ameaada de extino no Rio Grande do Sul, principalmente devido ao amplo emprego fitoterpico. Para identificar e caracterizar aspectos relevantes na produo de mudas de P. willdenovii, foi conduzida uma srie de experimentos, visando  propagao atravs de sementes e de partes vegetativas. Nos experimentos visando  propagao sexuada, a emergncia ocorreu aps um perodo mnimo de 34 dias. Tambm foi observada associao da germinao a um perodo de declnio da temperatura ambiente. Nos experimentos visando  propagao vegetativa, P. willdenovii apresentou limitaes, principalmente a restrio do potencial morfognico aos tecidos juvenis, a presena de contaminao de origem endgena e o alto ndice de oxidao dos tecidos. A propagao vegetativa foi viabilizada a partir de tecidos de plntulas germinadas in vitro. Assim, foi possvel registrar a resposta da espcie s estratgias mais comuns de propagao, identificar os problemas a serem resolvidos para viabilizar a multiplicao, alm de gerar 300 novas plantas a partir de duas matrizes. Persea willdenovii is a woody plant recorded growing in some Brazilian States, from Minas Gerais to Rio Grande do Sul, mainly in higher altitudes. P. willdenovii in Rio Grande do Sul is in danger of extinction, as the local people use this plant for phytotherapic purposes. To identify important aspects of P. willdenovii propagation, tests where conducted with seeds and vegetative structures. The germination of seed took a minimum of 34 days, associated with a decline of the temperature. P. willdenovii showed limitations to the vegetative propagation: morphogenic potential restricted to the juvenile tissues, presence of endogenous contamination, and high level of phenolic oxidation. Vegetative propagation was only possible with the use of juvenile tissues of plantlets germinated in vitro. By means of this sequence of tests it was possible to record responses to current propagation techniques, to identify problems to be solved in order to regenerate new plants, and to obtain 300 new plants from only two specimens.

Morales, a new species endemic to the Cordillera of Guanacaste in Costa Rica is described and illustrated and its relationship with G. schultesii Standl. is discussed. A key to the species of the genus Connarus in Costa Rica is included.

23498762|O presente trabalho apresenta a anlise florstica das pteridfitas ocorrentes no fragmento florestal Engenho gua Azul, municpio de Timbaba, estado de Pernambuco, Brasil. A rea abrange cerca de 600 ha de vegetao que se enquadra no tipo Floresta Ombrfila Densa Submontana, com altitudes entre 304-451m, e coordenadas geofrficas 3522'42,9"W-0736'31,5"S. Os resultados indicaram a ocorrncia de 16 famlias, 42 gneros e 85 espcies. As famlias mais representadas na rea em nmero de espcies foram Pteridaceae com 18, Polypodiaceae e Dryopteridaceae, ambas com 10, e Thelypteridaceae com oito. Em nmero de gneros foram Dryopteridaceae e Polypodiaceae ambas com sete e Pteridaceae com seis. Os gneros com maior nmero de espcies so Adiantum (12 spp.) e Thelypteris (7 spp.). A pteridoflora estudada est representada por 53 espcies com distribuio geogrfica restrita s Amricas, nove espcies Pantropicais, 13 espcies restrita a Amrica do Sul e oito espcies restritas ao Brasil. A maioria das espcies se apresentou como terrcolas e hemicriptfitas rosuladas, ocorrendo no interior da mata em barrancos ao longo de cursos d'gua e afloramentos rochosos. This study presents a floristic survey of the pteridophytes occurring in the forest fragment of Engenho gua Azul, municipality of Timbaba, State of Pernambuco, Brazil. The area has about 600 ha Atlantic forest with 304-451m altitude, and geographical coordinates 3522'42,9"W-0736'31,5"S. The study indicated the occurrence of 16 families, 42 genera, and 85 species. The most representative families in number of species were Pteridaceae with 18, Polypodiaceae and Dryopteridaceae both with 10 and Thelypteridaceae with eight, and in number of genera were Dryopteridaceae and Polypodiaceae both with seven and Pteridaceae with six. The genera with the highest number of species were Adiantum (12 spp.) and Thelypteris (7 spp.). The Pteridophytic flora is represented by 53 species with geographical distribution restricted to America, nine species Pantropical, 13 species for the South America and eight species restricted to Brazil. Most species are terrestrial and hemicriptophitic, occurring in the interior of the forest fragment in cliffs along courses of creeks and rocky.
23498767|O presente estudo teve como objetivo revelar padres de diversidade nos campos rupestres, gerando informaes teis  conservao. O estudo desenvolvido em quatro locais na Chapada Diamantina, todos eles em topos de serras e morros, incluiu dois tipos principais de fisionomias abertas: uma mais campestre e contnua (habitat entremeio) e outra mais arbustiva e insular (habitat afloramento). A vegetao foi amostrada em cada um dos quatro locais por quatro parcelas aleatrias simples de 10  10 m. Alm dessas 16 parcelas, mais 16 foram estratificadas ao habitat afloramento, quatro em cada local. Foram analisadas as riquezas em espcies, famlias, criptgamas vasculares, eudicotiledneas, monocotiledneas, alm das estimativas das reas de coberturas das plantas vasculares (vegetao) e dos liquens. Do total de 202 espcies, 11 foram criptgamas vasculares e 191 foram angiospermas (97 monocotiledneas, 93 eudicotiledneas e uma Piperaceae). Foi verificado aumento do nmero de espcies conforme os aumentos de rea de vegetao e de inclinao at 13. A variao da rea de vegetao entre os locais no foi significativa, assim como as riquezas em espcies, em famlias, em espcies de eudicotiledneas e monocotiledneas, sugerindo a existncia de certa estabilidade, apesar do dendrograma de similaridade demonstrar que a composio de espcies entre os locais varia. Diferenas significativas entre as reas de liquens e o nmero de espcies criptgamas vasculares indicam algumas distines entre os locais, provavelmente decorrentes de fatores como umidade e isolamento. This study aims at detecting patterns of diversity on campos rupestres, providing useful information to conservation strategies. Four sites in the Chapada Diamantina's summits were studied, including two kinds of open physiognomies, one more grassy and homogenous (continuous habitat) and the other more shrubby and heterogeneous (insular habitat). The vegetation in each one of the four sites was sampled by four simple random 10  10 m units. Besides these 16 units, more 16 were stratified to the insular habitat, four in each site. The number of species, families, vascular cryptogams, eudicots, and monocots, besides coverage areas estimations of vascular plants (vegetation) and lichens were analyzed. The total number of species was 202, 11 vascular cryptogams and 191 flowering plants (97 monocots, 93 eudicots, and one Piperaceae). The number of species increases with vegetation area and slope up to 13. Similarity cluster shows that species compositions are different among the sites studied. Nevertheless, vegetation area between them did not show significant differences, like species richness, family richness, mono and eudicot richness, suggesting a relative steady system. The areas of lichens and vascular cryptogams were different among sites, which is probably affected by different humidity and insulation.
23498759|Muitas angiospermas dependem da ao de animais para sua polinizao. Embora a maioria das interaes entre plantas e polinizadores no aparentem ser to peculiares,de certa forma, parecem envolver algum grau de adaptao mtua de flor e animal. A morfologia floral  um dos mais importantes aspectos de interaes planta-polinizador, pois determina a acessibilidade do polinizador ao nctar e a eficincia da deposio do plen no corpo do polinizador e da aquisio do plen pelo estigma. O presente trabalho pretende propor e validar uma metodologia que permita testar hipteses quanto  existncia de correlao morfolgica entre flores e polinizadores. Uma abordagem de anlise de srie temporal foi proposta como medida de esforo observacional e a morfometria de comprimento e curvatura de corolas de bromlias e bicos de beija-flores foram utilizados como descritores para um teste de ajustamento, realizado por regresso logstica. Em pequena escala, envolvendo quatro espcies de bromlias e sete de beija-flores, resultados levaram  rejeio da hiptese da existncia de restries morfolgicas exercidas pelas bromlias no sentido de selecionar beija-flores pelo comprimento ou pela curvatura de seus bicos. Many angiosperms depend on animals for their pollination. Although most of the interactions between plants and pollinators do not seem to be so peculiar, everything seems to involve some degree of mutual adaptation between flowers and animals. Floral morphology is one of the most important aspects of plant-pollinator interactions, because it drives the floral resource accessibility by pollinators. This paper aims to propose and validate a methodology to test hypothesis on morphological correlation between flowers and their pollinators. A temporal series approach was made as an estimation of observational effort. The morphometry of cord and curvature of flower tubes and hummingbird bills were used as descriptors for an adjustment test made by logistic regression. In this modeling scale, with four bromeliads and seven hummingbird species, we rejected the hypothesis of the existence of morphological restriction imposed by bromeliads on the hummingbird selection, by means of its bill length or curvature.
23498768|Foi realizado o estudo das pteridfitas ocorrentes na APA Ferno Dias, situada no extremo sul do estado de Minas Gerais, na Serra da Mantiqueira, abrangendo reas dos municpios de Camanducaia, Gonalves, Extrema e Itapeva. Esta regio encontrase entre 1.000 e 2.068 metros de altitude, em zona de tenso ecolgica entre as florestas tropicais montanas e submontanas. Constatou-se a ocorrncia de 173 espcies de pteridfitas, distribudas em 23 famlias e 55 gneros. As famlias mais representativas foram Polypodiaceae (21 spp.), Thelypteridaceae (18 spp.), Lomariopsidaceae (17 spp.), Pteridaceae e Aspleniaceae (13 spp. cada), Blechnaceae e Hymenophyllaceae (12 spp. cada), Grammitidaceae (10 spp.) e Lycopodiaceae (8 spp.). Os gneros com maior nmero de espcies foram Thelypteris e Elaphoglossum (17 spp. cada), Asplenium (13 spp.), Blechnum (12 spp.), Trichomanes (7 spp.), Campyloneurum (6 spp.), Pecluma, Polypodium, Huperzia e Hymenophyllum (5 spp. cada). A maioria das espcies  terrestre com distribuio neotropical. Athyrium filix-femina (L.) Roth. consiste na primeira referncia para Minas Gerais. Este estudo revelou a presena de uma espcie ameaada de extino (Dicksonia sellowiana Hook.) e trs presumivelmente ameaadas (Alsophila capensis (L.f.) J. Sm., Dryopteris patula (Sw.) Underw. e Botrychium virginianum (L.) Sw.), constantes da Lista Vermelha das Espcies Ameaadas de Extino da Flora de Minas Gerais. A floristic inventory of pteridophytes was carried out in the APA Ferno Dias, located in Serra da Mantiqueira, on the southern of Minas Gerais State, including the municipalities of Camanducaia, Gonalves, Extrema and Itapeva. This region is situated between 1.000 and 2.068 meters of altitude, in a zone of Tropical seasonal semideciduous and Tropical rain forests. A total of 173 pteridophyte species were identified, distributed in 23 families and 55 genera. The most representative families were Polypodiaceae (21 spp.), Thelypteridaceae (18 spp.), Lomariopsidaceae (17 spp.), Pteridaceae and Aspleniaceae (13 spp. each), Blechnaceae and Hymenophyllaceae (12 spp. each), Grammitidaceae (10 spp.) and Lycopodiaceae (8 spp.). The genera with the highest numbers of species were Thelypteris and Elaphoglossum (17 spp. each), Asplenium (13 spp.), Blechnum (12 spp.), Trichomanes (7 spp.), Campyloneurum (6 spp.), Pecluma, Polypodium, Huperzia and Hymenophyllum (5 spp. each). Most of the species were terrestrial and has a Neotropical distribution. Athyrium filix-femina (L.) Roth. is the first record for the Minas Gerais State. This study has also identified the presence of a species threatened with extinction, Dicksonia sellowiana Hook., and of three species presumably threatened: Alsophila capensis (Sw.) Conant, Dryopteris patula (Sw.) Underw. and Botrychium virginianum (L.) Sw., included in the Red List of Threatened Species of the Flora of Minas Gerais State.
23498763|O subgnero Ligustrina  caracterizado, dentro do gnero Polygala, sobretudo, pela presena de glndulas, geralmente cilndricas, laterais  base do pecolo e, freqentemente, na raque da inflorescncia; pelo estilete terminado em uma cavidade preestigmtica infundibuliforme; por um disco subanular chanfrado lateralmente, circundando a base do ovrio. O subgnero  restrito  Amrica do Sul. Na busca de melhor delimitar os txons desse subgnero, procede-se a anlise morfolgica de caracteres vegetativos, florais e frutferos. So includas, tambm, nas anlises morfolgicas, a epiderme e a vascularizao da lmina foliar e a testa das sementes, por meio da microscopia eletrnica de varredura (MEV). Os txons so descritos, ilustrados, comentados e discutidos quanto as questes taxonmicas e nomenclaturais; dados sobre distribuio geogrfica e formaes vegetacionais so apresentados, bem como chave para a identificao das espcies e variedades. Os resultados obtidos definem 11 espcies e sete variedades subordinadas ao subgnero Ligustrina. Dentre estes txons descreve-se uma nova espcie e trs novas variedades. As espcies P. bangiana e P. insignis so restabelecidas; P. autranii  redefinida como variedade de P. spectabilis e P. sinuata  proposta como novo sinnimo de P. laureola. The subgenus Ligustrina is characterized specially by the glands, generally cylindric, situated laterally at the base of the petiole and frequently in the rachis of the inflorescence and for the style terminated in one pre-stigmatic funnel - shaped hollow and by a sublunar disk laterally eleved that surrounds the ovary basis. The subgenus Ligustrina is restrieted to the South America. A detailed analysis of the floral and vegetative morphology characteristics of the subgenus, was realized, with the aim of to obtain a better delimitation of the taxa. It includes observations about the epidermis and leaf blade venation; the seeds are examined at scanning eletronic microscope. The specific and infraspecific taxa are described, illustrated, commented and discussed with relation to the taxonomic and nomenclatural questions. An identification key for the species and subgenus Ligustrina comprises 11 species and seven varieties. Among these taxa, a new species and three varieties are described. The species P. bangiana e P. insignis are restablished; P. autranii is redefinided as one variety and P. sinuata is proposed as a new synonym of P. laureola.
23498765|Os campos rupestres sobre canga so um ambiente peculiar e freqente na regio do Quadriltero Ferrfero, Minas Gerais. Sua vegetao, associada a afloramentos hematticos, apresenta uma srie de adaptaes morfolgicas e fiosiolgicas, assim como alto grau de endemismo. Foi realizado um leventamento florstico, restrito s fanergamas, e uma caracterizao descritiva dos campos rupestres sobre canga na Serra da Calada. Para tal, realizaram-se campanhas de campo mensais, entre junho de 2001 e agosto de 2002, e foram analisados exemplares depositados no herbrio BHCB. O levantamento contou com 358 espcies distribudas em 70 famlias, sendo as famlias mais ricas Poaceae (43 spp.), Asteraceae (42 spp.), Fabaceae e Myrtaceae (21 spp. cada), Melastomataceae e Orchidaceae (18 spp. cada). A maioria das espcies (210 spp.) ocorre em canga nodular, 153 em canga couraada, 93 em capes de mata e 47 em reas antropizadas. O alto grau de ameaa a que este ambiente est submetido e a presena expressiva de espcies ameaadas de extino implicam na necessidade urgente de preservao de reas que compreendem campos rupestres sobre canga. Ferrugineous rocky grasslands are a peculiar environment frequently found at the "Quadriltero Ferrifero" region, Minas Gerais State. The vegetation, associated to hematitic outcrops, presents physiological and morphological adaptations, as well as high levels of endemism. A floristic survey, restricted to phanerogames, and a descriptive characterization of the ferrugineous rocky grasslands of Serra da Calada are presented. Studies of specimens collected from July 2001 and August 2002 were complemented by exame of collections deposited at BHCB Herbarium. A total of 358 species distributed in 70 families were registred. The richest families were Poaceae (43 spp.), Asteraceae (42 spp.), Fabaceae and Myrtaceae (21 spp. each), Melastomataceae and Orchidaceae (18 spp. each). Most of the species (210 spp.) occur on grassy fields (or "canga nodular"), while 153 occur on rocky fields (or "canga couraada"), 93 on forest islands and 47 on anthropized areas. Ferrugineus grasslands is under threatened due to mining exploration and urban development, therefore urgent conservation measures are essential to protect threatened plant species.
