23500129|Uma nova espcie de Apocynaceae, Rauvolfia anomala Rapini & I. Koch,  descrita e ilustrada. Ela foi encontrada em cerrado-ano, na Chapada dos Guimares, estado do Mato Grosso, simpatricamente a R. weddelliana. Aparentemente, as duas espcies so proximamente relacionadas, mas podem ser facilmente distinguidas pelas flores, cuja corola  esverdeada, com lobos mais longos que o tubo em R. anomala, enquanto em R. weddelliana ela  avermelhada, com lobos mais curtos que o tubo. A nova espcie apresenta um polimorfismo floral surpreendente e pode se tratar de um novo exemplo de dioicia no gnero. Esta  a primeira espcie de Rauvolfia com distribuio restrita registrada para o Mato Grosso. A new species of Apocynaceae, Rauvolfia anomala Rapini & I. Koch, is described and illustrated. It was found in low savanna of Chapada dos Guimares, Mato Grosso state, sympatric with R. weddelliana. The two species seem to be closely related, but can be easily distinguished by the flowers, whose corolla is greenish, with lobes longer than the tube in R. anomala, or reddish with lobes shorter than the tube in R. weddelliana. The new species has remarkable floral polymorphism and possibly represents a new example of dioicy in the genus. This is the first species of Rauvolfia with narrow distribution reported to Mato Grosso.

While updating the list of species of the tribe Spermacoceae (Rubiaceae) from Brazil, the nomenclature of five published Diodia names was examined. We present two new combinations Diodella angustata (Steyerm.) E.L. Cabral & A. Cabaa-Fader and Mitracarpus froesii (Sucre) E.L. Cabral & E.B. Souza. Diodia barbeyana is included as new synonym of D. gardneri, Diodia microcarpa is cited as new synonym of Borreria palustris, and D. appariciana as a new synonym of Borreria multiflora.
23500131|A new species of Diderma (Physarales, Didymiaceae) was recorded in the Mata Estrela Private Nature Reserve, Rio Grande do Norte state. 23500138|Axonopus P.Beauv. es un gnero nativo del continente americano, del que se conocen cerca de 72 especies, principalmente concentradas en el norte de Sudamrica, con algunos representantes aparentemente introducidos en el Viejo Mundo. Axonopus P.Beauv. is an American genus with ca. 72 species, mainly distributed in northern South America, with some species apparently introduced in the Old World. Additionally, the name Axonopus kuhlmannii G.A.Black, endemic to Brazil, is accepted as distinct species. 23500123|Uma nova espcie de Oxypetalum, O. laciniatum Rapini & Farinaccio,  descrita e ilustrada. Ela foi coletada apenas uma vez, em mata higrfila, no sul do estado da Bahia, e pertence ao complexo O. cordifolium (Vent.) Schltr. Diferencia-se prontamente das demais espcies desse grupo pelas flores com lacnias da corola mais longas (ca. 2,85 cm compr.), polnios mais curtos (at 0,3 mm compr., cerca de um tero do comprimento do retinculo) e apndice do ginostgio com pice levemente bifurcado em ramos subparalelos. A new species of Oxypetalum, O. laciniatum Rapini & Farinaccio, is described and illustrated. It was collected only once in the moist forest of southern Bahia, and belongs to the O. cordifolium (Vent.) Schltr. species complex. The new species, however, can be promptly distinguished from the others in this group by the flowers with longer lacinia (ca. 2.85 cm long), shorter pollinia (up to 0.3 mm long; about 1/3 of the corpusculum length), and appendix of gynostegium with apex slightly bifid in subparallel branches.

23500127|Pera manausensis Bigio & Secco, uma nova espcie de Euphorbiaceae endmica de Manaus, Amazonas,  descrita e ilustrada. Esta espcie  afim de P. decipiens Muell. Arg., P. bicolor (Klotzsch) Muell. Arg. e P. tomentosa (Benth.) Muell. Arg., mas separa-se destas por ser a nica a apresentar face abaxial da folha com tricomas lepidoto-estrelados, emaranhados, flores estaminadas com clice 3-lobado e pistildio filiforme, e flores pistiladas com ovrio tomentoso, estigma 3-lobado, lobos bipartidos e estamindios sepalides, filiformes. Discusses sobre as afinidades do novo txon, bem como uma chave para separao das espcies mais prximas, so apresentadas. Pera manausensis Bigio & Secco, a new species of Euphorbiaceae endemic to Manaus, Amazonas, is described and illustrated. This species is closely related to P. decipiens Muell. Arg., P. bicolor (Klotzsch) Muell. Arg. and P. tomentosa (Benth.) Muell. Arg., but can be recognized by the following: leaf abaxial surface with entangled, lepidote-stellate trichomes; staminate flowers with calyx 3-lobed and pistillodium filiform; pistillate flowers with tomentose ovary, stigma 3-lobed, lobes bifid, and staminodia sepaloid, filiform. The affinities of the new taxon are discussed and a key to separate closely related species is presented.

A new narrowly endemic species of the genus Anthurium is described from Bananal municipality in the state of So Paulo. Anthurium tomasiae is endemic to Serra da Bocaina, and belongs to section Urospadix subsection Flavescentiviridia. The species occurs in the Atlantic rain forest biome in humid rocky areas. 23500128|So descritas e ilustradas cinco novas espcies de Xyris (Xyridaceae): X. anamariae Wand. & Kral, X. fredericoi Wand., X. kralii Wand., X. nanuzae Wand. e X. piranii Wand., endmicas da Serra do Cip, na Cadeia do Espinhao de Minas Gerais. Xyris fredericoi, popularly known as "abacaxi-dourado" ("golden pineapple"), is one of the most ornamental species in the family and should be considered endangered.
23500124|From 1990 to 2006, 2,875 new angiosperm species were described in Brazil, including 280 new Bromeliaceae species. This publication rate is considered to be a useful indicator of floristic richness and also reveals the huge gaps in our knowledge of species that make up Brazilian biomes and the importance of taxonomy as a basic tool to assess biodiversity and conservation. The goal of modern taxonomists is in a race against time ordained by an unprecedented rate of global biodiversity loss, and therefore collaboration is vital to successfully close these gaps. This paper is the result of a broad cooperative research effort undertaken specifically to provide basic data on the identity of new components of Brazilian biological diversity. The authors describe and illustrate 22 new Bromeliaceae species from three subfamilies: Bromelioideae  Aechmea guaratingensis, A. paratiensis, A. rubroaristata, Cryptanthus capitellatus, C. venecianus, C. viridovinosus, Hohenbergia aechmeoides, H. arcuata, H. barbarespina, H. reconcavensis, Nidularium alegrense, Orthophytum teofilo-otonense, O. cearence; Pitcairnioideae  Dyckia espiritosantensis, D. nana, Pitcairnia capixaba; Tillandsioideae  Tillandsia castelensis, Vriesea euclidiana, V. fontanae, V. multifoliata, V. sanctateresensis and V. teresopolitana. No Brasil, entre 1990 e 2006, foram descritas 2.875 novas espcies de angiospermas, incluindo 280 novos membros para a famlia Bromeliaceae. Esses nmeros constituem um indicador tanto da riqueza florstica do pas, como tambm da grande lacuna de conhecimento das espcies que compem os biomas brasileiros, ao mesmo tempo em que destacam a importncia da taxonomia como uma ferramenta de base no mbito da catalogao da biodiversidade e da conservao. A tarefa dos taxonomistas modernos  hoje ditada por uma verdadeira corrida contra o tempo em razo da perda global da biodiversidade sem precedentes. Nesse processo, a colaborao  vital para suprir as lacunas do conhecimento. Este trabalho  o resultado de um amplo esforo cooperativo de pesquisa que tem o propsito de fornecer dados bsicos sobre a identidade de novas espcies que compem a biodiversidade brasileira. So aqui descritas e ilustradas 22 espcies novas de Bromeliaceae, pertencentes a trs subfamlias e nove gneros: BromelioideaeAechmea guaratingensis,A. paratiensis, A. rubroaristata, Cryptanthus capitellatus, C. venecianus, C. viridovinosus, Hohenbergia aechmeoides, H. arcuata, H. barbarespina, H. reconcavensis, Nidularium alegrense, Orthophytum teofilo-otonense, O. cearence; Pitcairnioideae  Dyckia espiritosantensis, D. nana, Pitcairnia capixaba; Tillandsioideae  Tillandsia castelensis, Vriesea euclidiana, V. fontanae, V. multifoliata, V. sanctateresensis e V. teresopolitana.
23500130|Lepidaploa opposita, a new species from the Atlantic Forest in southeastern Brazil, is described and illustrated. The new species is readily distinguished from other Lepidaploa species by the opposite leaves. This character is very unusual in this genus, as well as in subtribe Lepidaploinae and tribe Vernonieae. Lepidaploa opposita, uma nova espcie da Mata Atlntica no sudeste brasileiro,  descrita e ilustrada. A nova espcie distingue-se das demais do gnero pelas folhas opostas. Essa caracterstica  incomum no gnero, bem como na subtribo Lepidaploinae e tribo Vernonieae.
23500133|Here we propose lectotypification for Melastoma coccinea and Pleiochiton glaziovianum, neotypification for Clidemia suffruticosa, new combinations for C. blepharodes and C. parasitica into Pleiochiton, and the synonymization of C. suffruticosa under P. blepharodes. Neste trabalho so propostas lectotipificaes para Melastoma coccinea e Pleiochiton glaziovianum, a neotipificao de Clidemia suffruticosa, novas combinaes de C. blepharodes e C. parasitica em Pleiochiton e a sinonimizao de C. suffruticosa sob P. blepharodes.
23500140|This study adds new synonyms, combinations, and lectotypifications for the genus Bahuria. Three synonyms are proposed, Benevidesia (= Behuria), Behuria corymbosa var. grandifolia (= Behuria corymbosa) and Behuria souzalimae var. pallescens (= Behuria souzalimae), two new combinations, Behuria organensis (= Benevidesia organensis) and Behuria magdalenensis (= Benevidesia magdalenensis), and ten lectotypifications as follows: B. cordifolia, B. corymbosa, B. corymbosa var. grandifolia, B. glazioviana, B. glutinosa, B. insignis, B. magdalenensis, B. mouraei, B. organensis, and B. parvifolia. 23500731|Este trabalho verificou a influncia das condies ambientais na estrutura do xilema secundrio da espcie Caryocar brasiliense Camb. (pequizeiro) atravs de um estudo anatmico comparado do lenho de rvores procedentes de fisionomias de cerrado e cerrado s.s., no municpio de Santa Rita do Passa Quatro, SP. As caractersticas do lenho foram analisadas qualitativa e quantitativamente, sendo as ltimas comparadas pela anlise de varincia, bem como por anlises multivariadas de agrupamentos e componentes principais. A anlise de varincia demonstrou existir diferenas significativas para oito das dezesseis variveis analisadas, bem como uma grande variao entre rvores da mesma localidade, aspecto corroborado pela anlise de agrupamentos. A matriz de correlao entre variveis indicou, de modo geral, relaes inversas entre dimenses longitudinais e radiais dos elementos anatmicos. Pode-se inferir pela variabilidade significativa entre rvores que a diferenciao das fisionomias ocorre de forma gradual, no se observando um conjunto de caractersticas anatmicas suficientemente marcantes que tipifiquem as fisionomias estudadas. This study aimed to verify the influence of ambient conditions on the structure of secondary xylem of Caryocar brasiliense Camb. ("pequizeiro") through a comparative anatomical study of two populations belonging to "cerrado" and "cerrado s. s." (Brazilian savannas), in the city of Santa Rita do Passa Quatro, So Paulo. The wood was described qualitatively, and quantitative data were analyzed using analysis of variance, as well as multivariate and principal components analysis. The analysis of variance showed significant differences for eight out of sixteen anatomical parameters, as well as great variation between trees of the same locality, an aspect corroborated by multivariate analysis. The correlation matrix showed generally inverse correlations between longitudinal and radial measurements of the anatomical characters. Based on the significant variability found between trees we can infer that the differentiation of the formations occurs gradually, since a marked set of anatomical characters that would individualize each type of vegetation was not observed.
23500739|Os estudos florsticos voltados s plantas mecanicamente dependentes (lianas e epfitas) permitiram vislumbrar a possvel contribuio destes elementos para a riqueza e diversidade das florestas tropicais. No Brasil, o nmero de trabalhos enfocando especificamente o estudo florstico das lianas ainda  escasso. Nesse sentido, o presente estudo teve como objetivos caracterizar a composio florstica de lianas e de seus mecanismos de ascenso na Estao Ecolgica dos Caetetus, uma floresta estacional semidecidual do sudeste brasileiro, e apresentar chaves de identificao para as famlias e espcies de lianas deste fragmento florestal. Foram amostradas 74 espcies de 19 famlias, sendo as mais representativas Bignoniaceae (25 espcies), Sapindaceae (11), Apocynaceae (7), Malpighiaceae (7) e Fabaceae (6). Quanto aos mecanismos de ascenso, a forma prensil foi a mais frequente, ocorrendo em 57% das espcies. Baseando-se nos resultados obtidos e nos demais estudos florsticos que enfocaram essa forma de vida, foi possvel verificar que, para as florestas estacionais semideciduais do sudeste brasileiro, a famlia com maior riqueza especfica  Bignoniaceae, seguida por Sapindaceae e Malpighiacae, e o mecanismo de ascenso predominante para as espcies lenhosas  a forma prensil. Floristic studies dedicated to non-self-supporting plants (lianas and epiphytes) made possible a better understanding of the contribution of these plants to the species richness and diversity of tropical forests. However, in Brazil, floristic studies on lianas are still rare. This study aimed at characterizing the floristic composition of lianas and their climbing mechanisms in a seasonal semideciduous forest in the Caetetus Ecological Station in southeastern Brazil, and providing identification keys to families and species of this forest fragment. We found 74 species belonging to 19 families, of which Bignoniaceae (25 spp.) is the most representative, followed by Sapindaceae (11 spp.), Apocynaceae (7 spp.), Malpighiaceae (7 spp.), and Fabaceae (6 spp.). As regards the attachment mechanisms, gripping was the most frequent (observed on 57% of the species). Based on our results, as well as on previously published ones, we suggest that in seasonal semideciduous forests of southeastern Brazil, Bignoniaceae is the most species-rich family, followed by Sapindaceae and Malpighiaceae, and that gripping is the most frequent climbing mechanism of lianas.
23500736|Artocarpus heterophyllus Lam. (jackfruit) was man made introduced in Tijuca National Park (TNP) in the mid-1800s. Native from Southeast Asia, nowadays densely colonizes the TNP. Here we analyze some jackfruit population parameters that probably allowed the local colonization followed by successful invasion of the new habitat. Based on 20 sample plots, randomly placed inside 5 sites colonized by jackfruit, we described subpopulations hierarchical size diameter structures. Gini's coefficient values turned around 0.64 and Lorenz's asymmetry coefficient around 1.03, indicating that size hierarchies were very similar between sites. The five sites were also compared and do not differ based on jackfruit basal area, number of species, Shannon's index and canopy openness. Jackfruit may, therefore, be considered invasive in all these sites and the low tree diversity values (H' overall mean 0.74) also indicates that this exotic species locally excludes native ones. Artocarpus heterophyllus Lam. (Jaqueira) foi introduzida pelo homem no Parque Nacional da Tijuca (PNT), em meados do sculo XVIII. Nativa do sudeste da sia, esta espcie extica hoje coloniza densamente o PNT. Neste estudo analisamos alguns parmetros populacionais da jaqueira que provavelmente permitiram a colonizao local e conseqentemente a invaso bem sucedida deste novo habitat. A partir da amostragem de 20 parcelas alocadas aleatoriamente em cinco stios colonizados por jaqueiras, descrevemos as estruturas de dimetro das subpopulaes. Os coeficientes de Gini oscilaram em torno 0,64 e os de Lorenz 1,03, indicando hierarquia de tamanhos semelhante entre as amostras. Os cinco stios tambm foram comparados e no diferiram quanto  rea basal de jaqueiras, riqueza total de espcies, ndice de diversidade de Shannon e abertura do dossel. A jaqueira pode, portanto, ser considerada invasora em todos estes stios e os baixos valores de diversidade de rvores (H' em torno de 0,74) tambm podem indicar que esta espcie extica exclui localmente as espcies nativas.
23500738|O epifitismo  responsvel por parte significativa da diversidade de florestas tropicais, proporcionando recursos alimentares e microambientes especializados para a fauna de dossel. A comunidade de epfitas vasculares ocorrente em floresta alta de restinga na plancie litornea da Praia da Fazenda, Ncleo Picinguaba, ao norte do municpio de Ubatuba/SP, foi avaliada atravs de coletas mensais durante o perodo de um ano. Foram identificadas 64 espcies, 37 gneros e 12 famlias, sendo Orchidaceae, Bromeliaceae, Polypodiaceae e Araceae as mais representativas com 75% do total de espcies amostradas. A forma de vida mais rica encontrada foi a holoepfita obrigatria (73,4%), tendo as monocotiledneas como maioria (55,3%). Em seguida, apareceram as holoepfitas facultativas (14,1%), restritas s famlias Bromeliaceae e Lomariopsidaceae, as hemiepfitas secundrias (6,3%) e primrias (3,1%), exclusivamente da famlia Araceae, e as holoepfitas acidentais e preferenciais (1,6% cada). Vascular epiphytism plays a significant role in the diversity of tropical forests and it also provides food resources and microhabitats for specialized fauna of the canopy. We present the epiphyte community of a "restinga" high forest on the coastal plain of Fazenda Beach, Picinguaba Sector of Serra do Mar State Park, located in northern Ubatuba municipality/So Paulo. The vascular epiphyte species were sampled monthly for a period of one year, resulting in 64 species, 37 genera and 12 families identified. Orchidaceae, Bromeliaceae, Polypodiaceae and Araceae were the most representative families, totaling 75% of all species. The life form "true epiphytes" was the richest in species (73.4%), with a monocot majority (55.3%). Next in order are the "facultative" group (14.1%), exclusively Bromeliaceae and Lomariopsidaceae, the "secondary" group (6.3%) and "primary" (3.1%) hemiepiphytes, exclusively Araceae, and the "accidental" and "preferred" epiphytes (1.6% each).
23500730|Este estudo trata da flora de Desmodesmus An, Friedl & Hegew. e Scenedesmus Meyen, encontrada em lagoas isoladas, lagoas interligadas, banhados, audes e ambientes lticos da Plancie Costeira do Rio Grande do Sul. A composio taxonmica e as relaes entre a riqueza e a densidade com as variveis temperatura e pH foram avaliadas. O estudo baseou-se em 41 amostragens efetuadas no outono (perodo de guas altas) e na primavera (perodo de guas baixas) de 2003. Treze espcies e trs variedades de Desmodesmus, e duas espcies e uma variedade de Scenedesmus foram identificadas. Dentre essas espcies, quatro combinaes novas (Desmodesmus granulatus (W.& G.S. West.) Hentschke & Torgan, D. heteracanthus (Guerr.) Hentschke & Torgan, D. microspina (Chod.) Hentschke & Torgan e D. spinoso-aculeolatus (Chod.) Hentschke & Torgan) so propostas. As maiores riquezas e densidades foram observadas onde o pH apresentou valor mais baixo. A mdia de densidade (ind.mL1) de Desmodesmus e Scenedesmus na primavera foi significativamente maior que a mdia obtida no outono, devido provavelmente aos maiores valores de temperatura da gua, como tambm  diminuio do nvel de gua, o que possibilitou a maior concentrao de organismos. This study on the Desmodesmus An, Friedl & Hegew. and Scenedesmus Meyen flora was developed in isolated ponds, interlinked ponds, marshes, dams and lotic environments of the Rio Grande do Sul Coastal Plain. 41 samples collected in autumn and spring 2003 were analysed. 13 species and three varieties of Desmodesmus and two species and one variety of Scenedesmus were identified. Four new combinations were proposed: Desmodesmus granulatus (W. & G.S. West.) Hentschke & Torgan, D. heteracanthus (Guerr.) Hentschke & Torgan, D. microspina (Chod.) Hentschke & Torgan and D. spinoso-aculeolatus (Chod.) Hentschke & Torgan. The highest values of richness and density were observed in samples with lower pH. The average density (ind.mL1) of Desmodesmus and Scenedesmus in spring was significantly higher than in autumn, probably due to higher water temperature and decreased water level, enabling a higher concentration of organisms.
23500729|Elaeis guineensis Jacq. (Arecaceae), the oil palm tree, serves as a phorophyte for many different groups of organisms, some of which help decompose organic matter coming from the organs of the tree itself or from remains of other plants retained in leaf sheaths. To study the myxobiota of E. guineensis, we examined living and dead trunks, leaves, bracts and inflorescences in the Gurja Ecological Reserve, in the township of Cabo de Santo Agostinho, Pernambuco, Brazil. Incidence and species abundance were determined in three Atlantic forest fragments. The reported species are listed herein, followed the known distribution of each species in Brazil, and which of them occur on palm trees. All of the subclasses and five orders were recorded and 22 species were added to the list of myxomycetes associated with oil palm trees in Brazil. The highest incidence value was recorded on dead leaves. Ceratiomyxa fruticulosa (O. F. Mll.) T. Macbr., Arcyria cinerea (Bull.) Pers. and Physarum compressum Alb. & Schwein. were the most common species, while Hemitrichia serpula (Scop.) Rostaf. ex Lister showed the highest levels of abundance and incidence, thus confirming its preference for the substrates provided by palm trees. Elaeis guineensis Jacq. (Arecaceae), o dendezeiro, serve como forfita para diferentes grupos de organismos e alguns deles atuam na decomposio da matria orgnica proveniente de rgos da prpria rvore ou de restos de outras plantas retidos pelas bainhas foliares. Foram determinadas a incidncia e a abundncia das espcies em trs fragmentos de Floresta Atlntica. As espcies foram listadas, indicando-se a distribuio conhecida para o Brasil assim como seus registros para palmeiras no pas. Todas as subclasses e cinco ordens foram registradas e 22 espcies foram adicionadas  lista de mixomicetos associados a dendezeiro no Brasil. Rostaf. ex Lister mostrou os nveis mais elevados de abundncia e incidncia, confirmando sua preferncia em associar-se a palmeiras.
23500734|La implementacin de programas computacionales es una alternativa para facilitar la caracterizacin objetiva de los taxones. En la revisin de Merremia para Venezuela, se emple el lenguaje y los programas informticos del Sistema DELTA. Para la definicin de la tabla de caracteres/estados se analizaron las descripciones publicadas sobre los taxones registrados para Venezuela y se contrastaron con la variabilidad observada en 129 Unidades Taxonmicas Operacionales (UTOs) (especmenes de los herbarios VEN, MY y PORT, fototipos y descripciones), resultando en una matriz de 209 caracteres cuantitativos y cualitativos. Con el Editor de Delta se codific la variabilidad morfolgica de las 129 UTOs y se obtuvieron matrices de distancias, analizadas con el programa PAST para establecer la delimitacin taxonmica mediante los anlisis multivariantes de ordenamiento y clasificacin. Las descripciones de los UTOs reconocidos como correspondientes a cada taxn en los anlisis multivariantes se consolidaron usando INTKEY. Estas ltimas fueron reintroducidas en Editor DELTA para elaborar las descripciones en lenguaje natural y las claves, tanto multientrada para INTKEY como dicotmicas. Los resultados obtenidos corroboraron la presencia de 12 especies de Merremia en Venezuela y permitieron el reconocimiento de nuevos caracteres tiles para la diferenciacin entre taxones. The implementation of software is an alternative to help with objective characterization of taxa. In a review of Merremia for Venezuela the language and software of the DELTA system were used. To define the table of characters/states, published descriptions of the taxa recorded in Venezuela were analyzed and compared with the observed variability in 129 Operational Taxonomic Units (OTU's) (VEN, MY, and PORT herbarium specimens, phototypes and taxa descriptions), resulting in a matrix of 209 quantitative and qualitative characters. OTU morphological variability was codified using Delta Editor and distance matrices were obtained with PAST software to establish the taxonomic delimitation using ordering and clustering multivariate analyses. The descriptions of OTUs recognized as belonging to each taxon in the multivariate analyses were consolidated using INTKEY. The latter were reintroduced into DELTA Editor to perform natural language descriptions, and to obtain both dichotomy and multi-input keys for the INTKEY software. The results confirmed the presence of 12 species of Merremia in Venezuela and allowed the recognition of new characters for differentiation among taxa.
23500740|A crescente perda de cobertura do cerrado sensu lato vern aumentando a visibilidade desse bioma, gerando uma crescente quantidade de informao a seu respeito. Atualmente, essa ateno j permite identificar padres fitogeogrficos, definindo provncias florsticas com base nos padres de diferenciao da flora. Este estudo descreve uma rea ainda no estudada de cerrado sensu stricto, prxima aos limites de duas dessas provncias florsticas, e testa se as ligaes florsticas entre a rea estudada e seu entorno so coerentes com os padres fitogeogrficos propostos na literatura. Para tal, uma rea de 1,45 ha foi amostrada pelo mtodo de parcelas, registrando-se indivduos com CAS  31,4 cm. Foram calculados os parmetros estruturais, ndice de Shannon (H') e equitabilidade de Pielou (J') para descrever a vegetao. Os resultados foram comparados a nove reas de cerrado sensu stricto atravs de uma anlise de agrupamento (UPGMA) a partir do coeficiente de Srensen. Foram registrados 1155 indivduos, 90 espcies, 73 gneros e 37 famlias. H' foi igual a 3,75 e J' igual a 0,83. Qualea grandiflora, Magonia pubescens, Curatella americana e Qualea parviflora apresentaram os maiores valores de importncia. A densidade foi de 796 indivduos ha-1 e a rea basal no nvel do solo foi de 11,87 m2 ha-1. Os resultados chamam ateno para as dificuldades de comparar estudos com diferentes metodologias e demonstram que o cerrado sensu stricto de Buritis possui valores de similaridade com reas em seu entorno que esto de acordo com os padres de diferenciao florstica propostos na literatura. The growing loss of cerrado sensu stricto coverage has increased its visibility and generated a rising amount of information about this biome. Such attention has already allowed identifying phytogeographic patterns and defining floristic provinces based on the flora differentiation patterns. This study aims to describe an unknown cerrado sensu stricto area close to two floristic-province borders and test if the area has floristic connections with surrounding locations in agreement with patterns proposed in the literature. A total area of 1.45 ha was sampled by plots, gathering data of individuals with circumference at soil height > 31.4 cm. Structural parameters, Shannon's index (H') and Pielou's equitability (J') were calculated to describe the vegetation. Results were compared through similarity analysis (Srensen's coefficient) to nine other cerrado sensu stricto vegetation surveys. A total of 1155 individuals were recorded, 90 species, 73 genera and 37 families. H' was 3.75 and J' was 0.83. Qualea grandiflora, Magonia pubescens, Curatella americana and Q. parviflora were the species with highest importance values. Tree density was 796 individuals ha-1 and total basal area at soil height reached 11.87 m2 ha-1. The results call attention to the difficulties of comparing studies with different methodologies and reveal that Buriti's cerrado sensu stricto has similarity values which are in agreement with the floristic differentiation patterns proposed in the literature.
23500733|Se presenta el estudio taxonmico de Merremia (Convolvulaceae) en Venezuela utilizando el lenguaje DELTA, sealando nuevos aportes para el gnero. Se revis material herborizado de herbarios venezolanos, confirmando la presencia de 12 especies de Merremia en Venezuela. Se elaboraron dos claves de determinacin de especies, una considerando slo caracteres vegetativos y otra con caracteres vegetativos y reproductivos. Se ofrecen descripciones detalladas de las especies. Se georreferenciaron los especmenes para determinar los mapas de distribucin de especies, y se muestran nuevos reportes de distribucin por estado. Dry samples from Venezuelan herbaria were reviewed, confirming the presence of 12 species of Merremia in Venezuela. Two identification keys were constructed, one considering only vegetative characters and the other grouping vegetative and reproductive characters. Detailed species descriptions are provided. Specimens were georeferenced to determine species distribution maps and new distribution reports for states are shown.
23500732|As espcies de Tibouchina so herbceas, arbustivas ou arbreas, freqentes nas reas abertas ou em regenerao, nas diversas formaes vegetacionais do estado do Paran. O gnero pode ser reconhecido pelas flores diplostmones, com estames dispostos em dois ciclos desiguais, com apndices do conectivo ventrais, bilobados, ovrio spero revestido por tricomas no pice, e frutos capsulares com semente cocleadas, com superfcie tuberculada. No Paran, o gnero est representado por 30 espcies, das quais 26 nativas, incluindo duas espcies endmicas, e outras quatro que ocorrem apenas sob cultivo. Neste trabalho, so apresentadas chave de identificao ilustrada, descries, comentrios taxonmicos, listas de coletores e dados de distribuio geogrfica das espcies. The species of Tibouchina are herbaceous, shrubby or arboreal, and are frequent in open or regenerating areas in vegetation types in the state of Paran. They can be recognized by the diplostemonous flowers, with two unequal cycles of stamens, these with ventral, bilobed appendages on the connective, by the ovary covered by trichomes at its apex, and by the capsular fruits with cochleate and tuberculate seeds. In Paran the genus has 30 species, from which 26 are native, including two endemics, and the other four are cultivated. Here we present an illustrated key, descriptions, taxonomic comments, specimen lists and data on the distribution of the species.
23500737|O tratamento taxonmico das Araceae foi realizado em nove fragmentos de Mata Atlntica pertencentes  Usina So Jos, municpio de Igarassu, Pernambuco, Brasil. Foram encontradas 18 espcies, distribudas em nove gneros, dos quais Philodendron e Anthurium foram os mais representativos, com oito e trs espcies, respectivamente. Caladium, Heteropsis, Montrichardia, Monstera, Syngonium, Taccarum e Xanthosoma apresentaram uma espcie cada. So apresentadas chaves de identificao, descries, ilustraes, dados sobre distribuio geogrfica, habitat, fenologia, heteroblastia foliar e informaes morfolgicas. An identification key, descriptions, illustrations, notes on geographic distribution, habitat, phenology, leaf heteroblasty and morphological information are presented.
23500735|The Serra de Itabaiana National Park, Sergipe, is situated in a transition area between Atlantic Forest and the Caatinga and is considered by the Ministrio do Meio Ambiente to be extremely important for the conservation of the Atlantic Forest flora. The paucity of floristic information from Sergipe state and areas of ecological tension motivated this floristic survey in the only National Park in the state. Botanical collections were made from 2006 to 2009, in six expedictions, by means of random walking. A total of 552 species distributed in 99 families of angiosperms and one gymnosperm were found. Of the species collected, 187 occurred in shrubby-herbaceous, 304 in shrubby, and 247 in arborescent physiognomy, with 23 common to all physiognomies. Leguminosae (41 spp.), Cyperaceae (40 spp.), Poaceae (38 spp.), Orchidaceae (30 spp.), Euphorbiaceae (27 spp.), Rubiaceae (24 spp.), Melastomataceae (21 spp.) and Bromeliaceae (20 spp.) were the richest families. The study revealed the presence of species in common with the Caatinga, Cerrado, Seasonal Forest, campo rupestre, restinga, tabuleiro and areas of ecological tension, corroborating floristically the classification of the locality as an area of ecological tension and reasserting its importance for the conservation of biodiversity. O Parque Nacional Serra de Itabaiana, Sergipe, est situado em uma rea de transio entre a Mata Atlntica e a Caatinga e  considerado pelo Ministrio do Meio Ambiente como de extrema importncia para a conservao da flora da Mata Atlntica. Informaes florsticas escassas, referentes ao estado de Sergipe e reas de tenso ecolgica motivaram o levantamento florstico no nico Parque Nacional do estado. As coletas foram realizadas no perodo de 2006 a 2009, em seis expedies a campo, atravs de caminhamento aleatrio. Foram encontradas 552 espcies distribudas em 99 famlias de Angiospermas e uma de Gimnosperma. Das espcies coletadas, 187 ocorreram na fisionomia arbustiva-herbcea, 304 na arbustiva e 247 na arbrea, sendo 23 comuns a todas as fisionomias. Leguminosae (41 spp.), Cyperaceae (40 spp.), Poaceae (38 spp.), Orchidaceae (30 spp.), Euphorbiaceae (27 spp.), Rubiaceae (24 spp.), Melastomataceae (21 spp.) e Bromeliaceae (20 spp.) foram as famlias mais ricas. Espcies comuns  Caatinga, Cerrado, floresta estacional, campo rupestre, restinga, tabuleiro e de reas de tenso ecolgica, corroboram floristicamente com a classificao do local como rea de tenso ecolgica, o que ressalta sua importncia para a conservao da biodiversidade.
23500741|Pouco se conhece sobre a estrutura e composio florstica das florestas do noroeste fluminense, intensamente fragmentadas. Assim, o presente estudo objetivou contribuir para o conhecimento da flora arbrea desta regio respondendo as seguintes questes: Qual a composio florstica dos fragmentos e que espcies os caracterizam? A comunidade arbrea dos fragmentos da Bacia Hidrogrfica do Rio So Domingos (BHRSD) possui elevada riqueza e diversidade florstica? Em que estdio sucessional se encontram os fragmentos florestais da BHRSD? Foram selecionados quatro fragmentos florestais. Em cada um dos fragmentos foram instaladas cinco parcelas de 20 m X 20 m. Todos os indivduos vivos e mortos com DAP  5 cm foram amostrados. Um total de 198 txons pertencentes a 52 famlias botnicas foi amostrado. As espcies mais abundantes foram Apuleia leiocarpa, Gallesia integrifolia, Dalbergia nigra e Guarea guidonia. Os valores de riqueza e de diversidade (H') de espcies nas cinco diferentes reas amostrais (0,2 ha) variaram de 33 a 89 e 2,81 a 3,87. Os fragmentos, apesar de secundrios e em estdio intermedirio de sucesso, apresentaram elevada diversidade, riqueza e uma composio peculiar de espcies arbreas, que parece receber influncias florsticas de formaes florestais ombrfilas e semidecduas do sudeste brasileiro. Sugere-se que estas referidas caractersticas estejam relacionadas  posio geogrfica da regio. Little is known about the structure and floristic composition of the highly fragmented northwestern Rio de Janeiro forests. Thus, this study aimed to address the following questions: What is the floristic composition and which species characterize it? Does the tree community show high species richness and diversity? What are the successional stages? Four fragments were selected. Five 20 m X 20 plots were allocated in each fragment and all dead and alive trees  5 cm DBH were sampled. A total of 198 taxa belonging to 52 families was sampled. The most important species were Apuleia leiocarpa, Gallesia integrifolia, Dalbergia nigra and Guarea guidonia. The values of richness and species diversity (H') in five different sample areas (0.2 ha) ranged from 33 to 89 and from 2.81 to 3.87, respectively. The forest fragments, although secondary and in a mid-successional stage, had a particular species composition, high diversity and richness, and seem to have floristic influence from both semideciduous and evergreen forests of southeastern Brazil. These characteristics are probably related to the geographic position of the region.
23500163|Uma das formas que os negros no Brasil criaram para enfrentar o regime escravocrata foi a formao de quilombos, dos quais centenas esto localizados no estado da Bahia, e vm mantendo ao longo dos sculos conhecimentos e prcticas de manejo sobre a flora local, ainda pouco estudados. Esta pesquisa visou determinar o valor local das espcies vegetais utilizadas pelos quilombolas do municpio de Jeremoabo, na regio nordeste da Bahia, principalmente aquelas da caatinga. A coleta de dados se deu atravs de entrevistas semi-estruturadas e lista livre. Os entrevistados citaram 86 espcies que esto distribudas em dez categorias de uso: medicinal, ritual ou religioso, construo, alimentao, combustvel, veterinrio, melfera, forrageira, comercializao e artesanato. As cinco espcies que tiveram o maior valor local, em ordem decrescente, foram: Gochnatia oligocephala (candeia), Myrcia sp. (ara), Schinus terebinthifolius (aroeira), Hymenaea courbaril (jatob), Mimosa tenuiflora (jurema-preta). Os resultados dessa pesquisa, sobretudo as espcies vegetais de maior valor local identificadas, podem ser aplicados em programas de recuperao de reas degradadas, desenho de sistemas agroflorestais e educao ambiental nas escolas locais. One of the ways that blacks in Brazil created to confront the regime of slavery was the formation of "quilombos". This study aimed to determine the value of local plant species used in the "quilombolas" of Jeremoabo district located in northeastern Bahia, especially the Brazilian species from the caatinga environment. Data collection was made through semi-structured interviews and free lists. The people interviewed cited 86 species that are distributed in ten use categories: medicinal, ritual or religious, building, food, fuel, veterinarian, honey, fodder, marketing and handicrafts. The five especies that had the largest local value in descending order were: Gochnatia oligocephala (candeia), Myrcia sp. (ara), Schinus terebinthifolius (aroeira), Hymenaea courbaril (jatob), Mimosa tenuiflora (jurema-preta). The results of this research, especially the plant species of highest local value identified, can be applied in environmental restoration programs of degraded areas, agroforestry design and environmental education in the local schools.
23500164|Este trabalho apresenta resultados do levantamento da micota Urediniolgica realizado na Reserva Biolgica do Lago Piratuba e reas de entorno, no estado do Amap. Foram inventariados 17 txons da ordem Uredinales, parasitando 15 gneros de plantas hospedeiras, classificados em 12 famlias vegetais. As espcies Aecidium amazonense Henn, Phragmidiella bignoniacearum (W.T. Dale) Buritic & J.F. Hennen, Prospodium laevigatum J. F. Hennen & Soto, Puccinia cynanchi Berk. & M. A. Curtis, Puccinia lateritia Berk. & M. A. Curtis, Puccinia peperomiae J. C. Lindq., Puccinia puta H.S. Jacks. & Holw. e Puccinia spegazzinii De Toni so novas citaes para o Amap. Jacks. & Holw. and Puccinia spegazzinii De Toni are new reports for Amap. All the listed species are new reports for the study area.
23500161|O conhecimento da biologia reprodutiva e polinizao de rvores neotropicais vm aumentando nas ltimas dcadas. No entanto, ainda  incipiente para a Mata Atlntica e muitas questes persistem, por exemplo, sobre a prevalncia de autoincompatibilidade. A biologia floral, o sistema reprodutivo e os visitantes florais de Senna multijuga foram estudados, com o objetivo de verificar a ocorrncia de autoincompatibilidade e determinar seus polinizadores. A espcie apresenta caractersticas florais tpicas do gnero, como flores assimtricas, enantiostilia, heteranteria e deiscncia poricida. A antese  diurna e a viabilidade do plen no diferiu entre os morfos de anteras. Os polinizadores foram abelhas dos gneros Bombus, Epicharis, Centris e Xylocopa e abelhas menores atuaram como pilhadores de plen. A reproduo sexual em S. multijuga depende da transferncia de plen pelos polinizadores, pois no foram formados frutos por apomixia ou autopolinizao. Este ltimo resultado pode ser devido  depresso por endogamia ou a um mecanismo de autoincompatibilidade de ao tardia, uma vez que houve aborto uniforme de pistilos e penetrao de tubos polnicos nos vulos aps autopolinizao. Diferena na fecundidade aps polinizao manual e em condies naturais indica que a limitao polnica afeta o sucesso reprodutivo feminino, assim como a disponibilidade de recursos. Knowledge of reproductive biology and pollination of Neotropical tree species has been increasing in recent decades. However, this is still incipient in the Atlantic Forest, and many questions remain, for instance, about the prevalence of self-incompatibility. We studied the floral biology, breeding system and floral visitors of Senna multijuga in order to verify the occurrence of self-incompatibility and determine its pollinators. This species bears the typical floral traits of the genus, such as asymmetry, enantiostily, heteranthery and poricid anthers. Anthesis is diurnal and pollen viability did not differ among the morphs of anthers. Pollinators were bees of the genera Bombus, Epicharis, Centris and Xylocopa and smaller bees acted as pollen thieves. Sexual reproduction of Senna multijuga depends on the transfer of pollen by pollinators, as no fruit was formed by either apomixis or self-pollination. The latter result may be due to inbreeding depression or by a mechanism of late-acting self-incompatibility, as we observed after self-pollination both penetration of pollen tubes in the ovules and uniform abortion of pistils. Differences on fertility after manual crossings and under natural conditions indicate that female fitness is affected by pollen limitation, as well as by the availability of resources.
23500160|A introduo e manejo de plntulas de Euterpe edulis Mart. em florestas tem sido uma alternativa encontrada para no levar a espcie  extino devido ao extrativismo desenfreado. O objetivo deste estudo  ampliar o conhecimento das exigncias ecolgicas das plntulas desta espcie, visando auxiliar sua conservao in situ. Frutos despolpados da espcie germinaram em casa de vegetao e as plntulas, ainda com os vestigios da semente ligados ao eixo embrionrio, foram separadas em seis lotes. Cada lote recebeu os seguintes tratamentos: 2% de luminosidade, 50% de luminosidade, sem nutrio mineral, com nutrio mineral, irrigao a cada dois dias e irrigao a cada sete dias. Observou-se que o tempo de esgotamento das reservas das sementes no pareceu ser influenciado pela intensidade de luz e fertilidade do solo, como tambm o peso da matria seca, rea foliar e nmero de folhas das plntulas, sugerindo que o crescimento da plntula parece ser independente da intensidade de luz e fertilidade do solo enquanto h reservas na semente. Sob regime de menor disponibilidade de gua, as plntulas apresentaram aumento no teor de prolina da folha, indicando que a espcie apresenta regulao osmtica As plntulas apresentaram inibio do crescimento a 2% de luz solar, indicando que o nvel de luz solar que chega ao interior da floresta fechada pode ser limitante para o crescimento de plntulas desta espcie. The introduction and management of Euterpe edulis seedlings in forests is an alternative that has been found to prevent the species' extinction. The aim of this study is to increase our knowledge of the ecological demands of seedlings of this species in order to contribute to in situ conservation. Fruits of Euterpe edulis without pulp were germinated in the greenhouse, in vermiculite moistened with water. The seedlings obtained, still with some seed reserves attached to the embryonic axis, were separated in six groups. Each received the following treatment: 2% sunlight, 50% sunlight, without mineral nutrition, with mineral nutrition, irrigation every other day and irrigation every seven days. It was observed that the time of seed-reserve depletion did not seem to be influenced by light intensity or soil fertility, nor did dry mass, leaf area and number of leaves, which suggests that seedling growth is independent of these environmental factors while the seed reserves are present. Under decreasing water, seedlings showed an increase in proline content, indicating a mechanism of osmotic regulation. The plants showed growth inhibition under 2% sunlight. This result indicates that the level of light intensity that reaches the interior of a closed forest can limit seedling growth.
23500165|O Parque Ecolgico do Gunma  PEG (Santa Brbara do Par, estado do Par, Brasil) representa um dos poucos remanescentes florestais da regio metropolitana de Belm. O PEG mantm uma rica flora fanerogmica composta por espcies consideradas raras, mas nada se conhece a respeito de sua flora de plantas vasculares sem sementes. Assim, este trabalho teve como objetivo inventariar as espcies de samambaias e licfitas do Parque Ecolgico do Gunma. No PEG foram registradas 56 espcies, distribuidas em 28 gneros e 15 familias. Das espcies registradas, Lellingeria suspensa (L.) A.R. Sm. & R.C. Moran foi citada pela primeira vez para o estado do Par, e Polyphlebium diaphanum (Kunth) Ebihara & Dubuisson constituiu um novo registro para a Regio Norte (Amaznia brasileira). As familias mais representativas foram Hymenophyllaceae (15 spp.), Dryopteridaceae (8 spp.), Polypodiaceae (7 spp.) e Pteridaceae (6 spp.), e os gneros foram Trichomanes (7 spp.) e Elaphoglossum (6 spp.). A maioria das espcies apresentou hbito herbceo (52 spp.), habitat epifitico (30 spp.) e terrestre (23 spp.), ocorreu exclusivamente nos sub-bosques (35 spp.) e apresentou distribuio americana (34 spp.). Estes resultados demonstraram a importncia do Parque Ecolgico do Gunma para a preservao da flora local e regional de plantas vasculares sem sementes. The Gunma Ecological Park  PEG (Santa Brbara do Par, Par state, Brazil) is one of the few preserved forest remnants in the metropolitan region of Belm. The PEG has a rich phanerogamic flora with rare species, but nothing is known about its seedless vascular-plant flora. Our aim is to present a floristic survey of ferns and lycophytes from Gunma Ecological Park. The 56 recorded species belong to 28 genera and 15 families. This is the first record for Lellingeria suspensa (L.) A.R. Sm. & R.C. Moran in Par state and also for Polyphlebium diaphanum (Kunth) Ebihara & Dubuisson in the Brazilian Amazon. The richest families were Hymenophyllaceae (15 spp.), Dryopteridaceae (8 spp.), Polypodiaceae (7 spp.) and Pteridaceae (6 spp.). The genera with highest number of species were Trichomanes (7 spp.) and Elaphoglossum (6 spp.). The majority of the species were herbaceous (52 spp.), with epiphytic (30 spp.) and terrestrial (23 spp.) habitat, occurred exclusively in the understory (35 spp.) and presented American distribution (34 spp.). This result demonstrates the importance of Gunma Ecological Park for local/regional seedless vascular-plant flora preservation.

Sapotaceae has 53 genera and about 1,100 species mainly found in tropical and subtropical regions. They occur especially in lowland moist forests, up to 1,000 m, and their main center of diversity is the Neotropics. In Brazil, 14 genera and about 200 species are registered, almost 70 of which can be found in the Northeast region. The flora of Sapotaceae from Usina So Jos, Igarassu, Pernambuco, is presented in this study. 23500162|Smilax subsessiliflora Duhamel, espcie exclusivamente brasileira, tem por habitat a floresta Atlntica, mesfila e as matas de restinga. Este trabalho tem por objetivo descrever a morfoanatomia do sistema subterrneo de S. subsessiliflora. O sistema subterrneo da espcie em questo  constitudo pelo rizforo, do qual partem os ramos caulinares e as razes adventcias. O rizforo apresenta epiderme uniestratificada com estmatos, crtex com clulas de paredes espessadas e lignificadas, meristema de espessamento primrio e cilindro vascular, integrado por feixes colaterais. Das razes adventcias que partem do rizforo originam-se outras que se distinguem pelo calibre e pela cor. Aquelas apresentam crtex externo, constitudo por clulas parenquimticas e crtex interno, constitudo por escleredes, que passam a exercer a funo de revestimento, aps a eliminao do crtex externo. O cilindro vascular  poliarco e sifonostlico. Gros de amido ocorrem no periciclo e na medula. No crtex das razes laterais detectaram-se endomicorrizas arbusculares. As caractersticas anatmicas observadas no sistema subterrneo de S. subsessiliflora se assemelham s relatadas para o rizforo de S. quinquenervia. Smilax subsessiliflora Duhamel, a native Brazilian species, inhabits the Atlantic rain forest, Mesophytic forest and Restinga forest. This study aims to describe the morphoanatomy of the underground system of S. subsessiliflora and compare the results to literature data. The underground system of the analyzed species is composed of the rhizophore, which emits the shoots and adventitious roots. The rhizophore has unistratified epidermis with stomata, cortex with thick lignified cell walls, primary thickening meristem (MEP) and vascular cylinder composed of collateral bundles. In the adventitious roots emitted by the rhizophore, other roots are formed, distinguished by thickness and color. These have external cortex composed by parenchyma and inner cortex (composed of sclereids) that becomes the outermost part after the elimination of the external cortex. The vascular cylinder is polyarch and siphonostelic. Starch grains are present in pericycle and pith. Arbuscular mycorrhizae were detected in the cortex of the lateral roots. The anatomical characters observed in the underground system of S. subsessiliflora are similar to those of the rhizophore of S. quinquenervia.

23500167|Este estudo apresenta o levantamento florstico de Orchidaceae ocorrentes em 125 fragmentos florestais de 23 municpios da regio central do estado de So Paulo. Foram identificadas 218 espcies distribudas em 96 gneros. Os indivduos coletados em estado vegetativo foram mantidos em casa de vegetao at a ocorrncia de florao. A maioria das espcies (64%)  epfita, 35% so terrcolas, 14,6% so rupcolas, duas so hemiepfitas (0,9%) e apenas uma  micoheterotrfica (0,4%). Os gneros mais representativos so Acianthera (13 spp.), Habenaria e Gomesa (12 spp.) e Epidendrum (11 spp.). Dentre as espcies no identificadas, quatro parecem ser novas para a cincia: Anathallis sp., Baskervilla sp., Pelexia sp., Triphora sp. Alm disso, uma nova combinao para o gnero Gomesa R.Br.  apresentada. O elevado nmero de espcies encontradas provavelmente est relacionado ao fato da regio ser um ectono entre o Cerrado e a Floresta Atlntica. Muitas das espcies (44,7%) so raras na regio e encontram-se ameaadas devido ao intenso desmatamento e coletas indiscriminadas. This study reports the floristic survey of Orchidaceae occurring in 125 forest fragments distributed among 23 counties of the central region of So Paulo state, Brazil. In this region, the family is characterized by 219 species distributed in 96 genera. Individuals collected in the vegetative state were maintained in a greenhouse until flowering. The majority of species (64%) are epiphytes, while 35% are terrestrial, 14.6% are rupicolous, two (0.9%) are hemi-epiphytes and one is mycoheterotrophic (0.4%). Acianthera (13 spp.), Habenaria and Gomesa (12 spp.), and Epidendrum (11 spp.) are the most representative genera. Of the unidentified species, four are possibly new to science: Anathallis sp., Baskervilla sp., Pelexia sp., Triphora sp. Furthermore, a new combination for the genus Gomesa R.Br. is presented. The central portion of So Paulo state is an ecotone between Brazilian Savanna and Atlantic Forest with a high number of species from both formations. Many species (44.7%) are rare in the study area and are threatened due to anthropogenic disturbance and indiscriminate collecting of orchids.
23500166|Two new species of Lessingianthus (Asteraceae: Vernonieae) are described and illustrated. One of these, L. foliosus Dematt., bears a resemblance to L. vepretorum, but can be separated from it by its linear leaves, that are lanate on the abaxial surface, and by its shorter internodes. The other new species, L. lapinhensis Dematt., can be easily separated from L. brevifolius and other taxa of the genus by the combination of stems 8-18 cm tall, glabrous linear leaves and campanulate involucres. Thirteen other taxa previously described as Vernonia are transferred to the genus Lessingianthus and two lectotypes are designated here. Duas novas espcies de Lessingianthus (Asteraceae: Vernonieae) so descritas e ilustradas. Uma dessas espcies, L. foliosus Dematt., apresenta semelhana com L. vepretorum, mas diferencia-se dela pelas folhas lineares, lanosas na face abaxial e pelos entrens mais curtos. A outra espcie, L. lapinhensis Dematt., pode ser distinguida facilmente de L. brevifolius e outros txons do gnero pela combinao de caule 818 cm compr., folhas lineares, glabras e invlucro campanulado. Outros treze txons descritos como Vernonia so transferidos para o gnero Lessingianthus e dois lecttipos so aqui designados.
23500172|O presente trabalho consiste da reviso de Mitracarpus para o Brasil, com base em observaes de campo e estudo de espcimes de herbrio. Mitracarpus  um gnero neotropical, distribuindo-se desde o sul dos Estados Unidos at o centro da Argentina, com uma espcie invasora ocorrendo nos Paleotrpicos. O gnero apresenta trs centros de diversidade de espcies: o Mxico, o Caribe e o Brasil. Vinte e quatro espcies so reconhecidas, das quais seis novas para a cincia: Mitracarpus albomarginatus, M. buiquensis, M. diversifolius, M. eitenii, M. nitidus e M. robustus. Chave de identificao, nomenclatura, descries, ilustraes e notas sobre o estado de conservao das espcies so apresentados. This paper presents the revision of Mitracarpus from Brazil. The study is based on field observations and study of herbarium specimens. Mitracarpus is a neotropical genus, distributed from the southern United States to central Argentina, with one invasive species occurring in the Old World. The genus presents three centres of diversity: Mexico, the Caribbean region and Brazil. Twenty four species are accepted, of which six are new to science: Mitracarpus albomarginatus, M. buiquensis, M. diversifolius, M. eitenii, M. nitidus and M. robustus. A key to identify the species, updating of the names and their typification, synonymy, descriptions, illustrations are provided, together with data on their conservation status.
23500684|Estudos fenolgicos auxiliam na compreenso do comportamento das espcies em resposta a alteraes no ambiente e so tambm importantes para a conservao e manejo das mesmas. A fenologia de Paratecoma peroba (Record & Mell) Kuhlm. foi estudada no perodo de outubro/2005 a dezembro/2007 na Mata do Carvo (Estao Ecolgica Estadual de Guaxindiba), So Francisco do Itabapoana, RJ. As observaes foram realizadas mensalmente, exceto durante a fase de florao que ocorreram em intervalos quinzenais. Acompanharam-se 42 indivduos que apresentaram comportamento fenolgico sazonal, com a senescncia foliar ocorrendo no incio da estao seca e a queda foliar entre meados e final desta mesma estao. O brotamento de novas folhas ocorreu no incio da estao chuvosa. As percentagens de Fournier encontradas para as fenofases reprodutivas foram baixas e somente indivduos com DAP > 16 cm apresentaram botes florais. No final da estao seca de 2005, os indivduos apresentaram fenofases reprodutivas, com a florao ocorrendo na transio da estao seca para chuvosa e a frutificao foi longa (cerca de um ano) tendo incio na estao chuvosa (novembro), com os frutos dispersando as sementes aladas no incio da estao chuvosa seguinte. Nos anos seguintes, 2006 a 2008, no foi observado evento de florao. A espcie foi caracterizada como decdua, apresentando periodicidade de florao supra-anual. Phenological studies help the understanding of species behavior as a result to environmental changes and are also important for species conservation and management. The phenology of Paratecoma peroba (Record & Mell) Kuhlm. was studied from October/2005 to December/2007 in Mata do Carvo (Guaxindiba Ecological Station), So Francisco do Itabapoana, RJ. The observations were done in one-month intervals, except the flowering that was done at two week intervals. Forty two individuals were systematically observed. They showed phenological pattern characterized by the seasonal occurrence of the phenophases, with leaf senescence occurring at the beginning of the dry season and the leaf fall between the middle and the end of this season. New leaves were flushed at the beginning of the wet season. Fournier intensity values were low for reproductive phenophases and only trees with diameter at breast height (dbh) > 16 cm sprouted flowers. Reproductive phenophases started at the end of dry season of 2005, with flowering occurring in the transition of the dry to the wet season. Fruiting was long (one year), starting at the beginning of the wet season (November) with dispersion of the anemocoric seeds occurring at the beginning of the following wet season. However, in the following years (2006-2008), flowering did not occur. This species was classified as deciduous, with a supra-annual flowering period.
23500671|O estudo taxonmico sobre o gnero Nitzschia Hassall, nas reas da Lagoa do Casamento e do Butiazal de Tapes, localizados entre 3040'3010'S e 5030'5130'W, baseou-se em amostras de plncton e metafton, coletadas em 21 estaes abrangendo diferentes ambientes (lagoas interligadas, lagoas isoladas, banhados e aude) no outono e primavera de 2003. Foram encontrados 35 txons especficos e infra-especficos, destacando-se 11 novas ocorrncias para o Estado e cinco para a Plancie Costeira do Rio Grande do Sul. Quanto ao hbito, 91% dos txons ocorreram no plncton e metafton e 9% restringiram-se ao metafton. A rea da Lagoa do Casamento apresentou maior riqueza (35 txons) em relao  rea do Butiazal de Tapes (13 txons), provavelmente pela presena de ambientes em conexo com a laguna dos Patos, a qual detm uma flora rica de Nitzschia, associado s condies de alta condutividade e pH da gua. So apresentadas descries, ilustraes e comentrios sobre as variaes morfolgicas e/ou mtricas dos txons. The taxonomic study about the genus Nitzschia Hassall, the Lagoon Casamento and Butiazal de Tapes areas, located at 3040'3010'S e 5030'5130'W, was based in plankton and metaphyton samples, collected in 21 stations including different environments (interconnected lakes, isolated lakes, swamps and ponds), in the fall and spring of 2003. The results revealed the presence of 35 taxa specific and infra-specific, highlighting 11 new records for the State and 5 new ones for the Coastal Plains of Rio Grande do Sul. Regarding the habit and 91% occurred in plankton and metaphyton, only 9% were restricted to metaphyton. The Lagoon do Casamento area presented greater richness (35 taxa) compared to the Butiazal de Tapes area (13 taxa), probably due to the presence of environments in connection with the Patos lagoon, that has a rich flora of Nitzschia, associated to a high conductivity and water pH conditions. Descriptions, illustrations and comments about the morphological and/or metric variations and of the taxa are presented.
23500674|Quiinaceae est representada no Nordeste do Brasil por quatro espcies e dois gneros: Lacunaria crenata, Quiina cruegeriana, Q. florida e Q. glazovii. Na Regio, ocorrem exclusivamente em floresta atlntica, com preferncia por ambientes mais midos e preservados. So registrados casos de endemismos na floresta atlntica (Q. glazovii) e disjuno entre as florestas amaznica e atlntica ao norte do rio So Francisco (Q. cruegeriana e Q. florida). So apresentados comentrios sobre distribuio geogrfica, habitats, caracteres diagnsticos e ilustraes, alm de um novo sinnimo. Quiinaceae is represented in Northeast Brazil by four species and two genera: Lacunaria crenata, Quiina cruegeriana, Q. florida, and Q. glazovii. They occur in the Atlantic forest, clearly preferring wet, preserved habitats. A new synonym is presented as well as comments on geographic distribution, habitats, and diagnostic characters.
23500682|A conservao dos ecossistemas de reas protegidas inseridas em paisagens urbanas constitui-se um desafio para as instituies responsveis por sua gesto. O. conhecimento desses ecossistemas e de sua distribuio espacial so essenciais para direcionar seu manejo. O objetivo deste estudo consistiu em analisar o Parque Estadual Sumama, Manaus, AM, no contexto da ecologia de paisagens e caracterizar a composio florstica e estrutural das unidades florestais da rea. Trinta parcelas de 20  20 m foram estabelecidas, e os indivduos com DAP > 5 cm foram identificados e medidos. Foram registradas 196 espcies arbreas, pertencentes a 134 gneros e 58 famlias, refletindo uma alta diversidade florstica. No Parque foram identificadas plantas exticas e seis espcies ameaadas de extino. Mtricas da paisagem foram analisadas para cinco unidades de paisagem: floresta de encosta, floresta de baixio, campo antrpico, solo exposto e edificaes. Os ndices de forma e dimenso fractal demonstraram que as paisagens florestais tendem para uma forma no-circular, o que indica a necessidade de maior controle de suas bordas. Estudos permanentes so necessrios para a conservao das reas de fragmentos florestais tendo em vista a manuteno de suas funes ecolgicas e sociais alm da recuperao de reas alteradas o mais prximo possvel dos ambientes florestais menos impactados. Ecosystem conservation of protected areas included in urban landscapes is a challenge for efficient management. Knowledge of these ecosystems and their spatial distribution is essential to guide conservation and restoration planning. We analyzed vegetation units and landscape metrics, as well as the structure and floristic composition of slope and lowland forests in Sumama State Park, Manaus, Amazonas, Brazil. Thirty plots (20  20 m) were sampled, and the height and diameter of all individuals with dbh > 5 cm were measured and the species identified. A record of 196 species belonging to 134 genera and 58 families was made, reflecting high diversity, although mainly for secondary vegetation. We identified exotic plants and six endangered species. Landscape metrics were calculated for the five landscapes units within the Park: slope forest, lowland forest, manmade grassland, bare soil and buildings. Shape and fractal dimension landscape indices for the two forest classes showed a tendency toward non-circular shape, which indicates the need to mitigate edge effects. Ongoing studies are needed to conserve areas of forest fragments in order to maintain their ecological and social functions and the recovery of degraded areas as close as possible to less impacted forest habitats.
23500675|The species complex related to Alcantarea extensa is presented and delimited as: A. extensa, A. vinicolor, A. burle-marxii, A. turgida, A. distractila, A. lurida, A. simplicisticha, A. nigripetala, A. mucilaginosa, and A. trepida. Alcantarea trepida, known from Esprito Santo state, southeastern Brazil, is described as new, and illustrated. It is compared to A. extensa, A. simplicisticha, and A. vinicolor from which it differs by the robust, erect, compound inflorescence with more numerous flowers and by the straight and thicker rachilla. O complexo de espcies relacionadas a Alcantarea extensa  apresentado e delimitado como: A. extensa, A. vinicolor, A. burle-marxii, A. turgida, A. distractila, A. lurida, A. simplicisticha, A. nigripetala, A. mucilaginosa e A. trepida. Alcantarea trepida, conhecida do estado do Esprito Santo,  descrita como nova e ilustrada.  comparada com A. extensa, A. simplicisticha e A. vinicolor, das quais difere pela inflorescncia ereta e robusta com flores mais numerosas e pelas rquilas retas e mais grossas.
23500672|La flora de musgos de Cuba presenta su mayor diversidad en la regin oriental. A partir del trabajo de campo, de revisiones bibliogrficas y de materiales de herbarios se realiza un inventario de los musgos registrados para Cuba Oriental, reconocindose 354 taxones infragenricos pertenecientes a 153 gneros y 47 familias. The Hedwigiaceae family is reported for the first time from Cuba as well as the genera Braunia and Leucophanes and, the species Braunia squarrulosa (Hampe) Mll. Hal., Callicostella rivularis (Mitt.) 23500681|El Carso de Baire es una zona constituida fundamentalmente por mogotes y poljas que se encuentran en la vertiente Norte de la Sierra Maestra y se diferencia del resto de la misma por su geologa y geomorfologa. Generalmente no hay un suelo tpico, la temperatura del aire vara entre 20 y 24C y llueve de 1.200 a 1.600 mm por ao. Mediante la utilizacin de la metodologa de la Escuela Zurich-Montpellier, se describen las dos asociaciones ms conspicuas y extensas de dicha zona, Hohenbergio penduliflorae - Guapiretum obtusatae y Rhipsali cassuthae - Hohenbergietum penduliflorae, las que se incluyen en la alianza Synapsidi ilicifoliae - Coccothrinacion Borhidi 1996. La primera, constituida por un Bosque siempreverde micrfilo con poca cobertura, ocupa la mayor extensin en el lapiez de la parte alta de los mogotes, desarrollando el reciclaje de nutrientes en la estera radical; a su vez la segunda, que conforma un matorral, crece en los paredones de alrededor de 90 grados y sus plantas se fijan a las fisuras de las rocas. Ambas asociaciones estn sometidas a un gran estrs hdrico y nutrimental. Baire's karst is encountered on the north slope of Sierra Maestra. It is geologically and geomorphologically different from the rest of the Sierra Meaestra mountain system because of the development of "mogotes" and "poljas". Generally no soil type is typical of the region, air temperature varies from 20 to 24C and rainfall is 1,200 to 1,600 mm annually. Using the Zurich-Montpellier school methodology the two most important phytocenoses are described from Carso de Baire Hohenbergio penduliflorae - Guapiretum obtusatae and Rhipsali cassuthae - Hohenbergietum penduliflorae, included in the Synapsidi ilicifoliae - Coccothrinacion Borhidi 1996 alliance. The first is represented by an open, microphyllous, evergreen forest occupying the highest part of "mogotes" (karstic dome hill), whereas the second consists of shrubby vegetation growing on a 90-degree wall. Both occur under water and nutritional stress.
23500683|Este estudo teve por objetivos analisar a fenologia de florao, a biologia e a morfologia floral, o sistema e o sucesso reprodutivo dos morfos florais de Psychotria carthagenensis Jacq. O perodo de florao se estendeu de maio (estao seca) a janeiro (estao chuvosa). A florao dos morfos florais foi sincronizada e o nmero mdio de inflorescncias, de botes em pr-antese e de flores abertas por indivduos foram semelhantes. A antese das flores de ambos os morfos foi de 12 horas. Houve diferena significativa no comprimento da corola, dos lobos estigmticos, das anteras e altura do estilete entre os morfos florais. A viabilidade de plen foi alta entre ambos os morfos. A formao de frutos ocorreu em polinizaes intramorfos e intermorfos e no houve diferena significativa na produo de frutos e sementes em tratamentos intermorfos. Os atributos florais analisados sugerem que os dois morfos contribuem similarmente para a manuteno da espcie na rea de estudo. This study aims to examine flowering phenology, floral biology and morphology, and the reproductive system and success of the floral morphs of Psychotria carthagenensis Jacq. The long flowering period lasts from May (dry season) to January (rainy season). Flowering of the floral morphs was synchronized and the number of inflorescences, buds in pre-anthesis and flowers per plant were similar. Anthesis of the flowers of both morphs was 12 hours. Significant differences were observed in the corolla length, the stigmatic lobes, anthers and styles between floral morphs. Pollen viability was high in both morphs. Intermorph and intramorph pollinations resulted in fruit set. There was no significant difference between intermorph treatments in fruit and seed production. The flower attributes indicate that both morphs contribute similarly to species persistence in the study area.
23500685|The stigma surface is a complex multicellular structure where the development of the pollen tube begins. This development is necessary for sucess in fertilization and depends on recognition processes that involve the anatomy of the stigma. Passiflora is an economically important genus becasue of its edible fruits. Many authors have described the stigma of Passiflora but nothing is known about the ontogenesis of this structure. This work aimed to describe the formation of the stigmatic surface of Passiflora elegans. Results showed that, in bud, the stigmatic surface of this species is flat with small cells. The cells in the subdermal layer have large vacuoles and the nucleus, near to the external periclinal walls. During its development the stigma surface becomes uneven due to the elongation of cells in the subdermal layer. Elongation results in an increase of external secretory surface area of the stigmas, and probably plays an important role in pollen recognition. The polysaccharide content found in the inner walls of these structures might be involved in the signal process for pollen tube growth during its early development. The morphological evidence presented here shows that, as the stigma of Passiflora is formed by dermal and subdermal cells, it should not be characterized as colleters or papillae and, therefore, it is defined here as stigma emergences. A superficie estigmtica  uma estrutura multicelular complexa, onde o tubo polnico inicia o seu desenvolvimento, necessria para a fecundao. Este desenvolvimento depende de condies favorveis que envolvem a anatomia do estigma durante o processo de reconhecimento. Passiflora  um gnero economicamente importante devido aos seus frutos comestveis. O estigma de Passiflora tem sido descrito por vrios autores, mas o seu processo de formao  desconhecido. Esse trabalho tem por objetivo descrever o processo de formao da superficie estigmtica de Passiflora elegans. Os resultados demonstram que durante a fase de boto jovem, a superficie estigmtica  composta por pequenas clulas e apresenta superficie plana. As culas da camada subdepidrmica apresentam grandes vacolos e ncleo, prximo da parede periclinal externa. Durante o seu desenvolvimento, a superfcie estigmtica torna-se irregular devido ao alongamento de culas da camada subdepidrmica. Essas modificaes resultam em um acrscimo da superficie secretora externa do estigma, e provavelmente desempenham um importante papel no reconhecimento do plen. Os contedos polissacardicos encontrados na superficie interna dessas estruturas podem estar envolvidos com os processos de sinalizao do tubo polnico durante seu desenvolvimento inicial. As evidncias morfolgicas observadas nesse trabalho demonstram que as estruturas presentes na superficie do estigma de Passiflora so constitudas por culas de origem drmica e subdrmica, e no devem ser caracterizadas como colteres ou papilas, sendo assim, caracterizadas nesse trabalho como emergncias estigmticas.
23500678|O Parque Estadual da Serra do Rola-Moa localiza-se na poro centro-sul da Cadeia do Espinhao, na regio denominada Quadriltero Ferrfero, nos municpios de Belo Horizonte, Brumadinho, Ibirit e Nova Lima. Apresenta como vegetao os Campos Rupestres ferruginosos e quartizticos, Floresta Estacional Semidecidual e Cerrado. O presente trabalho teve como finalidade estudar a florstica da famlia Bromeliaceae no Parque Estadual da Serra do Rola-Moa. Foram identificadas 25 espcies pertencentes a 11 gneros, sendo Dyckia o gnero mais representativo em espcies. Eduandrea selloana, Cryptanthus schwackeanus, Dyckia consimilis, D. densiflora, D. macedoi, D. simulans, D. schwackeana, D. trichostachya, Vriesea longistaminea e V. minarum encontram-se citadas na Listas das Espcies da Flora e da Fauna Ameaadas de Extino do Estado de Minas Gerais. Neste trabalho optamos por revalidar Dyckia oligantha. The Serra do Rola-Moa State Park is located on the central southern portion of the Espinhao Range, in a region denominated Quadriltero Ferrfero (Iron Quadrangle). It comprises the municipalities of Belo Horizonte, Brumadinho, Ibirit and Nova Lima. The main vegetation types include the rocky grassland, semideciduous seasonal forest and savanna vegetation. This work aimed to study the floristics of the Bromeliaceae family in Serra do Rola-Moa State Park. Twenty-five species belonging to 11 genera were identified, and Dyckia is the most species-rich genus. Eduandrea selloana, Cryptanthus schwackeanus, Dyckia consimilis, D. densiflora, D. macedoi, D. simulans, D. schwackeana, D. trichostachya, Vriesea longistaminea and V. minarum are cited on the Minas Gerais Endangered Flora and Fauna Species List. Here we re-establish Dyckia oligantha as a species.
23500679|Este trabalho apresenta a flora de Habranthus (Amaryllidaceae) da Cadeia do Espinhao, estados de Minas Gerais e Bahia. Na regio, o gnero est representado por sete espcies: H. bahiensis, H. botumirensis, H. datensis, H. irwinianus, H. itaobinus, H. lucidus e H. sylvaticus.  apresentada uma chave para separao dos quatro gneros de Amaryllidaceae que ocorrem na Cadeia do Espinhao, uma chave e uma tabela diagnstica para a identificao das espcies de Habranthus, alm de descries, ilustraes e comentrios sobre a morfologia e a distribuio geogrfica dessas espcies.
